As introduced, authorizes issuance of two memorial license plates to recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, subject to local approval, grants the county legislative body broader authority to set compensation for county highway commissioners, rather than setting a specific compensation in the charter. - Amends Chapter 53 of the Private Acts of 1985.

As introduced, requires corporations to file statement of contributions and expenditures when using corporate funds to aid in either the election or defeat of a candidate; requires corporation to disclose such corporation paid for public communication when it expressly advocates the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 2, Chapter 19.
As introduced, enacts the "Drinking Water Access and Resources Planning Act." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, exempts persons 70 or older from Hall Income Tax beginning in tax year 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts persons 65 or older from Hall Income Tax beginning in tax year 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes police departments to impound motor vehicles upon driver's failure to provide proof of financial responsibility. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 16.

As introduced, prohibits the department of environment and conservation from issuing permits related to surface mining activities under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221 and Title 69.

As introduced, reduces the sales and use tax on food and food ingredients for human consumption except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from 5.5% to 2.75% beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, prohibits employers from prohibiting employees possessing a handgun carry permit from transporting and storing a firearm out of sight in a locked vehicle on any property set aside for employee parking; prohibits employer from terminating, demoting, or other discrimination against such employees. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, requires TennCare MCOs to contract with nursing homes and associated physicians and hospitals in their service area under the Long-Term Care Community Choices Act of 2008. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, requires the Tennessee wildlife resources agency to post the annual report of estimated acreage closed, opened, and added on its Web site. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, requires the state or a local subdivision to post results of a feasibility study relative to converting a right-of-way into a hiking-bicycle trail on the appropriate Web site of the state or local subdivision. - Amends TCA Title 11.
As introduced, extends time to resubmit a corrected municipal solid waste region plan from 60 days to 75 days and corrects reference to state agency. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, exempts food and food ingredients for human consumption except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from the state sales and use tax beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, adds notaries public to those who may solemnize marriages. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 16 and Title 36, Chapter 3.

As enacted, creates sales and use tax exemption for purchase of building supplies for construction of storm or tornado shelters purchased between July 1, 2011, and December 31, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts the Jobs Creation Lawsuit Reform Act. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 22; Title 24; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires candidates and political campaign committees to report any contribution received or expenditure made to the registry of election finance within 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department of human services to establish a mandatory drug screening program for adult recipients of Families First in order for adults to be eligible for the program. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, bans all use of color printers by state agencies, departments and commissions with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56, Part 1; Title 12, Chapter 7 and Title 12, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, allows the board of education to grant teachers tenure at any time between their third and tenth years of service; eliminates judicial review of decision to suspend or dismiss a teacher for incompetence, inefficiency, neglect of duty, unprofessional conduct or insubordination. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, protects a teacher from discipline for teaching scientific subjects in an objective manner. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.
As introduced, enacts the Health Care Compact. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires gift certificates with a monetary value of less than $10.00 to be redeemable in cash for cash value. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
As introduced, removes the authority for a municipality to build powder magazines at a safe and prudent distance from the limits of the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, increases the penalty for failure to pay a special assessment or installment levied by a local government on property located within a central business improvement district from 0.5% per month of the amount of such assessment or installment to 1%. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As enacted, directs the genetic advisory committee to develop a program to screen newborns for critical cyanotic congenital heart disease; the screening program must make use of pulse oximetry and be developed by January 1, 2013.
As introduced, deletes requirement that local law enforcement enter order of protection or dismissal of order into the Tennessee crime information system. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-609.
As enacted, adds attempting or intending to cause bodily injury by strangulation to the definition of aggravated assault. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-102.

As enacted, changes the timing and manner in which members of the county election commission are required to inspect new voter registration forms; requires that certain audits be conducted. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-120.
As enacted, exempts the purging of a person's voter registration after a change of name due to a divorce. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-106.

As enacted, removes election officials legislative district residency requirement to serve but requires such officials to reside in the county in which they are appointed to serve. - Amends TCA Section 2-4-103.

As introduced, requires notices of citations based on surveillance cameras to include opportunity to view photographic or video evidence; exempts certain motor vehicles from such violations; requires reporting by cities and counties operating traffic enforcement camera programs. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires the state to assume responsibility to regulate effluents during any period in which the federal government is unable to exercise its responsibilities because of inadequate funds to operate the appropriate regulatory agencies. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As introduced, prohibits specified ticket scalping activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 11.

As introduced, effective 2012, increases from $1,000,000 to $1,750,000 the maximum exemption against net estate; requires amount be adjusted for inflation every three years; requires publication and notification of any change. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, authorizes Davidson County clerk to perform vehicle inspections, and collect a fee up to $37.50 for such inspections, prior to issuing certificate of title for a rebuilt motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

As introduced, removes judicial discretion to apportion costs between the parties and clarifies that the prevailing party is entitled to recover costs. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27; Title 29, Chapter 11; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 29, Chapter 5.

As enacted, increases the amount the superintendent of an urban type public facility may purchase without approval of the governing authority from $500 to $10,000 and increases the amount of construction contracts from $2,000 to $10,000 for which the superintendent must advertise for bids. - Amends TCA Section 5-16-105.
As enacted, makes the use of precinct-based optical scanners by a county election commission discretionary instead of mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, provides scholarship aid to students with special needs to permit parents of such students to choose schools, either public or private, that their children will attend. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 67.
As introduced, enacts the "Equal Opportunity Scholarship Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, requires the governor to designate one day each year in April as Autism Awareness Recognition Day. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires the director of legislative budget analysis to report to the speakers of the house of representatives and the senate and to the house and senate education committees if the commissioner of education fails to provide the director with the revised BEP funding formula for the ensuing fiscal year by January 1. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 37 and Title 49.

As enacted, increases the minimum time that a driver license may be revoked for third and fourth and subsequent DUI convictions from three and five years to six and eight years. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises procedure for determining the tax on the privilege of participating in an amusement; to be determined annually by the county legislative body in accordance with established criteria, rather than imposing a set fee. - Amends Chapter 2 of the Private Acts of 1981; as amended.
As introduced, requires citizenship status to be proven prior to registration to vote and requires certain procedures to ensure identity and citizenship status prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates honoring Tennessee's veterans; allocates 50 percent of revenues produced from the sale thereof to state veterans' homes in Bradley and Montgomery counties. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, establishes requirements for retired law enforcement officer to become certified to carry a firearm in this state in the same manner and to same extent as active law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Victims of Crime Executive Clemency Notification Act." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 27.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the transportation of certain persons to mental health facilities in regard to responsibility and costs. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 6, Parts 4 and 9.
As introduced, increases the fine for assaulting a sports official of a school sponsored activity to $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits an LEA or school within an LEA from conditioning a student's attendance at an activity or trip upon whether the student made a lump sum contribution to the school or sold a required amount of fund-raising products or merchandise. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, removes exception allowing a defendant not otherwise eligible to be sentenced to community correction rather than incarceration if the defendant has special needs that are best treatable in the community. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 36.
As enacted, creates exceptions to the exclusionary rule for good faith mistakes and technical violations in a search warrant. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, requires a voter to present qualified photographic identification before voting; voters without proper identification shall be allowed to cast provisional ballots. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, creates new specialty license plate for SpiritHorse Therapeutic Riding; allocates funds from the sale of the plates to allow children with special needs to work with horses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes county governments to adopt local preference purchasing policies. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
As introduced, authorizes a sales and use tax exemption on purchases made by any veteran with a 100 percent permanent total disability. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires the chief officer of a hospital or other residential service facility to provide notice of admission to a recipient's attorney-in-fact acting under a durable power of attorney for health care; prohibits a treatment review committee from overriding a decision made by the attorney-in-fact. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires the chief administrative road supervisor to file a complete inventory of all machinery, equipment, tools, supplies, and materials with the county legislative body and the county mayor within 75 days after taking office instead of 60 days, and thereafter to file a revised current inventory by September 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 54.
As introduced, deletes repealed citation from the records disclosure act and clarifies that highly restricted personal information shall not be sold to any person. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long-range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

As introduced, indexes to the consumer price index as published by the U.S. bureau of labor statistics amount of contracts in excess of $100,000 for public work which require a 25 percent bond of the contract price be executed. - Amends TCA Title 12.

As introduced, places burden of proof on agency taking disciplinary action at each step when disciplining a higher education employee, and for final step requires administrative law judge from secretary of state hear the case. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits the constitutional county officers from holding any other local or state public office for profit during such official's term of office; applies whether the official was appointed to fill a term or elected to serve a full or partial term. - Amends TCA Title 5 and Section 8-8-101.
As introduced, repeals the Tennessee Voter Confidence Act. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 20.

As enacted, clarifies that order of protection issued pursuant to title 36, chapter 3, part 6, may require respondent to immediately and temporarily vacate a residence shared with the petitioner pending a hearing on the matter. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As introduced, prohibits changing of custodial arrangements due to an order of protection against the custodial parent unless the child is the victim of child abuse or the effects of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
As introduced, authorizes use of discovery to aid in defense of petition for protective order. - Amends TCA Title 19; Title 20; Title 36, Chapter 3 and Title 40.
As introduced, authorizes parent or guardian who pays for supervision of child visitation to select provider of supervision services. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
As introduced, authorizes man who has paid child support for a child who is not his biological child to recover such child support from the biological father. - Amends TCA Section 36-2-309.
As introduced, authorizes defendant in divorce case to request one automatic recusal of the judge assigned to hear the case. - Amends TCA Title 17; Title 20 and Title 36, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires fees over $500 collected for child support be paid by obligor and recipient of the child support payments. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, entitles either party to a visitation agreement to file a petition for an expedited hearing pursuant to the provisions governing expedited hearings for support and reduces period of time for non-compliance with an order of visitation from six months to three months. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6 and Title 36, Chapter 5.
As introduced, creates rebuttable presumption that shared custody is in child's best interest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, makes all records pertaining to licensure or registration by owners of security systems held or kept by a governmental entity confidential; includes all information, photos, presentations, schematics and surveys. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
As introduced, defines the term "alarm verification" for purposes of the Alarm Contractors Licensing Act. - Amends TCA Title 62.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 53 in Gainesboro and Jackson County as "William Benson "Ben" Wooten, II Memorial Highway."

As introduced, requires agencies to report fines of more than $1,000 and suspensions and revocations of licenses for more than seven days to the government operations committees within 72 hours. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

As introduced, creates a joint committee to evaluate acute adverse action taken by state agencies and requires that state agencies report such action to the committee. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 4, Chapter 5.

As enacted, authorizes disabled persons who receive special license plates to obtain a decal to affix to such specialty plates; recognizes plates with affixed decals as disabled driver plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 21 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires fines from certain traffic enforcement cameras be placed in a dedicated fund for permanent public works projects. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, contingent upon availability of certain amount of surplus revenues, reduces sales tax rate on food by .5 percent in next fiscal year. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires schools to notify parents, by way of student handbooks or policy guidebooks, of school-associated extracurricular activities and gives parents the opportunity to prohibit their child from participating. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, revises requirements applicable to ambulatory surgical treatment centers in which abortions are performed in regard to required insurance coverage, requirements for the administrator of the facility and the civil penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, revises requirements applicable to ambulatory surgical treatment centers in which abortions are performed in regard to required insurance coverage, requirements for the administrator of the facility and the civil penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, deletes requirement that vehicle making right turn on red signal come to full and complete stop prior to making such turn. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, prohibits any licensed physician or osteopathic physician from performing or attempting to perform any abortion, including a medically induced abortion, or from prescribing any drug or device intended to cause a medical abortion, except in the physical presence of the pregnant woman; no drug or device intended to cause a medical abortion may be administered or dispensed to a pregnant woman except in the physical presence of her physician. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, requires the executive director of the commission on aging and disability to provide appropriate advice and support to the bureau of TennCare concerning the Long-Term Care Community Choices Act of 2008. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, clarifies the legislative committees designated to receive information concerning TANF and Medicaid. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, clarifies that licensing of facilities for the intellectually and developmentally disabled shall be the sole responsibility of the department of mental health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33 and Title 71.
As enacted, creates a pilot project in Knox County for up to two years for a maximum of 10 patients at any given time to receive assisted outpatient treatment. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, requires the board of dentistry to report to the select committee on children and youth on the availability of dental services to children and the adequacy of the supply of pediatric dentists. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, excludes certain casual labor not in the course of an employer's trade or business from coverage under employment security law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, prohibits sale of food and beverages in certain containers containing bisphenol A. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 53 and Title 68.

As introduced, increases the application fee for a restricted license, after having a driver license suspended based on a failure by a driver to submit to tests determining blood alcohol content, from $20.00 to $50.00; increases the fine for both the offense and the delinquent act of underage driving while impaired from $250 to $500. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.
As introduced, criminalizes possession of certain weapons on the property of a housing project. - Amends TCA Title 32 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires any school bus purchased on or after July 1, 2011, to have an approved restraint system; requires all school buses in use after July 1, 2023, to have an approved restraint system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21.
As introduced, requires the board of physical therapy to meet not less than quarterly. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 13.

As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the maximum civil penalty that may be imposed each day that a person performs any activity that requires a certificate of need without first obtaining the required certificate of need. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, allows the commissioner of health to bring an action to enforce a civil penalty assessed against a deficient nursing home in general sessions court as well as in circuit or chancery court. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, adds an additional element to the actuarial study of TennCare to include an analysis of the effect of reduction of payments to providers on the provision of care. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, restricts the ability of a county legislative body to eliminate line items included in a budget submitted by the administrator of elections. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 5.
As introduced, requires that all written examinations for a driver license or intermediate driver license be in English. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
As enacted, allows Blue Porch Inn in Rutherford County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-101.
As introduced, prohibits persons convicted of a felony drug offense on and after July 1, 2011, from being eligible for receiving Families First benefits [TANF] and food stamps. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor of producing, manufacturing, selling or offering to sell any product containing any of six listed synthetic derivatives or analogues of the Schedule I controlled substance methcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As enacted, abolishes eligibility for carryovers for purposes of ad valorem tax equity payments made to telecommunications service providers. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103; Section 67-6-221 and Section 67-6-222.

As introduced, authorizes provisional approval of applications for property tax exemption for property owned by religious, charitable, scientific or nonprofit educational institutions; revises certain requirements related to that exemption. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-212.
As enacted, changes membership of audit and budget committee of THDA by replacing the comptroller of the treasury with the state treasurer. - Amends TCA Section 13-23-112.

As enacted, authorizes state board of equalization to maintain certain records in electronic format; revises requirements for form of complaints and appeals filed with the board. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1412; Section 67-5-1512 and Section 67-5-1513.

As introduced, adds certain rights regarding challenges and refunds to the Taxpayer Bill of Rights; revises procedures regarding disputed taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.
As introduced, authorizes the board of trustees to undertake certain endeavors in regard to foundations established to support the university. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As enacted, revises provisions governing obligation to pay property taxes during an assessment appeal. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1512.

As enacted, clarifies that auditee records, intra-agency and interagency communications, draft reports, schedules, notes, memoranda and other records relating to an audit or investigation are confidential and not open for public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As enacted, requires annexing municipality to record adopted or approved annexation ordinance or resolution with register of deeds in counties where annexation adopted or approved; copy to be sent to comptroller and assessor of property for each affected county. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1.

As enacted, revises deadlines for filing applications for refunds or presentments of credit vouchers; clarifies that repayment not required if certain persons determined to be eligible are later found to be ineligible for property tax relief. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, for purposes of property tax classification and assessment, provides that real property does not include property determined by Tennessee courts to be personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes certain courts to attach a copy of the court's order to the tax books under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36.

As introduced, sets awards from net lottery proceeds for certain postsecondary scholarships and grants at the amount the student initially received or at the amount awarded for initial recipients in the current semester of enrollment, whichever is greater. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires the state election coordinator to study the feasibility of permitting registered voters who reside outside the precinct listed as their permanent residence on their permanent voter registration card to vote only for candidates running for statewide office; the study will not address property rights voting; the coordinator must report the results of the study to the general assembly by February 28, 2012.

As introduced, adds costs of certain printing equipment to current list of costs for which municipal electric plants may charge for production of certain maps as a public record. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.

As enacted, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship; revises law regarding the dual enrollment grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, changes the standards by which a person is considered to be driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, allows law enforcement to use reasonable force when causing certain people to submit to a test of their bodily fluid. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.

As introduced, creates the offense of internal possession of a controlled substance for producing a dirty drug test; punishes the offense in accordance with the same provisions governing simple possession. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, requires certain commissioners and agency heads to certify to comptroller that state employees could not have been used instead of contracting with outside entities in rendering services required under certain contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 12.

As introduced, authorizes a water utility district in the eastern portion of White County with over 1,000 customers to change the manner in which vacancies are filled and commissioners are selected. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act for a contractor to require a person to waive a right of lien in violation of law. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 47, Chapter 25; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

As introduced, authorizes all required notices and answers concerning administrative actions to be served or filed personally or by certified mail; if served personally the time runs from the date of service and if by certified mail from the postmarked date. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes department of revenue to contract with private entities, in addition to present authority to contract with county or municipality officials, for collection of delinquent business taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As introduced, removes loan companies and cemetery companies from requirements of intangible personal property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 11.

As introduced, lowers the DUI enhancement that would require an ignition interlock from .15 percent to .08 percent and removes the DUI enhancements that would require an ignition interlock relative to implied consent. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
As enacted, names "SPC Michael E. Harr Memorial Bridge" on S.R. 126 in Sullivan County.
As enacted, names "Orville Depew 'Dick' Kitzmiller and Riley Lee Milhorn Memorial Bridge," on S.R. 75 in Sullivan County.

As introduced, allows the respondent in a contested case to continue the date of the first scheduled hearing until both parties certify that they are ready for the hearing; allows either party to make a motion to set the hearing if unreasonable delay occurs. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, increases from $200 to $500 the amount of indebtedness that requires newspaper advertisements, three different times, announcing a pending court-ordered judicial sale. - Amends TCA Title 35.

As introduced, requires state board of education to modify uniform high school grading system to allow for the awarding of pluses and minuses on letter grades. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302; Section 49-6-407; Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9; Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 1.

As introduced, adds language to not construe any limitations on obtaining compensation under the workers' compensation statute to limit third party actions against tort-feasors. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As enacted, clarifies that the notice of exemption given by a judgment debtor shall state "Tennessee law provides a $10,000 exemption" instead of "Tennessee law provides a $4,000 exemption." - Amends TCA Title 26.
As enacted, extends for two years the nursing home privilege tax and restricts the use of such tax revenues to the funding of nursing home rates. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the current moratorium on the issuance of certificates of need (CONs) for new nursing home beds until June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

As introduced, exempts from sales tax the sale of motor vehicles to active duty members of the armed forces stationed in Tennessee but on temporary duty assignment in another state. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.
As introduced, transfers jurisdiction of Off-Highway Vehicle Act from wildlife resources agency to department of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title 68 and Title 70.
As introduced, provides for licensure or certification of radiology practitioner assistants as radiologist assistants. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, requires the development of a logo or seal to promote products and goods, other than agricultural products, made in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

As enacted, specifies that when a defendant commits a homicide or assault against a pregnant woman, the woman's fetus, regardless of viability, is also considered a victim of the offense. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-107 and Section 39-13-214.
As introduced, redefines "NAIC" to include any successor organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, establishes certain requirements regarding netting agreements and qualified financial contracts. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, broadens the definition of NAIC to include any successor organizations. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, broadens the definition of NAIC-SVO to include any successor organization. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals the Hamblen County special endowment fund. - Chapter 106 of the Private Acts of 2006.

As introduced, includes multifamily residential developments among establishments affected by non-conforming use exemptions and restrictions in municipal zoning regulations; changes from 30 continuous months of cessation of operation by a facility during which non-conforming use exemption expires to continuous period of between 12 and 30 months as established by zoning ordinance. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

As introduced, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Public Charter Schools Act, including eliminating caps on the number of charter schools and changing requirements for charter schools' prospective student population. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, provides that failure of a drug and alcohol test, or refusing the test, in a drug-free workplace makes the injured employee ineligible for workers' compensation benefits related to an injury; removes requirement for proximate causation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.
As introduced, extends time for meeting issuance requirements of Fisk Jubilee Singers new specialty earmarked license plate until June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits parents to see the body of an adult child prior to the commencement of an autopsy; authorizes the state to restrict a parent from touching the body to the extent necessary to preserve evidence. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 38 and Title 68.
As introduced, creates sunrise provision for commission of Indian affairs, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 34, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts certain provider agencies from annual quality assurance evaluations if the agency possesses certain accreditation. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 68.

As enacted, establishes presumptions of proximate cause of death, injury, or damage for certain motor vehicle accidents occurring within a construction zone; establishes immunity from claims for personal injury, property damage, or death arising from certain department of transportation projects. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 42; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 29 and Title 54.
As introduced, excludes employees working under certain employment contracts for 999 or less hours from qualifying for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-303.

As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals requirement that satellite offices for the register of deeds be maintained outside the county seat. - Repeals Chapter 242 of the Acts of 1899; and any other acts amendatory thereto.

As introduced, delays collection efforts for any taxpayer with not-for-profit status pending final outcome of litigation challenging tax assessment on ground that taxpayer was tax-exempt. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.
As enacted, revises the trauma center funding law; includes licensed Level IV institutions in definition of trauma center. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 59.
As introduced, requires hospitals to report annually on community benefits they provided. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-310.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of commerce and insurance to report to the general assembly on the availability for sale in Tennessee of certain Canadian stocks. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, allows creditable service for military service used to establish credit in another retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6.

As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax over a two-year period by reducing the amount of the tax by 50% for decedents dying in 2012, and for decedents dying in 2013 and thereafter, no inheritance tax applies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
As introduced, exempts handgun carry permit holders from criminal background check requirement when purchasing a firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, requires the governor to proclaim the second Friday in October of each year as Arbor Day. - Amends TCA Title 15.
As introduced, prohibits general assembly from raising tax rate on food above 5.5% beginning on July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes department of transportation to specify by rule unpaved county roads on which the use of off-highway vehicles will be permitted. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 70, Chapter 9.

As introduced, authorizes courts to order payment of restitution in addition to, rather than in lieu of, $50.00 fine for riding an OHV on another's land without permission. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title 39; Title 55; Title 68 and Title 70, Chapter 9.
As introduced, limits certificates of need to facilities and removes equipment and services from the certificate requirements. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, adds Englewood to municipalities which permit golf carts on certain highways; extends termination date of pilot project to July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-201.

As introduced, prohibits the transfer to the general fund of interest derived from the 911 emergency communications fund as well as the fund itself. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-1016 and Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 3.
As introduced, requires credit for courses taken at military schools be transferable to public postsecondary educational institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, adds six stimulants that are compounds of methcathinone and used to make plant food and bath salts to list of Schedule I controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, revises educational requirements for office of constable. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, increases from 10 to 15 the number of days prior to a sentencing hearing that a presentence report shall be filed. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, prohibits certain waste processors from processing radioactive waste. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that any revenue generated by county litigation tax for victim-offender mediation shall be used for the purpose of victim-offender mediation or other community mediation matters. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts." - Amends TCA Title 8.

As enacted, requires clerk to accept cost bond signed by attorney in lieu of party paying fees or clerk must forfeit all costs. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 4 and Title 25, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, corrects typographical error in Public Chapter 901 by inserting the word "or" in section specifying that remedies under the chapter are cumulative. - Amends TCA Section 36-5-2103 and Chapter 901 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, imposes a one-cent per ounce privilege tax on bottled soft drinks containing sugar; reduces from 5.5% to 4.5% the retail sales tax rate on food, which includes soft drinks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, clarifies that, to meet the definition of "industrial machinery" for purposes of the sales and use tax exemption, any product resulting from the fabrication or processing must be for consumption off the premises of the one engaged in the fabrication or processing. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, exempts persons with certain weapons training from the hunter education course required before being able to hunt. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes military veterans to obtain driver licenses displaying language "Veterans," if department of safety receives private funding by June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.
As introduced, requires a petitioner for order of protection to pay court costs and attorney fees if the petition is dismissed. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, provides buyers involved in home solicitation sales with additional cancellation rights; establishes additional notice requirements for sellers; allocates the cost of any notary witnessing the signatures to sellers. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 7.

As introduced, specifies that alternative schools must obtain the individualized education plan (IEP) and related records of a student entering the alternative school with an IEP. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3402.
As enacted, establishes job qualifications for directors of local emergency management agencies. - Amends TCA Title 58.
As introduced, designates segment of State Highway 109 in Sumner County as "Tommy Marlin Highway."
As enacted, designates bridge at State Route 109 and U.S. Highway 70 / State Route 24 in Wilson County the "Spc. Michael Lane Stansbery Jr. Memorial Bridge."
As introduced, extends ordinary duration of driver licenses from five to eight years; increases fees for driver licenses and photo identification cards. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, exempts ambulances from requirement that each for-hire motor carrier providing passenger transportation service in a motor vehicle or motor vehicles designed or constructed to accommodate and transport eight or more passengers, or any motor vehicle transporting passengers who are TennCare enrollees eligible for such transportation services under TennCare, maintain at least $1,000,000 in liability insurance, drug test operators, conduct biennial physical exams of operators, and conduct annual safety examinations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 51 and Title 65.
As enacted, creates a special coordination committee to coordinate transportation efforts of state and local government. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Dickson Augustus Weems Memorial Bridge"
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Roy Bell & David O'Guin Memorial Bridge"

As introduced, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires commission to suspend or revoke a license or permit instead of imposing a fine after the third violation of certain offenses within a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Music Recording Investment Incentive Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Entertainment Industry Investment Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, limits right to recover noneconomic damages by a motorist who does not comply with the financial responsibility law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Donate Life; 50% of the proceeds from sale of such plates earmarked for Tennessee Donor Services to raise awareness of organ and tissue donation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes lump sum death benefit to beneficiary for noncontributory member dying prior to retirement as if such member had been a contributory member. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-107.

As introduced, allows sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages for on premises consumption has been approved but does not allow sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages in retail package stores has been approved. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, allows local jurisdictions to hold a referendum concerning the sale of wine in retail food stores; creates license for sale of wine in retail food stores. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates an additional class of licenses allowing the sale of wine at certain retail food stores; requires person purchasing wine at certain retail food stores to present photo identification. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, allows retail package stores to sell ice, soft drinks, mixes, glassware and corkscrews in addition to alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, allows sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption has been approved but does not allow sale of wine in retail food stores where sales of alcoholic beverages in retail package stores has been approved. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, exempts the diabetic supplies of blood glucose monitor test strips, lancets and visual reading and urine test strips from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, changes the method of selection of trustees of TCRS representing teachers and retired teachers from election by the representative assemblies of the Tennessee Education Association and the Tennessee Retired Teachers Association respectively to appointment by the speakers of the senate and the house; authorizes professional education employees' organizations to recommend persons to the speaker of each chamber of the general assembly for appointment to teacher trustee positions for TCRS. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-302 and Section 8-34-303.

As enacted, revises provisions governing reporting of aviation fuel sales; makes failure to file the aviation fuel sales report punishable by a civil penalty of $500 that may be abated by the commissioner instead of being punishable by a civil penalty in an amount set by the commissioner.

As enacted, limits liability of a bovine owner for injuries, loss, damage or death of another resulting from bovine activities if the bovine owner maintains proper warning notice on signs, and maintains proper fences and enclosures. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 43 and Title 44.

As enacted, requires counsel for claimants reporting to the commissioner regarding medical malpractice claims to include information as to whether the health care provider received payment from TennCare; requires the commissioner to include such information in the annual report on medical malpractice claims. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 54.
As introduced, regulates the activities of radiology benefit managers with respect to orders or recommendations of treating physicians. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

As enacted, allows the court to assess court costs, filing fees, litigation taxes and attorneys' fees against a petitioner seeking an order of protection if court does not issue or extend order of protection and makes certain other findings. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As enacted, requires that in taking into account the child's best interest for purposes of a child custody arrangement, the court shall order a custody arrangement that permits both parents to enjoy the maximum participation possible in the life of the child. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-106 relative to child custody.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Electronic Recordation of Custodial Interrogations Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, relieves lottery retailers from payment for stolen unsold instant lottery tickets if retailer notifies law enforcement and the lottery corporation as soon as practicable upon discovery of theft, and if within 72 hours of the issuance of a police report concerning the theft, a copy of the report is filed with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Access, Competition, and Consumer Fairness Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 5.
As enacted, revises the requirement that police officers be provided with training to deal with mentally ill persons to require that training be provided annually.

As introduced, requires executive director of agency to submit report to commission and governor by September 30 of each year; extends effective date of regulations for cooperative agreements with federal agencies from 30 to 45 days after publication. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time in which persons cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.

As introduced, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including, but not limited to, marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, requires loose material hauled in open bed of certain motor vehicles to be covered by tarpaulin in addition to present requirement limiting height of load. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7.

As introduced, for inheritance tax purposes, excludes from decedent's gross estate the special use value of certain family owned farmland; exempts from additional taxation certain woodland and conservation transactions; exempts up to $5 million or 50 percent of the value of certain land covered by conservation easements. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows person issued a restricted driver license to drive to and from a doctor's office, hospital, pharmacy or other location to obtain necessary medical care or to obtain an item for which the person has a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, provides that aggravated criminal trespass is also committed if the trespasser destroys or vandalizes a gate, fence, lock or other barrier in order to gain entrance to the property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4.

As enacted, authorizes the Beech River watershed development authority to create the position of board member emeritus and establishes the qualifications for such position. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1.
As introduced, removes specifically defined categories of veterinary facilities and excludes from the definition of "veterinary facility" certain premises. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.
As enacted, requires utilization of census 2010 geography in establishment or alteration of precincts after March 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-102.

As enacted, authorizes Lexington, by ordinance adopted by a two-thirds vote, to levy an occupancy tax on the privilege of staying in any hotel or motel in Lexington; the ordinance to set the rate and further set forth the manner of collection and administration of the privilege tax; requires that all proceeds received by the municipality from the tax be deducted for tourism development. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.
As enacted, adds executive director of development district in which a megasite is located to megasite board. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.

As introduced, clarifies that the fact that an object has not yet been used or did not contain a controlled substance shall not be a defense to a charge that the object was possessed with the intention for use as drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires inspection of livestock by agriculture crimes unit within department of agriculture to precede inspection by county agricultural extension agents in response to alleged offenses being committed against livestock. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 43.
As introduced, revises requirements on pharmacists in issuing certain methamphetamine precursors. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-431.

As enacted, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption, if local legislation body adopts resolution adopting resort as premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, prohibits public employees from having a payroll deduction to a political action committee or for dues for membership organizations that use funds for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 7 and Title 8.

As introduced, authorizes regional and municipal planning commissions to revoke subdivision plats under certain circumstances and return proceeds from enforced bond or guaranty to property owner. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403(b) and 13-4-303(b).
As enacted, authorizes a hospital to designate an entity to report the hospital's discharge claims data with the commissioner of health. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-108(a).

As enacted, requires health care practitioners licensed in the healing arts to affirmatively communicate proof of licensure to patients; expands list of practitioners required to post proof of licensure at their place of practice. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1.
As introduced, enacts the Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

As introduced, requires certain political activities by labor organizations be funded separately through voluntary donations of members and not through regularly collected dues. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
As introduced, allows Morgan County to use jury coordinators instead of jury commissioners for the selection and attendance of jurors. - Amends TCA Section 22-2-101.
As introduced, requires reports to and by the select committee on long-term care concerning recent long-term care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, creates a special joint committee to study the creation of a department of aging and adult services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, removes loan companies and cemetery companies from tax on shares of stock. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 11.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Protection from Secondhand Smoke for Children Act." - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires criminal background checks on persons seeking renewal of locksmith licenses; exempts locksmiths with 10 years experience from continuing education requirements; sets license renewal fee at not less than $200. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits any person who is not a licensed dealer from selling a firearm at a gun show or within 1,000 feet of a gun show. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires ice cream truck workers to submit to a criminal background check and prohibits persons on the sexual offender registry or convicted of certain sexual offenses from being employed as such workers. - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 53; Title 55 and Title 68.
As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of boating under the influence of an intoxicant to approximate DUI penalties. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 55 and Title 69.
As introduced, increases the penalty for certain offenses involving the possession of firearms by minors. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, changes date of presidential preference primary from first Tuesday in February to first Tuesday in March; changes the qualifying deadline for candidates in a county primary held in February in presidential election years from "the first Thursday in November" to "the second Thursday in December" and specifies that candidates in municipal elections held in conjunction with the presidential preference primary election must file their nominating petitions by the second Thursday in December. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, allows Woodlake Golf Club to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, extends the department of finance and administration, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, deletes references to defunct fireworks advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 68-104-216.
As enacted, repeals sunset provision and creating authority for the private protective services advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-35-129.

As enacted, requires comptroller to conduct a performance audit of the implementation and impact of current law authorizing the creation of a lien on a motor vehicle by filing a notarized copy of an instrument when the existing certificate of title on the vehicle is unavailable. - Amends TCA Section 55-3-126.
As introduced, reduces termination date for board of dispensing opticians, from June 30, 2015 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As enacted, terminates the occupational safety and health administration labor advisory council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3, Part 9.
As enacted, extends the department of labor and workforce development, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14.
As enacted, extends the commission on children and youth, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, terminates the board of review, department of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Section 4-5-319 and Section 50-7-704.
As enacted, extends the water and wastewater operators, board of certification, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 9.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee health information committee, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, terminates the teacher evaluation advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, extends the state soil conservation committee, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 14, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the southeast interstate low-level radioactive waste compact, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 7.
As enacted, extends the oil and gas board, June 30, 2016; revises appointment process of membership of oil and gas board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 60, Chapter 1, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the Four Lake regional industrial developmental authority, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, extends state procurement commission, state protest commission, and advisory council on state procurement, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, revises termination date for board of physical therapy from June 30, 2014 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As introduced, revises termination date for board of athletic trainers from June 30, 2016 to June 30, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits persons registered as lobbyists from serving as members of state boards, commissions or other governmental entities whose activities are regulated by such entities; requires members to be state residents; prohibits public members from having a direct or indirect affiliation with professions and industries being overseen or regulated. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee criminal justice coordinating council, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 41, Chapter 52, Part 1.
As enacted, repeals the public livestock market board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the prevailing wage commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As enacted, extends the standards committee, department of human services, June 30, 2013; revises the membership of the child care agencies licensing standards committee, appointed by the commissioner of human services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.
As enacted, extends the state unemployment compensation advisory council, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 6.
As enacted, extends the archaeological advisory council, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the board of medical examiners, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the cemetery advisory board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 46, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, extends the civil service commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the commission on aging, June 30, 2016; requires the division of state audit to return to the Tennessee commission on aging and disability in 2012 to review actions taken by the commission to address the monitoring issues raised in the first finding in the January 2011 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the committee for purchase from the blind and other severely disabled, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As enacted, extends conservation commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, requires commissioner to report the death of any person in custody to the members of the general assembly representing such person within five business days of such death rather than 10 days, with additional requirement that the report include the department facility where the death occurred. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, repeals provision prohibiting persons registered as lobbyists from serving as members on certain state boards, commissions, committees and councils. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-121; Section 57-1-102; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 64.
As enacted, continues certain permanent rules filed with secretary of state after January 1, 2010.

As introduced, removes authority of the government operations committees to stay the running of the period between the time a rule is filed with the secretary of state and the rule's effective date. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires each state agency head to complete periodic training for purposes of complying with the provisions of the Regulatory Flexibility Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.

As enacted, places the Doe Mountain recreation authority under the governmental entity review requirements by scheduling the authority to sunset on June 30, 2014; schedules the board of appeals for the department of human resources to sunset on June 30, 2014; schedules the civil service commission to terminate and cease to exist on April 1, 2013; replaces the present law requirement that the TennCare bureau competitively procure an annual study designed to accurately assess the cost of dispensing a prescription in a retail or community pharmacy setting to a TennCare enrollee with a requirement that the TennCare bureau annually report to the house health and human resources committee and the senate health and welfare committee concerning pharmacy benefits under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enacted, extends the elevator and amusement device safety board, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 121, Part 1.

As introduced, combines regional community services agencies into one state agency; extends the state community services agency, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As enacted, extends the Douglas Henry state museum commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20, Part 3 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the department of transportation, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the department of safety, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20.
As enacted, creates sunrise provision for the interstate insurance product regulation compact. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the governor to consult with the Tennessee Dental Association prior to making appointments to the board of dentistry. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 63-5-103.
As enacted, deletes references to defunct Tennessee Alzheimer's disease task force. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.
As introduced, deletes references to defunct commission of Indian affairs. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 4, Chapter 34; Section 11-6-116; Section 15-2-106 and Section 68-24-701.
As enacted, extends the department of human resources, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the board of boiler rules, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 122, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the soil scientist advisory committee, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 2.

As enacted, extends the standards committee, department of children's services, June 30, 2013; revises the membership of the child care agencies licensing standards committee, appointed by the commissioner of children's services. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As enacted, extends the occupational safety and health review commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 3, Part 8.
As enacted, extends the interstate compact on the placement of children, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the bureau of ethics and campaign finance, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 55, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the West Fork Drakes Creek dam and reservoir interstate authority, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 1, Part 9.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee wars commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 11, Part 5 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee motor vehicle commission, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee board of court reporting, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.
As introduced, extends the state TennCare pharmacy advisory committee, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 24.
As enacted, extends the southern dairy compact commission, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 35, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the regional transportation authority, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 64, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the human rights commission, June 30, 2013; requires the division of state audit to return to the human rights commission on November 1, 2011, to review actions taken by the commission to address the internal control issues raised in the fourth finding in the April 2011 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 2 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the medical care and cost containment committee, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits an agency that has filed an emergency rule from filing a proposed rule on the same subject without first holding a public rulemaking hearing. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-202.
As introduced, requires governor to submit legislation to revise TCA to reflect changes in governmental structure made by executive order. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, extends energy efficient schools council, June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 49-17-103.
As introduced, revises from 60 to 75 days the time the government operations committees can stay the running of a permanent rule's effective date. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.
As enacted, designates first full week in March each year as "Volunteer Firefighters Week"; such dates shall not be a legal holiday under state law. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes insurers to use incentives and rewards to encourage or reward participation in a health promotion program. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, authorizes court ordered assisted outpatient treatment in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, revises the Insurance Producer Licensing Act of 2002 and other provisions pertaining to investigations of insurance producers and insurers. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, authorizes magistrates to require a defendant to wear a global positioning monitoring system as a condition of bail in any domestic violence, stalking, aggravated stalking, or especially aggravated stalking case or in any case in which the defendant is in violation of an order of protection; the defendant must pay for the use of such system if able. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Section 39-17-315 and Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, requires any sexual offender who is housed in a halfway house or any other facility as an alternative to incarceration to register as a sexual offender and report with the offender's registering agency. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As enacted, requires registration with the sex offender registry by a juvenile between the ages of 14 and 18 who is adjudicated delinquent for any violent juvenile sexual offense committed on or after July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 40; Title 49 and Title 55.

As enacted, exempts antique vehicles being registered for antique motor vehicle license plates from emissions testing requirement imposed in certain counties for motor vehicle registration. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4; Title 55, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 201.
As enacted, provides for suspension of certain assessments against grain producers; revises other provisions regarding assessments and grain indemnity fund. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 32, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes P.O.W.-M.I.A. flags to be flown at welcome centers and, if flown, requires flag to be flown between the United States flag and the Tennessee state flag. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 4, Part 3.
As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County as "Tyler Leon Sneed Memorial Highway."

As introduced, exempts funeral directors from registering as pre-need sales agents or pre-need sellers before engaging in the sale of pre-need merchandise or pre-need contracts. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5.
As enacted, clarifies provisions governing victims assistance assessment. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As enacted, revises eligibility criteria for pretrial and judicial diversion programs. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, enhances the penalties for a second or subsequent conviction of domestic assault. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As enacted, changes the sentence for the offense of rape of a child from a minimum of 25 years to a minimum Range II sentence; permits a Range III sentence to be imposed if appropriate. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, names a portion of I-75 the Tuskegee Airmen Memorial Trail.

As enacted, prohibits charging a teacher with a day of leave for any day on which the teacher's school or school district is closed because of natural disaster, inclement weather, serious outbreak of contagious illness or other unexpected event. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, makes materials containing any quantity of ephedrine or pseudoephedrine a Schedule III controlled substance and exempts immediate methamphetamine precursors if they are not in form that can be used in manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires any permit issued by the department of environment and conservation to specify the types of waste a facility is prohibited from receiving for disposal or processing; prohibits any person from knowingly accepting for disposal or processing certain nuclear or radioactive materials in any landfill. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, removes the requirement that unconsciousness be "protracted" in cases where "serious bodily injury" results from strangulation. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires that 100% of the sentence imposed for attempts to commit murder in the first degree shall be served, minus certain credits; prohibits release eligibility for persons committing such offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, specifies that defendant released before trial will continue on release during trial or release pending trial under same terms and conditions as were previously imposed, unless the court determines that other terms and conditions or termination of release are necessary; authorizes court to order a defendant held without release during existing trial, if, after the defendant is released upon personal recognizance, an unsecured personal appearance bond, or any other bond approved by the court, the defendant violates a condition of release, is charged with an offense committed during the defendant's release, or engages in conduct which results in the obstruction of the orderly and expeditious progress of the trial or other proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, corrects reference from "commissioner of personnel" to "commissioner of human resources" in provision regarding membership of TCRS board of trustees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.
As introduced, corrects reference to the board of trustees of the consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 27.

As enacted, increases from $10,000 to $50,000 the maximum amount of retirement benefits that may be paid in a lump sum to a state employee's surviving spouse or next of kin in the absence of knowledge of a purported will naming a surviving executor. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 35; Title 8, Chapter 36; Title 8, Chapter 3.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing the Tennessee consolidated retirement system; requires that counsel for treasury department serve as attorney for the chair of TCRS and treasury with regard to deferred or tax-sheltered compensation plans. - Amends TCA Section 8-24-104(c); Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Section 8-25-111; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 2; Section 8-34-203; Section 8-34-302(a)(6); Section 8-34-319; Section 8-34-321; Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 2; Section 8-35-201(d); Section 8-35-218(a); Section 8-36-208(b) and Section 8-36-212.

As enacted, changes the early voting period when a presidential preference primary is held or an election is held at the same time as a presidential preference primary, to not more than 20 days nor less than seven days before the day of the election, instead of not more than 20 nor less than five days before the day of the election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6.

As enacted, eliminates early voting period for a municipal election in a municipality having a population of 5,000 or less, if there is no opposition for any office in the election and the election is held on a date which does not coincide with the August or November general election unless the municipality files a request with the county election commission for the early voting period to apply; does not apply to municipal elections in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of agriculture to appoint a qualified organization to be the sole and exclusive operator of a fair known as the Tennessee State Fair. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires petitions in juvenile court to contain the name of any alleged biological father if applicable; requires service of summons on alleged biological father in abuse, neglect or dependency proceedings; allows for service by electronic publication. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, revises certain provisions governing jurisdiction in juvenile court; grants temporary jurisdiction to issue temporary orders in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-103.

As enacted, amends various provisions regarding the transfer of juveniles to adult court and the department of children's services' custody of such children; authorizes communication between the adult court and the juvenile court; clarifies provisions on home placement supervision of juveniles. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, clarifies various provisions relating to divorce and custody proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 36.
