As enacted, permits an officer to test the blood alcohol content of certain drivers regardless of whether they consent. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
As introduced, enacts the "Prescription Integrity Act of 2011," which regulates therapeutic substitution of medications. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63.

As introduced, adds to list of events triggering extraordinary reporting requirements by licensed money transmitters the institution of any official investigation by a government entity with jurisdiction over financial laws. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the setting of bail in certain DUI-related cases. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.

As enacted, requires longevity pay for eligible state employees who previously worked for health departments of home rule municipalities; establishes eligibility criteria. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23.

As introduced, prohibits any public utility from collecting outstanding underpaid fees resulting from an error by the public utility's employee or agent beyond six months from date of erroneous bill. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 34; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 28, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 65 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 2.
As introduced, authorizes certain electronically published newspapers to be used for legal notices. - Amends TCA Section 1-3-105; Title 30, Chapter 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, exempts an animal from having a rabies inoculation if a veterinarian determines in writing that the inoculation would compromise the animal's health, but the owner must still be responsible for the fees. - Amends TCA Section 68-8-103.
As introduced, requires health insurance coverage of certain treatments for ectodermal dysplasia, cleft lip and cleft palate for children. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, establishes the Blue Alert system to provide rapid dissemination of information to aid in detection of persons when law enforcement officer is killed, injured or suspiciously missing in line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, requires that one of the seven members of the board of funeral directors and embalmers must be a representative of a multi-facility owner and operator of funeral homes, cemeteries or crematories. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, requires all public, private or volunteer fire agencies to conduct criminal background checks on paid or volunteer fire protection personnel applicants, and includes rescue squad personnel. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 102.
As enacted, allows dental service plans to make payments to dentists electronically if the dental service plan also receives claims from dentists electronically. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.
As introduced, deletes current statutory language which authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to assess investigatory and hearing costs. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, lowers the civil penalty for violations concerning gas pipeline systems from an amount not to exceed $10,000 per violation for each day that such violation persists to an amount not to exceed $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, creates the Tennessee Home Construction Jobs Development Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 60 and Title 13, Chapter 23.

As enacted, removes requirement that written notice of termination of teacher contain a statement that such notice was authorized by a majority vote of the local board of education with the name of the teacher receiving such note being recorded in the minutes of the board. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-409.

As enacted, removes the provision whereby only students in K-12 who were enrolled in and attended a public school during the previous school year are eligible to participate in a virtual public education program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
As introduced, requires the commissioner of education's annual report to be issued on July 1, rather than November 1, of each year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, changes the date on which the department of education must publish its annual report from November 1 to July 1. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-211.

As enacted, requires notice of termination of director of schools to comply with same requirements as notice of extension of a director's contract; requires termination of contract of director of schools to be first item on the agenda of the board meeting at which such action is to be considered. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203.

As introduced, authorizes Tennessee licensed wineries to conduct business at no more than two additional satellite locations after obtaining a satellite permit and paying a fee to the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, requires persons registering or paying property taxes on real property to designate an address of residence that notice of legal and administrative proceedings, whereby the real property is the subject, may be sent to meet proper service of process. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 66 and Title 67.
As enacted, enacts the "Annual Coverage Assessment Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, allows access by the fiscal review committee staff to certain confidential tax information and records in the possession of the department of revenue; requires the fiscal review committee staff to maintain the confidentiality of such information and records. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.

As enacted, requires licenses issued by the department of commerce and insurance and licenses required to work as athlete agents, lobbyists, and K-12 public school teachers to be denied, suspended, or revoked, if student loans are not paid. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 49 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires commissioner to report to comptroller any penalty waivers and taxpayers whom special investigations found violated criminal tax laws but were not reported to district attorney; requires comptroller to report annually to finance, ways and means committees waived penalties and amount of lost revenue from failing to prosecute; corrects incorrect code reference. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 14 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 8.

As introduced, increases income limitations for certain disabled homeowners, from present $24,000 to $26,500 each year, to be eligible for reimbursement for property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, lowers tax rate on retail sale of food from 5.5 percent to 5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires certain prospective recipients of the Tennessee HOPE access grant to enroll in an eligible postsecondary institution no later than 28 months following graduation from high school. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As introduced, increases annual income amount of certain elderly taxpayers who are eligible for property tax relief from $24,000 to $26,500 for tax years 2011 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, increases time of effectiveness of orders of protection; specifies that a person who violates an ex parte order of protection is subject to arrest. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.
As introduced, extends the time of ex parte orders of protection from 15 to 28 days. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.
As introduced, makes a third conviction of domestic assault punishable as a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes psychologists with certain training to prescribe medicines to patients. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the board of regents and the board of trustees for the University of Tennessee system to develop a verification process to establish the lawful presence of applicants for admission; prohibits the admission of applicants unlawfully present in the United States to either system. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, unless the context provides otherwise, specifies the criteria for being deemed a Tennessee citizen or resident. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 36 and Title 68, Chapter 3.

As introduced, prohibits counties and cities from imposing more stringent regulations on a lawfully operated private or nonprofit ambulance service than the regulations imposed on the county or city ambulance service. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 96 in Rutherford County as "James C. McKnight Bridge."

As enacted, clarifies that money deposited in the police pay supplement fund can only be used for the payment of police pay supplements and such other payments as may be authorized by the police pay supplement statute. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, decreases from 10 to five days the time for the supreme court clerks to deliver to the attorney general and reporter the supreme court opinions; decreases from 60 to 30 days the time for the attorney general and reporter to publish reports of such opinions. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to develop and implement a reporting plan to track the costs of civil litigation in which discovery of insurance limits is allowed in Tennessee as compared to other states and the federal system. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires that local governments employing traffic enforcement cameras make required signage in advance of such cameras visible and conspicuous; requires that citations state fine amount and additional fees or court costs separately. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As enacted, adds exceptions to the licensure requirements under the Tennessee Residential Lending, Brokerage and Servicing Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.
As introduced, provides for the redemption of certain property at tax sales that is situated in federally designated qualified census tracts within Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, moves presidential preference primary to first Tuesday in May from first Tuesday in February to coincide with county primary date. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 2, Chapter 13.
As enacted, mandates that group and individual insurance policies cover hearing aids for children covered by the policy. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, for counties which provide county-wide fire protection and which fund fire protection services from revenue as an alternate to establishing fire tax districts, requires the annual budget to identify specific revenues and amounts generated by situs-based taxes and other revenue sources that have been shared with municipalities which are used to fund such fire protection services. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

As introduced, provides that veterans or current members of the United States armed forces who are not residents of Tennessee shall be classified as out-of-state students but shall not be charged out-of-state tuition rates. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires all state and local governmental entities to verify that all employees hired after July 1, 2011, are not illegal aliens. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 39 and Title 50.

As introduced, deletes the requirement that taxes remitted by NHL and NBA players be solely used for expenses associated with securing current, expanded or new events for municipally-owned indoor sports facilities. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1703.

As introduced, provides that the red flag required to be attached to a load that projects beyond the rear of a motor vehicle may be made of plastic pliable material instead of cloth. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, deletes current statutory language that authorizes the commissioner at rulemaking hearings to administer oaths, receive oral and documentary evidence, and exercise subpoena power. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, deletes the authorization in present law that two or more central business improvement districts may overlap and encompass some or all of the same properties. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 84.

As introduced, authorizes a municipality to issue revenue bonds for a public facility acquired, improved or constructed by a third party including a private entity, notwithstanding any local charter provision or other law to the contrary. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 32 and Title 7, Chapter 33.
As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to promulgate rules pertaining to automobile clubs and associations. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, authorizes a dental service plan corporation to limit participation by dentists if the dental plan is providing or managing dental benefits for the impoverished uninsured on behalf of or as required by any governmental entity. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.
As introduced, exempts new, and newly relocated, small businesses from excise tax liability for a period of five consecutive tax years. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As enacted, specifies that if a county has been reimbursed for housing convicted felons for a continuous period of three or more fiscal years and has received the maximum amount allowed per prisoner per day as reasonable allowable costs during this period, then the county would thereafter be presumed to be entitled to the full maximum amount allocated per prisoner per day as reimbursement of reasonable allowable costs for housing such prisoners. - Amends TCA Section 41-8-106.

As introduced, subject to local approval, reallocates proceeds from the hotel/motel tax from the general fund for county general revenue, with 90 percent being allocated to the tourism fund and 10 percent, minus the trustee's commission, being allocated to the Anderson County chamber of commerce for economic development purposes. - Amends Chapter 193 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended.

As enacted, allows Anderson County register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents maintained on computers; also allows register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents at request of certain persons if practicable. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-515.
As introduced, adds a representative from Oak Ridge to the Knoxville Regional Transportation Planning Office. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 8.

As introduced, corrects definition of "regional accrediting association" for HOPE scholarship purposes to change the name of the Northwestern Association of Schools and Colleges to its present name of the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, requires TSAC to publish eligibility requirements for the minority teaching fellows program. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-706.

As introduced, requires local law enforcement to make every reasonable effort to have a visible presence during the time a door-to-door campaign is scheduled upon the written request of the public official conducting such campaign. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, simplifies lottery scholarship statutes by removing obsolete and unnecessary provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, permits THEC to post its annual report on its Web site and provide a summary of the report to the standing committees on education in lieu of disseminating the full report to the committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires annual progress report of governing body of a public charter school to be made to the executive director of the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for legitimate business purposes or commercial uses from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for residential use from sales taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, establishes monetary limits on a candidate's contributions to the candidate's own campaign for state or local office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 3.
As enacted, states that a parent, guardian or other person who has control of a truant student commits educational neglect. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.

As enacted, states that attendance laws apply to remedial instruction for students who are determined to require such instruction, including summer school and after school programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, establishes provisions governing survival of certain rights of actions in regard to a surviving spouse who has abandoned the deceased spouse. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires persons serving process to not have been convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 21, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires corporation policies and procedures concerning competitive bidding of major procurement contracts to be reviewed and approved by the procurement commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 4, Chapter 56.

As introduced, allows corporations to contribute to candidates and certain multicandidate political campaign committees; allows use of corporate funds for certain political activity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, changes date of presidential preference primary from February to March and the qualifying deadline to the second Thursday in December. - Amends TCA Section 2-13-205 and Section 2-5-101.

As enacted, creates criteria to enable a minor party to be recognized; permits name of candidate for such party to be listed under the appropriate column for a recognized minor party. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 13, Part 2 and Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by Hardeman County may be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101 and Section 54-7-202.
As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school as well as during fall and spring semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, requires reference in governor's budget document to personal income and appropriations from state tax revenues from 10 years prior to current year and fiscal year, instead of from 1977 and from fiscal year 1977-1978. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.
As enacted, revises the provisions governing using a spotlight to locate deer. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, deletes prohibition against using bait, including grain and other ingredients, used as or for food purposes, to capture or kill protected birds or animals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes commissioner to implement procedure to award certain federal transportation enhancement grant funding directly to established nonprofit organizations for acquisition and preservation of civil war battlefield sites and that preference be given to nonprofit civil war preservation organizations over state agencies. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, requires that a traffic citation based upon evidence obtained by a traffic enforcement camera is to be served upon the driver in the same manner as a criminal summons and prosecuted in the same manner as a traffic citation based upon the observation of a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, requires a lien book to be kept in the register's office of the county where the land lies. - Amends TCA Title 25.

As introduced, deletes statutory requirement that certain health clubs post either a bond of $25,000 or an audited financial statement with the department of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Section 47-18-321.

As introduced, requires the treasurer's annual report to include the total amounts received and paid out of the criminal injuries compensation fund and the number of claims for compensation asserted. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, allows clerk of court in which an action was initiated to transmit the transcript and original documents to clerk of court to which venue was transferred through e-mail in addition to physical transfer of records, upon agreement of both clerks. - Amends TCA Title 20.
As introduced, provides for extension of statutes of limitations and statutes of repose in the event the governor declares a disaster. - Amends TCA Title 28.

As enacted, allows three or more sexual offenders to establish primary or secondary residence together if the property on which they live has been zoned for a use other than residential or mixed use by the appropriate local zoning laws. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As introduced, creates a special committee of public citizens to review which licensed or certified professions can be deregulated.
Enacts "Tennessee Fair and Independent Congressional Redistricting Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.

As introduced, provides for the state sales tax on food and food ingredients, which is presently 5.5 percent, being reduced by 0.5 percent per year in any fiscal year following a year in which the amount of surplus state revenue collected above budgeted estimates exceeds $50 million. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits the possession, promotion, sale, distribution, transportation, purchase or exchange of material that includes an adapted or modified depiction of an identifiable minor engaged in sexual activity or simulated sexual activity that is patently offensive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires identification of appropriation items impacting single legislative districts; requires majority vote on each item by full finance committees; requires 2/3 vote on each item for approval on floor. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 9.
As introduced, removes requirement that Tennessee state fair be held annually in Nashville. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As introduced, terminates pension eligibility for members elected or appointed to the general assembly on and after November 6, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8.

As introduced, limits the amount of money that a multicandidate political campaign committee can contribute to candidates and other multicandidate political campaign committees excluding party and caucus PACs; requires multicandidate political campaign committee to certify names and addresses of persons making decisions about the committee's contributions and expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for businesses maintaining health programs or pension plans in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, clarifies that state house districts must comply with all federal statutes and court decisions. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, clarifies that senate must comply with applicable federal statutes. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits inmates from accessing personal identifying information of state residents or employees through prison work programs. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As introduced, allows a victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a lease or rental agreement if notice and documentation that tenant is a victim are presented to landlord. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that on or before October 1, 2012, any person who provides satisfactory proof that such person graduated from a court reporting program in this state prior to January 1, 2012, will be licensed to practice as a court reporter. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.
As introduced, specifies that it is the court's discretion whether to approve a transfer of structured settlement payment rights. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 26.
As enacted, requires hospitals to have certain persons authenticate verbal orders. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As introduced, requires TennCare managed care organizations (MCOs) to allow TennCare enrollees to request particular providers for non-emergency ambulance service and requires all providers to be reimbursed on same basis whether or not they are in the MCO's network. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes municipality or county that compensates counsel for county election commission to select that counsel instead of allowing the commission to select their own counsel. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1.

As enacted, removes the six-year limitation on the duration of non-compete agreements between a healthcare provider and an employing or contracting entity; applies the present law limitations on non-compete agreements for physicians to such agreements for osteopathic physicians. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, requires county trustee to notify commissioner of education within 10 days of payment of funds of dissolved special school district to the county board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As introduced, requires director of schools of each LEA to submit report on alternative schools to the commissioner of education instead of the senate and house education committees; requires commissioner to include compilation of these reports in commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, eliminates required annual study by the state board of education of the weight of textbooks; requires commissioner of education to perform the study one time every five years and permits study to be done more often if the commissioner determines it to be necessary. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, allows designees of named members of THEC to serve in members' places. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, enacts the "Move on When Ready Act." - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, defines installation and deinstallation services for sales tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, directs the comptroller to study issues relating to the letting of contracts for weatherization services by the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

As enacted, directs the office to study certain issues related to the use of old warrants and related process by local law enforcement and to report to the house and senate judiciary committees on or before February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, provides for a special probation punishment for certain first offense marijuana violators who are age 18-21. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, prohibits a traffic citation in Knox County for not coming to a complete stop before turning right on red at certain intersections that is based solely on evidence from a traffic surveillance camera. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, establishes certain claim settlement practices for insurers issuing automobile liability insurance in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, designates segment of State Route 62 in Knox County as "Veterans Memorial Mile."

As introduced, directs the commissioner of economic and community development, in consultation with MTAS and CTAS, to study the effects of state and local tax incentives on the economic development of municipalities and counties. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits mortgage companies from estimating the cost of homeowner's insurance for inclusion in their good faith estimate of closing costs; requires the prospective purchaser to provide this information to the mortgage company. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As enacted, allows direct shipper to ship wine to any address in the state. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-217.
As introduced, increases the late application fee, accompanying a late application responding to a notice of disqualification, from $50.00 to $75.00. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes fire service utility district in Knox County to impose charges on nonsubscriber for cost of services rendered. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 3 and Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that fire chiefs can relinquish control over any other fire district's fire department or company responding to an emergency in the chief's fire district. - Amends TCA Title 6 and Title 7.
As enacted, changes the name of the association that nominates members for the governor to appoint to the board of optometry. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 8.
As introduced, requires the department of transportation to mark the appropriate exits for certain hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-706.

As introduced, specifies that if Tennessee's lethal injection protocol is held unconstitutional, defendants sentenced to death by lethal injection shall be executed by any lethal injection protocol upheld by the United States supreme court versus "any constitutional method." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2 and Title 40, Chapter 23, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that venue for the prosecution of the offense of promotion of methamphetamine manufacture is proper in any county in which a drug or chemical used to produce meth or an immediate meth precursor is purchased. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, allows veterans to use state park facilities free one day a month instead of once a year; allows commissioner to offer discounted rates to veterans all the time, not just during off season. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3 and Title 58, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates the Class C felony offense of endangering a child through the manufacture of methamphetamine which is initiating the manufacture of meth in a residence in which a child under 14 is located or within 200 feet of such a residence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, names bridge in Somerville in honor of Colonel Will Rhea Winfrey, United States Army, Retired.
As enacted, names bridge in Grand Junction in honor of Dr. N.H. Edwards.

As enacted, authorizes a highway patrol member in good standing that retires because the member met the mandatory retirement age but didn't have 20 years of service to keep his badge and weapon and to receive a retired commissioned card. - Amends TCA Section 4-7-110.

As introduced, authorizes public employees who are in the military to use five days of sick leave in lieu of annual leave after the employee has received 20 working days of compensation so the employee does not have to take leave without pay when called to military duties. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes capitol police who have completed certain law enforcement training to have law enforcement powers throughout the state; authorizes capitol police to be employed as a security guard/officer for a private business licensed by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20; Title 38 and Title 62, Chapter 35, Part 1.
As introduced, includes drug felonies under felony murder. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-202.
As enacted, adds random killings to the list of aggravating factors for imposition of the death penalty. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-204.
As introduced, includes murder as the result of gang activity as an aggravating factor for purposes of death penalty sentencing. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

As enacted, deletes the age limitation in statute permitting mothers to publicly breastfeed only their children who are age 12 months or younger. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-511 and Title 68, Chapter 58.
As introduced, deletes two definitions that are not used in the lottery scholarship program and deletes an obsolete provision. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires the consortium for cooperative innovative education to evaluate annually the need for legislation to assist in development of programs enabling high school students to earn college credit and to present its findings and conclusions in its annual report; changes date annual report is to be made from February 15 to January 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, clarifies that before returning a severely abused child to the home where abuse occurred the court must find by clear and convincing evidence that the child will be safe from further abuse, including written findings of fact. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-130.

As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding utility districts, water systems and wastewater systems including provisions governing a required bond and annual audit; revises law regarding the filling of vacancies on the board of commissioners of a utility district and the filling of vacancies in the office of a utility district commissioner and removes certain exceptions to various requirements regarding utility districts. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.

As introduced, requires the director of the office of legislative budget analysis to report by the second Tuesday in January to the speakers of each house, the education committees of each house, and the comptroller, if the commissioner of education fails to provide the revised BEP funding formula for the ensuing fiscal year by January 1. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to report the status of all local governments' and local government entities' debt management policies, including total outstanding debt, to the state and local government committees of each house by the second Tuesday in March. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.

As introduced, increases the bond a county property assessor must post from $10,000 to $25,000 and removes the present law provision stating that the governing body of any county by a 2/3 vote may elect whether or not county officials must post a bond. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 18; Title 49; Title 54 and Title 67.
As introduced, removes obsolete reference to the public deposits task force. - Amends TCA Title 9.

As introduced, specifies that the comptroller will serve as vice chair of school bond authority, in addition to serving as secretary; specifies authority may prescribe its rules and regulations and govern its proceedings as it deems advisable; specifies that a majority of authority constitutes a quorum and confirming vote of three members is required. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to conduct a study of the statutory law and cases involving the manner in which delinquent property taxes are reported by the trustee and collected by delinquent tax attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, specifies that a personal property schedule may be amended only for certain reasons and that the failure of a taxpayer to receive the schedule would not excuse the taxpayer from filing the schedule by March 1. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, provides that when the department of labor and workforce development conducts unemployment hearings that personnel records and other business records that are in the possession of a claimants employer and that are relevant to a claim are admissible and may constitute proof of misconduct, regardless of whether such evidence is hearsay or whether corroborated by direct witness testimony, if such evidence is accompanied by an affidavit of its custodian or other qualified person certifying the evidence as a business record. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

As enacted, changes the number and qualifications of students, the selection process, and term length for appointment to the board of the Tennessee student assistance corporation. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-202.

As introduced, authorizes the department of education to establish a three-year pilot project of competitive grants for middle school after school and summer educational programs. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

As introduced, allows certain employers to apply for exemptions from the workers' compensation law if such employers meet certain requirements, such as filing a security bond for $500,000 with the commissioner of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.
As enacted, specifies procedures for determining retired law enforcement officer's eligibility to carry a firearm under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As enacted, exempts income derived from cemetery trusts from state and local taxation. - Amends TCA Title 46, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes that the sole educational and experience qualification for the position of highway superintendent in certain counties is a high school education or GED. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, removes authority from the department of agriculture to regulate or inspect a distillery or wholesaler of alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 53 and Title 57.
As introduced, allows common carriers to accept for shipment and to transport the products of manufacturers to points within the state. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2 and Title 57, Chapter 3.
As introduced, allows manufacturers to obtain license to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.
As introduced, exempts manufacturers from certificate of compliance requirement when applying for retail license; allows manufacturers to sell certain merchandise. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.
As introduced, requires the department of education to post teacher effect data by LEA and school in which the teacher is employed on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Arsenic Feeding Law." - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 2 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, clarifies that sales tax does not apply to sales of agricultural products from farmer to consumer; specifies that agricultural products includes certain meats and prepared food items containing farm-raised ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44; Title 53 and Title 67.

As introduced, specifies that the Dairy Law of the state of Tennessee does not prohibit the independent or partial owner of any hoofed mammal from using products made from the milk from such animal for the owner's personal consumption or other personal use; present law addresses only the milk from such animals. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 3.
As introduced, expands the Dairy Industry Promotion Act to include organic milk and milk products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 19, Part 1.

As introduced, requires all poultry processed in this or other states and sold in this state to state whether arsenic was fed to poultry at any time prior to processing. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Farm Land Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 7; Title 29 and Title 43.

As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for certain counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

As enacted, creates the commercial fishing advisory committee; requires TWRA to request approval from the Convention for the International Trade of Endangered Species (CITES) to establish a length limit of at least 36 inches and an annual season length no shorter than November 15 to April 15; requires TWRA to develop a plan to study sustainability, population conditions, and juvinal survival rates on waters not currently open to commercial roe fishing. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Farm Winery Law." - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, adds a horticulturist and a person with ornamental lawn and turf experience to the pest control board. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21.
As enacted, authorizes local governments to establish community gardening programs. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As enacted, retains authority for a municipality or municipal agency to participate in, sponsor, conduct, or administer a cooperative purchasing agreement for the procurement of any supplies or any services other than construction, engineering or architectural services or construction materials with one or more other local governments outside of this state but removes authority for such cooperative agreements to be within this state. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1009.
As introduced, authorizes deduction of amounts owed to an employer from an employee under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, clarifies provisions for creation, operation and governance of certain regional airport authorities. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 9, Part 1 and Title 42, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Animal Fighting Enforcement Act," increasing penalties for certain offenses involving animal fighting. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
As introduced, provides additional exceptions to the Tennessee Residential Lending, Brokerage and Servicing Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-13-201(b).
As introduced, permits certain entities to limit the liability of a landowner to the entity for certain activities on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As enacted, authorizes increase to the maximum amount of the allowance that may be provided to members of boards of public utilities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 1.
As enacted, provides for the naming of certain roads and bridges in honor of certain specified persons and provides for the placement of other certain signage. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, extends deadline for Civil War Preservation special license plates to meet minimum order requirement; authorizes issuance of Music City Alumni Chapter of Western Kentucky University; names segment of State Route 68 in Monroe County the "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway". - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, increases from three to five years the period of time that must elapse before an obsolete new specialty earmarked plate may be re-issued; specifies the type of plates that may not be re-issued in this period. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.
As introduced, provides for issuance of Cave Salamander special license plate; proceeds to be deposited in the wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires department of revenue to issue dealer plates with distinctive numbering system. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires department of revenue to study its administration of the new specialty earmarked plate program and report recommendations to reduce unnecessary administrative burdens to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires department of transportation to prepare a long-range transportation plan that includes state-controlled bridges and highway improvements that will be revised and submitted annually to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, urges commissioner to use wildflowers native to each grand division in new wildflower plantings. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, defines "surveillance camera" as used in the rules of the road. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

As enacted, clarifies that persons who reside in counties that do not require the display of a motor vehicle privilege tax decal on their license plates are not required to display any such decal. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires TDOT to provide supplemental report of progress of Tollway Act pilot program to general assembly by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.
As introduced, removes outdated language from transportation equity trust fund provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 56, Part 2; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes TDOT to employ analysts and economists in addition to other employees to perform duties related to railroad regulation. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, declares that bond requirement for all public contracts in excess of $100,000 is subject to change based on the consumer price index for the previous calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, increases the distance of the required unobstructed view of stopped vehicles upon any highway outside of a business or residential district from 200 feet to 300 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, extends sight distance required for certain parked vehicles from 200 feet to 250 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, defines the term "rickshaw" to exclude bicycles built for more than three persons and also to exclude any type of motorized scooter used by a disabled person. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, decreases from 30 to 20 the number of days following a conviction for a traffic violation that a commercial vehicle operator must notify employer of the conviction. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires department to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources when any county is designated as a "citizen transportation area." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10; Title 38; Title 39; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, increases from three to five years moratorium between time plate has become obsolete and invalid until re-authorization by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of various special license plates; extends minimum order deadline for certain plates and redesignates certain plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires violations from traffic enforcement cameras to be reviewed by POST-certified officers, rather than employees of law enforcement office; prohibits mailing of notices of such violations by traffic camera vendors. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, creates a per se DUI offense for driving with Schedule I or II drugs in a person's system unless the person has a valid prescription for the Schedule II drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires each LEA to determine each student's, and each health care facility to determine each patient's, citizenship and immigration status; aggregate reports of students and patients to be delivered to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 11.
As introduced, creates offenses of use and possession of certain devices with the intent to commit, aid, or abet any unlawful activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, designates progress report on Memphis Research Consortium to be annual report to standing committees on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, creates pilot project in Shelby County requiring a seller of scrap jewelry or precious metals to give thumbprint on purchaser's transaction log. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-203.
As enacted, deletes wild hog from definition of "big game" and removes permitting requirements for hunting wild boars and wild hogs. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offenses regarding drawing and filing of deeds without actual ownership of property. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 66.

As enacted, changes the reporting deadline of the special joint committee to study the capping of utility rates for senior citizens from February 1, 2011, to June 1, 2011. - Amends Chapter 1071 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As enacted, authorizes the Tennessee Code Commission to make stylistic, nonsubstantive changes when codifying acts of the general assembly and preparing replacement volumes, so long as such changes are consistent with style guidelines adopted by the commission and submitted to the senate and house judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Section 1-1-108.

As introduced, prohibits a health insurance carrier, and any subcontractor of the carrier, from making changes to policies, procedures, payment methodologies, or claims processing edits that have the effect of lowering negotiated rates unless agreed to by the hospital. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 10.

As introduced, grants property owner, or a deceased owner's heirs or assigns, whose land is taken by eminent domain the right to repurchase such property if the condemning entity does not use the property for the purpose for which it was condemned or if the entity sells the property within 10 years of condemnation. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17, Part 10.

As introduced, requires county and municipal legislative bodies to conduct a public hearing on necessity of condemning property and approve the exercise of eminent domain by a majority vote prior to any property being condemned and taken by such bodies. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding law enforcement access to the controlled substances database and the application process for such access. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3.

As introduced, adds certain persons to the controlled substance database advisory committee; requires the committee to release certain database information to the Tennessee bureau of investigation and to a manager or prosecution unit conducting any investigation, adjudication or prosecution that involves a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires all physicians' offices that perform five or more abortions annually to be licensed as ambulatory surgical treatment centers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes drug testing for reasonable cause of persons who receive public assistance benefits; authorizes termination of benefits of persons testing positive for controlled substances who do not enroll in a drug treatment program. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires the popular election of state trial court judges, appellate court judges, and supreme court judges; makes other revisions for filling vacancies. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5; Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 17, Chapter 4 and Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that a federal employee who is not designated as a Tennessee peace officer may not make an arrest or conduct a search and seizure in this state without the written permission of the sheriff of the county in which the arrest, search and seizure will take place except under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes certain property to be classified as affordable housing rental property for tax assessment purposes. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.
As enacted, requires the state board of education to post the teacher code of ethics on its Web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 10.

As enacted, authorizes the use of a duplicate capias for the arrest or surrender of an individual when the clerk is unavailable to provide a certified capias. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, requires office of research and education accountability to compile activities and recommendations of statewide education reform initiatives and report to governor and education committees as requested. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, requires that state board of education mandate revisions to financial literacy education, including as component on certain achievement tests, after recommendations made by financial literacy commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.

As enacted, specifies that if a statute, ordinance, resolution, rule or regulation mandates the use of competitive bidding of any kind or nature whatsoever, by any state agency, county or municipal corporation, then no addenda would be permitted less than 48 hours of the bid opening date; questions concerning the bid documents must be received by the designer no less than 96 hours before the bid opening date; not applicable to DOT contracts or state or local agency contracts funded with state or federal highway funds. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts the "Surplus Lines Insurance Act" and the Surplus Lines Insurance Multi-State Compliance Compact. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14.

As enacted, authorizes filings for personal risk insurance that provide for an overall statewide rate increase or decrease of no more than 15% in the aggregate for all coverages that are subject to the filing to take effect the date it is filed. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

As enacted, requires the health related boards and the boards attached to the division of regulatory boards to develop a procedure to expedite the licensing or certification of persons who were licensed or certified in another state and accompanied their spouse, who is the subject of a military transfer, to Tennessee; requires regulatory boards to develop methods to allow certain persons to perform professional services for a limited period of time. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 13; Title 62 and Title 68.

As enacted, applies the hours for the sale of beer on Sunday to the area of the county outside of a municipality that adopts liquor-by-the-drink in a referendum, unless the county legislative body by a 2/3 vote sets the hours for the sale of beer on Sunday in areas outside such municipality. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, increases reasonable fee authorized to be charged by commissioner of revenue to issue revenue letters or revenue rulings from $200 to $250. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of agriculture to appoint an advisory committee to provide assistance to the commissioner concerning invasive pest plants in Tennessee; the appointments shall be from rural and urban areas of the three grand divisions and the members shall serve without compensation or reimbursement for travel expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, subjects members of the general assembly to the same laws as are applicable to elected municipal, county and other local officials enacted in the public interest to provide transparency and accountability in government. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.

As introduced, authorizes county election commissions to use ballot-on-demand printers during early voting periods upon a majority vote of the county legislative body approving such use; establishes a standard for the printing of a sufficient number of ballots for any election. - Amends TCA Section 2-20-105.

As enacted, authorizes $4.00 to be deducted from the wages of prisoners in a county workhouse in certain circumstances to satisfy judgments against the prisoner to make restitution to the victim. - Amends TCA Section 41-2-129(c).
As introduced, provides for a department of health program to augment the provision of adult emergency dental services for indigents. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires any public water system or waterworks system that initiates or permanently discontinues the fluoridation of its water supply to give notice of such discontinuance to the departments of health and environment and conservation within 10 days of decision and public notice to customers in the next general mailing, which must be 30 days prior to discontinuance. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, requires license for a facility to perform outpatient elective cosmetic medical procedures or treatment. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the department of education to develop an athletic concussion policy for adoption by each LEA and commands insurance companies issuing policies to certain entities for accident coverage to require those entities develop an athletic concussion policy and procedures. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 56.

As introduced, authorizes Davidson County clerk to perform vehicle inspections, and collect a fee up to $37.50 for such inspection, prior to issuing certificate of title for a rebuilt motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 7; Title 18, Chapter 6 and Title 55, Chapter 3.

As enacted, extends property tax relief to the surviving spouse of a soldier whose death results from being deployed, away from any home base of training and in support of combat operations, if the surviving spouse does not remarry; solely or jointly owns the property for which tax relief is claimed; and uses the property for which tax relief is claimed exclusively as a home. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.
As enacted, deletes outdated language from requirements concerning the sex offender registry. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-116.

As introduced, provides that persons who have been convicted of a felony and escaped from confinement or broken terms of bail or probation shall be presumed at substantial risk for willfully failing to appear and require substantial bail. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 1.

As enacted, removes statutory requirements that law enforcement agencies make order of protection entries into the Tennessee criminal information system; eliminates these entries from the TBI database within two years from the effective date of the act. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 71, Chapter 6.

As enacted, authorizes spouses of military members who leave employment due to military reassignment to qualify for unemployment benefits; requires that state pay such benefits and does not count against employer's experience rating. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As enacted, makes several additions to present law concerning the sale of alcoholic beverages; expands the definition of "Tennessee River resort district" to include a limited service restaurant located within a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, provides for the manufacturing and retail sale of high alcohol content beer; revises various provisions of law regarding alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, authorizes a licensed wholesaler holding a basic permit under the Federal Alcohol Administration Act as an importer to import alcoholic beverages and wine under certain circumstances; permits a licensed wholesaler to deliver alcoholic beverages and wine by common carrier to a retailer only in certain quantities. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes a manufacturer of intoxicating liquors or drinks in certain localities to be issued a license by the alcoholic beverage commission for on-premises consumption of the liquors or drinks produced at the licensed facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.
As introduced, requires commission to implement new licensing structure for restaurants and limited service restaurants based on liability insurance codes. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

As introduced, transfers regulatory authority over municipality operating electric plant that provides cable, video programming, Internet or similar services to Tennessee Regulatory Authority for such services. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.
As enacted, increases certain fees sheriffs and constables may collect. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-901.

As enacted, clarifies and updates the language of various provisions of law regarding the powers of incorporated municipalities; generally removes archaic language and comports the powers to be compliant with other general law provisions. - Amends TCA Title 6.
As introduced, removes restrictions on county redesignating county mayor as county executive; specifies duties for county attorney. - Amends TCA Title 5.

As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, clarifies the period of time included in statements filed prior to primary and general elections; clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, clarifies that any legal authority shall be cited in the written denial of a public records request. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.

As introduced, increases size of voting precincts from 5,000 registered voters to 6,000 registered voters; requires one voting machine for every 800 registered voters instead of 1,000 voters. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, allows ethics commission or commission staff to provide information on the status of a complaint to the named complainant and to the alleged violator. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3, Chapter 6; Title 4, Chapter 55 and Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.

As introduced, requires counties receiving correctional incentive subsidies to submit an accounting of such expenditures to the commissioner; if the facility has not been certified pursuant to state jail standards, prohibits grant of future subsidies unless required expenditures are made; authorizes the commissioner to reimburse counties for actual improvement expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As enacted, renames the "Tennessee distinguished service medal" as the "Tennessee fallen heroes medal". - Amends TCA Section 8-30-306; Section 49-7-102; Title 58, Chapter 7; Title 58, Chapter 3 and Section 67-5-704.

As introduced, increases the time in which the secretary of state has to return an application for a construction services provider's workers' compensation exemption from 10 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, increases contribution limits by 20% and then ties future increases to reflect change in the CPI; allows corporations to contribute to candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As enacted, increases contribution limits to reflect change in the CPI; allows corporations to contribute to candidates; revises certain other provisions regarding campaign funds. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, authorizes an employer subject to certain state employment law penalties to send written notification of the employer's intention to challenge the assessment of penalties electronically to an e-mail address designated by the commissioner of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 50.
As introduced, requires employers to pay tipped employees wages at a rate of at least $6.55 per hour. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2.
As introduced, requires the commissioner of education to submit annual report as of each December 1, rather than November 1. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, broadens requirement that drivers exercise due care to apply to bicyclists; enhances penalty for certain traffic violations that cause serious bodily injury or death. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, authorizes the issuance of revenue or letter rulings on an expedited basis; allows the commissioner to determine a reasonable fee for such service, subject to certain specified maximum amounts. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, allows taxpayers and the commissioner or the commissioner's delegate to enter into agreements extending the one-year statute of limitations period for filing suits in chancery court challenging denied claims for refund. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-1802.

As introduced, extends the time in which a foreign judgment may be enforced from 30 days to 40 days after the date a summons has been served upon the judgment debtor. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 19; Title 20; Title 21; Title 25; Title 26 and Title 45.
As introduced, prohibits county clerk from registering or renewing registration if owner has parking tickets within such county that are more than 60 days past due. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, provides that the department of correction cannot incarcerate a prisoner in a private contract prison facility if the security classification for the prisoner is higher than the private facility is designed to house. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As enacted, reconstitutes the board of directors for the Four Lake regional industrial development authority and makes certain other changes concerning the management of the authority. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that an officer making a lawful stop or detaining a person who violates certain traffic offenses shall cause the seizure of the person's vehicle if the person is unlawfully present in the United States. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, inserts a statutory citation in regard to a reference to the board of claims in provisions regarding insurance for the state. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8 and Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 9.

As introduced, prohibits both the driver and passenger of a motor vehicle from consuming an alcoholic beverage or possessing an open alcoholic beverage container within the passenger area. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, allows the governor to fill a vacancy in the office of an appellate court by appointing any person who is duly licensed to practice in this state and who is fully qualified under the law of this state if the governor is not satisfied with the list of nominees submitted by the judicial selection commission or the commission does not furnish a list of nominees within 60 days after receiving written notice from the governor that a vacancy has occurred; provides that if the governor appoints a judge who is not from the list of nominees submitted by the commission, the judge appointed shall run in a contested election. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, requires that any award of punitive damages in a civil action be divided equally with the plaintiff and with the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20; Title 22; Title 23; Title 29; Title 33; Title 36; Title 39; Title 45; Title 47; Title 49; Title 65; Title 66; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As enacted, provides that a Tennessee Distinguished Service Medal may be awarded on behalf of the people of the state of Tennessee to an individual serving on active duty who has been killed in action, while engaging in certain military service. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1 and Title 58, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that liability for legal and financial obligations pertaining to real property subject to a lease and payment in lieu of tax (PILOT) agreement remains with the person who transferred title to the municipality or corporation; provides immunity for the municipality or corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.
As introduced, extends deadline for applications for 2011-2012 annual events for five days after effective date of act. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As enacted, revises various provisions relative to administration of estates; makes certain revisions in regard to jurisdiction in Greene County; conforms state law to extend the time period for certain disclaimers as authorized by the federal Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act. - Amends TCA Title 18; Title 30; Title 31 and Title 32.
As enacted, designates welcome center at Exit 9 on Interstate 26 in Unicoi County as the "Zane Whitson Welcome Center."

As enacted, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including the development of marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, increases from three to seven the number of persons/electors required for submission of an application for incorporation of a public building authority. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, requires municipalities to employ licensed engineers to prepare bid specifications and estimates for all street improvements over $25,000. - Amends TCA Section 54-4-204.

As introduced, requires the board of trustees of the University of Tennessee system to submit its report to the governor on the number of students and the workings of the system 10 business days instead of 10 days before the general assembly convenes. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, adds local education agencies to those able to sponsor a charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires licensed motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers to maintain records of each vehicle purchased for seven years rather than three. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 55 and Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As enacted, enacts "The Virtual Public Schools Act." - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, enhances the offense of aggravated assault where death results from Class C or D felony to Class B felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, adds emergency medical services personnel to mandatory retirement provisions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35 and Title 8, Chapter 36.
As introduced, creates 12 additional assistant district attorney general positions. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2.
As introduced, eliminates post-conviction relief at the state level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 16; Title 29; Title 38; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, creates a good faith exception to the exclusionary rule. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, prohibits department from promulgating rules to impose fees on public safety agencies for the registration and inspection of x-ray machines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 5.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates to members and associate members of organization without 1,000 plate minimum and allocates 50% of revenues derived from sale thereof to organization's charitable foundation; deletes authorization for National Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, removes the requirement that a defendant have a BAC of .20 and a prior conviction to meet the requirements of aggravated vehicular homicide and includes, as a part of the offense, a BAC of .08 in addition to any amount of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides for revocation of licenses or certificates of a dentist, dental hygienist, or dental assistant if the licensee or registrant fails to pay license or registration fee within 90 days, instead of 60 days, after such fee becomes due. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As enacted, regulates pain management clinics and requires that such clinics apply for certification as such a clinic with the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, revises membership of the solid waste disposal control board, the water quality control board, and the air pollution control board. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As introduced, prohibits the use of cell phones in school zones while warning lights are flashing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, adds enlistment and active duty service in a branch of United States Armed Forces as a possible condition of pretrial diversion for a defendant who is 21 years or younger and eligible for military service. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, requires letter rulings and revenue rulings issued by the commissioner of revenue to be open to the public. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, allows an aggrieved party to appeal a workers' compensation specialist's order of future medicals in a workers' compensation case after judgment or settlement. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As enacted, authorizes licensure and regulation of businesses where customers can make wine for personal, home consumption. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-703 and Title 57.
As introduced, requires licensure of independent insurance adjusters. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, changes the amount and time period within which a person can purchase base ephedrine and pseudoephedrine from a pharmacy and decreases the amount of base necessary for the offense of promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, authorizes enhanced penalties for promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine or initiating the process of manufacture of methamphetamine in a school zone. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, specifies that knowingly exposing a child to the making of methamphetamine is aggravated child endangerment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, enacts the "I Hate Meth Act." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, exempts from the sales and use tax diabetic testing supplies, including but not limited to lancets, test strips for blood glucose monitors and visual reading and urine test strips, sold pursuant to a prescription for human use. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, enacts the "Pharmacy Benefit Integrity Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 31.

As enacted, specifies that for purposes of the present tobacco tax law, "cigarette" includes any cigarette produced by a cigarette rolling machine at a retail establishment; adds various requirements regarding such cigarettes and rolling machines operators. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 43 and Title 67.
