As enacted, requires licensed distributor reports filed with the department of revenue to be admitted into evidence as non-hearsay documents in all judicial and administrative proceedings. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.
As introduced, extends biodiesel manufacturers' incentive fund one additional year, until June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, makes violations of the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act a violation of the Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for Prince Hall Masons; allocates 50 percent of proceeds to Orange Mound Lodge, Free and Accepted Masons in Memphis. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, directs that house and senate judiciary committees study application of death penalty in Tennessee; provides for moratorium on executions until study results are presented to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, increases penalty for speeding in marked school zone from Class C misdemeanor to Class B misdemeanor; designates $50.00 of such enhanced penalty to be used by TDOT for grants for safe pathways for students. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, authorizes a county mayor, when disposing of an unclaimed body at public expense where no relative or medical examiner claims the body, to do so by cremation or burial; cremated remains may be interred, entombed or inurned. - Amends TCA Section 68-4-103.

As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 35; Title 42; Title 47; Title 48; Title 64; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.
As introduced, abolishes monitoring inspection fee levied on manufactured home manufacturers. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 68, Chapter 126.
As introduced, provides for TennCare and health insurance coverage of telemedicine services. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.

As enacted, permits the district attorney to apply for an order to wiretap if the interception may provide evidence of a criminal gang offense by a criminal gang member. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, imposes higher classifications for certain violent crimes that are committed by three or more persons; sets the presumptive sentence for such crimes classified as Class A felonies at the maximum within the range; describes indictment parameters. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, increases the penalties for discharging a firearm into a habitation. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, authorizes certain retirees of the highway patrol to retain their badge and service weapon and require that such persons be issued a retired commission card.

As introduced, prohibits any board under the division of health related boards from issuing or renewing a license to a health care professional or applicant who might engage in direct patient care when that professional or applicant has been convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires proof of compliance with financial responsibility law prior to registering motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement officer not engaged in duties from carrying firearm on school property during school hours unless the officer shows proof of being officer upon request; deletes requirement that officer notify the school principal. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1350.

As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch, and beginning with the November 2012 election to be elected by the qualified voters of this state, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.

As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch to be appointed by joint vote of the general assembly, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.
As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body of a county that has enacted county-wide zoning to create a design review committee (DRC). - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7%. - Amends Chapter 219 of the Private Acts of 1988.

As enacted, revises provisions governing tax exemption for certain public radio and television stations; prohibits the assessment of state board of equalization hearing costs against a non-prevailing party that is not the appellant. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires that notification of a regular or special meeting of the water quality control board shall be provided seven days instead of five in advance of the meeting. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, makes the jury coordinator law applicable to Rhea and Morgan counties, which were previously excluded from such law. - Amends TCA Title 22.
As introduced, excludes from sales and use tax certain information technology services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As enacted, revises provisions concerning voting by military and overseas citizens. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, places all responsibility for building standards and fire safety inspections on business occupancies and places of assembly in buildings less than three stories in height with certain local jurisdictions who have been approved by the state fire marshal to enforce codes inspections. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that failure of a drug and alcohol test, or refusing the test, in a drug-free workplace makes the injured employee ineligible for workers' compensation benefits related to an injury; removes requirement for proximate causation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.
As introduced, enacts the "Consumer Civil Litigation Funding Act." - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, requires persons enrolling children for the first time in public schools to submit the student's social security number, a visa as issued by the United States, or certain birth certificates; requires schools to submit certain enrollment information to the department of education for inclusion in the department's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes the city of Goodlettsville to conduct a referendum for the sale of alcoholic beverages at retail package stores only in that portion of the city located in Sumner County without affecting the sale of such beverages in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, mandates that any insurer that provides health insurance coverage for cancer chemotherapy treatment must provide coverage for a prescribed, orally administered anticancer medication used to kill or slow the growth of cancerous cells. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, prohibits a local government from requiring a private employer to pay the employer's employees wages in excess of the amount required under state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As enacted, replaces outdated terminology related to individuals with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 11; Title 13; Title 15; Title 16; Title 20; Title 27; Title 28; Title 29; Title 30; Title 32; Title 34; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 62; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As enacted, reduces from three to one the number of copies of building and utility codes adopted by reference that must be maintained by county clerk for public use. - Amends TCA Section 5-20-102.

As introduced, requires county trustees to return any commissions received over the amount required to operate the trustee's office to the school fund, provided the amount returned shall not exceed the amount received from the school fund. - Amends TCA Section 8-11-110.
As introduced, authorizes assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative form of mandatory outpatient treatment. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, allows state board to grant exceptions or waivers to certain employment requirements for emergency call takers and public safety dispatchers. - Amends TCA Section 7-86-205.
As enacted, allows district to purchase equipment under same terms of legal bid initiated by another district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1.
As introduced, requires local board of education to maintain a record of dismissal and suspension hearings as well as the results of such hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Charitable Gift Annuities Exemption Act. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 52.

As enacted, abolishes certain statutorily created, legislative oversight committees and assigns certain responsibilities to certain legislative standing committees. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Section 36-5-112; Title 37; Section 39-13-530; Section 40-34-107; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires TBI to conduct background investigations for persons appointed by the speaker of the senate or the speaker of the house; limits number of such investigations to 15 per calendar year per speaker. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires attorney general to be available for hearing on pending legislation when time prevents issuance of a written opinion. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 8, Chapter 6; Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 38, Chapter 5.

As introduced, increases from two to four years period in which a former member of the judicial nominating commission may not be selected for judicial nomination. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires submission of special school district board minutes to county board of education and department of education within five business days after affirmative administrative action for abolition of the special school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requests chancellor to study tenure and report to education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires TSAC to annually prepare a status report for governor and general assembly on the Tennessee HOPE foster child tuition grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires local boards of education to develop and implement an evaluation plan to be used annually for the director of schools; authorizes certain municipalities to request county election commission to conduct a referendum regarding creation of new school in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, makes various changes regarding child custody determination for a mobilized member of the armed forces. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.
As introduced, clarifies that health care facilities regulated under the Cancer Reporting Act are facilities regulated under title 68, chapter 11, part 2. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, requires insurers to state in bold face type in an insurance policy whether an insured is entitled to assign benefits to a healthcare provider. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-120.

As introduced, requires the recipient or beneficiary to provide written notice to the state before initiating any legal proceeding to pursue recovery from a third party. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-117.
As introduced, prohibits information relative to violations captured by unmanned traffic surveillance cameras from being transmitted to credit reporting agencies. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
As introduced, exempts the sale of certain nonpotentially hazardous foods at farmers' markets and church and community events from licensing and inspection requirements. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As introduced, enacts the "White-tailed Deer Breeding and Farming Act." - Amends TCA Title 44; Section 70-4-403 and Section 70-4-413.

As introduced, requires all documents, petitions or papers filed to be examined by the appropriate election official prior to accepting the items to ensure accuracy and that filing deadlines have been met; if accepted then it is conclusively presumed that all requirements have been met and the document, petition or paper is timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, authorizes the coordinator of elections to review the county election commission in the administration of election laws; gives the coordinator certain powers in conducting an investigation or a review. - Amends TCA Section 2-11-202.

As enacted, revises various election law procedures concerning registration notification forms, times for appointment of election officials, inclusion of voter's date of birth on application to vote absentee, and establishing a mechanism for non-resident property owners to vote absentee by mail. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-111(a); Section 2-2-107(a); Section 2-2-115(b); Section 2-4-102(a); Section 2-5-211(b); Section 2-6-102(a)(1); Section 2-6-102(b); Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Section 2-6-202(a)(3).
As introduced, places limitations on the hiring of certain relatives by county election commissions and administrators of elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-201 and Section 2-9-103.

As enacted, adds to current list of persons committing felonies or sexual offenses who are never eligible to register to vote, a violation containing the same elements and designated as a felony in any other state or federal court. - Amends TCA Section 40-29-204.

As introduced, expands where a person may go to early vote to include another polling place appropriately designated by the county election commission in addition to the county election commission office. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies necessity, requirement and statutory responsibility of the county to fund all county election commission expenses including compensation of its employees and election officials, expenses incurred in holding elections, and all fees incurred due to the filing or defense of a lawsuit. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-109.
As introduced, revises the definition of election official. - Amends TCA Section 2-1-104.

As introduced, requires additional $10.00 payment be made to election official that accompanies the officer of elections to the county election commission on election day. - Amends TCA Section 2-4-109.
As introduced, mandates loss of sick leave benefits by teachers who falsify medical information submitted to the sick leave bank trustees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends prohibition on smoking in places of employment to fire stations of volunteer fire departments or companies recognized under title 68, chapter 102, part 3 as well as to those of political subdivisions; includes volunteer fire fighters under the definition of employee for purposes of such prohibition. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 18.
As enacted, includes lineal descendants of original owners of private trust companies among those who may control a private trust. - Amends TCA Section 45-2-2001.
As introduced, deletes existing statute governing interchanges of anti-epileptic drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10.
As introduced, revises certain provisions concerning payment of claims to non-governmental, nonprofit healthcare research institutions. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.
As enacted, adds state government telephone subscribers to do not call registry. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 19 in Haywood County as "Reverend Clay Evans Road".
As introduced, effectuates additional employee longevity payments conditionally included in FY 2010-2011 appropriations bill. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, changes the punishment for the offense of abuse of a corpse from a Class E felony to a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-312.
As enacted, adopts "Tennessee" by John R. Bean as an official state song. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, authorizes local boards of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires that student performance data that is used to evaluate teachers or calculate students' final grades be reported to each school district by June 1 of the current school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, replaces references to mental retardation with references to intellectual disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 10; Title 37; Title 48; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires charitable organization that solicited and received contributions exceeding $25,000 related to a disaster occurring in this state on or after May 1, 2010, to file a quarterly financial report with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 1, Part 5 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.
As introduced, permits any registered Tennessee voter to vote absentee. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, requires employers to provide each employee who is a veteran with paid or unpaid holiday time off for Veterans' Day under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 58.
As introduced, allows certain local governmental entities to enter into memoranda of understanding with employee representative organizations. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 50.

As introduced, clarifies that one police officer member of the peace officer standards and training commission shall be the president of the state Fraternal Order of Police. - Amends TCA Section 38-8-102.
As introduced, requires that state firefighters in non-supervisory and non-administrative positions must retire at age 60. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

As enacted, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older to $26,200 for single filers and $37,000 for persons filing jointly beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing utility districts that fail to take affirmative action or provide services and consolidation of a financially distressed district with another district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.
As introduced, eliminates Hall Income Tax for tax years 2012 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As introduced, increases exemptions from Hall Income Tax for single filers from $1,250 to $2,400 and for joint filers from $2,500 to $4,800. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As introduced, increases the penalty for a fraudulent act or practice in connection with the offer, sale or purchase of any security from $5,000 to $6,000. - Amends TCA Title 48.

As introduced, requires commissioner of finance and administration to seek an amendment to the TennCare waiver to require TennCare enrollees to seek all of their nonemergent primary care from public health departments; requires MCOs to contract with public health departments; requires bureau of TennCare to provide certain financial assistance to local health departments. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires the party who filed a petition to remove a case to federal court to pay all costs of the removal if the petition is granted. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 20, Chapter 12.

As introduced, requires a written memorandum of understanding between a law enforcement agency and a LEA for school policing to include employment standards, hours of training, hours of work and assignment to specific schools; requires under such agreements that alternative schools be staffed by school resource officers who are full time. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 42.
As enacted, revises filing deadlines for employer disclosure reports from within 45 days of March 31 and September 30 to within 45 days of June 30 and December 31. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act." - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, removes a statutory reference to notice provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act that are no longer in existence; establishes certain immunity for local board of education and school official in regard to entry or use of school property by others outside of regularly scheduled school activities. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.
As introduced, enacts various provisions relative to tort reform. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 20; Title 22; Title 24; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47; Title 50; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, clarifies terms and policies associated with harassment, intimidation and bullying. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, authorizes local government entities to file motions to prevent litigation opponents from using the Public Records Act in lieu of discovery. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
As introduced, revises various statutory provisions relevant to foreclosure. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 3 and Title 35, Chapter 5.

As introduced, removes judicial discretion to apportion costs based on equity and permits recovery of certain litigation costs by the successful party to certain civil actions. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27; Title 29, Chapter 11; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 29, Chapter 5.

As introduced, prohibits recovery in a medical malpractice case for negligent diagnosis or treatment that decreases a patient's chances of avoiding death or any other adverse medical condition when the death or other adverse medical condition would have occurred even if the defendant had not been negligent. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Patient Safety and Quality Improvement Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 63, Chapters 1 and 6.

As introduced, specifies the date for a referendum by which a special school district board of education seeks to transfer administration of the district's schools to the county board of education; requires that, if the voters approve the transfer, the transfer shall occur on the second July 1 following the election. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.
As introduced, revises certain provisions concerning payment of claims to non-governmental, nonprofit healthcare research institutions. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.
As introduced, authorizes the University of Tennessee to enter into certain agreements with foundations that support the university or one of its campuses. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As introduced, requires health insurance entities to reimburse certain costs to insured when coverage is unreasonably denied. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires all health insurance entities to report the number of approvals and denials of physician requests for preauthorization for admissions and imaging tests to certain officials in a form that categorizes the information by age, gender, ethnic group and cost savings for denials. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires physicians reviewing and preauthorizing certain claims for health insurance entities to complete the same credentialing process as required for the ordering physicians. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, restores sovereign immunity from liability for dangerous conditions on unpaved county roads where OHV use is permitted. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-203.
As introduced, returns collection of gross receipts tax to county clerks and designated city officials. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

As introduced, subject to local approval, permits the city of Harriman to raise its occupancy tax from a rate not to exceed 5 percent to a rate not to exceed 7 percent. - Amends Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 1995.

As introduced, changes the date on which the select committee on children and youth is to report its findings concerning its study on human sex trafficking from March 1, 2011 until June 1, 2011. - Amends Chapter 1023 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As enacted, requires registered sex offenders to report to registering law enforcement agencies prior to traveling out of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As introduced, "Historic Rock Castle," I-65 at Vietnam Veterans Parkway and Exit 232 (Highway 109) on I-40.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding alcoholic beverages, including provisions concerning tourism developments zones and certain alcohol sales in Monroe and Robertson counties. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As enacted, prohibits a health care institution that treats drug abuse patients from being held liable for any damages resulting from the introduction of harmful substances into an indwelling catheter placed in the patient, provided that the health care institution informs the patient of such immunity. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 33, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, removes authorization of graduate students in audiology at public institutions of higher education to evaluate, prescribe and dispense hearing aids; removes prohibition on employees of hearing centers at public institutions of higher education serving private-practice patients in publicly owned facilities or referring patients to their own private practices; permits state public colleges and universities to establish and operate clinical and dispensary programs in speech pathology, speech therapy and audiology for the purpose of educating students and generating financial support necessary to operate and make necessary improvements to those programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 27.

As introduced, authorizes local boards of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.
As introduced, amends first degree murder statute to include felony murder, during a felony drug offense, of a law enforcement officer engaged in official duties. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

As enacted, allows law enforcement agencies to exchange confiscated firearms with other law enforcement agencies for body armor and ammunition as well as for other firearms. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As enacted, requires all sexual offenders who are incarcerated, but who have not yet registered as a sexual offender or violent sexual offender, to be registered in the institution in which they are incarcerated by no later than August 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, clarifies TCA citation for definition of "relative" in the Criminal Injuries Compensation Act. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 29, Chapter 13, Part 3; Section 40-24-107 and Section 67-4-606.

As enacted, clarifies intent of PC 1004 of 2010, imposing $250 drug testing fee on convictions of or grants of diversion for violations of Tennessee Drug Control Act, to apply statewide and not be limited to certain counties. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-420.

As enacted, clarifies that $13.75 court costs for TBI are imposed upon the forfeiture of any cash bond or other surety entered as a result of a municipal traffic citation. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, subjects the act of rock harvesting to the current permitting process for minerals; grants surface landowners and operators the option of entering into their own agreements to harvest rock without having to meet statutorily enforced reclamation plans or permitting requirements. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2 and Section 66-5-102.

As introduced, subjects the act of rock harvesting to the current permitting process for minerals; grants surface landowners and operators the option of entering into their own agreements to harvest rock without having to meet statutorily enforced reclamation plans or permitting requirements. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2; Section 66-5-102 and Section 67-5-804.

As introduced, allows a person convicted of a misdemeanor offense for the first time who is put on probation, successfully completes probation and does not commit another offense for three years, to have public records of misdemeanor conviction expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes certain persons arrested for or charged with misdemeanor offenses, while protesting or challenging the legalization or performance of abortion procedures, to petition for destruction of public records pertaining to such arrests or charges. - Amends TCA Section 40-32-101.

As enacted, requires the department of safety to report annually to the senate and house education committees the number of students whose driver licenses were suspended for failure to make satisfactory academic progress; also requires reporting of the number of students whose licenses were reinstated during the school year after such students had their licenses suspended and the total number of licenses granted to students during the school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires maps corresponding to bills and amendments modifying legislative and congressional districts to be posted on Web site of general assembly for 60-day period prior to adoption of any such bill or amendment; allows public comment through Web site during the 60-day period. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, requires the treasurer to hold any abandoned military medal until the owner or owner's heirs or beneficiaries can be identified for the return of the medal; allows the treasurer to appoint a custodian such as a veterans' organization to hold such medal; imposes other requirements related to such medals. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, requires state treasurer to study current efforts of depositing state funds that provide specific assistance to eligible state depositories that are community banks, and recommend enhanced efforts to the senate and house finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As enacted, specifies that TCA titles 50 and 56 provide the sole and exclusive statutory remedies and sanctions applicable to an insurer, person, or entity licensed, permitted, or authorized to do business under title 56 for alleged breach of, or for alleged unfair or deceptive acts or practices in connection with, a contract of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, revises certain requirements which a person must meet in order to qualify for election or appointment to the office of sheriff; revises law regarding verification of POST certification of any person seeking the office of sheriff; and removes certain provisions regarding when a person runs for sheriff or is elected as sheriff and does not possess a current and valid peace officer certification. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies that the general contractor of a commercial construction project shall select the three individual construction services providers who may be exempt from workers' compensation coverage while working on the commercial construction project. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires a contract entered into between a developer or owner of property and a prime contractor to include specific information concerning the manner in which the developer or owner plans on financing the project; as a condition to the finalization of the contract, such information is subject to being verified by the prime contractor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 45; Title 49; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

As introduced, simplifies LEAs' reporting on conflict resolution programs by requiring such reports be made to the commissioner of education biennially instead of annually and requiring, in lieu of a separate report by the commissioner, a summary of the reports and the commissioner's findings to be published in the commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, transfers supervision of the out of state parole and probation supervision registry from the TBI to the board of probation and parole. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-116 and Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 4.
As introduced, establishes the Tennessee HOPE prospective teacher's scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, provides that before submitting the annual budget for the state court system to department of finance and administration, the administrative director of the courts must first submit it to the executive committee of the judicial conference for approval. - Amends TCA Section 16-3-803.

As introduced, provides that if a party makes a timely recusal motion and judge denies it, the party has the right to have another judge sit by interchange or as special judge to hear and determine whether the motion should be granted or denied. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, provides that if a complaint is filed against a judge who is or was a member of the court of the judiciary at the same time as the investigative counsel served as counsel for the court, the investigative counsel must retain a special counsel to investigate any such complaint. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, authorizes the spouse of a deceased recipient of a Purple Heart memorial registration plate to receive two such registration plates for no cost. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, authorizes electric cooperatives to provide services anywhere such services are currently provided by wireless cable (microwave) systems. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

As enacted, replaces "non-residential methadone treatment facility" with "nonresidential substitution-based treatment centers offering treatment for opiate addiction." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, creates exemption from excise and franchise tax for entities owned by a branch of the U.S. armed forces that derive more than half of gross income from operation of facilities located on federally owned or leased property and operate primarily to benefit armed forces members. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires commissioner to appoint advisory council on pest plants and invasive species. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires commissioner of health to report on or before January 31, 2012, with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in the disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, authorizes Oneida Special School District to issue bonds.
As introduced, excepts insurance producers from continuing education requirements related to licenses if those producers meet certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-107.

As introduced, permits certain victims of crimes to terminate residential leases without penalty upon providing notice and particular documentation to the landlord. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 17; Title 40 and Title 66, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As enacted, designates certain segments of I-24 and I-75 in Chattanooga as the "Sgt. Tim Chapin Memorial Highway." - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 54, Chapter 21.

As introduced, allows state building commission, attorney general and commissioner of correction to proceed on proposal or contract for correctional services if select oversight committee on correction, fiscal review committee and state and local government committees have not reported any comments in 30 days after receiving the proposal or contract. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 24.

As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, requires that 50% of funds expended for in-home visitation programs be expended on evidence-based programs for the fiscal year 2011-2012 and 75% for each year thereafter and specifies research methods that show a program is evidence-based. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, requires municipality to notify affected property owners by mail of proposed extension of corporate limits under certain circumstances and requires publication in newspaper. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51 and Title 6, Chapter 58, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that no more than 20 percent of property taken by eminent domain can be leased to private companies; grants right of first refusal to owner of land taken by eminent domain that is not converted in five years to the purpose for which it was taken. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Title 29.
As enacted, imposes criminal and civil penalties upon persons who have hepatitis and who do not tell persons to whom it could be transmitted. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, creates Class D felony aggravated assault offense of a person sentenced to confinement in an adult or juvenile facility throwing urine, blood or other bodily fluids upon an officer of the facility, intending the fluid to make contact with the officer and reasonably knowing the officer would find it offensive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes the transfer of a juvenile from juvenile to adult court if the juvenile commits an aggravated assault against an employee of a juvenile detention facility to which the juvenile has been committed or is confined. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, makes certain hospital provider reimbursement information involving the program a public record. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, allows a court to consider the reasonable preference of a child, who is 10 instead of 12, when determining whether to allow a custodial parent to move more than 100 miles from the noncustodial parent.
As introduced, requires that a defendant pay $250 upfront prior to making an agreement with the prosecution to suspend prosecution. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, directs the proceeds of a sale of weapons confiscated by a judicial drug task force to the judicial drug task force for law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, requires court to consider the behavior and attitude each parent has displayed with regard to familial obligations, including but not limited to any instances of adultery while married to the child's other parent, when making a custody determination. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 4 and Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, provides that no arrest warrant or criminal summons shall issue without the written approval of the applicable district attorney if the affiant knows the person to be arrested or summoned is a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, provides that if an attorney, post-conviction defender or district public defender in a criminal case is found to have provided ineffective assistance of counsel, that attorney cannot receive any further state funds for legal services until the attorney obtains continuing education, counseling or training that addresses the reason for the attorney being ineffective. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 40.

As introduced, increases the penalty for possessing a firearm if the defendant has a prior felony conviction involving force or violence from Class E to Class C felony and from Class E to Class D if prior conviction is for drug offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, makes a person who is charged with statutory rape by an authority figure ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.
As introduced, makes certified nurse assistant services for certain quadriplegics a covered medical service under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, provides that the law enforcement training academy curriculum requirements include materials on sexual assault and stalking of domestic abuse victims as well as materials on domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38 and Title 40.
As introduced, enacts the "Access to Pediatric Rare Disease Treatment Information Act." - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires annual report to governor and speakers concerning programs receiving funding from bottler's tax to be delivered by February 1 each year instead of by March 31 each year. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-402.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 75 days period in which dealer via signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, codifies stream mitigation plan requirements in accordance with state and federal guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 69.
As enacted, permits a county to pay the cost of obtaining and recording the bond required for constables. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits the board of veterinary medical examiners from requiring a certified governmental animal control agency to have a full-time licensed veterinarian on staff in order to obtain a certificate to perform chemical capture. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 63.

As introduced, gives judge the discretion to dismiss a charge of failure to provide proof of financial responsibility if the person did not have such proof at the time of the charge but submitted satisfactory proof at time of court date that financial responsibility was obtained. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12, Part 1.

As introduced, specifies that restrictions imposed by board of trustees of the baccalaureate education system trust fund program regarding the substitution of another individual for the original beneficiary must be no less stringent than that required by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 8.
As introduced, inserts TCA code citation in regard to reference to state school bond authority. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, clarifies that any reserve balance remaining unexpended at the end of a fiscal year in the Tennessee financial literacy commission's account will not revert to the general fund but will remain available to be used by the commission for commission purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.
As enacted, revises the manner in which a person applying pesticides may be supervised. - Amends TCA Section 62-21-102.

As introduced, exempts from mortgage lender licensure certain persons who make five or fewer residential mortgage loans in any consecutive 12-month period, and certain licensed real estate brokers. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.
As introduced, requires state departments, agencies and entities to reduce paper and paper products annually by 5 percent starting on July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 68 in Monroe County as "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway."
As enacted, exempts not-for-profits owning and operating water companies from 3 percent gross receipts tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes a semitrailer with a fifth wheel with a boat or a tractor trailer attached to operate on highways in Tennessee if such semitrailer with a fifth wheel is for personal use and not for hire. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7, Part 2.

As enacted, requires that each business that provided disabled parking spaces prior to April 25, 2006, provide van-accessible parking spaces as soon as such provision is readily achievable; specifies that each business that provides only one specially marked parking space must convert such specially marked parking space into a van-accessible parking space when such conversion is readily achievable. - Amends TCA Section 55-21-105.

As introduced, prohibits any person convicted of a felony under state or federal law involving moral turpitude after July 1, 1986, but before July 1, 1996, while in public office who, on the effective date of this act, has not had the persons citizenship rights restored, from qualifying for or holding any office under the laws or constitution of this state. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 4.

As enacted, allows Loudon County to impose additional $5.00 litigation tax on all civil and criminal cases to be used for grants to Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA). - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3; Title 36, Chapter 6; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.
As enacted, designates "Gold Star - Blue Star Memorial Bridge" on U.S. 321 in Loudon County.

As introduced, prohibits both the driver and passenger of a motor vehicle from consuming an alcoholic beverage or possessing an open alcoholic beverage container within the passenger area. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Administrative License Revocation Act." - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 50 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires terms of county administrators of elections to expire when the commission's term expires and allows county election commissions to consider political party affiliation, knowledge and experience when hiring administrators; prohibits county from revising or restricting line items in the election commission's budget. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12.
As introduced, requires a retailer to disclose that instructions provided with a good are not in English. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.
As introduced, removes annual reporting requirement of the state board of education on the weight of textbooks. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, allows the clerk of probate court to enter an order dismissing without prejudice probate cases which have no order of disposition, have been open for at least 18 months, and administration of the estate remains incomplete. - Amends TCA Section 18-6-106.
As introduced, creates a catastrophic trauma fund for persons with motorcycle-related injuries. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, requires that honey sold or offered for sale in Tennessee must be labeled as 100 percent pure or not pure; authorizes any person who suffers an injury or death, or an ascertainable loss of money or property, as a result of a violation of the bill to bring an action individually to recover actual damages. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.

As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26 and Title 63, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes the Hamilton County legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.

As introduced, authorizes the county legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.

As introduced, permits a temporary license or permit for beer to be issued for events sanctioned by a municipal or county government to be held in conjunction with a fair or on publicly owned municipal parks, streets or sidewalks where the event is held within the municipality and the streets are cordoned off to permit only foot traffic. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, directs the board of trustees of the TCRS to authorize a preference for investing in venture capital and private equity funds that are Tennessee-based or having presence in this state, to the extent deemed prudent and financially sound. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 37, Part 1.
As introduced, shortens time period from 180 days to 150 days following close of fiscal year within which TNInvestco must submit annual audit to ECD. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 28, Part 1.

As introduced, requires ECD to report annually to office of legislative budget analysis in addition to joint select committee on business taxes regarding Tennessee job skills program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7, Chapter 53; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 8, Chapter 24; Title 9, Chapter 16; Title 9, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 64, Chapter 6; Title 65, Chapter 5 and Title 67.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Self-Service Storage Facility Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 31.

As introduced, creates special account in general fund from which the annual educational incentive payments will be made to certain eligible county officials; previously, the payments were made from the general fund. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-310 and Section 67-4-409.
As enacted, requires limited lines licensure for the sale or offer of coverage under a policy of portable electronics insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, revises the pilot project requirements for convenient voting centers in certain municipal elections; extends pilot project to be in Knox, Hamblen, Shelby and Rutherford counties. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 50 years the maximum period of time that an economic impact plan can provide for allocating property taxes to a county industrial development corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3.

As enacted, provides that the HIV test a sexual offender is required to undergo must be performed within 48 hours after the presentment of the indictment or information and with or without the request of the victim; adds aggravated rape of a child and statutory rape by an authority figure to the list of offenses requiring HIV testing of the alleged perpetrator. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

As introduced, removes requirement that council for licensing hearing instrument specialists be administratively attached to board of communication disorders and sciences; renames council the board for licensing hearing instrument specialists. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 63, Chapter 17.

As introduced, allows the municipality or county that conducted a sale for delinquent taxes to submit a report of findings of fact to the court that summarizes for each property sold at the sale for delinquent taxes the names of all parties with an interest in the real estate and such other facts relevant to the sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.

As introduced, clarifies that the chancery court has jurisdiction of cases involving the sale of property for delinquent taxes even though the amount sued for is less than $100, instead of $50.00. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, increases the number of weeks that the trustee is required to publish a notice of delinquent taxes in a newspaper prior to filing suit from two weeks to four weeks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires a court prior to accepting a guilty plea or a verdict or finding of guilty for a violation of Section 55-10-401, to review the defendants official driver record maintained by the department to determine the factual basis for determining whether a defendant is a repeat or multiple offender. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, clarifies the responsibility of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority to preserve universal service consisting of basic local exchange telephone service at comparable rates and carrier of last resort obligations for rural incumbent local exchange telephone companies and telephone cooperatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, creates grant program to assist processors of recycled plastic to be used as raw material in manufacturing. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Adventure Tourism and Rural Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 11; Title 54; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 70.

As enacted, adds firefighters and certain emergency services personnel to statute permitting law enforcement officers and certain TBI employees to request that an arrestee's blood be tested for certain infectious diseases. - Amends TCA Title 41 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires that all weapons seized as contraband that are not used in law enforcement be sold in a public sale. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, increases from 10 percent to 15 percent the amount of proceeds from sales of seized contraband tobacco products that are set aside for administration of the tobacco tax law beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.
As introduced, requires businesses to show evidence of payment of personal property taxes prior to issuance of a business license. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-723.
As introduced, permits certain employees of Tennessee federally qualified health centers to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, requires that all property taxes be paid in full on any property subject to the Property Tax Freeze Act. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705.

As introduced, raises the threshold for a certificate of need for capital expenditures for nonhospital health care institutions from $2 million to $2.5 million; makes health care institutions responsible for attorneys' fees in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, redefines city governing body to include board of mayor and aldermen as it applies to the consolidation of certain governmental and corporate functions, and to the creation of metropolitan governments. - Amends TCA Section 7-1-101 and Section 68-211-835.

As introduced, prohibits sales of certain tobacco products by certain persons and businesses; prohibits sales of certain tobacco products and drug paraphernalia near schools, churches, and other locations. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 47 and Title 67.

As introduced, adds roach clips, rose and pen combinations, cocaine spoons, certain tobacco products, and other items to list of items that are considered drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires individuals applying for food stamp program benefits, unemployment benefits, and families first assistance to submit to drug testing; prohibits felons of certain drug crimes from receiving certain benefits. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 71.

As introduced, creates a separate criminal offense for selling or offering for sale drug paraphernalia. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 39, Chapter 17; Title 39, Chapter 11 and Title 40, Chapter 33.
As introduced, authorizes the use of telemedicine to provide medical care to prisoners in a jail or workhouse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 41; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires high school curriculum to include courses on Tennessee history and the free enterprise system, as approved by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 412 in Lewis County as "John Andrew Carroll Memorial Bridge."
As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 43 in Lawrenceburg as "H.O. Sam Garrard Memorial Highway."
As introduced, requires commissioners of certain water utility districts in Lawrence County to be elected by the customers of the utility district. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307.
As introduced, requires officers to ask for proof of insurance for any traffic violation, moving or otherwise. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, requires that members of a school board have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires that motor vehicle registration plate is illuminated at all times headlights are required to be displayed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.
As introduced, authorizes certain distribution of state sales tax revenues to municipalities within Madison County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, changes references from "names" to "nominees" in regard to appointments to advisory council on workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, removes additional state sales tax on single articles priced between $1,600 and $3,200; authorizes local sales tax on single articles priced up to $3,200 and requires the $3,200 limit be increased annually for inflation beginning July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-202 and Section 67-6-702.
As introduced, enacts the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 15.

As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

As introduced, rewrites present exemption to requirement that motor vehicle dismantlers must obtain copy of certificate of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap, to apply to motor vehicle manufactured in a year prior to issuance of certificates of title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As enacted, requires bounty hunters to undergo a criminal background check. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-318.
As introduced, requires bounty hunters to have a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-318.
As introduced, extends time period for Habitat for Humanity new specialty earmarked plates to meet minimum issuance requirements until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the general assembly to provide funding for unfunded mandates which place increased expenditures over certain amounts on local governments; prohibits an agency of state government from creating a new fee in any year in which the general state revenues to the agency have decreased from the previous year. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 53.

As introduced, enacts the "Electronic Publication of Legal Notices Act of 2011"; applies only to Hamilton County and municipalities located in Hamilton County. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 8, Chapter 21.

As introduced, increases cash amount higher education employee in an optional retirement program may withdraw upon terminating employment from 50% to 100% of such employee's accumulated account. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.

As introduced, enacts the "Telephone Cooperative Transparency Act of 2011," which requires telephone cooperatives to comply with open meetings and public records laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44; Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 65, Chapter 29.

As introduced, removes the requirement that a court determine whether a defendant is a danger to the community prior to releasing the defendant on bail for being charged with vehicular assault, vehicular homicide or driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-118.

As introduced, allows certain individuals who meet certain criteria to transfer previous service from Group 1 to Group 3 of the retirement system if certain conditions are timely met. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-101(3); Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6; Section 8-34-716 and Section 8-35-105.

As enacted, exempts persons holding a commercial driver license to perform transportation services as employee of federal or state government or political subdivision of the state or an agency established under compact between states and approved by Congress from the requirement that Tennessee commercial driver license holders must maintain valid medical card; exemption does not apply to passenger, school bus or hazardous material endorsement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Labrador Retriever Foundation new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to Labrador Retriever Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, defines "quarrying" as the extraction, removal and mechanized processing of any mineral, including clay, stone, gravel, phosphate rock, metallic ore, limestone, marble, chert, sand, dimension stone and any other solid mineral or substance of commercial value, except coal and deep metal mining, found in natural deposits in the earth, for barter or sale for purposes of county and municipal zoning. - Amends TCA Sections 13-7-101 and 13-7-201.

As introduced, adds sexual orientation to the list of characteristics on which discrimination is prohibited in employment, public accommodations, and housing and financing. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21; Title 8 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires law enforcement investigating child abuse or child sexual abuse to be trained in child protective investigations whenever possible and requires department of children's services to annually conduct such training. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 4 and Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 6.
As introduced, directs the commissioner of education to require all high schools to allow eligible students 18 to 20 years of age to voluntarily enroll and attend school. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, makes various changes to the requirements for parenting plans and allocation of parenting responsibilities in situations involving domestic violence or sexual abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the district attorney general of each judicial district to report on child protective teams to the judiciary committees of the senate and house of representatives by February 15 of each year, rather than January 15. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-607.

As introduced, requires a child advocacy center to perform the initial forensic interview with a child who is the victim of alleged child sexual abuse and any subsequent interviews found necessary by the child protective team to be conducted in a neutral setting whenever possible. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, requires comptroller to conduct a performance audit of the implementation and impact of current law authorizing the commissioner of finance and administration to implement policies and processes to expedite the determination of medicaid categorical and financial eligibility and medical eligibility for home and community-based programs and services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.
As introduced, adds board of trustees for the University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, clarifies that confidential records and information maintained by the department of children's services that shall be disclosed to members of the general assembly includes information contained in any internal audit conducted by the department. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, clarifies that no preference shall be given a child's relatives when a child has resided in a foster home for at least one year prior to the filing of the foster parents' adoption petition. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 37, Chapter 2; Title 37, Chapter 3 and Title 37, Chapter 5.

As introduced, establishes a formula for determining restitution owed to a victim of involuntary servitude that is based on comparable wages paid for the labor performed. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-403 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

As introduced, extends from 10 to 20 days the time for a parent who has surrendered a child for adoption to revoke such surrender. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 2, Part 4 and Section 40-14-103.

As enacted, allows a court to prohibit any person convicted of child abuse or aggravated child abuse from contacting such person's victim if the person does not have any parental rights to such victim, including contact via electronic means. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, changes from January 15 to February 1 annual deadline for district attorneys general to submit to the standing judiciary committees their reports on the progress of child protective teams. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

As introduced, requires the TBI to conduct any investigation into the department of children's services that is currently conducted by such department and requires TBI to maintain confidentiality of the department's records. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 37.
As enacted, revises law regarding custody of abused children.

As introduced, specifies that injuries to domestic violence victims and sexual assault victims shall not be reported to law enforcement unless the injured person consents to a report. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, exempts information concerning adult victims of domestic abuse or sexual assault from being mandatorily reported by doctors and hospitals to law enforcement unless the patient consents to such reporting. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-101.

As introduced, requires health care practitioners to report patient injuries caused or suspected to be caused by domestic violence or abuse to the department of health within 15 days of the date the practitioner has knowledge or suspects the cause of such injuries are the result of such violence or abuse rather than on a monthly basis. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, enacts the "Special Education Behavioral Supports Act," amending current restrictions on isolation and restraint in special education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10, Part 13.

As introduced, prohibits the sale of energy drinks at a business with a license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink; designates the offense as a Class A misdemeanor, punishable only by fine and suspension of an offender's license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 57.
As enacted, revises the provision regarding the sale of alcoholic beverages in certain unincorporated areas. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, repeals Tennessee Petroleum Underground Storage Tank Act. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As enacted, authorizes public library directors to reasonably restrict the access of any person listed on the sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, establishes procedures for pharmacies to transfer Schedule II prescriptions in accord with certain federal and state requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, designates, as confidential records, certain information submitted to local industrial development corporations by applicant seeking PILOT benefits. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, permits home school students to obtain HOPE scholarships as entering freshmen if such students achieve a high school GPA of 3.0 or an ACT score of 21. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-908.

As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, prohibits rezoning of private property by local government without written consent of property owner. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.
As introduced, allows winery to sell and transport up to 3,000 cases of wine to restaurants and hotels licensed to serve wine for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-207.

As introduced, replaces references to the "office of energy management" with references to the "state building management program." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 3.

As introduced, creates new lottery scholarship programs for students preparing to become teachers; requires THEC, TBR, and UT to assist colleges in establishing joint teacher preparation programs with nonprofit organizations and LEAs to meet the requirements of one of the scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends the 25 percent tuition discount at state operated institutions of higher education that is presently available to children of full-time public school teachers and technology coordinators to children of public school support personnel who are employed at least 25 hours per week. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes municipalities and counties, by resolution or ordinance, to prohibit landlords from leasing real property to persons unlawfully present in the United States; requires the attorney general and reporter to draft and defend such resolutions and ordinances upon written request. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 66.
As introduced, exempts from tangible personal property tax equipment used for harvesting timber. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, implements an integrated sex education program in place of the family life curriculum and authorizes parents to maintain an action against an outside instructor or organization for teaching students about material prohibited by the curriculum guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 49 and Title 68.
As enacted, enacts the "Material Support to Designated Entities Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 55 and Title 58.

As enacted, specifies that dental hygienists are authorized to perform stain removal on teeth in addition to performing those tasks that they are authorized to perform under present law. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108.

As introduced, provides that circuit and chancery courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over claims filed against governmental entities, and provides that general sessions courts have concurrent jurisdiction with those courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-307.

As introduced, requires LEAs to report each fiscal year the percentage of expenditures made on classroom expenditures district-wide and by school; requires classroom expenditures to be at least 70 percent of the total operating expenditures both district-wide and by school by fiscal year 2015-2016 and to reach at least 90 percent by fiscal year 2019-2020. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As introduced, provides that in deciding any motion for summary judgment in any common law or statutory discrimination or retaliation action arising out of an employment relationship, courts must apply the burden-shifting methods available to the moving party when the moving party does not bear the burden of proof at trial that would be available to the moving party had the claim or cause of action been asserted in federal district court in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25 and Title 50.

As enacted, declares that a moving party prevails on a motion for summary judgment if it submits affirmative evidence negating an element of a nonmoving party's claim or demonstrates that the nonmoving party's evidence is insufficient to establish an essential element. - Amends TCA Title 20.

As introduced, allows court to infer that DNA obtained from exculpatory evidence does not match applicant's profile and that offense was committed solely by person whose DNA profile is derived from such evidence. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 3.

As introduced, provides that the executive committee of the judicial conference appoint and set the salary of the administrative director of the courts rather than the supreme court. - Amends TCA Section 16-3-802.

As introduced, provides that all records filed with, created by or in the possession of the court of the judiciary or the office of investigative counsel be maintained by the administrative office of the courts for at least eight years from the date of creation or receipt and that maintenance of the records does not change their status as a public or confidential record. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, provides that if complaint filed against a judge and the judge is not reelected, resigns or retires before disposition of the complaint, the court of the judiciary must make the complaint and allegations contained therein public. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, provides that rules adopted by the court of the judiciary may not be inconsistent or in conflict with the statutory provisions establishing the court. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.
As enacted, provides that making a false statement on a declaration, such as under the Uniform Unsworn Foreign Declarations Act, is covered by the offense of perjury. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-702.

As enacted, increases the amount of time a petitioner in a post-conviction relief action has to appeal the ruling of the trial court to the court of criminal appeals on a motion to reopen the petition from 10 to 30 days. - Amends TCA Section 40-30-117(c).

As introduced, changes burden of proof necessary to cause investigation of a judge for misconduct from a reasonable person believing there is a substantial probability that misconduct occurred to probable cause that the misconduct occurred. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 8; Title 16; Title 17, Chapter 5 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, authorizes the investigative panel of the court of the judiciary to request that a judge file a written response to a complaint filed against the judge within 20, rather than 30, days after service of notice. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5.

As introduced, reestablishes the judicial council with a sunset date of two years; requires judicial council to meet twice a year while legislature is in session. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.
As introduced, extends jurisdiction over claims against governmental entities or governmental entity employees to chancery courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-313.
As introduced, extends jurisdiction to chancery courts for certain claims against governmental entities. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305.
As introduced, restores the right to trial by jury in quo warranto actions contesting the validity of municipal annexation. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-111.

As introduced, requires that the salary of the director of schools not be higher in any given fiscal year than the salary paid to the county mayor for the same fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Section 49-2-301.

As introduced, deletes the authority of the county legislative body to confirm appointments made by the county mayor to county boards and commissions and department heads. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-106.
As introduced, changes the required vote of the county legislative body to override the veto of the county mayor from a majority vote to a two-thirds vote. - Amends TCA Section 5-6-107.

As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review current policies, rules and regulations pertaining to transitional licensure options and make recommendations relative to certain items. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, revises the municipal gas system tax equivalent law.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of two memorial license plates to recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross and the Air Medal. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Lawful Employment Act; revises other provisions of law regarding employment of persons unlawfully present in the country. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39 and Title 50.
As enacted, enacts the "Eligibility Verification for Entitlements Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Immigration Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, clarifies that renewal of contractor license must be effectuated 30 days prior to expiration. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 26, Chapter 7; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, prohibits a committee of either house from considering, or the chief clerk from referring, a general bill concerning revenue unless it limits statutory changes to only one part of title 67. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As enacted, specifies, with certain exceptions, that new fee or fee increase promulgated by state agency rule in accordance with UAPA will take effect on the July 1 following the expiration of the 90-days after filing with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Food Desert Relief Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9; Title 13; Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 68.
As introduced, authorizes hunting wild hogs at all times in Overton County. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-116.

As introduced, authorizes the Knox County board of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.
