As introduced, reforms system of K-12 teacher tenure. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires state board of education to notify local school systems of specific prerequisite requirements and the courses of study for which the prerequisites apply at least one year prior to the effective date of any prerequisite courses for vocational technical education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, makes changes to the membership and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.
As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding deferred presentment services. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.
As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-102; Section 45-17-103; Section 45-17-104; Section 45-17-105; Section 45-17-106; Section 45-17-107; Section 45-17-108; Section 45-17-109; Section 45-17-110; Section 45-17-111; Section 45-17-113; Section 45-17-114; Section 45-17-115; Section 45-17-116; Section 45-17-117; Section 45-17-118 and Section 45-17-119.
As introduced, lowers the required amount of net assets that an applicant must have to be eligible for a pawnbroker's license from $75,000 to $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires reports concerning title pledge lenders to be submitted annually rather than biennially. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
As introduced, establishes tax credit for angel investors who invest in qualified Tennessee businesses. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As enacted, authorizes certain persons with a disability to obtain photo identification license upon proof of identity to the satisfaction of the commissioner of safety. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

As introduced, requires law enforcement officer investigating an allegation of domestic abuse to file a report with the officer's supervisor within 48 hours of the initial investigation whenever possible. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 39.
As introduced, makes certain revisions to the basis for determining the estimated rate of growth of the state's economy. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly.

As introduced, reduces from 90 to 75 days period in which a dealer via a signed statement can deduct on a return sales tax collected but not yet remitted to commissioner for refunded items. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 51; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, deletes an outdated provision related to the commission for uniform legislation; decreases from 35 to 30 years old the age requirement for serving on the board of examiners for land surveyors.
As introduced, decreases toll bridge rate for a four-horse wagon, loaded or unloaded, from 35 to 25. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, requires employers receiving a Tennessee job skills grant filing a final report with the department of economic and community development to report the outcome measurements for the project and the actual cost per person enrolled, trained, hired, and retained in employment in addition to other presently required information. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, increases from 11 months to one year the period of time in which an appointment of proxy is effective by a shareholder in a for-profit corporation. - Amends TCA Title 48.

As introduced, allows a warehouse to require payment from a person whose unfixed storage period has expired at least 45 days, instead of 30 days, after sending proper notice to the person. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, permits commissioner of commerce and insurance to terminate temporary permit for operating cemetery by giving written notice of at least 20 days, instead of 10 days, before effective date of termination. - Amends TCA Title 46.

As introduced, increases from 90 to 100 calendar days the period of time in which application from bank without regulatory rating of one or two shall be deemed approved for branch facilities. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, redefines dairy farm to include all milk-producing animals instead of limiting it to cows. - Amends TCA Title 44.
As introduced, deletes requirement that department prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43.
As introduced, decreases from three to two the number of members necessary to constitute a quorum of the state aeronautics commission. - Amends TCA Title 42.
As introduced, clarifies that inmates and their baggage are to be searched for all contraband, not just instruments of escape. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As introduced, decreases from 15 days to 10 days time period after receiving district attorney's letter for alleged violator to pay a bad check prior to possible commencement of criminal action. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, clarifies that age-restricted venue exception to no smoking law applies only to persons entering such facilities other than employees. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, increases fee for surgeon or physician summoned as a coroner's witness from an amount not to exceed $25.00 to an amount not to exceed $30.00. - Amends TCA Title 38.

As introduced, clarifies that court order for youth service officer, probation officer, or the state agency to notify the school principal in writing of the nature of the offense and probation requirements, if any, related to school attendance for juvenile in state custody occurs as soon as possible before the child resumes or begins school attendance, whichever occurs first. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, decreases period of time in which hearings in all child support cases that are not being enforced pursuant to the provisions of Title IV-D of the Social Security Act shall be heard from within 45 days to 35 days of the service of process. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, removes authority of attorney general to designate a district attorney general to prosecute or defend any court action concerning the amount, administration, or disposition of a charitable gift or a discretionary charitable gift. - Amends TCA Title 35.

As introduced, decreases compensation payable to guardians from not more than 7 percent to not more than 5 percent of the amount of moneys received during the period covered by the account. - Amends TCA Title 34.

As introduced, requires department to report to general assembly following each meeting on transportation service for persons with developmental disabilities, mental illness, and serious emotional disturbance. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, increases amount of personal property that can be distributed by means of a nuncupative will from $1,000 to $10,000 and from $10,000 to $50,000 for persons in military service during time of war. - Amends TCA Title 32.

As introduced, clarifies that reports concerning property that may be subject to escheat must be filed with the treasurer within 60 days of obtaining knowledge that property may be subject to escheat. - Amends TCA Title 31.

As introduced, requires the clerk to mail copies of exceptions to the personal representative of an estate, or the personal representative's attorney, within 10 days after the filing of exceptions, instead of five days. - Amends TCA Title 30.

As introduced, decreases from eight months to six months the time an award shall be filed if the time is not fixed in the submission and the time is prolonged by mutual consent. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, decreases period for bringing actions against the personal representative of a decedent, for demands against such decedent, from within seven years after the decedent's death to within six years after the decedent's death. - Amends TCA Title 28.

As introduced, requires funds deposited into the wildlife resources fund from the sale of new specialty earmarked license plates to be used in accordance with the provisions authorizing issuance of such plates. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 100. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the period of time in which a person cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.
As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time for filing appeal from final action of solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, increases franchise and excise tax credit for financial institutions donating to the Tennessee rural development opportunity fund from 10 percent of contribution to 12 percent of contribution. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, increases from 180 to 200 days the minimum time required before a dry cleaner or launderer may dispose of unclaimed garments. - Amends TCA Title 66.
As introduced, authorizes conductor to put off non-paying passenger at any regular station instead of any station or convenient point. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, authorizes the East Tennessee regional agribusiness marketing authority to plan, acquire, construct, improve, extend, furnish, equip, finance, own, operate and maintain a wastewater treatment and collection system within the region served by the authority. - Amends TCA Title 64.

As introduced, increases from one to two years the expiration date of temporary permits the board may issue to dietitians, and increases the renewal period from six months to one year. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, assigns personal, civil, and criminal liability to private security guard using unauthorized deadly force. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, increases from three to four months the period of time in which a person with a claim against a dissolved limited partnership may commence a proceeding to enforce the claim after receiving notice that the claim was rejected. - Amends TCA Title 61.
As introduced, increases from 10 to 20 days the time period in which a supervisor may grant or deny a mineral test hole permit. - Amends TCA Title 60.
As introduced, increases from 90 to 100 days the time period in which backfilling, grading, top soiling, and planting of cover crops is required. - Amends TCA Title 59.
As introduced, redefines "natural emergency" to specifically include forest fires, hurricanes, and tornadoes. - Amends TCA Title 58.
As introduced, clarifies that the term "intoxicating liquors" does not apply to any beverage with alcohol content by weight of 5 percent or less. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As enacted, makes various changes and additions to present law concerning insurance, in regard to confidentiality and Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, provides for issuance of photo identification license free of charge to person who signs an affidavit stating the person: does not have a valid government issued photo identification; is a registered voter in this state; and needs the photo identification license for voting purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, requires that bathrooms in food producing and distributing establishments supply both hot and cold running water. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As introduced, establishes procedure to declare position of incapacitated member of code commission vacant. - Amends TCA Title 1.

As introduced, requires election officials to inspect filings for sufficiency and timeliness; establishes conclusive presumption that accepted filings are sufficient and timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As enacted, extends the period within which an annual event may be held during the annual event period beginning July 1, 2011, and ending June 30, 2012, from within 28 calendar days of the event date listed in the application to within 45 calendar days of the event date listed in the application; makes other various changes to provisions regarding filing deadlines and omnibus lists. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, increases the number of interested persons necessary to petition an agency requesting the adoption, amendment, or repeal of a rule from five or more to 10 or more. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, adds to the duties of the county attorney the duty to consult with and advise other elected county officials, their deputies and their employees as to the application and enforcement of federal and state laws pertinent to carrying out their official duties. - Amends TCA Title 5.
As introduced, increases from 30 days to 40 days time period prior to effectiveness of a municipal annexation ordinance. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, requires every railroad operating trains within the state to notify the commissioner of transportation of the telephone number of its registered agent for service of process. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, requires department of audit to maintain liaison with each entity subject to audit for information and advice as to audit requirements and standards. - Amends TCA Title 9.

As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer of each entity subject to public records to inform employees and appointees about the requirements of state law concerning public records and the entities' policies for administering public records statutes. - Amends TCA Title 10.

As enacted, authorizes the appropriation of the yearly interest and earnings of the natural resources trust fund for reimbursement of greenbelt rollback taxes assessed against a county or municipal government as the result of acquisition of land for a park; if the land is not used as a park for 10 years or more, the county or municipality must repay the amount of the reimbursement to the fund. - Amends TCA Title 11.
As introduced, requires that electronic copies of the state owned property inventory be provided to designated officials as well as paper copies. - Amends TCA Title 12.

As introduced, requires the county building commissioner to return by mail a copy of a certificate of insurance or workers' compensation policy within 15 working days, instead of 10 working days, to the person who obtained the permit. - Amends TCA Title 13.
As introduced, redesignates the second Monday in September each year as American Indian Day instead of the fourth Monday in September each year. - Amends TCA Title 15.

As introduced, requires a municipality to reimburse a county an amount equal to the compensation of the municipality's city judges when any general sessions judge is appointed to serve as a municipal or city judge. - Amends TCA Title 16.

As introduced, clarifies that the joint legislative committee appointed to review a recommendation to remove a judge shall file its report within 10 business days, instead of 10 days, of the date of the hearing. - Amends TCA Title 17.
As introduced, decreases from 90 days to 60 days notice required by court clerk to state librarian and archivist prior to destruction of records. - Amends TCA Title 18.
As introduced, increases penalty for failure to note date of process from $125 to $150. - Amends TCA Title 20.

As introduced, decreases from three years to two years time period in which a decree against a defendant without personal service of process and who does not appear to defend becomes absolute. - Amends TCA Title 21.
As introduced, increases from $30.00 to $35.00 per day compensation for a sequestered juror. - Amends TCA Title 22.
As introduced, increases from two years to five years time period in which the supreme court may revoke a license procured by fraud. - Amends TCA Title 23.
As introduced, adds optometrists to deponents exempt from subpoena to trial but subject to subpoena to a deposition. - Amends TCA Title 24.
As introduced, requires a final judgment to include the full name of each person against whom a judgment is rendered, if known to the prevailing party. - Amends TCA Title 25.

As introduced, increases from 30 days to 45 days after the date a summons has been served upon the judgment debtor prior to execution or other process for enforcement of a foreign judgment. - Amends TCA Title 26.

As introduced, clarifies that appeal from judgment of a municipal recorder or officer in a civil action may be made within 10 business days, rather than 10 days excluding Sundays, to the next term of the circuit court. - Amends TCA Title 27.

As enacted, authorizes counties and cities to prohibit, by ordinance, smoking outside of hospitals or in the public areas immediately outside of a hospital building and its entrances, including public sidewalks. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires department of revenue to establish program to authorize the sale of non-refundable gift vouchers redeemable toward additional $35.00 fee for cultural, specialty earmarked and new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, expands state election commission to seven members permanently. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, prohibits an operator from engaging in rock harvesting without having first obtained a permit or a notice of coverage under a general permit from the commissioner of environment and conservation; imposes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, mandates the means by which TRA is required to determine whether or not a public utility's increase to an existing rate, joint rate, toll, fare, charge, schedule or classification is just and reasonable. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, specifies that persons who are employed by an LEA in a position for which no teaching license is required must be hired at the will of the director of schools; requires local boards of education to develop policies for dismissing employees in positions for which no teaching license is required. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.

As introduced, delays the implementation of last year's bill concerning the procurement commission and related topics; makes substantive changes in certain parts of last year's bill. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4; Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Chapter 1098 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, enacts the "Tax Increment Financing Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53; Title 9; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Chapter 987 of the Public Acts of 1998.
As enacted, rewrites law regarding invalid obligations. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21.

As enacted, specifies that before the board of education of special school district requests legislation to exceed the certified rate, it must first publish notice of its intent to exceed the certified rate in the manner required of cities and counties; specifies that present law regarding tax rates in special school districts would apply to all counties instead of only to counties with less than 50,000 people. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1704.
As enacted, removes requirement that county legislative bodies must have typed or printed a description of the boundaries of county districts. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-110.

As enacted, requires that amendments to resolution that created a local government audit committee be submitted to the comptroller for review and comment in same manner as the creating resolution under present law; specifies that if audit committee was created by legislative body of a county whose charter requires charter changes to be approved in a referendum, and if such actions occurred and were approved in a referendum prior to January 1, 2011, then such an audit committee will be considered created pursuant to present law. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 3, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes state funding board to require public entities to adopt the model finance transaction policies created by the board and clarifies that such policies would include budgeting and capital planning, finance transaction management, investment, and risk management. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.

As enacted, changes time within which fiscal review committee must submit a fiscal note on legislation from within 7 days of introduction or request to within 10 days of introduction or request. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8.
As enacted, authorizes the acceptance of partial payment of delinquent property taxes by the county trustee under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2001.
As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, includes organic milk and milk products under the Dairy Industry Promotion Act, which authorizes producers of milk and milk products on a commercial basis to levy upon themselves an assessment on milk products for the purpose of financing or contributing to the financing of a program of promoting, advertising, researching and other methods designed to increase the consumption, use and sale of domestic milk and milk products.
As introduced, creates joint congressional communications committee of general assembly; authorizes changing of congressional districts between apportionment. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.
As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, mandates that civil leave and compensation be provided to state employees when they are subpoenaed to testify at trial. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 4.
As introduced, exempts from window tinting restrictions motor vehicles owned or leased by members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-107.

As introduced, authorizes reimbursement from the criminal injuries compensation fund for the reasonable costs of temporary lodging for the victim of domestic violence, not to exceed 14 days. - Amends TCA Section 29-13-106.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Stax Museum of American Soul Music new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to the Stax Museum. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requests the commissioner of revenue to explore the possibility of developing an on-line filing system which would permit the automatic deduction from the collectors business account for the payment of the tax due on sales of mixed drinks and setups upon the filing of the monthly statement by the collector where the collector has supplied the commissioner with the collectors bank account number, the bank transit routing symbols and number and an authorized signature as filed with the payee bank. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-410.

As introduced, clarifies that performance requirements or incentives in contracts or grants between state entities and providers of services related to prevention, treatment or care of delinquent juveniles are allowed to ensure that the initial amount of the grant or contract does not decrease, nor financial penalties accrue to the grant or contract recipients based on performance requirements. - Amends TCA Section 37-5-121.

As introduced, requires commissioner to file annual report as to projects receiving transportation enhancement grants. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51 and Title 54.
As introduced, extends time period for meeting initial issuance requirements for Civil War Preservation new specialty earmarked license plates until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Equine Association new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to such association. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, enacts the "Freedom in Contracting Act." - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

As enacted, specifies that the county executive of Roane County may designate a person from the office of the county sheriff or from the county office of emergency management to accompany an agent of TWRA when inspecting a Class I wildlife facility in Roane County. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As enacted, revises enforcement provisions of unmanned traffic surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, makes a person who is charged with sexual exploitation of a minor ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.

As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As enacted, makes various revisions to employment law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2; Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, reduces the penalty for unauthorized practice of medicine from a Class B to a Class C misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, delays implementation of the voter confidence act for two years. - Amends TCA Title 2, and Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2008 as amended by Chapter 612 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, authorizes state agencies to provide free and discounted services to Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.

As enacted, deletes certain provisions regarding Tennessee Challenge 2000; implements certain reporting requirements on THEC regarding an education fact book; revises certain other provisions relating to THEC and higher education. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires local governments to participate in workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8; Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, revises law concerning submission of economic impact plans in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement officers or agencies from collecting or maintaining information about political or religious views of an individual or group unless it directly relates to criminal investigation and subject of information is believed to be involved. - Amends TCA Title 38.

As introduced, clarifies that authority for department of revenue's officers to enforce provisions of tobacco tax law does not limit attorney general's duty to enforce or defend Tobacco Master Settlement Agreement. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As introduced, allows 20-auditorium, all digital movie theater in Davidson County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises, if one auditorium is restricted to patrons 21 years of age or older. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, increases annual Hall income tax exclusion from first $1,250 to $7,500 for individual returns and from first $2,500 to $15,000 for joint returns beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Pay Equity in the Workplace Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes unemployment insurance benefits to individual who leaves work or is discharged due to circumstances resulting from being victim of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits any public employer from contracting with a private employer who fails to verify the legal status of the private employer's employees; creates penalties. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.
As introduced, prohibits the governor and members of the general assembly from creating or controlling multicandidate political campaign committees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires the department of labor and workforce development to create an office of lawful employment enforcement, staffed by three persons, whereby random audits of employers shall be conducted for compliance with prohibitions under state law concerning the hiring of illegal aliens. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12 and Title 50.

As enacted, enacts the "Carmen Burnette Act of 2012," which requires cardiopulmonary resuscitation programs to implement hands-on practice and skills testing to support cognitive learning, as opposed to merely cognitive training. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.

As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; subject to a hearing, authorizes license suspension or revocation for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; creates penalties for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires mandatory mediation between a bank or other financial institution and a borrower before foreclosure proceedings may be instituted on a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45.

As introduced, requires companies locating in state to establish defined benefit plans and health insurance prior to receiving tax credits and state funding. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 53 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires native grasses to be used to cover landfill sites that have been filled or closed to further operations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, requires that certain structures maintain or acquire photo-electric smoke detectors. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-412; Title 68, Chapter 102, Part 1; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.
As introduced, adds as a consumer protection violation representing that an Internet-based ticket sale price has increased after the sale is completed. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes a conclusive presumption that a beryllium employee, employee with cancer or silicosis, or other employee covered under the federal Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation Act has an occupational disease for the purposes of state workers' compensation claim. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, removes members of the general assembly as eligible participants in the state employees health care plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
As introduced, reduces from 5.5% to 5% the sales tax on food in fiscal year 2011-2012; reduces the rate from 5% to 4.5% in fiscal year 2012-2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, urges municipalities and counties to develop grants to preserve and rehabilitate historic residential homes. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, extends time for foreclosure notice; requires notice be given to borrower of foreclosure counseling; requires mortgage loans be based upon ability of borrower to repay such loans. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
As introduced, enacts the "Ticket Broker Licensing Act." - Amends TCA Title 62.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee High Growth Sustainable Jobs Act." - Amends TCA Title 50; Title 66 and Title 67.
As introduced, revises certain disclosures relative to time-shares and prohibits certain advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 32.
As introduced, requires maximum exemption to be applied against the net estate for inheritance tax purposes to be the same as under federal estate tax law. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
As introduced, clarifies requirements concerning secondhand mattresses sold in this state. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that nonexempt methamphetamine precursors may only be sold after pharmacist has consulted with prospective buyer and has no reason to believe that the person will use it in the illegal manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, designates, for purposes of TDOT providing for relocation of certain public utilities in public right-of-way, that chief engineer shall serve as liaison between utility and contractor. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 8.
As introduced, makes 911 calls and transmissions of such calls confidential. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, transfers contested case hearings currently under jurisdiction of the department of revenue to the office of the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the governor to proclaim a statewide day of mourning for any member of the armed services who dies as a result of injuries sustained from a service connected, combat-related cause. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

As introduced, revises various provisions of the Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act, including certain reporting requirements and minimum dollar values that must exist. - Amends TCA Section 66-29-113 and Section 66-29-115(f)(4).

As introduced, corrects a code reference to clarify what conditions raising a presumption of abandonment must be satisfied in order for intangible property to be subject to the custody of this state as unclaimed property. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies a reference to the department of the treasury in provisions governing the public utility assistance program for small and minority-owned businesses. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-112 and Section 65-5-113.

As introduced, establishes that procedures for the certification, recertification and decertification of health benefit plans as qualified health plans shall be implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 28.
As introduced, removes reference to security for public deposits task force, which no longer exists, in provisions governing collateral pool for public deposits. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, lowers the period of time from four to three years for extending the investment period for required capital investment for an excise tax credit based on the amount of capital investment in industrial machinery. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20.
As introduced, authorizes specified fees relative to deferred presentment services. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-112.

As introduced, excludes certain residential mortgage transactions from the application of the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act; creates a pilot project in Shelby County for voluntary mediation prior to the foreclosure of loans entered into under such act. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45, Chapter 20, Part 1.

As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, revises the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
As introduced, makes various changes to the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

As enacted, specifies, in certain situations, that if the owner of the vehicle is not present, then prior to any person, firm or entity towing a vehicle, such person, firm or entity must notify local law enforcement of the vehicle identification number (VIN), registration information, license plate number and description of the vehicle; local law enforcement must keep a record of all such information which would be available for public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16; Title 55, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 66, Chapter 19, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 5.

As enacted, authorizes industrial development corporations located in municipalities in which urban brownfield redevelopment projects are located to prepare and submit economic impact plans for the development of such projects. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.
As enacted, establishes state house of representatives districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As enacted, establishes state senate districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As enacted, establishes the state's congressional districts. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to convene a working group of representatives from the insurance industry and the medical professions to study recent trends concerning various issues affecting the health insurance industry and the medical professions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, prohibits an award of exemplary or punitive damages for an unfair or deceptive practice that is a willful or knowing violation of consumer protection law if the court has already awarded three times the actual damages sustained. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, decreases the time in which the district attorney is required to notify the child protective team of whether prosecution is justified or appropriate in view of the circumstances from 15 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, revises property tax freeze income limit reference of census data from the most recent decennial census to estimates in the year following the most recent federal census. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705(f).

As introduced, exempts from licensure: individuals making five or fewer mortgage loans within the same 12-month period and sellers who receive one or more mortgages, deeds of trust, or other security instruments as security for a purchase money obligation. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.

As enacted, specifies that it is not an offense for a manufacturer of gambling devices to knowingly own, manufacture, assemble, design, possess, buy, sell, rent, lease, store, repair, transport, print or make any gambling device or record solely intended for gambling outside of Tennessee and in compliance with federal law. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, specifies that no registration fee will be charged for special purpose license plates issued to enlisted members of the National Guard, cultural license plates issued to active members of the United States military and military reserves, and plates issued to Tennessee State Guard and the United States reserve forces. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As introduced, imposes identical registration fee for special purpose license plates issued to enlisted members of the National Guard and cultural license plates issued to active members of the United States military and military reserves. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes the use of flashing white and/or amber lights displayed to the front of a motor vehicle operated by an organ procurement organization or a person under an agreement with an organ procurement organization when transporting an organ for human transplantation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 60 days the period in which a purchase-money security interest in goods, other than inventory or livestock, must be perfected in order to maintain its priority over conflicting security interests in the same goods. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As enacted, rewrites law regarding the disposition of stolen property that is in the possession of a pawnbroker. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, provides for certain reemployment rights for volunteer firefighters injured in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Prescribed Burning Act." - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 4, Part 8 and Title 68.

As introduced, clarifies that alcoholic beverages may be served in any structure, location, open air or dining facility located on Blackberry Farm property. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(20)(F)(iii) and Section 57-4-203.
As introduced, prohibits advertising requirements on certain vacation lodging service firms. - Amends TCA Title 62.
As introduced, exempts certain vacation lodging businesses from regulation by Tennessee Real Estate Commission. - Amends TCA Section 62-13-104.

As introduced, restates authority for counties, cities and towns to take property by eminent domain for a public purpose; revises the procedure for resolving just compensation issues when counties, cities and towns take property by eminent domain for a public purpose. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 29, Chapter 17 and Title 29, Chapter 16.

As enacted, creates the Class A misdemeanor offense of sexual contact by an authority figure which is defined as an adult with supervisory or disciplinary power over a minor, unlawfully kissing the minor for the purpose of sexual arousal or gratification. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Immigration Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, deletes requirement that executive director of the real estate commission have passed the broker's examination. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.

As introduced, increases from three to four years the time period an owner must not have resided at transferred property to be exempt from residential property disclosure. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires director of schools' acceptable Internet use policy to include provisions that encourage the use and understanding of the Internet as an educational tool in preparing students for college and career readiness. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Presence Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, increases maximum number of members who may serve on certain solid waste authority boards from 15 to 17. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 9.

As introduced, requires the department of education to devise an additional alternative assessment for certain students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6; Title 49, Chapter 10 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.
As introduced, creates financial disclosure requirements for state employee associations. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50.
As enacted, broadens scope of violence in the workplace laws. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 14.
As introduced, authorizes expunction of records of certain persons convicted of simple possession before age 21. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits a lessor from charging more than two and a half times the cash price of any merchandise subject to a rental-purchase agreement; requires lessor to keep records of lessor's cost for the merchandise; provides that violation results in the agreement being voided and retention of the merchandise by the consumer. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, allows a 16-auditorium movie theater in Davidson County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises if the theater has one auditorium restricted to patrons 21 years of age or older. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, designates American Baptist College as an eligible independent postsecondary institution for purposes of lottery scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As enacted, revises law regarding restrictions on physicians' rights following the termination or conclusion of employment. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204.
As introduced, identifies reasons other than breach of contract for which restrictions on employment agreements with physicians are void. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204.

As enacted, requires any county election commission desiring to use ballot-on-demand technology to have approval by the coordinator of elections 60 days before any election; requires the coordinator of elections and the state election commission to provide an approved list of available ballot-on-demand technology vendors from which the county election commission must select for use. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-209.

As introduced, permits polling places to close one hour later and requires that the county election commission give 30 instead of 15 days' notice as to the time at which polling places will open. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.

As enacted, specifies that provision whereby information contained in a policy application or obtained in the servicing of a policy of insurance may not be used by the servicing carrier or its representatives for the purpose of soliciting any form of insurance, except when permission to use the information is granted by the commissioner on any specific risk, also applies to a policy of insurance written through a plan depopulation initiative. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, prohibits courts from hindering the collection of taxes administered by the commissioner of revenue, except as provided in present law regarding taxpayer remedies for disputed taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.

As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

As enacted, broadens application of lighting requirements for vehicles or trailers transporting certain loads at night to apply to such loads projecting three and one-half feet or more, rather than four feet or more, beyond rear of vehicle's body. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

As introduced, requires the comptroller of the treasury to review the land acquisition of any hospital authority to determine whether such acquisition would negatively impact businesses in the surrounding area, including but not limited to, health care related businesses. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires commissioner of health to report on or before January 31, 2012, with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in the disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, directs the perinatal advisory committee within the department of health to study issues and policy options relating to hospital discharge and follow-up care procedures for premature infants born less than 37 weeks gestational age to ensure standardized and coordinated processes are followed as premature infants leave the hospital from either a Level 1 (well baby nursery), Level 2 (step down or transitional nursery) or Level 3 (neonatal intensive care unit) unit and transition to follow-up care by a healthcare provider in the community. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, prohibits a local government from establishing a magazine or gun powder storage facility within one mile of a daycare facility or school. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, requires that LLPs list partnership interests in the partnership agreement. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As enacted, allows state agencies to provide free and discounted services to the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation; requires that the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation bear any costs associated with the operation of the general assembly's chambers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.

As enacted, prohibits person, firm, corporation or association of any kind operating in this state from executing an agreement with a union or employee organization of any kind that includes a maintenance of membership clause prohibiting employees from withdrawing from a union or employee organization prior to the agreements expiration. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 2.
As introduced, provides for discounted rates to certain uninsured persons for emergency, inpatient or outpatient care at licensed healthcare facilities. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or municipalities operating school systems; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts certain persons or entities from requirement to obtain a license as a general contractor or home improvement contractor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.
As enacted, designates segment of State Highway 109 in Sumner County as "Tommy Marlin Highway."
As introduced, establishes criteria for evaluations of certified employees of LEAs and grievance of such evaluations by teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax any over-the-counter drug for human use dispensed without a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, requires any proposed landfill owner to provide notice to persons owning property within a three-mile radius of such landfill at least 15 days in advance of any public hearing scheduled regarding applications for the construction of the proposed landfill by having signs erected on all roads leading directly to the proposed landfill site. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, removes the fee that the state fire marshal charges for review and approval of plans and specifications prior to construction or alteration of certain types of buildings or structures. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medication Therapy Monitoring and Management Act of 2011" for immunosuppressant and anti-epileptic drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Medication Therapy Monitoring and Management Act of 2011" for anti-epileptic drugs. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, expands when real property may be forfeited for conviction of certain drug offenses and offense of promoting prostitution, from three or more acts within 60 days to three or more acts within 120 days. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 2 and Title 39, Chapter 11.

As introduced, excludes principals, assistant principals and system-wide supervisors from membership on negotiating units for purposes of the Education Professional Negotiation Act. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-602.
As introduced, allows cities that do not operate city school systems to sponsor charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, requires the statewide policy council for the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities to attend to identifying issues relating to delivering health care to the department's service recipients with particular attention to issues involving TennCare and health care facilities regulated by the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires a board of public utilities to meet within 14 days of appointment to elect a chair instead of 10 and requires notice of meetings to be posted on the board's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 34; Title 7, Chapter 52; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.
As introduced, authorizes licensing of certain all terrain vehicles (ATVs); allows local governments to authorize use of such ATVs on certain public highways. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, revises retirement provisions for general sessions judges, from Group 1 to Group 4 level. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, removes certain responsibilities of the executive director of the district public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

As enacted, provides that offenses of wiretapping and electronic surveillance do not apply to person who installs software on a computer the person owns if such software is intended solely to monitor and record the use of the Internet by a minor child of whom such person is a parent or legal guardian. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6.

As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the current elementary and secondary curriculum standards for the subject of United States and Tennessee government. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits budgetary expenditures on programs enacted by congress without constitutional authority or funding. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, revises licensing requirements for surplus lines agents. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14 and Title 56, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires organizations that supply mental health and developmental disability services to check the registry that contains the names of any persons who have been determined to have abused, neglected, misappropriated or exploited the property of vulnerable individuals and not hire or use as a volunteer any individual listed on the registry; requirements apply to organizations that contract with the division of intellectual disabilities services for residential services, day services or supported employment services.
As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to keep on file the certifications for electronic voting systems. - Amends TCA Section 2-20-104.
As enacted, makes various changes to home school requirements. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3050.
As enacted, enacts the "Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 45 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires the first AED received by a school to be placed in a location that can be readily accessed, which may include those areas used for physical education or activity. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-122.

As introduced, specifies that no managed care entity is exempt from antitrust law, regardless of whether or not such entity contracts with a private act hospital authority that has such an exemption. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, adds to description of a premier type tourist resort in Blount County that the resort maintains a rock climbing facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-101.

As introduced, authorizes the board for licensing health care facilities to establish rules and regulations concerning the operation and licensing of pain management facilities. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.

As enacted, provides that a defendant in a criminal case has the right to have court reporter and make a verbatim recording of all proceedings in open court. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9 and Title 40, Chapter 14.

As introduced, restricts a plaintiff from introducing certain evidence of amounts charged by health care providers if the defendant or the defendant's insurer meets certain requirements. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that tort actions brought against a nursing home, home for the aged or assisted-living facility based upon the provision of health care services is a medical malpractice action and is governed by the provisions of Title 29, Chapter 26. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, establishes a framework for the consideration of evidence offered during all stages of the proceedings in employment discrimination and retaliation cases. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.
As introduced, enacts uniform standards regarding claims of prohibited employment actions. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 50.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Improvement District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Prohibition of Covenants Providing for Transfer Fees Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 66.

As introduced, adds to the offense of perjury any false statement made, not under oath, but in a declaration stating on its face that it is made under penalty of perjury. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-702.

As introduced, increases the number of days that a petitioner has to appeal after a motion to reopen a post-conviction petition is denied from 10 days to 30 days; increases the number of days that the state has to respond from 10 days to 30 days. - Amends TCA Section 40-30-117(c).

As introduced, provides that any private act hospitals authority's records shall be open to public inspection, except as otherwise provided by state statute or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, increases maximum fine imposed for disorderly conduct at funerals and other similar services from $50.00 to $500. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-317.

As introduced, transfers responsibility for mowing of rights-of-way and litter collection on state highways from department of transportation to department of correction; requires TDOT to pay TDOC for use of necessary prison labor. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "J. Marlin Goodman Memorial Bridge."
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "William B. Long Memorial Bridge."
As introduced, changes qualifications for the office of sheriff for all persons running for sheriff on and after July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes certain municipality located in a tier 3 enhancement county, acting through the authorization of the board of public utilities or other board or supervisory body having responsibility for the gas department or electric department, to loan funds from the gas department or electric department to an eligible industrial development corporation for the purpose of economic development or industrial development, or both, in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54.

As enacted, requires approaching vehicles to move into other lane from a stationary utility vehicle with flashing lights if such lane change can be safely made. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits any private act hospital from conditioning receipt of medical staff privileges at such hospital or an affiliate of such hospital on any economic criteria unrelated to quality of care or professional competence. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, revises various criminal provisions relative to the use of any bank, savings and loan association, savings bank or subsidiary's trade name or trademark. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 56.

As introduced, requires all public utilities to allow telecommunications service providers and cable operators to make pole attachments subject to reasonable fees. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 21, Part 1.

As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, deletes current statutory language which states that the tobacco tax is levied on the consumer, who is liable for the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, states that an employer may remit the professional privilege tax on behalf of an employee but the employee shall remain liable for the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires for-hire limousine passenger services to be regulated by the Tennessee regulatory authority. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 65.
As introduced, reduces from 5.5% to 5% the retail sales tax on food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, creates a statutory physical invasion of privacy and constructive invasion of privacy cause of action; creates a fund where half of any civil penalties collected are deposited, with the other half going to prosecuting counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 66.

As introduced, directs that no hospital that is a subsidiary or an affiliate of a private act hospital is exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires that on or after July 1, 2011, if any private act hospital authority operates ambulance service and such ambulance service carries forward a net operating deficit for two consecutive calendar years, such ambulance service shall be subject to general procurement laws. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, recreates the judicial council; revises provisions governing legislative oversight of council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the period of time in which a person cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Gun Owners Improvement Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 70.
As introduced, provides for the regulation of the sale and identification of honey products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.
As introduced, authorizes the state apiarist to place certain registration and safety requirements on beekeepers. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

As enacted, provides that no county, municipality, consolidated government, or other political subdivision of this state may adopt or continue in effect any ordinance or resolution prohibiting the establishment or maintenance of honeybees in hives, provided that such establishment or maintenance is in compliance with the Tennessee Apiary Act of 1995. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

As introduced, clarifies that there are circumstances in which a firearm can be carried in a public park and clarifies that it is firearms, clubs and knives that are prohibited in parks and not weapons already regulated such as machine guns and explosive weapons. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13; Title 40, Chapter 14; Title 40, Chapter 35; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 70.
As introduced, authorizes persons to ride a motorcycle without a helmet if they are 21 and have at least $15,000 of medical insurance coverage. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

As introduced, requires the department of transportation to award a safe routes to schools grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21; Title 54, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 2, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 4 and Title 55, Chapter 20.

As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the feasibility and recommend ways and means of establishing incentives including tax credits by local governments and the state to encourage people to conserve land.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to award a community development block grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 6; Title 13 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance allocated to a member who has $20,000 in such allowance to revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires cost of any remodeling, paint, furniture or other improvements to a member's state office to be paid from such member's postal and printing allowance. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance of more than $10,000 not be transferred to a new member when the former member retires, loses an election, resigns or is otherwise removed from office but revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies that certain private act hospital authorities are not exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-501 and Section 7-57-502.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding high-voltage lines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 103.
As introduced, provides that photo identification licenses issued by the department of safety to persons 18 and over will be free to recipients. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

As enacted, subject to funding, authorizes honorably discharged veterans to have language or a symbol indicating their military service placed on their driver license; requires the department of veterans' affairs, in consultation with the department of safety, to develop appropriate language or military symbol. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
As introduced, establishes manner for determining years of service under certain voluntary separation plans. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As enacted, permits a city and a special school district with coterminous boundaries to specify by contract that city funding for the district shall be used half for district operations and half for issuance of bonds and, upon agreement of the city legislative body and the school board at the time that the bonds are issued, proceeds of any such bond issue shall be used for maintenance and construction at schools existing at the time the bonds are issued. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the department to promulgate as a rule by means of cross-reference the manual relating to the child care certificate program and requires administrative hearings in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, allows homeless person to vote at county election commission office; requires such person to execute affidavit of identity prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2 and Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, revokes outgoing mail privileges of inmates convicted of sexual offenses and not registered as sexual offenders for contact by mail with victims and victims' families. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 41.
As introduced, allows a credit against franchise and excise taxes for the purchase of Tennessee goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, creates a sales tax holiday for the first weekend of March and October of each year for senior citizens; exempts certain items. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, restricts amount of per diem and mileage reimbursement to amounts set in 2010 beginning with the next general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires records of statements filed with registry of election finance be kept for length of candidate's term of office or two years whichever is later. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires THEC to develop a tuition waiver program for students within four courses of completing a baccalaureate degree who have been out of school for at least five years. - Amends TCA Title 49.
Enacts "Tennessee Congressional Redistricting Commission Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the task force on charter schools to study the personnel requirements that result from the creation of charter schools and make recommendations to the general assembly about the impact of charter school expansion in the future by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school, reduces the number of years in which the HOPE scholarships may be received from five to four and alters the dual enrollment grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, requires state insurance committee to establish a supplemental health insurance program that pays cash benefits for state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
As enacted, revises conditions under which grandparent visitation can be awarded. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes the sale of nonpotentially hazardous foods that are prepared in home based kitchens at a person's personal residence, a community or social event, including church bazaars and festivals, and flea markets, in addition to authorizing the sale of such foods at farmer's markets; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1 and Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes persons who are licensed to sell eggs to sell, offer, or expose for sale, or have in the person's possession for sale, all eggs produced by the person unless limited otherwise by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As enacted, prohibits election commission members and administrators of elections from hiring relatives for certain election-related positions. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, requires appellate judges be retained by 75 percent of persons voting rather than by a majority of voters. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, requires principal to consider best interests of child before permitting a child to delay entering school after reaching the mandatory age for beginning school; revises from 30 to 15 days when a child withdrawn from a public school must re-enter public school or be home-schooled. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3001.
As introduced, requires delegates from Tennessee attending a federal constitutional convention to vote according to the demands of the Tennessee general assembly.

As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, provides that court or jury may take into consideration the defendant's personal income and ability to pay when determining the amount of criminal fine to assess, if any. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As introduced, grants an across-the-board salary increase of $2,000 to each full-time employee and a proportionate share to each part-time employee of UT and TBR for the fiscal year that begins July 1, 2011, and ends on June 30, 2012.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of health to develop a plan for ensuring that 90 percent of pregnant women in this state have access to prenatal care and to report concerning such plan to the house health and human resources committee and the senate general welfare, health and human resources committee by February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, authorizes pregnant females to drive in HOV lanes without additional passengers in the motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-188.

As introduced, adds "manufactures or produces Tennessee products, including agricultural products," to the definition of Tennessee-based business enterprise. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 4; Title 43; Title 44; Title 47; Title 57; Title 59; Title 60 and Title 70.

As introduced, makes a one-time reduction to the total amount of health insurance benefits paid on behalf of current and former legislators, and administrative department heads and executive officials in the executive branch, by $100 million; effective July 1, 2011, for former members and executive officials; effective at the election of 108th general assembly for current members. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of law regarding electrical inspections and changes the date by which swimming pools have to be equipped with alarms. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.
As introduced, revises various provisions governing billboard regulation and control. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.
As enacted, provides an unpaid leave of absence for members of the Tennessee state guard and civil air patrol. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes a credit against income taxes for any taxpayer in the amount of taxes paid on dividends from stock in Tennessee businesses. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, allows local boards of education to establish funds to accept donations from individuals, corporations or other entities to fund educational field trips and permits recognition of such donors within guidelines of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax certain baby items intended for traveling, feeding, and daily living. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, limits actions taken by students while at school or on school grounds that are grounds for criminal charges being filed. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, for family automobiles which secure a debt, authorizes a debtor to petition a chancery court for an order granting the debtor up to 30 days to repay or settle the debt. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 55.
As introduced, requires certain civil service lay off provisions to apply to reductions in force of University of Tennessee employees. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-134.
As enacted, sunsets the current post-conviction defender commission; creates a new post-conviction defender oversight commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 30.

As introduced, allows governor to employ additional counsel to the attorney general or in lieu of the attorney general if the governor determines it is in the interest of the state following consultation with the attorney general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, allows private entity to provide a roll off construction or demolition debris container to a person requesting such container even if the site is located in a municipality that has granted an exclusive franchise for the collection, removal and disposal of solid waste. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, authorizes state fire marshal to exempt certain buildings from mandatory sprinkler requirements adopted by local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 120.
As introduced, allows student attending a state university to use student identification card as evidence of identification. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study establishing grant program to assist first-time home buyers in economically distressed areas.

As enacted, makes it a Class C misdemeanor for a person to sell or distribute an electronic cigarette to another person who has not attained 18 years of age or to purchase an electronic cigarette on behalf of such person under 18 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 15 and Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As introduced, requires that, for the purpose of ad valorem property taxation, the value of certain facilities that extract, purify, dehydrate, or otherwise treat landfill methane be assessed at the same percentage as a qualified pollution control facility. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 28, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6.
As introduced, allows person age 65 or older who is unable to obtain copy of such person's birth certificate to vote by executing affidavit of identity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits public higher education employees from engaging in activities that do not constitute work stoppages, but disrupt or reduce the institution's educational services or impair the ability of the institution's employees or agents to perform their duties. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits LEAs from denying equal access to LEA employees to all domestic professional employees' organizations offering membership to all certificated personnel and removes prohibition against LEAs prohibiting communications on school premises. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As introduced, permits city and special school district with boundaries contiguous with the city limits to specify by contract that funding from the city to the district shall be used half for operations of the district and half for bond issue for maintenance and construction at existing schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.
As enacted, clarifies certain provisions governing the casting of a provisional ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, prohibits governmental entities from denying access to records available for public inspection because a governmental entity is involved in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding or contemplating involvement in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding, provided that such records were in existence and available for public inspection prior to initiation or contemplation of the litigation or proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
