As introduced, makes possession of between 1/1000 and 1/8 of an ounce of marijuana a fine only $250 minimum Class A misdemeanor with the first $250 of the amount of the fine going to the drug court in the county of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, subjects property and revenues of airport authorities to taxation and requires authority approval for vendor fee increases. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 4.
As enacted, clarifies counties to which certain court jurisdictional provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act apply. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305 and Section 29-20-307.

As introduced, makes a lien filed by a municipality for the cost of maintaining real property that is not being maintained the same priority of lien as a lien for property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.

As introduced, changes the title "registered interior designers" to "licensed interior designers" and allows them to prepare non-structural interior design plans for large commercial interior spaces. - Amends TCA Title 62.
As introduced, includes livestock and equine animals in the class of animals protected against aggravated cruelty to animals. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-212.
As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Animal Abuser Registry. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, redefines owner for purposes of mechanics' and materialmen's liens to specify that an owner is an owner of real property that a lien claimant seeks to attach or sell under process. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11.
As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to file copy of governor's statement concerning an agency exemption from provisions of UAPA due to federal funding conditions with chairs of the government operations committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, specifies that the right to a secret ballot in union certification elections will only apply to extent that secret ballots are permissible under state or federal law and that, in any such elections where secret ballots are permissible, no alternative means of designation may be used as convincing evidence of employee majority support; such right may not be waived by means of an agreement between a union and an employer; not applicable to union contracts entered into before July 1, 2011, or that involve both employees within and without Tennessee when the employer conducted business within Tennessee before July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As enacted, includes East Fork Stables in the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; designates certain other facility as premier type tourist resort for purposes of sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

As introduced, requires the state to assume the entire cost of any mandatory costs it imposes on local education agencies as its compliance with the constitutional duty to share in costs imposed on local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49.

As introduced, deletes the energy efficient schools initiative and transfers remaining amounts in the energy efficient schools council fund to the lottery for education account. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49.
As introduced, enacts the "Youth Sports Safety Act." - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.

As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding additional information and follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency patients; specifies that exemptions from the utilization review standards for certain agents do not apply to the standards for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency care. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.

As enacted, includes certain nonprofit entities in Davidson County which operate in conjunction with a metropolitan hospital authority within the definition of "governmental entity" in the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, requires certain economic development contracts to be submitted to the chief executive officer of the affected jurisdiction and to the state treasurer within 15 days of the execution of such agreement rather than 10 days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 17.

As introduced, extends authority of commissioner of labor and workforce development to enjoin operation of a business or to order monetary penalties to include workers' compensation premium fraud by an employer. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, adds certain enforcement responsibilities to the employee misclassification advisory task force. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-919.

As introduced, reduces the time within which the board for licensing contractors is to post disciplinary actions on its Web site from 30 days to two business days; changes reference to an advertising campaign to a public information campaign about the board's disciplinary efforts. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of Uniform Landlord and Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.

As introduced, requires commissioner of human resources to develop criteria to distinguish applicants based on applicants' unique characteristics, history and abilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.
As introduced, revises certain provisions pertaining to cable television services. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, applies the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to all counties for rental or lease agreements entered into or renewed on or after July 1, 2011; currently the Act only applies to counties with a population of more than 68,000. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 1.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; authorizes franchise and excise tax credit of $5,000 to employers for each newly hired employee previously receiving unemployment compensation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; allows franchise and excise tax credit for employers equal to certain portion of wages paid to each new full-time employee who was previously unemployed. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, exempts sale of water for certain agricultural purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of municipal school systems related to transfers of administration under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, deletes requirement that department of agriculture prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 44.

As introduced, allows a judge who has a permit to carry a handgun and is in the actual discharge of duties as a judge to carry a handgun while in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, removes the jury's ability to sentence a defendant convicted of first degree murder to death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, abolishes all special school districts on July 1, 2012; requires municipal school districts and county school districts to attempt to consolidate by July 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, creates a joint committee on the study of job creation in this state; provides that the committee shall report to the general assembly no later than January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 49 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires the commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to conduct a joint study, to be presented to the general assembly on or before February 15, 2012, on the impact of the expiration of federal renewal community incentive programs on urban municipalities and the implementation of other economic development and tax incentive programs for urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes a local government's legislative body to designate certain records as proprietary information, and thereby not subject to public records law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 10, Chapter 7.
As enacted, allows lobbyist to attend annual ethics course provided for members of the general assembly to meet annual training requirement. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, specifies that only business days are to be counted for purposes of calculating 10-day period for acceptance of partial payments of property taxes prior to tax lien sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Land Bank Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65 and Title 66.
As enacted, clarifies that misdemeanor probation services may also be provided by a public company other than a municipality or county. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-302.

As enacted, specifies that no contract offered by any insurer, dental service plan, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental services, and no contract or participating provider agreement with a dentist may require that a dentist who is a participating provider, provide services to an enrollee at a fee set by, or subject to the approval of, the dental service plan, insurer, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental plan services unless the dental services are covered services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 10.

As introduced, requires all meetings of transition planning commissions created to develop plans pursuant to the transfer of the administration of schools in special school districts to county boards of education be subject to the open meetings law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, and Chapter __ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 25 / House Bill 51).
As introduced, repeals Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011. - Repeals Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, allows the attorney general to recover in a civil action property or proceeds obtained through or as a result of unlawful conduct. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39.

As enacted, includes entertainment services in services the theft of which constitutes theft of services; specifies that a person commits theft of services by intentionally obtaining services by forgery or false statement, in addition to deception, fraud, coercion, false pretense or any other means, to avoid payment for the services; specifies that victims may report violations and testify. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, adds additional requirements to be submitted for certain candidates' names to be placed on the ballot in this state. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, adds various requirements for issuance of permit to dispose of coal combustion waste in landfills. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, calls for a run-off election in the event that there is a tie for county or civil district office. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, allows the National Ornamental Metal Museum in Memphis to serve or sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As enacted, creates David Crockett commission to oversee erection of monument or statue honoring David Crockett.

As introduced, defines employee for purposes of adult-oriented establishments and prohibits employees from living on the same premises or in the same building as the establishment. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

As introduced, authorizes a court to order a first time violator of an order of protection to attend counseling and pay for such counseling, in addition to optional counseling for the victim; authorizes a court to order a $3,000 fine for each subsequent violation in addition to other penalties. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district whose boundaries are coterminous with the city's boundaries to maintain effort in funding such school system; requires automatic increase in maintenance of effort if there is an increase in the number of students in the school district or inflation occurs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, requires comprehensive energy audits of state buildings, state-owned facilities and commercial buildings, with audit results to be conspicuously displayed in the buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 13.

As introduced, requires victim of domestic violence filing for order of protection and respondent to attend one hour of domestic violence counseling prior to hearing on the order; requires costs of counseling to be assessed against the respondent in certain cases. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As introduced, establishes certain procedures for creation of special school districts related to transfers of administration effectuated under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of certain special school districts. - Amends amend Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to perform a financial audit of any school district seeking to convert to a special school district, if such conversion is permitted. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.
As introduced, prescribes certain procedures to govern the abolition of city school districts. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the establishment of a rural infrastructure fund to assist economically distressed rural areas of the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13; Title 54 and Title 67.
As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, requires the commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to conduct a joint study, to be presented to the general assembly on or before February 15, 2012, on the impact of the expiration of federal renewal community incentive programs on urban municipalities and the implementation of other economic development and tax incentive programs for urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, clarifies that deputy sheriffs assigned to courthouse security may be POST certified but are not required to be. - Amends TCA Section 5-7-108.
As introduced, revises qualifications for being elected or appointed to office of sheriff. - Amends TCA Section 8-8-102.

As introduced, permits certain utilities providing water to only initiate a rate proceeding once every six years; provides that books, records and documents that authority has access to for rate regulation for certain utilities providing water are considered public records. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, requires juvenile detention facilities to report annually to the department of education on the number of youth served, dates of entry and exit and demographic information. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires school year to begin no earlier than fourth Monday in August unless the department of education grants a waiver; requires department to create a timeline detailing how state will meet federal school choice notification requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement agencies and employees from practicing biased-based policing against persons residing unlawfully in the United States; provides penalties for such violations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

As introduced, encourages racial, gender and ethnic diversity among the appointed membership of a transitional planning commission created pursuant to a Section 49-2-502 transfer of a special school district to the county. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.

As introduced, prohibits the back assessment of property taxes on any growing crops owned by certain entities; clarifies that growing crops includes pine plantations and saplings. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 10; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 8.

As introduced, specifies that state government's purchasing preference for Tennessee goods includes building materials and requires local governments to use the same purchasing priorities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 12 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, operating a motorcycle registered in another state to comply with mandatory motorcycle equipment laws from state in which motorcycle is registered. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 3.

As introduced, exempts from requirement to wear a helmet while riding a motorcycle nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, from states that do not require motorcycle helmets. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

As introduced, requires local governing body of municipalities or counties to approve location of each traffic enforcement camera placed or located within such jurisdiction after July 1, 2011; establishes penalty up to $50.00 plus court costs. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires law enforcement agencies seeking to conduct undercover investigations on school grounds to place certain authorities on notice prior to conducting such investigations. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 49.
As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, requires each person employed to work at an adult-oriented establishment or adult cabaret to be at least 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 57.
As introduced, creates the Tennessee municipal government economic development and opportunity grant fund. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7 and Title 9, Chapter 4.
As introduced, establishes provisions governing the employment of physicians by licensed nursing homes and their affiliates. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, requires coverage of tamper resistant opioids if a health benefit plan includes prescription drug coverage. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 2 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

As enacted, allows an employer to offset an employee's wages if the employee owes the employer money that the employer loaned or advanced the employee, in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 26 and Title 50.

As introduced, imposes $4.00 fee on each new case filed in all courts, instead of earmarking $2.00 out of all the general filing fees already charged by court clerks, for computer hardware purchases or replacement; in Knox County, makes same $4.00 fee mandatory instead of authorizing clerk to charge $2.00 data entry fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.
As introduced, limits increase in value of certain real property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires all persons arrested on or after January 1, 2012, for the commission of any felony to have a biological specimen taken for the purpose of DNA analysis; requires sample of biological specimen to be destroyed if charges dismissed or defendant acquitted. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.
As introduced, directs TBI to create policy and uniform procedures authorizing familial DNA searches in certain criminal investigations by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 38.
As introduced, creates a rebuttable presumption that price-gouging has been committed in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 51.
As introduced, revises various provisions relative to business organizations. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As enacted, clarifies various provisions relative to business organizations and revises various provisions regarding documents from such organizations that are filed with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.
As enacted, enacts the "Border Region Retail Tourism Development District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires the comptroller to audit private act hospital authorities. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, allows substitute teachers to be employed by local education agency or third party public or private employer through agreement with the LEA; states that substitute teachers employed by third party shall be subject to same unemployment benefit eligibility conditions as those employed by LEAs. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-709.
As introduced, enacts the "Grand Jury Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 22 and Title 40.
As introduced, enacts the "Fully Informed Jury Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17; Title 20; Title 22 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires the department of health to make available for public inspection all federal return of organization exempt from income tax (Form 990) for all private act hospital authorities in this state. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, creates civil penalty for employee engaged in a work stoppage; requires all documentation of labor negotiation with state employee associations be public record; revises other provisions governing state employees and employee associations. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44; Title 8, Chapter 50 and Title 8, Chapter 23.

As introduced, increases penalty for failing to provide evidence of financial responsibility from $100 fine to $250 fine for first offense and $500 fine and mandatory impoundment of driver's motor vehicle for second or subsequent offense. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 16 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, changes name of Tennessee highway patrol to be Tennessee state patrol. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16; Title 38, Chapter 8; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 68.

As introduced, exempts any person who has successfully completed all handgun training of not less than four hours as required by any branch of the military from paying the $115 handgun carry permit application and processing fee. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, authorizes a municipal electric system to provide cable and Internet related services in an area 10 miles beyond the system's service area. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 1 and Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.
As enacted, adds "unmanned free-floating devices capable of producing an open flame, such as, but not limited to sky lanterns" to the definition of special fireworks.
As introduced, deletes authority to transfer fund balance in the fire prevention fund to the state general fund at end of each fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 68-102-142.

As introduced, requires department to impose statewide approval of any transitional license preparation program that has received, at a minimum, National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE) candidacy status. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.
As introduced, authorizes utilities to send notices of discontinued service by electronic mail for nonpayment of services. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, defines "destroy" for purposes of the Billboard Regulation and Control Act of 1972. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-102.

Requires commissioner of economic and community development to report to finance chairs as to use of contingent FMAP funding appropriated to the department in the FY 2010-2011 annual appropriations act. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, requires non-binding, advisory referendum on the performance of the director of schools to be held every four years in coordination with the election of governor. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 49.

As enacted, revises authority of commissioner of commerce and insurance to investigate insurance agents; revises rights of insurance agents under investigation; revises penalties imposed against insurance agents. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-112; Section 56-6-117; Section 56-6-120 and Section 56-8-107.
As enacted, broadens transaction exemptions under the Tennessee Securities Act of 1980. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2.
As introduced, defines Fairfield Glade as a governmental entity under the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

As introduced, creates an advisory council that shall study the potential impact of tort reform measures on anticompetitive activities engaged in by hospitals, insurance companies and health care professionals and whether or not such impact, if any, would increase or decrease the overall cost of healthcare in this state. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 24; Title 25 and Title 29.

As introduced, creates two new Class C misdemeanor offenses, punishable only by fine of $50.00, if either a legal guardian expressly permits their child to participate in any solicitation or collection event at a highway or street intersection, or the organizer of the collection event expressly permits the child's participation. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 68.

As introduced, creates a Class B misdemeanor, punishable by a $2,500 fine and mandatory driver license suspension, for operating a vehicle with the intent to obstruct certain private or public property. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, creates Class B felony for person manufacturing, delivering or selling substances containing 15 grams or more of oxycodone; creates Class A felony for person manufacturing, delivering or selling substances containing 150 grams or more of oxycodone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, exempts mechanical or HVAC contractors installing duct detectors on HVAC systems from the alarm contractors licensing act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

As introduced, requires notice and opportunity to be heard, as well as appeals process, for issuance of permits for drilling oil and natural gas. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Section 69-3-105.

As enacted, creates a presumption that HIV acquired by emergency medical worker was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by preponderance of the evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.
As introduced, adds additional restrictions on the use of tax revenues relative to obligations involving the Tennessee Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-402.

As introduced, modifies the surcharge on premiums for workers' compensation insurance policies issued by an insurance carrier for the administration of TOSHA. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Transportation Challenge Grant Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 2.
As enacted, increases the auctioneer's fee for sale of real property at public sale under any order or decree of any court from 6 percent to 8 percent.
As introduced, removes the sales tax on retail sales of food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, requires health insurance entities to establish both internal and external grievance and appeals processes to permit review of coverage and payment determinations; corrects TCA cross-reference. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 32 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, allows a reviewing court to award an appellee's attorneys' fees and related filing costs if the court determines that an appeal is frivolous or taken solely for delay. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 25 and Title 27.

As introduced, effective September 1, 2011, creates division V of circuit court of 21st judicial district with the judge to be appointed by the governor and serve until September 1, 2014; at August 2014 general election, a judge shall be elected for division V for a full 8-year term; district consists of Hickman, Lewis, Perry and Williamson counties. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As introduced, exempts any new LLCs or foreign LLCs from the initial filing fees associated with articles of organization or other documents filed with the secretary of state; requires an annual fee thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 249; Title 48, Chapter 246 and Title 48, Chapter 247, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee New Entrepreneur Tax Credit Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, renames the position of small business advocate the small business center and transfers the function from the office of the comptroller of the treasury to the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Section 12-3-813.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Job Tax Credit Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, allows children, up to 24 years of age, of retired teachers with 25 years service to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated area technical-vocational school or state-supported institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As introduced, permits a dependent spouse to acknowledge receipt of notice by written acknowledgement if not as provided under the Tennessee Rules of Civil Procedure. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2366.
As enacted, increases penalty for disorderly conduct within 500 feet of a funeral or memorial service from Class C misdemeanor to Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.

As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires certain executive branch employees to make financial disclosures. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, creates an annual sales tax holiday for eligible veterans on the Saturday and Sunday before Memorial Day; exempts certain property from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, encourages the department of health to conduct a study concerning exposure to fluoride to the extent funds are specifically provided in the general appropriations act; any study conducted by the commissioner, to the greatest extent possible, should include utilizing the research personnel and tools available through the public and private teaching hospitals located in this state. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1; Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 68.

As introduced, prohibits Tennessee from participating in the implementation of the federal REAL ID Act of 2005, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 55.

As enacted, specifies that, under law regarding records open to public inspection, "public record" or "state record" does not include the device or equipment that may have been used to create or store a public or state record. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, extends certain property tax assessment remedies for disaster damage. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-604 and Section 67-5-606.

As enacted, provides for revocation of driver license for nonpayment of litigation taxes, court costs or fines in certain circumstances; provides payment plan option and hardship exemption. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 40, Chapter 24, Part 1; Title 50 and Title 55.

As introduced, mandates that employees without a teaching license be hired on an at-will basis rather than on a yearly contract and specifies that the director may only dismiss nontenured, licensed employees for certain conduct. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.
As introduced, clarifies that electric cooperatives have no authority to offer incentives that effectively exclude or limit the use of alternative fuel sources. - Amends TCA Section 65-25-205.

As enacted, creates an exception to the general prohibition against assigning security interests in trust funds that are held for use in connection with the purchase of motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 35; Title 47 and Title 55.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of the "Neighborhood Preservation Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 6.

As introduced, under certain circumstances, broadens the Class E felony offense of aggravated criminal littering to include littering in areas designated as no dumping zones. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5.

As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As introduced, requires 10 percent of registered voters in district to recall municipal office holder if district smaller than the municipality. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-151.

As introduced, vests control of Alvin C. York Institute in a board of trust composed of the governor, the commissioner of education and a citizen of Fentress County appointed by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes property tax relief to surviving spouses of disabled veterans who would have been eligible for relief had the veteran qualified under later amendments to the law. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.
As introduced, establishes a report card for parents in order to encourage parental involvement and accountability in public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, directs the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the curriculum standards for civics education to determine whether the course of instruction in all public schools is designed to effectively and rigorously educate children in local, state and federal government. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.

As enacted, revises offense of producing, manufacturing, distributing, or possessing with intent to produce, manufacture, or distribute the active chemical ingredient in the hallucinogenic plant salvia divinorum or the synthetic cannabinoids JWH-018, JWH-073, HU-210 and HU-211 to include other synthetic cannabinoids. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor, punishable by fine of $2,500, to knowingly produce, manufacture, distribute, sell, offer for sale, or possess with intent to produce, manufacture, distribute, sell or offer for sale any product composed of any amount of methcathinone that is not lawfully prescribed or approved by the FDA. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, creates the Tennessee interagency cash flow committee. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-234 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 6.

As introduced, redefines beer to include beverages with up to 12 percent alcoholic content; allows retail package stores to sell beer. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 5; Title 57, Chapter 6 and Title 57, Chapter 9.
As introduced, requires agencies filing rules with the secretary of state provide a cost-benefit analysis on state and local governments of such rules. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, specifies, in regard to present requirement for an officer to cause a driver to submit to a test to determine the alcohol or drug content of the driver's blood if the officer has probable cause to believe that the driver was driving under the influence and such driving resulted in an accident causing injury or death to another, that the test be taken "immediately". - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, allows an officer to conduct a blood alcohol test upon reasonable suspicion, instead of probable cause, that a driver was intoxicated for any driver involved in an accident resulting in serious injury or death. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.
As enacted, establishes requirements for the supervision of nurses and physician assistants by certain physicians when engaged in interventional pain management. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, makes changes to the membership of and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As introduced, requires the local board of education to maintain a record of teacher dismissal and suspension hearings of tenured teachers in addition to the results of those hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As introduced, modifies nursing facility diversion requirements at time of nursing home admission concerning home and community-based services. - Amends TCA Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires the department of commerce and insurance to cooperate fully with the department of health in all aspects of the transfer of the board of pharmacy and the long term effects of such transfer including prompt submission of any requested documents or records. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 31; Title 56, Chapter 57; Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 32 and Title 63.
As introduced, deletes the retail sales tax imposed on food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, eliminates state lottery January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 6; Section 39-15-413 and Title 49.

As introduced, permits, on a case-by-case basis, a child who has not reached five years of age by September 30 to enter school, if a parent requests early entrance and the LEA determines early entrance is in the best interest of the child. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, makes technical changes to remaining terms involving mental retardation and the division of intellectual disabilities services to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes code commission to make changes to effectuate Chapters 734 and 1100 of the Public Acts of 2010 with respect to references to mental retardation and similar terms and the creation of the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, provides for additional notice to legislative committees, lengthens certain reporting deadlines and authorizes additional assistance to the commissioner of intellectual and developmental disabilities concerning determining the fiscal impact of certain changes impacting certain licensees of the department of mental health; creates committee to examine fiscal notes and other costs associated with transferring the function of licensing services and facilities from the department of mental health to the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, extends publication of notice of any sale of land from 20 days to 30 days. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.

As enacted, specifies that all records containing the results of individual teacher evaluations administered pursuant to the policies, guidelines, and criteria adopted by the state board of education would be treated as confidential and would not be open to the public; specifies that the LEA, public charter school, state board of education, or department of education may access and utilize such records as required to fulfill their lawful functions. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As enacted, specifies that temporary absence of a member of a county board of education to serve in the military does not constitute a vacancy in office and is not subject to provisions of the code requiring a temporary replacement. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-202.
As enacted, specifies the manner of obtaining fingerprints of certain applicants under the Uniform Debt-Management Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 55.

As introduced, establishes a ceiling of 100 percent for interest rates on payday loans; defines "payday loan" as short-term cash loan or funds provided to an individual in anticipation of future receipt of wages. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, creates presumption that person making sale of tangible personal property to persons in this state that have been solicited by independent contractors or other representatives in Tennessee is responsible for sales tax on such sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, makes certain adjustments to statutes pertaining to sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Section 67-6-202.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Protection Act" to require combined reporting for franchise and excise tax purposes; reduces sales tax on food from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, decreases the time an insurer of commercial risk insurance has to file rates, supplementary rate information, policy forms and endorsements with the commissioner from 15 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As enacted, allows commission to assess costs for administrative hearings; revises certain requirements for servers permit. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, clarifies that any CD-ROMs or digital products sold with textbooks and workbooks shall be exempt from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes juvenile court to hold a hearing and take evidence if necessary before determining whether a parent is indigent; states that indigent parent shall not be required to pay for child's nonsecure alternate accommodations. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.
As introduced, allows early voting for regular November election starting August 15 instead of 20 days before election day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, revises provisions governing description of property in notice of judicial or trust sale; authorizes the postponement and rescheduling of a foreclosure sale without further newspaper publication under certain circumstances, unless prohibited by contract. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.

As enacted, revises various provisions related to the notice of the right to foreclose that must be sent by the lender to the debtor prior to foreclosure; effective January 1, 2013, deletes certain notice requirements. - Amends TCA Section 35-5-117.
As introduced, requires that the loan limit prescribed for state banks take into consideration the credit exposure to derivative transactions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2.
As enacted, deletes the provisions relating to the defense of unclean hands. - Amends TCA Title 16.

As enacted, clarifies that a holder of an indebtedness has a duty to collect the tax imposed on the recordation of evidence of the indebtedness and to remit the tax as required by law. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.
As introduced, adds step-up bonds and obligations to list of eligible collateral for public depository purposes. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 9, Chapter 5.

As introduced, authorizes the treasurer to accept as security for public deposits certain governmental bonds containing increases in the interest rate; authorizes the treasurer to discount the face value of such bonds. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 5.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the delivery of community services by various agencies.
As introduced, enacts the "Genetically Engineered Food Labeling Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1.

As introduced, increases period of denial of license due to withdrawal from secondary school from 18 to 21 years of age with certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30 and Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires a referendum be conducted before a publicly funded entity can be sold or leased; "sale or lease" means that more than 30 percent of the assets of the entity are subject to sale or lease. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

As introduced, prohibits the sale of a catalytic converter to a junk yard if the seller fails to present either proof of ownership of the vehicle from which the converter was removed or a sales receipt for the converter; classifies the offense as a Class B misdemeanor, punishable only by fine of $500. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 47; Title 55 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires person with two or more convictions for driving under the influence to maintain double the amount of liability insurance, deposit of cash, or bond filed with the commissioner of safety in order to comply with financial responsibility laws. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, increases penalty for leaving the scene of an accident when a minor child is injured from Class A misdemeanor to Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, requires plants and seeds sold in Tennessee to be labeled to indicate open pollination, genetic modification, or hybridization. - Amends TCA Title 43.

As introduced, requires payor banks to process items sequentially as indicated by the numbers on the bank drafts on the day items are charged against a customer's account; places limits on handling charges for insufficient funds if items are not processed sequentially. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, limits the amount of the handling charge assessed to not more than the amount of the check, draft, or order if such instrument is less than $30.00. - Amends TCA Section 47-29-102.
As introduced, requires first or second term inmates without high school diplomas or GEDs to attend GED examination preparation classes. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.

As introduced, makes it a criminal offense punishable by fine and community service only to knowingly wear pants below waistline to show underwear or buttocks; earmarks proceeds of fines to equipment for school activities. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits an insurance company from setting rates based upon the zip code of the applicant's place of residence or employment. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.
As introduced, removes all requirements or restrictions regarding traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, prohibits an insurer from taking an adverse action against a consumer based primarily on the consumer's insurance score, credit reports, or other credit information or based primarily on the fact the consumer does not have a credit account. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 56.

As introduced, decreases fine for making aggravated nonemergency 911 calls from $2,500 to $500; earmarks proceeds of fines to 911 call center in city where call originated. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires department to utilize scale of 100% when reporting progress in the Tennessee report card for schools beginning with the report for the 2012-2013 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As enacted, provides that person who commits theft of services may be required to perform debris removal, cleanup, restoration or other necessary physical labor at the location within the area affected by a disaster or emergency, if the offense occurred: during or within 30 days following the occurrence of a tornado, flood, fire, or other disaster or emergency; within the area affected by the disaster or emergency; and when, as a result of the disaster or emergency, the owner of the property taken, or the person charged with custody of the property, is unable to adequately guard, secure or protect the property from theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.

As enacted, changes various requirements for registration of athlete agents, providing notice of athlete agent activities to higher education institutions and penalties for violations of Athlete Agent Reform Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 21.

As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission established relative to certain transfers of administration effectuated pursuant to Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, authorizes the cost of veterinary services and final disposal or burial expenses in determining the value of a police dog, fire dog, search and rescue dog, service animal or police horse knowingly and unlawfully killed without the owner's effective consent. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50; Title 13; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 44; Title 50; Title 62 and Title 66.
As introduced, removes obsolete language from provision on fiscal procedures used by institutions of the board of regents. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8.

As enacted, enacts the "Kristen Azevedo Act" regarding background checks on persons applying to work at higher education institution in housing facilities who will have access to student rooms or apartments. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, permits THEC, UT and TBR to provide information on lottery scholarships in the normal course of business and recruitment of Tennessee students on the annual lottery scholarship day. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, changes from December 1 to February 1 the date by which the commission shall triennially report its findings of the study of independent nonprofit colleges and universities. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, removes authorization for the commissioner of education to remove from office any local board of education member who fails to attend the annual training as prescribed by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires Tennessee higher education commission to provide data in its annual report on the rate at which students receiving scholarships and grants pursuant to this part graduate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5 and Title 49.

As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding public charter schools, including provisions regarding the governing body of a public charter school, public charter school applications, and funding for public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a green jobs vocational and technical education program. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, lowers maximum rate that municipalities are authorized to charge for hotel occupancy tax from 5% to 4%. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As enacted, enacts the "Tourism Development Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, under certain circumstances, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to capture visual images of persons, except elected officials; increases penalties for assault, false imprisonment, criminal trespass, trespass by motor vehicle, unlawful observation, and reckless driving when done with intent to capture such images. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 2.

As introduced, allows certain fiduciaries and related persons to purchase property of a minor or disabled person without court approval when it is done by public auction. - Amends TCA Section 34-1-116.

As introduced, requires that a person be in full compliance with the Financial Responsibility Law of 1977 prior to having vehicle registration approved or renewed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, prohibits certain types of late fees from being charged in consumer contracts. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to create common application and common financial aid application to be used by all higher education institutions within the state university and community college system and the University of Tennessee by the 2012-2013 academic year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires Tennessee housing development agency to study feasibility of establishing a Tennessee foreclosure mediation program. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
As introduced, suspends annual and percentage pay increases to the minimum compensation for county officials for a period of five years. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24.

As introduced, requires nonprofit entities, that contract with the commissioner of education to manage schools or LEAs in the achievement school district, to be registered with the secretary of state or to be 501(c)(3) organizations; prohibits for-profit partnerships from managing such schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.

As enacted, authorizes an LEA to be the sponsor of a charter school; if an LEA seeks to sponsor a charter school, then the state board of education would serve as the chartering authority. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, urges the respective appointing authorities, in making appointments to a transition planning commission, to ensure that appointments reflect the ethnic and gender demographic makeup of their respective jurisdictions. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay restitution to victims and be current on child support obligations and court costs to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.
As introduced, requires mortgage counselor be consulted before an adjustable rate mortgage can be completed. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, converts the three ex officio members of a Section 49-2-502 transitional planning commission from voting to non-voting members. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, increases fine for first offense of violating "Katie Beth's Law" from fine not to exceed $100 to fine not to exceed $250. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 68, Chapter 14.
As introduced, establishes requirements for skilled nursing facility liability actions. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

As enacted, provides that the marketing, sale, offering for sale, issuance, making, proposing to make and administration of a service contract shall not be construed to be the business of insurance and shall be exempt from regulation as insurance pursuant to title 56. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires hard or electronic copies of pre-need contracts and pre-need insurance arrangements be maintained; deletes prohibition against promises of a rebate, discount or reduction in price upon the death of any person. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-409 and Section 62-5-411.

As enacted, requires a local board of education to allocate funding in an amount equal to the per pupil state and local funds received by the LEA to state licensed residential mental health facilities on a prorated daily basis for the student's length of stay, provided certain criteria have been met. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.

As enacted, requires LEAs to establish a transparent and uniform method of calculating all terms and costs related to any lease, lease-purchase agreement, or other contract or agreement executed between the LEA and a charter school for the use of the LEA's educational facilities; establishes certain requirements regarding underutilized and vacant property; specifies uses of capital outlay funds by charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, eliminates caps on the number of charter schools that can be formed. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for the United States Green Building Council; allocates 50% of proceeds to the United States Green Building Council. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires contracting agents to be registered by the department of commerce and insurance and prohibits unauthorized access to services or discounts under a provider network contract. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enacted, allows city of New Market to permit nonresident property owners to vote in municipal elections upon 2/3 approval of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-53-102.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As introduced, makes appropriations to defray the costs of certain enactments of the 2011 annual session of the 107th General Assembly.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding charter schools, including provisions governing students eligible to attend; removes caps on number of public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, specifies that authorization for commissioner of health to remove non-narcotic, over the counter drugs from schedule of dangerous drugs does not apply to non-exempt products containing an immediate methamphetamine precursor that must be kept behind the pharmacy counter. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-403.

As enacted, creates exception for commercial driver license holders and violations occurring in a commercial motor vehicle to the prohibition on the department of safety suspending a driver license for failing to appear in court on a traffic citation unless the request for suspension is made within six months of the violation. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502(a)(1)(l).

As enacted, delays effective date of certain streamlined sales tax provisions until July 1, 2013; specifies that if the headquarters staff employee position does not remain filled during the investment period, the taxpayer must repay any franchise tax credit or refund taken relating to such position, plus interest; extends certain filing deadlines when due date falls on legal holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67; and Chapter 530 of the Public Acts of 2009 and Chapter 602 of the Public Acts of 2007.

As introduced, increases the grace period for active military members stationed outside of continental United States to renew vehicle registrations from "14 days" to "30 days" after the member's return to the state; revises when a registration plate must be attached to the rear of a truck. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 65 and Title 66.

As enacted, revises various tax provisions including provisions regarding gains on sales of assets designated as goodwill and Class VII assets, local option taxes with respect to industrial and farm machinery, sales tax credits to dealers, and electronic tax return filings and payments. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 67 and Chapter 1134 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As enacted, revises various provisions of law governing taxes, including certain sales tax and franchise/excise tax credit provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 49; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, authorizes a court to order defendants who are in custody and are found not guilty by reason of insanity of a felony offense against the person, such as felony sex offenses, assaults, kidnappings, and robberies, to remain in custody after the verdict to receive an outpatient mental health evaluation. - Amends TCA Section 33-7-303(a).

As enacted, redefines "developmental disability"; makes technical changes to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 37; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, Chapter 6.
As introduced, specifies that assistance under the program for the care and treatment of persons suffering from hemophilia would be subject to availability of funds. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, adds the conference of state bank supervisors and the money transmitter regulators association to list of entities to which the department of financial institutions may release confidential information concerning licensees and applicants, if such organizations enter into confidentiality agreements with the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 7.

As enacted, delays the implementation of certain provisions concerning the procurement commission and related topics; makes substantive changes in certain parts of procurement commission legislation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4; Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Chapter 1098 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, removes the requirement that if the commissioner of education ceases to be the commissioner, then such former commissioner must remain a member of the teacher evaluation advisory committee until the committee ceases to exist. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302.
As introduced, revises requirements to be commissioner of education to only require the commissioner to have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

As introduced, clarifies that a manager of a school placed in the achievement school district will determine whether a teacher may continue "employment," instead of "teaching," at the school. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.

As enacted, authorizes the commissioner to require assignments of independent review organizations on a random basis if random assignments are required by the U.S. department of health and human services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 61.

As enacted, removes provisions regarding the small employer carrier committee and risk-assuming and reinsuring carriers under the Tennessee Small Employer Group Health Coverage Reform Act and rewrites law regarding accident and sickness insurance rates. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, specifies proper venue for proceedings in which a child who is in the custody of the department of children's services is alleged to be unruly. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-111.
As enacted, enacts the "Revised Tennessee Captive Insurance Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 13.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.

As introduced, decreases from four to three the number of directors for the authority by removing position presently filled by joint agreement among the governor, the speaker of the senate and the speaker of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, enables students who first received the Tennessee HOPE scholarship, HOPE access grant or HOPE scholarship for nontraditional students in the fall semester 2009 or thereafter, to receive such lottery-funded scholarships and grants in the summer semester, in addition to the fall and spring semesters; revises the law on terminating events for the HOPE scholarship or access grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends the tax on intermediate care facilities for the mentally retarded to July 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-830.

As enacted, changes date by which assignments for the following school year and notices of termination must be sent to school personnel from May 15 to June 15; specifies that director of schools must decide if a teacher is qualified for an open position; changes various requirements for obtaining tenure and other tenure-related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 125. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes full-time faculty and staff at public colleges and universities in Tennessee to carry handguns if not otherwise prohibited by law. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, authorizes certain law enforcement officers and military personnel to carry weapons on public colleges and universities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, authorizes full-time faculty at a public college to carry a firearm on such campus if they have a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As enacted, authorizes display of P.O.W.-M.I.A. flag at state capitol and each county courthouse and city or town hall on any day U.S. flag is displayed at such buildings. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 4, Part 3.

As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor punishable by mandatory 30 days in jail for a non-participant in a sports event to assault a sports official and Class E felony if more than five assemble to assault a sports official. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits certain union and employee organization activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11; Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires drivers to submit proof of compliance with the financial responsibility law prior to registering car; establishes fines for failure to comply with such law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, prohibits personnel from MTAS, CTAS, the state planning office, regional development districts or human resource agencies from assisting state or local government in the selection process for professional services.
As introduced, authorizes commissioner of TDOT to contribute annually to fund ferries that substantially add to interstate commerce in the state. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes up to four special censuses in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1; Section 54-4-203; Section 57-5-205 and Section 67-6-103.
As introduced, allows a court to dismiss a financial responsibility case if the defendant did not have financial responsibility at the time of certain violations. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-139.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for American Red Cross; allocates 50% of proceeds to Tennessee chapters of American Red Cross. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes the sale of air conditioner evaporator coils or condensers to scrap metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9.
As introduced, specifies conditions under which collection stations for laboratory specimens that are open to the public must operate. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, requires school districts to pay education providers, contracting with the department of children's services to provide education to children in the department's custody, for each child from the district an amount equal to that paid by the district for children attending public schools. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.
As enacted, revises various provisions of workers' compensation law regarding construction services providers. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, establishes requirements for home health companies to provide assistance with medication to clients; requires background checks of employees, recordkeeping, and waiver. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7 and Title 68.

As introduced, establishes procedure for deducting from amount bid on state building commission project the estimated energy cost savings attributable to bidder's design modifications and proposals. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, requires that providers of services, material, and equipment in state and local building contracts meet energy efficiency standards. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, directs the department of revenue and the department of finance and administration to promptly furnish certain information required for the state funding board to estimate state revenues for the upcoming fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-5202.

As enacted, adds Cocke County to those counties where distilleries may be located without conducting an additional referendum if within the boundaries of the county both retail package sales and liquor-by-the-drink have been approved through voter referendum. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As introduced, specifies that funds allocated in the classroom component of the BEP for textbooks must be expended for textbooks and other instructional materials. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, specifies that beginning with the 2011-2012 school year, a student in the third grade may not be promoted to the next grade level unless the student has shown a basic understanding of curriculum and ability to perform the skills required in the subject of reading as demonstrated by the student's grades or standardized test results; such student may be promoted if the student participates in an LEA approved research-based intervention prior to the beginning of the next school year; act does not apply to any student who has an IEP pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes any state court judge who possesses a valid handgun carry permit and who completes both 16 hours of POST court security training and eight hours per year of POST firearm training to possess a firearm in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, adds a plumber representative to the state board for licensing contractors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-6-104.
As introduced, designates segment of State Route 143 in Carter County as "Sen. Robert "Bob" Burleson Parkway."

As introduced, authorizes a judge at any level who has a handgun carry permit to possess a handgun at all times and in the same places as a law enforcement officer is authorized. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, alters various provisions regarding removal of a member of a utility management review board from office. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.
As introduced, requires the department of human services to develop and administer a child care assistance program for low income and at risk children. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.

As introduced, provides civil and criminal immunity for person threatening or using lawful force to protect real property from severe environmental degradation caused by feral hogs; lawful force includes the use of dogs. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11, Part 6 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, establishes certain requirements for electronic prescribing and electronic prescribing software. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10.

As enacted, changes the evidence requirement from a preponderance of the evidence to clear and convincing evidence for rebutting the presumption that drugs or alcohol were the proximate cause of an injury from a drug test result or the refusal to submit to a drug test. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.

As introduced, allows the next-of-kin of a patient in a state hospital to access the records of such patient if the patient has been deceased more than 10 years and the records are more than 50 years old. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, permits judge to donate a communication device or access device that is legal to own but was used in an unlawful manner to an LEA or not-for-profit organization in lieu of destroying the device as contraband. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, permits the legislative body of Cheatham County to impose the fire tax as a flat fee to fund county-wide fire and emergency services. - Amends TCA Section 5-17-107.

As introduced, requires county legislative bodies in a county in which the county school system converts to a special school district to continue to levy a countywide property tax for school purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, names flyover that connects Interstate 40 eastbound to Briley Parkway northbound in Nashville in honor of late Ralph M. Cohen.

As enacted, specifies that a person does not compromise their amateur status for purposes of the Tennessee Athletic Commission Act of 2008 by competing in an event held by a sanctioned olympic organization. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115.
As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by local governments can be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101.
As introduced, grants state recognition to certain Indian tribes, bands, and groups; provides means for other Indian tribes, bands, and groups to receive state recognition. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As enacted, designates Old Forest in Shelby County as a Class II Natural-Scientific Area. - Amends TCA Section 11-14-108.

As introduced, requires that clerks must state actual fee that is charged to use a credit card instead of stating either the percentage rate of the fee or the actual fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for the manufacture, sale, offer for sale, advertisement, or distribution of any caffeinated alcohol drinks; defines caffeinated alcohol drink. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, allows TBI to perform familial DNA searches in order to locate biological relatives of an individual whose DNA profile was taken from a crime scene. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires department to develop and maintain Internet Web site to provide certain information on state revenue, expenses and opportunities for public involvement. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, creates new offenses involving motor fuel transporters offloading motor fuel at a retail station. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

As introduced, allows a voter, who does not possess the required proof of identification, to appear in person at the county election commission office during the early voting period, sign an affidavit of identity, and pose for a digital photograph; thereupon, the voter would be allowed to vote in the election. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, clarifies that persons age 65 or older are not required to show identification with a photograph in order to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, provides that a person who had severe and persistent mental illness at the time of committing murder in the first degree cannot be executed but may be sentenced to life imprisonment or life without parole. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

As introduced, requires candidates for president of the United States, as a condition of having the candidate's name appear on the ballot, to file a sworn affidavit with the secretary of state together with certain information to prove the candidate meets the constitutional residency requirements. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes the secretary of state to make a determination regarding whether or not a publication is a "newspaper of general circulation" for purposes of the publication of notices relative to foreclosures, land sales, transactions involving real property, or other legal notices required by statute. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 17; Title 18; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 59; Title 61; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.

As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, clarifies that facilities revolving fund may be used in support of routine maintenance expenditures including janitorial services at capitol and legislative complexes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 9.
As introduced, provides for the classification of certain property as affordable housing rental property. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the department of human services to expend at least 2 percent of the Child Care and Development Funds block grant on activities to improve the quality of child care. - Amends TCA Section 71-3-502.

As introduced, authorizes board of claims to determine claims for compensation by persons granted declaratory judgments for state agency's termination of program participation without compliance with rulemaking process. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108.

As introduced, requires certain government-run proceedings that impose sanctions against a licensed entity to include notice and a hearing before an administrative law judge, and further clarifies that such licensed entity does not have to waive such rights when contracting with the state. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-320.
As introduced, prohibits requiring vendors with the state of Tennessee to waive any legal remedies against the state. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.
