As introduced, tolls statute of limitations for filing claim against state employee with claims commission as of the date suit is filed or criminal prosecution instituted in which claimant and employee or employee's agency participate. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-402.

As introduced, prohibits county officials' compensation from increasing in any year in which the compensation of other county employees is not increased; prohibits the new federal census figures from being used to increase the compensation of county officials until the salary of other county employees is increased. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Broadband Infrastructure for Regional Economic Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, authorizes a tiered level credit against sales and use tax, and franchise and excise tax, for any qualified company that expands or relocates to counties with certain unemployment rates. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, specifies subjects that may be addressed by a planning commission in regulations governing the subdivision of land; requires that notice of hearings be published on commission's Web site if the commission maintains a Web site. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-4-303.
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12 and Title 67.

As introduced, deletes provisions concerning Tennessee board for economic growth serving as an advisory commission to the commissioner of economic and community development as board was repealed in 2009; requires commissioner to report on job creation programs and opportunities to finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits any local legislative body from negotiating with local police association or fireman association concerning the terms or conditions of professional service if no local boards of education are allowed to negotiate with a professional employees' organization or teachers' union concerning the terms or conditions of professional service. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.
As enacted, urges employers to develop programs under which their employees with children in school can take time off to volunteer in their children's schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes requirement that members of charitable gaming oversight committee be from different grand divisions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, specifies that expenses of members are paid in accordance with Article II, Section 23 of the Constitution of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, removes confidentiality of certain nonprofit entity records concerning contractors. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 10.

As introduced, prohibits multicandidate political campaign committee from contributing to candidate after the fourteenth day before an election instead of after the tenth day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, adds to the content of fiscal notes a job implication statement to estimate if the measure would increase, decrease or not significantly impact jobs. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As introduced, specifies the type of documentation a person may attach to the required statement filed in support of a refund claim for taxes paid on petroleum products. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.

As introduced, permits the disclosure of confidential tax information or returns to state or federal authorities if the information or return is relevant to the authority's functions, regardless of the existence of any reciprocal agreements. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.
As introduced, exempts private land used as an easement or right of way by a governmental entity from property taxation during the period of use. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, changes from "not sooner than 30 days" to "not sooner than 40 days" time within which lessor must give notice regarding non-payment of rental fees. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, specifies that students who are related by blood or marriage cannot be assigned to classes based only on the fact that they are related. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the annual BEP report to be submitted on October 1 of each year to the governor, state board of education, select oversight committee on education, and education committees of the senate and house of representatives.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to report on the status of in-service training funds for higher education during certain fiscal years and requires the commission to include certain discounts in reports on the status of funding. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires commissioner of revenue to post cost of living adjustment amounts on the department's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 10.

As introduced, extends time between notification of department and collection of tax from first day of the month occurring 30 days from notice of legislative action to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 7.

As introduced, revises the prohibtion on an insurance company or affiliate of an insurance company owning 15 percent or more of the voting securities or other voting ownership interest of a TNInvestco to increase the allowable ownership interest to 25 percent. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 64; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires report by the commissioner of revenue to the study committee to examine and make recommendations regarding fiscal policy on the issue of natural disasters concerning administration of the sales tax refund program enacted in response to the May 2010 natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows eligible financial institutions and qualified business enterprises to carry forward any unused amount of credits against franchise and excise tax liabilities beyond the tax years in which the applicable credits originated. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, extends time for filing a duplicate copy of an amended return from 30 days to 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires preference to services by Tennessee bidder if cost of service is not 10% greater than cost of other similar services of similar expected quality that are not offered by a Tennessee bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56 and Title 12.

As introduced, requires annual report by the commissioner of revenue concerning payments in lieu of taxes from the Tennessee valley authority to the finance, ways, and means committees of the senate and house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires that for purposes of determining the maximum dollar amount of an insurance policy when converting an insurance policy, the amount of such policy shall be rounded up to $20.00 instead of $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires all employers to register with the E-Verify system and verify the employment eligibility of all employees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 16; Title 38; Title 39; Title 45; Title 50 and Title 70.

As introduced, prohibits any county, municipality or LEA from appropriating public funds generated from taxpayers to fund professional trade associations or associated public interest groups; removes authorization to use taxpayer funds for membership dues and traveling expenses incurred in attending meetings of Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 5, Chapter 7; Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, provides that the general contractor shall determine the three construction services providers that may be awarded exemptions from carrying workers' compensation insurance on themselves. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-914.

As introduced, requires annual report to the general assembly as to participation in the Local Tourism Development Zone Business Tax Act. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 30.

As enacted, clarifies that purchases by and for the legislative department are exempt, subject to the policies of the board of standards, from the operation of the present law provisions governing public purchases. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
As introduced, makes it unlawful to hunt on private lands or waters within 100 yards of a visible dwelling house. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, permits a city or county that owns all or some portion of real or personal property used to provide health care to sell the asset and use the proceeds as it sees fit, without any notice to the attorney general and reporter; authorization applies only if city or county opts in. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 62.

As introduced, provides that service performed by persons providing services as leased-operators or owner-operators of motor vehicles under contract to common carriers doing interstate business while engaged in interstate commerce is excluded service for purposes of employment and wage regulations. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-207 and Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, expands period, from 15 to 30 days, for interested persons to be notified by the division of radiological health prior to the issuance of a permit to or hearing an appeal from radioactive waste processors. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68.
As enacted, requires LEAs to implement a project-based assessment in civics at least once in grades 4-8 and at least once in grades 9-12. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes state funding board to require public entities to adopt the model finance transaction policies created by the board and clarifies that such policies would include budgeting and capital planning, finance transaction management, investment, and risk management. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 15; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.
As enacted, expresses intent to name certain bridge in Franklin County in honor of the late D. Alex Stephens.
As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of Joe DeLong.
As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of the late Jeremy Brown.

As introduced, requires department of financial institutions, with assistance from state treasurer, to develop guide to enhance deposits of state funds into eligible community banks, and disseminate such information to banks across state. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.

As introduced, states that law enforcement will be deemed to have probable cause to search any known member of a criminal gang or person wearing clothing or insignia indicating affiliation with a criminal gang if the gang has been implicated in the death of a U.S. law enforcement officer killed in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, states that a person who provides personal support services to clients living in their own private residence must, prior to assisting the client with medication, have received training in medication assistance developed by a registered nurse. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners, and against osteopathic physicians by the board of osteopathic examination. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 63, Chapter 6 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $2,000 for each full-time employee job created by a qualified small business. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, names Tennessee National Guard Armory in Tullahoma in honor of Command Sergeant Major Howard Boswell.

As introduced, subject to local approval, changes the term of office for mayor from two years to four years beginning with the August 2012 local election. - Amends Chapter 603 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the due dates for property taxes in the City of Elkton. - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended and rewritten.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes county mayor to nominate persons for membership on the board of commissioners of the Tennessee Technology Corridor Development Authority; authorizes board to review the environmental and developmental impact of medium and high density residential developments. - Amends Chapter 148 of the Private Acts of 1983; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, raises monetary limit on purchases that do not require prior approval of the board of mayor and aldermen, from $1,000 to $5,000; raises limit on purchases that do not require competitive bidding, from $5,000 to $10,000. - Amends Chapter 192 of the Private Acts of 1994.

As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the mayoral term from two years to four years and alters the election cycle so that city elections are held in November in 2014, 2016, and every other year thereafter.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to establish staggered terms for the aldermen, to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the recorder and revise the duties of the recorder, and to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the police chief. - Amends Chapter 450 of the Acts of 1901.

As introduced, subject to local approval, designates the four at-large aldermanic positions as A,B,C, and D and requires that candidates select and designate the position being sought. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal year beginning July 1, 2010.

As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds and anticipation notes of up to $106.4 million for purpose of grants to the Southeast Tennessee Development District and the Industrial Development Board of the City of Memphis and Shelby County.
As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $273 million.

As enacted, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2010-2011 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $250 million or 2.15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

As introduced, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2011-2012 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $200 million or 1.65 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

As enacted, revises certain provisions of law necessary for implementation of appropriations act, including authorizing and prohibiting the transfer of certain funds; terminating the local planning assistance section of the department of economic and community development; and clarifying the duties of certain governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal years beginning July 1, 2010, and July 1, 2011.

As introduced, subject to local approval, beginning with the 2014 city election, moves the election of the mayor and board of aldermen to coincide with the November general election. - Amends Chapter 350 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 294 of the Acts of 1903.

As introduced, subject to local approval, permits flexibility for the development tax to be collected at the time a building permit is issued or to defer collection until a certificate of occupancy is issued. - Amends Chapter 28 of the Private Acts of 1997.
As introduced, subject to local approval, requires two readings for passage of an ordinance instead of three. - Amends Chapter 683 of the Private Acts of 1951.
As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.
As introduced, modifies requirements for membership on the board of trustees for the Cookeville Regional Medical Center Authority. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999, as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.
As introduced, requires county assessors to audit the value and levels of assessment of public utility property located in their respective counties. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1973.

As introduced, subject to local approval, requires reading of ordinances on two different days, rather than three, prior to adoption; authorizes mayor to appoint a director of public works, subject to confirmation by the city council; increases salary of mayor. - Amends Chapter 235 of the Private Acts of 1945; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. - Amends Chapter 135 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites county road law to conform with the Tennessee County Uniform Highway Law. - Amends Chapter 634 of the Private Acts of 1935; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel-motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7.5%. - Amends Chapter 145 of the Private Acts of 1979.

As introduced, changes method of electing the five members of the South Carroll County Special School District board of education from election of one member from each of five districts to election of all members on a district wide basis. - Amends Chapter 278 of the Private Acts of 1955; as amended.

As enacted, extends the period in which an eligible person may collect extended unemployment benefits pursuant to the federal Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes city to set criteria for awarding contracts by ordinance, rather than by charter provision, in accordance with the Municipal Purchasing Law. - Amends Chapter 327 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $150 million.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 or June 2011 to expire December 1, 2014 or 2016. - Amends Chapter 298 of the Private Acts of 1972.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.
As enacted, revises certain provisions regarding tort actions and damages. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.
As introduced, enacts the "Caylee Anthony Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, penalizes a parent for failing to report a missing child. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of revenue to reduce the state sales tax rate on food if there is a surplus of state revenue collected above budgeted estimates in a fiscal year; reserves one-half of such surplus for additional Tennessee student assistance awards. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires that taxpayer-funded family planning services and programs to be provided through the county health departments or, alternatively, by the department of health; prohibits payment of such family planning funds to third-party providers or private organization or entities. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.
As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a weighted instrument for evaluation of applicants for teaching positions with LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires that an interest inventory be available to all public middle schoolers or ninth graders and to all public college students beginning with their freshman year to assist the students in career decisions; requires the LEAs and post secondary institutions to annually send summary data obtained from the interest inventories and personality profiles administered under the bill to the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, provides that combat veterans or current members of the United States armed forces that have been in combat who are not residents of Tennessee shall be classified as out-of-state students but shall not be charged out-of-state tuition rates. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the office of research and education accountability to perform a study of the effect of school day start time on academic performance. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the department of education to purchase uniform liability policy for the benefit of all professional employees. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 49 and Title 56.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 374 in Clarksville as "Officers David Scott and Yamil Baez-Santiago Memorial Parkway."

As introduced, allows home school students, including those conducted by parents associated with an organization that conducts church-related schools, to participate in extracurricular athletics if the student meets the academic and conduct standards required of other participants. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, removes authority of Tennessee wildlife resources commission and TWRA to regulate hunting of wild hogs on private land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As enacted, allows persons age 60 and older to vote absentee upon request, instead of age 65 and older; effective until July 1, 2017. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-201(5).
As introduced, permits the sale of consumer fireworks in Shelby County by deleting language that prohibits the sale of fireworks in such county. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-112.

As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, adds to evidences of identification to vote, a valid photo identification card issued free of charge by the county election commission of the county in which a person is registered to vote, provided the person meets the current requirements to obtain a free photo ID to vote and signs an affidavit verifying such person's qualifications; equipment and training to be provided by the coordinator of elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, recognizes as evidence of identification to vote, a valid employee identification card issued by a Tennessee municipality or county, provided the identification card contains a photograph of the voter. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, requires the department of education to include in its budget estimates an amount sufficient to cover the cost of providing liability insurance for professional public school personnel. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49 and Title 56.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, clarifies that senate must comply with applicable federal statutes. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
As introduced, repeals Chapter _ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 632 / House Bill 600). - Repeals Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, establishes a standard, which excludes certain expenses, to be used by the authority for determining justness and reasonableness of water utility rates. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As enacted, clarifies definitions that apply to parents in the armed forces seeking modification of orders concerning parenting. - Amends TCA Title 36.
As enacted, names Murfreesboro National Guard Armory in honor of the late First Lieutenant William Eric Emmert.

As introduced, exempts a person 65 years of age and older from the requirements of showing an identification with a photograph of the voter when signing an application for ballot to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, creates felony offenses for concealing, harboring, shielding from detection, transporting, or any attempt thereof, certain persons in this state; provides that certain property utilized in committing such offenses be subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 50.

As introduced, revises provisions governing liability of landowners who permit others to use their land for recreational purposes free of charge. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 49 and Title 70, Chapter 7.

As enacted, specifies that a discharge from employment will be deemed to be a discharge for misconduct connected with the claimant's work, which disqualifies the discharged employee from eligibility for unemployment benefits in connection with the job from which the employee was discharged, when it results after a claimant entered into a written agreement with an employer to obtain a license or certification by a specified date as a condition of employment and subsequently the claimant willfully fails without good cause to obtain such license or certification by the specified date. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits a person convicted of an infamous crime from voting in person or by absentee ballot if the person is incarcerated on election day or for the period of time established by law for early voting. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of National Council of Negro Women new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to promote initiatives to maximize the personal, emotional and academic growth and development of African American children in Memphis and Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, restores language to clarify that the governmental entity, committee or board that issues a beer permit or license is the governmental entity to revoke or suspend such permit or license. - Amends TCA Section 57-5-108.

As introduced, requires a person with two or more convictions for driving under the influence to maintain double the amount of liability insurance, deposit of cash, or bond filed with the commissioner of safety in order to comply with financial responsibility laws. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As enacted, revises and enacts provisions governing the tattooing of minors. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 62, Chapter 38.

As introduced, requires all contracts of insurance issued for delivery in Tennessee after July 1, 2012, to provide for a 10 percent premium reduction for any renewed insurance policy that has not had any claims filed against such policy that resulted in payment by the insurance company for the previous year. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, creates student athlete trust fund to provide one-time payments to public higher education Division 1 athletes upon graduation that are funded from athletic department revenue, does not apply if causes loss of revenue due to loss of membership in NCAA, requires THEC to direct requesting of a waiver from NCAA to allow implementation. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires that persons convicted of rape or aggravated rape serve 100 percent of sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to appoint department attorney to indigent claimant in unemployment benefit appeal upon request when employer is represented by counsel at appeal; employer will pay costs of claimant's legal representation if claimant prevails, otherwise cost comes from department's existing resources. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 23 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires demolishers to contact the police before destroying a vehicle that does not present with a certificate of title, auction sales receipt, or certificate of authority to demolish. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55, Chapter 16.
As introduced, reduces from 12 to 10 the number of months that a former member's legislative email will be forwarded to a private email account on request. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, increases from $1,000 to $1,100 the maximum civil penalty that may be assessed administratively for violation of laws and rules concerning money transmitters. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, increases from 90 days to 120 days the notice period that clerks must provide to the state librarian and archivist before destroying books or records, in order that such documents may be examined for historical value. - Amends TCA Title 18.
As introduced, clarifies that trailers used in the furtherance of a business are required to be registered. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, increases from $400 to $450 the penalty for conspiring not to report a newly hired employee to the department of human services for purposes of checking for child support arrearages and establishing paternity. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, increases from two weeks to 17 days the minimum amount of time by which advance notice of a public hearing concerning adoption of a resolution establishing a grant program for revitalization of real estate in an older neighborhood must be given. - Amends TCA Title 13.
As introduced, requires hearing notices given to oil and gas surface owners to contain the date and nature of the hearing. - Amends TCA Title 60.

As introduced, increases from two to three weeks the minimum period of time that notices of public hearings for proposed economic impact plans be made by the Tennessee Regional Megasite Authority. - Amends TCA Title 64.

As enacted, authorizes the department of labor and workforce development, in accordance with the federal treasury offset program, to set off any covered unemployment compensation debt due to the department against any federal income tax refund due to the claimant debtor and revises various provisions of present law regarding the recovering of unemployment benefit overpayments. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, allows students to indicate that they do not wish to receive electronic advertisements and solicitations if students' e-mail addresses are used in campus directories. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, removes Tennessee from the Interstate Compact for Supervision of Adult Offenders. - Repeals l TCA Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 4 and Chapter 805 of the Public Acts of 2002.

As enacted, enacts "Jaclyn's Law," which, in certain circumstances, provides civil immunity for first responders when using forcible entry to enter premises to render emergency assistance when responding to 911 call. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 29; Title 63, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 140.
As introduced, changes from September 30 to July 31 the date by which children must reach age four in order to enter pre-K or age five to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires all tractor trailers to have a sign on the rear of the vehicle identifying the owner and the owner's business phone. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits controlled substance analogues that have substantially same chemical structure as a controlled substance or have a similar effect on the central nervous system as a controlled substance and punishes the offense the same as the controlled substance to which it is similar. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, authorizes an identification card from certain transit authorities to be used as valid identification when voting. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, directs the department of transportation to erect signs designating the route to T.O. Fuller State Park from Graceland Mansion.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a person 18 years of age or older to knowingly promote or organize a gathering of two or more minors in a public place with the intent to provide a location for such minors to engage in public indecency; any personal property used in the commission of a violation of this offense would, upon conviction, be subject to judicial forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, requires the achievement school district to adopt an appropriate dress code for its professional employees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, codifies the Acts of the 2011 legislative session.
As introduced, enacts the "Main Street Recovery and Anti-Wall Street Corruption Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 28; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45 and Title 47.

As enacted, revises provisions governing the filling of vacancies occurring on the board of commissioners of certain multi-county utility districts. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307 and Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 6.

As enacted, criminalizes possession, use, transfer or installation of software designed to manipulate retail records of transactions for evading payment of sales tax to the state. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires certain landlords to register with governmental entities, pay a registration fee and maintain certain identification on tenants; requires the comptroller to include certain information in its online database. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 66 and Title 67.

As introduced, revises from 10,000 to 8,000 the size of a municipality that can enforce certain traffic violations on interstate and defense highways within their jurisdiction without the permission of the commissioner of safety. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-308.

As enacted, requires high schools to forward vaccination records to higher education institution on behalf of dual enrollment student upon request of the student's parent or guardian; authorizes state board of education to promulgate rules to implement this act. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 5.
As introduced, changes date for annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend in August to the last weekend in July each year. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniformity in Tax Increment Financing Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 9 and Title 13.
As introduced, names new driver services center in Chattanooga in honor of Joe Glasscock.

As introduced, designates titles and related qualifications concerning interns and level I and II alcohol and drug abuse counselors under statute for licensing alcohol and drug abuse counselors. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 24, Part 6.

As introduced, requires LEAs to complete final teacher summative evaluation conferences no later than the last teacher work day of the school year using all data and information available by such time. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, makes the Move on When Ready Act inapplicable in Williamson County. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 83.
As enacted, names I-65 overpass in Williamson County in honor of late Lance Corporal Benjamin H. Gearheart.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of present law regarding suspension of teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

As introduced, limits ability of local governments to place employment practices, standards or other requirements on businesses that deviate from, modify, supplement, add to, change or vary in any manner from state statutorily imposed or recognized requirements. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-1802.
As introduced, reduces from 5.5 percent to 5 percent the tax rate levied on the retail sale of food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, changes the date of the sales tax holiday from the first Friday of August to the last Friday of July. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, permits a valid photo identification card issued by a county or city to its employee to be used as identification for verifying the person's identify on an application for ballot. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, allows student identification cards, issued by institutions of higher education in the state, to verify a person's identification to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, requires the department of correction to conduct a study on the number of inmates sentenced pursuant to the "Three Strikes Law." - Amends TCA Section 40-35-120.
As introduced, limits to two years permits issued to teach a subject in public schools when qualified teachers for such subject are unavailable. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-106.

As introduced, requires employing authority or civil service commission to decide state employee grievance or appeal within same amount of time that employee is given to file grievance or appeal. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 8, Chapter 30.

As introduced, provides that eligible disabled veteran home owners are not required to reapply for property tax relief in years following initial tax years in which they originally submitted applications. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 7.

As introduced, specifies that state employees are subject to discipline, including dismissal, for advertising nongovernmental business on state property or in state media while on duty, exempts bulletin boards and newsletters that are designated by employer as being acceptable venue for such advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires that notice of change of polling place be mailed to voters at least 10 days before the election day, except in cases where polling place is changed within 10 days of the election day due to an emergency. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, creates a sentencing enhancement factor for adult defendants who involve children under the age of 13 in the commission of an offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, enacts the "Educate, Don't Incarcerate Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3; Title 40 and Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes man who has paid child support for a child who is not his biological child to recover such child support from the biological father. - Amends TCA Section 24-7-112; Title 36, Chapter 2 and Title 36, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to create a program to enable each precinct registrar to search records of the coordinator that are linked to the department of safety database to retrieve a photographic image of the voter if the voter is unable to present evidence of identification that bears the name and photograph of the voter. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, authorizes change by county legislative body, with approval of the voters, in the number of members of the county board of education to any number no less than three nor more than 13. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, requires transition planning for funding local maintenance of effort before a city or special school district may be abolished or dissolved or its administration transferred to another school system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the director of schools and the local board chair to prepare needs based budgets for the first, third, fifth, seventh and 10th school years beyond the next school year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires a local legislative body to make maintenance of effort payments according to a standard statewide payment schedule adopted by the commissioner of education; permits adoption by the LEA and the local legislative body, with the approval of the commissioner, of an alternate payment schedule. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, removes statutory provision prohibiting mid-census redistricting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.
As introduced, clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient for congressional districts. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
As introduced, creates incentives for participation in community gardens. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 49; Title 67 and Title 71.

As introduced, specifies that perpetrator of domestic violence remains liable for rent and damages under rental agreement even if the perpetrator is ordered to vacate the premises by protection order. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 66.

As introduced, allows a victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a lease or rental agreement if notice and documentation that tenant is a victim are presented to landlord. - Amends TCA Title 66.

As introduced, requires motor vehicle dealers and automotive mobility dealers to receive, and maintain for a certain amount of time, certain documentation from consumers prior to facilitating an auto loan for the purchase of vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 55.

As introduced, clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

As introduced, authorizes counties and cities to sell real estate acquired at delinquent tax sales to adjoining property owners at a 25 percent discount in exchange for sweat equity, under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 13 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.

As introduced, requires court clerks who are notified by persons having legal claims against property set for delinquent tax sale to notify such persons of the results of such delinquent tax sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, permits charter school use of LEA vacant land on same basis that LEA underutilized and vacant properties, other than vacant land, can currently be used; permits property obtained by local governments at tax sales to be conveyed to a charter school for use for its school purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, requires any person, firm, or corporation engaged in the business of buying and selling used or scrap jewelry and precious metals through the Internet to register with the chief of police and sheriff of each city and county in which the person selling or buying such used or scrap jewelry and precious metals is located. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1.

As introduced, creates a civil cause of action for institutions of higher education for damages resulting from the actions of coaches and agents that result in sanctions or penalties being assessed against the institution or its athletes; creates a civil cause of action for student athletes for damages resulting from the actions of coaches, institutional agents, boosters, other student athletes and athlete agents that result in sanctions or penalties being assessed against the institution or its athletes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As introduced, defines maintenance of effort and requires local tax rate to be sufficient to fund maintenance of effort. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes a local government's legislative body to designate certain records as proprietary information, and thereby not subject to public records law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, provides that alleged victim's termination of participation in global positioning monitoring system does not terminate defendant's obligation to participate as a condition of bail. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-152.

As introduced, requires LEA to use years of service acquired as a charter school teacher for tenure decisions upon return of the teacher to the LEA; permits public charter school teacher on leave of absence from an LEA to continue in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient for senatorial districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, implements system for regulating repossession agencies and collateral recovery agents. - Amends TCA Title 26; Title 45; Title 47; Title 55; Title 56; Title 62, Chapter 11 and Title 66.

As introduced, increases tax on gasoline and diesel products one cent a year for the next five years; allocates funds from increase in tax to counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 9.

As enacted, provides that a person may be prosecuted, tried and punished for producing obscene material, sexual exploitation of a minor, aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor or especially aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor, no later than 25 years from the date the child becomes 18 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 2.
As introduced, restricts access to public restrooms and public dressing rooms designated by sex to members of that particular sex. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 3.

As introduced, requires persons who solicit orders for magazines or make contracts for the future delivery of magazines conditioned upon payment of a subscription fee for magazines to register their presence with municipal law enforcement authorities. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

As enacted, includes as an element of the offense of theft by a home improvement contractor failure to provide a current address to the residential owner until the work to be performed under the contract is completed; changes the requirements for establishing a violation of the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act against a home improvement services provider to enter into a contract for home improvement services without making certain disclosures. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-154 and Section 47-18-104.

As introduced, creates requirements for issuance of certificates of insurance; clarifies the effect of such certificates; and authorizes oversight by the commissioner of commerce and insurance regarding regulation and assessing fines in relation thereto. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, enacts the NCOIL model "Unclaimed Life Insurance Benefits Act." - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 66, Chapter 29.
As introduced, establishes standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, adds community service as punishment for simple possession or casual exchange of certain controlled substances. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-418.

As enacted, creates Class E felony of manufacturing or selling an imitation controlled substance and the Class A misdemeanors of ingesting an imitation controlled substance and possessing an imitation controlled substance for the purpose of ingesting it. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, allows persons 60 years of age or older who elected to obtain a nonphoto bearing license prior to January 1, 2013, to retain and renew such license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50.

As introduced, authorizes each type of new specialty earmarked plates to be personalized so long as no duplicate registration numbers are issued to the same type of plate classification. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of revenue to revoke business licenses for the illegal sale of synthetic drugs and the local beer boards to revoke the beer license of a business selling such drugs. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401; Section 39-17-452; Title 57, Chapter 5 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

As introduced, provides that proceeds from confiscations and seizures in drug cases may be used to provide emergency care for child who is removed from a home in which methamphetamine was being manufactured. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2 and Title 53, Chapter 11.

As introduced, prohibits mere possession of a synthetic derivative or analogue of methcathinone rather than possession with intent to sell, produce or manufacture. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, names bridge on U.S. 127 in Cumberland County in honor of late Frederick A. Hassler, U.S. Army.

As introduced, allows an exemption against a net estate for inheritance tax purposes in an amount that includes exemption amount not applied against a deceased spouse's estate. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As enacted, authorizes the issuance of hunting licenses to persons with intellectual disabilities, subject to their attending a hunter education course and hunting in the presence of persons who are hunter-education-certified and licensed to hunt. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As enacted, clarifies that when persons are engaged in national guard active duties no private employment benefits may be curtailed or made ineligible due to such duties; specifies members to whom act applies and benefits to which act applies. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes the department of transportation to develop and assist in the implementation of the "yellow dot" motor vehicle medical information program. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 20.
As introduced, designates a certain segment of State Highway 28 in Sequatchie and Marion counties as "Veterans' Memorial Highway."
As introduced, limits general assembly members' terms to 12 years in the house and 12 years in the senate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, defines "inefficiency" with respect to teachers to include falling below the level of "at expectations" on evaluations for two or more consecutive years and only after proof of attempts to improve the teacher's quality of instruction, attendance or other performance problems. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As introduced, revises statutes concerning preexisting condition exclusions to be consistent with federal law. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, enacts "Influence Disclosure Act," which requires model bill filed by member to be accompanied by form created by chief clerk stating the bill is a model bill and naming the organization the bill came from; requires forms to be posted on general assembly's web site. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.
As introduced, modifies the scope of collaborative conferencing. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, allows teachers evaluated as "meeting expectations" to be eligible for tenure on the same basis as those teachers evaluated as "above expectations" and "significantly above expectations." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.
As introduced, removes prohibition on collaborative conferencing concerning payroll deductions for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, adds to evidences of identification to vote, a valid photo identification card issued free of charge by the county election commission of the county in which a person is registered to vote, provided the person meets the current requirements to obtain a free photo ID to vote and signs an affidavit verifying such person's qualifications. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, clarifies that any public school is eligible to be converted to a charter school. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-29-236; Title 9 and Title 45.
As introduced, requires the University of Tennessee to develop a plan that will double the output of the West Tennessee solar farm by 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Works Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, institutes Tennessee small business sales tax holiday program. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As enacted, enacts "Kimberlee's Law," which requires that persons convicted of aggravated rape serve 100 percent of sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to ensure the full development of the West Tennessee megasite; appropriates funds for such purpose. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to maintain a publicly accessible database of commercial real estate that is available for sale throughout the state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.
As introduced, appropriates $15 million to the board of regents to provide funding for equipment and program expansion at the technology centers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, postpones the use of the new teacher evaluation system. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, changes the permissive authorization in current law and requires local boards of education to offer preschool programs; requires the commissioner of education to recommend sufficient funding for space for all students. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, funds fully the planning, design, construction and equipping of a science building at MTSU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 8.

As introduced, permits certain students, at their own option, to include grades from courses taken during summer semester 2011 in the cumulative grade point average for continuation of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, declares it to be the intent of the general assembly to reduce the amount of state funds allocated per pre-kindergarten classroom by 25 percent for fiscal year 2012-2013, and such funds be reallocated to create additional voluntary pre-kindergarten classrooms. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, changes age for termination of health insurance coverage for dependents from 24 to 26. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As enacted, provides for the designation of the Tennessee Day of Prayer as the first Thursday in May of each calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, makes revisions to the Tennessee Public Charter Schools Act as amended. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 49.
As introduced, for tax years beginning July 1, 2012, creates a franchise and excise tax credit for employing unemployed persons under certain conditions. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, postpones the use of the new teacher evaluations and their use for tenure decisions. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits a local government from requiring a private employer to pay higher wages than required by state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes a nuclear security officer to employ deadly force in certain situations. - Amends TCA Section 38-3-120 and Section 39-11-611.

As introduced, expands definition of aggravated child abuse to include abuse resulting from a mother's ingestion of illegal drugs during pregnancy. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 40.

As enacted, revises provisions regarding tenure for teachers transferring from one LEA to another; requires that teacher evaluation information be sent to the LEA to which a teacher is transferring. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As enacted, designates the segment of State Route 386, known as Vietnam Veterans Boulevard, that runs from the Sumner County line to Long Hollow Pike for the placement of signs on such highway denoting fallen soldiers from the Vietnam War. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As introduced, requires fiscal notes for bills that criminalize activities, or enhance existing criminal penalties, to include a statement on the impact upon Tennessee if such bill does not become law. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections, in conjunction with the commissioner of safety, to equip a mobile unit or units to travel throughout the state to issue photo identifications to those meeting the requirements to obtain a photo identification free of charge to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-11-202; Section 2-7-112 and Section 55-50-336.

As introduced, provides that wildlife officers have the right to inspect the license of a person who is engaged in the taking or possessing of wildlife but are subject to same constitutional standards as law enforcement officers for other searches of persons or places. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, adds offenses the conviction of which requires the offender to be on the methamphetamine registry, makes registry retroactive and revises procedure by which methamphetamine-related convictions are transmitted to TBI from clerk's office. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, establishes the drug enforcement and education fund from forfeitures, seizures, confiscations sales and fines derived from the activities of judicial district drug task forces to be used for awarding grants to local law enforcement agencies for drug education, methamphetamine restoration and general law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 33.

As enacted, classifies as a confidential record the emergency contact information for any state, county, municipal or other public employee or former employee, or of any law enforcement officer in the employ of a public college or university. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

As enacted, changes references from "county audit division" to "comptroller of the treasury" and "department of audit" in provisions regarding judicial information system advisory committee members; the county financial management system; and audits of the solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 16 and Title 68.
As enacted, removes the 2012 repeal date for the Tennessee's Transitioning Youth Empowerment Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-417 and Chapter 1065 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, revises provisions governing placement of child outside the care of the child's parent or guardian by a court order as grounds for the initiation of the termination of parental rights. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-113.

As introduced, revises provisions governing the department's reciprocity with other states' confidentiality requirements and confidentiality of NAIC information; adds to the definition of "company action level event" under the Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2; Title 56, Chapter 22; Title 56, Chapter 44 and Title 56, Chapter 44.
As enacted, revises provisions governing deposit of securities in clearing corporation. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2 and Title 56, Chapter 3.

As enacted, adopts the 2010 ADA Standards for Accessible Design as the standards to be followed to make a building accessible to those with physical disabilities when constructing or altering a public building. - Amends TCA Section 68-120-204(a)(1).

As enacted, extends provisions regarding employee compensation and indemnification for officers killed in the line of duty to police officers employed by the state. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-208(a)(2).

As enacted, revises provisions governing the exercise of police powers by department employees and governing the authority of certain department employees to carry firearms. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-609 and Section 39-17-1350.

As enacted, clarifies purposes of FastTrack programs; requires certain reports be submitted to secretary of state; revises other provisions governing The Tennessee Job Growth Act of 2005. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-715; Section 4-3-716 and Section 4-3-717.

As introduced, classifies as confidential the due diligence materials submitted by a company to the department of economic and community development; confidentiality applies until such time as the provider of the material no longer requires its confidentiality. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-730.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing school accountability and achievement school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6 and Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, removes prohibition on using records from students eligible for special education services under federal law as part of the value added assessment. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-606.
As introduced, revises various provisions governing pupil-teacher ratios and salaries. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 4.

As introduced, requires commissioner of environment and conservation to impose certain conditions to provide mitigation of impact when issuing a permit for an activity that will cause alteration of aquatic resources in waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, requires the local government insurance committee and the local education insurance committee to provide for the financing of the health insurance plan for employees of local governments and quasi-governmental organizations and the group insurance plan for eligible employees of local education agencies, respectively, and determine premiums, co-payments, benefit levels, and the disposition of government grants and subsidies to assist in the funding and provision of health insurance for enrolled individuals. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the job tax credit given for new full-time employee jobs filled by a person with disabilities who is receiving state services directly related to such disabilities. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2109(f).

As enacted, authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to establish a fee by rule for conducting off-site investigation or examination of any mortgage lender, mortgage loan broker, mortgage loan servicer, or mortgage loan originator. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 13.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing deferred presentment services, including provisions regarding qualifications for licensure; authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to require persons subject to Deferred Presentment Services Act to be licensed through a multi-state automated licensing system. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As enacted, specifies that the limits on loans to any one borrower must take into consideration credit exposure arising from derivative transactions between the state bank and the person. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2.

As enacted, revises duties of the chief procurement officer relating to disposal of certain property; keeps administration of state surplus personal property within general services instead of with chief procurement officer; permits payment of state surplus personal property by credit card; specifies that disposal of surplus personal property in the possession of the general assembly would be exempt from the State Surplus Personal Property Act in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 4-56-105 and Title 12, Chapter 2, Part 4.

As enacted, revises requirements for amounts of goods or services that may be procured without requisitioning through the department of general services or for contracts that may be entered into without approval of certain government officials; permits competitive negotiations on certain contracts upon approval by the chief procurement officer; revises other related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes commission to delegate its authority to review, approve and recommend any matter over which it has authority to the state architect, the commissioner of finance and adminstration or the commissioner of the general services in accordance with policies adopted by the commission. - Amends TCA Section 4-15-102.

As enacted, increases from $75,000 to $150,000 the dollar amount of leases that require approval by the attorney general and state building commission; requires the state architect to post certain information on the state architect's web site, with regard to any proposed lease of property by or to the state that is less than five years or costs less than $150,000 per year or such other amount as determined by the state building commission. - Amends TCA Section 12-2-115.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing emergency medical services; requires licensure instead of certification. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 4.

As enacted, requires that licensure renewals for heath facilities licenses be due on the anniversary date of the license instead of June 30 of each year; authorizes, during transition period, issuance of renewals for terms of no less than five months and no more than 18 months or year to year. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, removes language in the qualifications for youth services officers, correction officers, police officers and sheriffs requiring such persons to be free of any apparent mental disorder. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8; Title 37, Chapter 5; Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 41, Chapter 1.

As enacted, revises provisions governing eligibility for temporary assistance; makes provision of transportation assistance discretionary instead of mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing the licensing of facilities and personal support services agencies for persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 33.

As enacted, provides for a statewide admissions review committee in regard to developmental centers for persons with intellectual or development disabilities, instead of having a review board for each center; makes other various changes in regard to such center. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As enacted, authorizes department to allow unlicensed individuals employed by licensed facilities to follow universal "do not resuscitate" orders in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, allows the set off of covered unemployment compensation debt under certain circumstances; revises other provisions regarding recovering benefit overpayments. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-303(d)(3)(B); Section 50-7-304(b)(2); Section 50-7-501 and Section 50-7-715.

As enacted, changes the name of the department to the "department of mental health and substance abuse services." - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 63; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, rewrites the provisions governing the scheduling of controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, designates March 3 of each year to be observed as "Tennessee National Guard Day." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2.

As enacted, establishes requirements for determining whether certain affiliates have physical presence in this state sufficient to establish nexus for sales and use tax purposes; provisions to be repealed January 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, authorizes the commissioner to require documents or payments filed with the department to be submitted electronically; revises other various provisions regarding the electronic submission of documents and payments to the department. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, redefines "intangible expense" under the Excise Tax Law; revises present franchise tax law regarding elections of a member of an affiliated group or a financial institution affiliated group to compute its net worth on a consolidated basis, and revises various other provisions of present law regarding taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As enacted, rewrites certains provisions regarding the sale and purchase of an immediate methamphetamine precursor. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-431.
As enacted, removes the requirement that certain accident reports be in writing; revises other various provisions governing motor vehicle accident reports. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, authorizes department to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote and support the goals and objectives of the agency. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 20.
As enacted, establishes that the submission of certain documents is considered compliance with certain requirements for reinstatement of driver license. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-321(c).
As introduced, adds as a purpose under the Tennessee Small Employer Group Health Coverage Reform Act the promotion of the health and wellness of the citizens of this state. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Medicaid False Claims Act. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5.

As enacted, redefines "evidence-based" for purposes of criteria for funding for in-home visitation programs; makes other changes to provisions governing in-home visitations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the distribution of utility relocation plans to utility owners. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-854.

As enacted, authorizes, until June 30, 2016, the commissioner to enter into certain contracts with financial institutions to stabilize the net expense of the department in the purchase of gasoline, diesel, or other fuels for the department's own use. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the annual renewal of outdoor advertising permits. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-104.
As enacted, makes appropriations for the purpose of funding certain rate and co-payment adjustments in the TennCare program.
As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Excellence, Accountability, and Management (T.E.A.M.) Act of 2012. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As enacted, changes the membership of the authority to be five part-time directors instead of four full-time directors; sets the salaries of such directors; revises other provisions regarding the Authority. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, transfers from board of probation and parole to department of correction certain functions relating to probation and parole services and the community correction grant program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing the structure of certain state agencies, committees, boards and commissions. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 11; Title 16; Title 37; Title 38; Title 41; Title 49; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 71.
As enacted, increases the punishment for unlawful possession of firearm by person with previous felony conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, revises punishment for convictions for domestic assault. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As enacted, establishes enhanced punishment for crimes of force or violence committed while acting in concert with two or more other persons. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Prescription Safety Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 4 and Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As introduced, creates the office of higher education ombudsperson within the office of the comptroller of the treasury. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As enacted, requires the chief procurement officer to develop a transition plan by "April 1, 2012", instead of "October 1, 2011", and corrects various typographical errors in provisions governing the procurement office and the authorized entity to promulgate rules. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, extends the reduced registration fee of $1.25 to motor vehicles operated by governmental units as bailee or lessee in addition to motor vehicles owned and operated by governmental units or private or volunteer fire department units exclusively used for governmental and fire protection purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, requires submission of certain reports and notices in regard to watershed districts. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As enacted, extends to June 30, 2016, the authorization for the state funding board to sell bonds at private sale permanent, which authorization is scheduled to expire June 30, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 9-9-205.
As enacted, provides for electronic, in addition to telephonic, notifications under the Advocacy for Honest and Appropriate Government Spending Act. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As enacted, clarifies that a taxpayer may request the assessor to mitigate a forced assessment by reducing the forced assessment to the standard depreciated value of the taxpayer's assessable property plus 25 percent. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1206 and Section 67-5-903.

As introduced, requires that sum sufficient to pay interest and installments of principal on state debt be set apart from the first general fund revenues received during the fiscal year for any year in which sufficient funds are not appropriated in the state budget for the timely payment of such interest and installment payments. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires, if the appropriations act fails to make sufficient provisions to pay principal of, premium and interest on bonds, notes or revenue notes on state debt, or, at the time such principal, premium or interest is payable sufficient moneys are unavailable for such payment, that a sufficient sum be set apart from the first revenues thereafter received to be applied to such purposes. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 9.
As introduced, enacts the "County Financial Management Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 5 and Title 7.
As enacted, requires beer boards to file annual reports with the alcoholic beverage commission concerning certain information. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 5.

As enacted, authorizes any county, subject to appropriation by the county legislative body, to provide vehicles for the use of any salaried county official described above, or, in the alternative, to provide a monthly car allowance to such salaried county official. - Amends TCA Section 8-26-113.
As introduced, adds Anderson County to list of counties requiring pawnshops to maintain computer records of all transactions of goods sold and pledged. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires the warden to permit three relatives or close friends of a victim to attend an execution where no surviving immediate family members of the victim over age 18 exist. - Amends TCA Section 40-23-116.
As enacted, revises provisions governing extensions of time to file francise and excise tax returns. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-804 and Section 67-4-2015.

As enacted, extends the date from December 31, 2010, to June 30, 2011, for apprentices and mortuary school students to complete all requirements to become licensed by the board as a funeral director or embalmer. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-312.
As enacted, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the American Red Cross new specialty earmarked plate by an additional year. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-356.

As enacted, conforms language under the employment security law concerning amount of retainage by a contractor entering into a contract with the state or local governments to conform to 5 percent as authorized generally for contractors. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7, Part 4.

As introduced, makes it a Class A misdemeanor, subject to a fine only, and a violation of the Consumer Protection Act, for a financial institution to fail to release funds received from an insurance company for repairs to a residence in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, requires the speakers of the house and senate to develop and implement a job applicant drug testing system for members and employees of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 50.

As introduced, reduces the state sales tax rate on food from 5.5 percent to .25 percent; increases the state sales tax rate on non-food goods and services from 7 percent to 7.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the Donate Life new specialty earmarked plate by an additional year. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, requires the office of research and education accountability and the department of health to do studies on HIV/AIDS prevention curricula; requires department to survey other state health departments' HIV/AIDS public outreach and education programs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, continues the career and technical class size extension pilot project in the Metro Nashville public schools; provides that the pilot shall only be used in schools or programs implementing the career academy or small learning community model. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Green Cleaning Schools Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires that a law enforcement officer obtain a subpoena prior to placing an electronic tracking device on a vehicle for criminal investigation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
