As introduced, requires investigating officer of traffic accident that involves a fatality to forward copy of the accident report to the alcoholic beverage commission, if one of the drivers is suspected to have been driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 55 and Title 57.
As introduced, requires that grand jury proceedings be recorded. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, increases expunction fee following the successful completion of diversion programs. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires that a parent ordered to pay medical bills for a child do so within 30 days of the order or have visitation rights suspended until the bills are paid along with any cost incurred by the other parent as a result of the delay. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, extends from June 30, 2012, to June 30, 2014, the expiration date for the authority of Hamilton, Knox and Shelby counties, Chattanooga, Knoxville, Memphis and Metropolitan Nashville to sell bonds at private sale upon terms and conditions that it determines and upon approval by the governing body of the local government; authorizes local governments to petition state funding board for permission to sell specific bonds determined to be required to be sold at taxable interest rates at private sale upon terms and conditions that the local government determines and upon approval by the governing body of the local government. - Amends TCA Section 9-21-132.
As enacted, revises provisions governing approval of compromises and settlements by the governor, comptroller or general assembly in actions involving the state. - Amends TCA Section 20-13-103.
As introduced, enacts the "County Finance Officer Certification and Education Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 5.

As enacted, revises provisions regarding cooperative purchasing agreements and county government purchasing in regard to the utilization of pricing discounts. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 10.

As enacted, authorizes board to approve a continuing education program for registered taxpayer agents and to charge agents a per-credit hour fee to defray cost of program. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1514.

As enacted, clarifies that provisions governing purchases by one local government under same terms as another local government's purchasing agreement apply to purchases of goods and equipment. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1004.

As enacted, authorizes any county that adopts either or both of the litigation taxes authorized by law to also adopt a resolution by a two-thirds majority vote of the legislative body to use those funds, in addition to the purposes described in law, for the purpose of obtaining and maintaining software and hardware associated with collecting, receiving and maintaining records for law enforcement agencies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.
As enacted, designates May 2012 as "Motorcycle Safety and Awareness Month."

As introduced, exempts the state and local governmental entities from liability for homeowners' association fee, restrictive covenants and certain obligations when the governmental entity acquires real property to enforce its tax lien. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 24 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
As introduced, permits consideration of history of drug abuse that indicates diminished capacity may be considered as a mitigating factor. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, requires drug testing of elected officials; requests Tennessee supreme court to require drug testing of judges. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 17 and Title 50.
As introduced, requires drug testing of members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 50.

As introduced, creates a vacancy for death, resignation, removal, disqualification, change of residence or persistent absence from meetings without good cause; a vacancy shall be declared if a person fails to attend six or more meetings of the commission in any one year requiring replacement by the appointing authority. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2.
As introduced, beginning on January 1, 2013, reduces the inheritance tax rate annually by 1 percent until the tax is phased out. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, creates fish hatcheries fund whereby all revenue collected from the sale of trout stamps will be used exclusively to operate and maintain fish hatcheries in Tennessee; in 2011, the cost of a trout stamp was $18.00. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1.

As enacted, exempts motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers or scrap metal processors from obtaining a copy of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap if the vehicle was manufactured more than 12 years ago; specifies that state law preempts any local regulation in regard to age of vehicle that may be purchased without title and in regard to waiting period for crushing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes, instead of requires, a county to offer a bid at a sale of property for delinquent county taxes when there are no other bidders for the property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.

As introduced, allows law enforcement and county clerks to electronically verify insurance status of any vehicle; provides that a valid insurance coverage indicator on the vehicle's electronic record shall be acceptable evidence of insurance in lieu of an officer requesting other types of evidence; prohibits issuance or renewal of title or registration unless insurance coverage is electronically verified. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 3; Title 55, Chapter 4 and Title 56.

As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor of removing or attempting to remove a law enforcement officer's handcuffs or other restraints and the Class E felony of removing or attempting to remove a law enforcement officer's firearm or stun weapon. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As enacted, eliminates the 72-hour time period restriction on determinations concerning good cause where the surrender is based on a conditional or final judgment of forfeiture issued by the court. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-137.

As enacted, requires a person seeking to own a bonding company have two years of experience writing bail as a full-time agent with a professional bonding company in good standing. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As introduced, authorizes sheriffs to purchase SHERIFF license plates for their personal vehicles that must be renewed annually; authorizes SHERIFF license plates for county vehicles to be considered governmental plates that are not subject to annual renewal. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, requires all municipal and county elections to be nonpartisan. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, phases out the Hall income tax over a three-year period beginning in tax year 2013 and ending with tax year 2015; holds local governments harmless from the loss of revenue resulting from the incremental reduction and repeal of the tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, phases out the inheritance tax over a three-year period beginning with tax year 2013 and ending with tax year 2015. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, allows teachers who receive evaluations demonstrating an overall performance effectiveness level of "meets expectations" or above in the last two years of the five-year probationary period to receive tenure. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, creates a committee to study the teacher evaluation system known as the Tennessee teacher acceleration model (TEAM). - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits use of taxpayer generated funds for payment of membership dues to the Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.

As introduced, allows home school students, including those in schools conducted by parents associated with an organization that conducts church-related schools, to participate in extracurricular athletics if the student meets the academic and conduct standards required of other participants; prohibits, subject to certain conditions, charging home school students participation fees by public schools and tuition by private schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, deletes provision stating that a court may permanently modify a decree of child custody or visitation in the event that a parent volunteers for permanent military duty as a career choice. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-113.
As introduced, limits any increase in tuition and school-related fees to the consumer price index. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As enacted, exempts nonprofit corporations from paying gambling machine manufacturing fees if the nonprofit is licensed by the Tennessee department of mental health and certified by the Tennessee department of human services to provide vocational rehabilitation job training programs. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, creates a rebuttable presumption that when an applicant for or party to an insurance contract signs an application, amendment, or other document stating the type, amount, or terms and conditions of coverage, the statements provided by the signatory bind all insureds under the contract and that the signatory has read, understands, and accepts the contents of the signed document; creates a rebuttable presumption that when an insured pays a premium the coverage provided has been accepted by all insureds under the contract. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, creates a "Tennessee Tennis" new specialty earmarked license plate; 50 percent of the proceeds from the sale of the plates earmarked for Tennessee Tennis Association to promote and develop the growth of tennis in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes a senior psychological examiner to provide an examination and sworn report to a court concerning conservatorship. - Amends TCA Title 34 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires sellers of residential property to disclose to buyer, prior to entering into a contract, whether a wildlife management area is located within 300 feet of the property line. - Amends TCA Title 66 and Title 70.

As introduced, increases the fine for unauthorized parking in a space designated for individuals with physical disabilities to $500 and authorizes persons who are not disabled to park in parking spaces that are reserved for disabled persons so long as their vehicle bears the appropriate certificate, placard or a disabled veterans license plate. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55.

As enacted, creates certain offenses and delinquent acts regarding entering into a retail package store when under age, visibly intoxicated or otherwise disruptive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 57, Chapter 3.

As introduced, prohibits gifts to a member of the general assembly, the value of which exceeds $50.00, and which is also made available to the general public; provides an exception to this prohibition. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning; provided, that the parent retired with 30 years of full-time creditable public school service. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of environment and conservation to offer discounted rates to former members of a reserve or Tennessee national guard unit with 20 or more years of service for activities at Tennessee state parks. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires state board of education to develop alternatives to student achievement data for use as evaluation criteria for teachers supervising student teachers; requires teachers to have met or exceeded expectations on evaluations for two consecutive years to qualify as supervisors of student teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends the current sales tax exemption on motor vehicles purchased by members of the armed forces to those who are stationed outside the United States, but who are permanent residents of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-303.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 11 in Marshall County in honor of late Matt Hayes.

As enacted, enacts the "Ricky Otts Act" which requires an officer to arrest drivers involved in accidents resulting in serious bodily injury or death when such drivers lack a valid driver license and evidence of financial responsibility; prohibits the issuance of a citation in lieu of arrest in such circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 55, Chapter 10; Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 50 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As enacted, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 7.

As enacted, permits any county register of deeds instead of present limitation to county register of deeds in Shelby County to assume certain functions and duties if the register receives endorsement from the existing county records commission or county executive. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 13.

As introduced, requires certain jails and detention facilities to report annually to the department of correction the number of persons arrested, booked or confined who are not U.S. citizens or whose citizenship status cannot be determined; requires the department to report annually such information to the house and senate speakers and judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, appropriates $130 million to the board of regents for the purpose of constructing a science building at MTSU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As introduced, increases the penalty to a qualified TNInvestco for certain noncompliance from $10,000 per day to $20,000 per day. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 28.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of economic and community development to release or disclose certain confidential documents within two years from such designation instead of five years. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.
As introduced, increases the fine that can be assessed against a person convicted of divulging unauthorized tax information from $3,000 to $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of economic and community development to release or disclose certain confidential documents within two years from such designation instead of five years. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 17.
As enacted, designates segment of State Route 235 in Dickson County to honor the late Deputy Sheriff Richard Keith Bellar.
As introduced, provides individuals age 65 and older with the option to decline jury duty service. - Amends TCA Title 22.
As enacted, names bridge in Dickson County in honor of the late Lt. Col. Malcolm Glenn Hicks, USAF.
As introduced, expands definition of governing body under open meetings law to include electric cooperatives. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-102.

As enacted, alters the definition of a physician in the Preferred Provider Organization Transparency Act to include chiropractic physicians, medical doctor or an osteopathic physician. - Amends TCA Section 56-60-102(10).
As introduced, repeals the office of legislative affairs.

As enacted, specifies that the present law fees that generally apply throughout the state would apply for clerk services in the criminal court, fourth circuit and general sessions court-criminal division of Knox County, but the separate provision of law regarding Knox County would continue to apply for clerk services in all other courts of Knox County. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of American Heart Association new specialty earmarked plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee chapters of the American Heart Association to reduce cardiovascular diseases and strokes. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Rolling Thunder new specialty earmarked plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee chapters of Rolling Thunder to increase awareness of POW-MIA issues. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, changes description of Veterans Memorial Mile in Knox County to segment of S.R. 62 from Solway Bridge to intersection with S.R. 162. - Amends Chapter 85 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, authorizes third party to contract with county clerks to perform titling and registration for companies with over 1,000 motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the film, entertainment and music commission to notify any member of the general assembly who requests notification of a proposed production activity in the member's district; allows a county to qualify as an eligible enhancement county during a 36-month period instead of 24-month period for purposes of the job tax credit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 49; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Section 67-4-2109 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop an evaluation instrument to permit teachers to assess new teacher evaluation systems, including the Tennessee Educator Acceleration Model, and their implementation. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, enhances the penalty for involuntary labor servitude where the victim was under age 13 and adds means by which the crime is possible. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.
As enacted, creates civil right of action for victims of human trafficking offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As enacted, establishes the eastern red cedar as the official state evergreen tree. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As enacted, creates Class B misdemeanor offense of a person falsely representing that he or she was or is a member of the United States armed forces with the intent to deceive another into believing such representation. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, directs the commissioner to develop a plan for Tennessee to assist in rehabilitating victims of human trafficking. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 71.

As enacted, clarifies that the offense of trafficking a person for a commercial sex act is Class A felony if the victim is a child under 15 years of age; adds that the offense is a Class A felony if the offense occurs on the grounds or facilities or within 1,000 feet of a public or private school, secondary school, preschool, child care agency, public library, recreational center or public park; adds Class C felony of advertising commercial sexual abuse of a minor; clarifies certain sex offender registry provisions.
As enacted, expands, subject to certain restrictions, the private universities or colleges that are permitted to have police forces. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-118.

As enacted, prohibits conflicts of interest in contractual services in regard to county officers in same manner as interests in supplies, material or equipment are prohibited. - Amends TCA Section 5-21-121 and Section 54-7-203.
As enacted, removes references to the office of the comptroller of the treasury in connection with the judicial cost accountant. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 24.
As introduced, authorizes insurers to offer individuals health insurance policies in Tennessee that have been approved for issuance in other states. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, imposes certain financial responsibility requirements on drivers charged with DUI and on nonresidents. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, prohibits persons who violate the Fair Labor Standards Act from contracting with the state for the provision of goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, subject to local approval, requires the mayor of Graysville be elected on a ballot separate from that of candidates for commissioner. - Amends Chapter 230 of the Private Acts of 1992; as amended.

As enacted, requires the commissioner of finance and administration by October 31 of each year to notify the division of regulatory boards and the division of health related boards the amount of board fees to be set for the subsequent fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-121 and Section 4-3-1011.

As introduced, creates Class E felony for failure of a child's parent to report within one hour of the time the parent discovers or should discover that the child is dead or that the child is missing for more than 48 hours. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.
As introduced, specifically includes provider-specific prescribing data within the confidentiality granted to medical records. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires court, when competency of a criminal defendant to stand trial is an issue, to hear testimony to determine if the defendant poses a likelihood of serious harm if ordered for an evaluation of competency on an outpatient basis. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 7, Part 3.

As enacted, extends the board of ground water management, June 30, 2015; requires board to adopt certain conflict of interest policy. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the department of environment and conservation, June 30, 2015. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the department of children's services, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 5.

As enacted, extends the department of human services to June 30, 2014, and requires the division of state audit to send follow-up questions to the department of human services in 2013 regarding actions taken by the department to address the issues raised in the January 2012 performance audit report. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact of 2007, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 58, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the board for licensing health care facilities, June 30, 2016; requires comptroller to issue questions and answers to board regarding surveyors in response to CMS audit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the civil defense and disaster compact, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
As enacted, extends the department of general services, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 3.
As enacted, extends the emergency management assistance compact, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
As enacted, extends the interstate earthquake compact of 1988, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2, Part 4.
As enacted, extends board of nursing, 2014; revises certain provisions governing board members and appointments. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 7.
As enacted, extends the soil scientist advisory committee, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 18, Part 2.

As enacted, extends the air pollution control board, June 30, 2015; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to board and qualifications of board members. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 201, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the board of dietitian/nutritionist examiners, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 25, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the board of examiners for architects and engineers, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As enacted, extends the board of examiners for nursing home administrators, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 16, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the board of pharmacy, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 10, Part 3.

As enacted, extends the committee for clinical perfusionists, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the committee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 28, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the council for hearing instrument specialists, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 17, Part 2.

As enacted, extends the emergency medical services board, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 3.

As enacted, extends the Tennessee medical laboratory board, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the advisory council on workers' compensation, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee court of the judiciary, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee emergency management agency, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 58, Chapter 2.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee financial literacy commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 17.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee heritage conservation trust fund, board of trustees, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 7.
As introduced, extends the Tennessee higher education commission, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 7.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee life and health insurance guaranty association, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 56, Chapter 12, Part 2.

As enacted, extends the Tennessee technology development corporation, June 30, 2017; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the corporation board of directors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 14 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, extends the water quality control board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 69, Chapter 3.
As introduced, extends the judicial nominating commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends the judicial performance evaluation commission, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, extends the Second Look commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 37, Chapter 3, Part 8.
As introduced, extends the solid waste disposal control board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

As enacted, extends the state board for alarm systems contractors, June 30, 2016; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 32.
As introduced, extends the state board of accountancy, June 30, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 62, Chapter 1.
As enacted, extends the state capitol commission, June 30, 2017; revises certain provisions governing appointments to the board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 8.
As enacted, extends the state forestry commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 11, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee arts commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 20 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee council for career and technical education, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 49, Chapter 11.
As introduced, extends the petroleum underground storage tank board, June 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 215.
As enacted, requires visible full face color photograph of a licensee. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, requires schools to notify parents, by way of student handbooks or policy guidebooks, of school-associated extracurricular activities and gives parents the opportunity to prohibit their child from participating. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, establishes requirements on certain health care providers when engaged in interventional pain management. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, decreases the amount of time that a sheriff must wait before disposing of certain unclaimed property in the sheriff's custody from six months to 90 days from the date of acquisition. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8.

As enacted, extends the sales and use tax exemption for repair and refurbishment services with respect to airplanes and airplane components and parts that are situated outside Tennessee and removed from Tennessee within 15 days from the completion of the repair or refurbishment services with respect to the airplanes or airplane components are performed pursuant to and by an authorized service facility designated by an original equipment manufacturer for such service with respect to aircraft qualifying as "Transport Category Aircraft" under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, requires funding for capital projects exceeding $1 million to be specified in detail in budget document; requires quarterly report of any changes to projects. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, authorizes the department of audit to require state and local governments to electronically file, report or store records of transactions dealing with public funds; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, redefines the annual taxpayer's income for elderly low-income and disabled homeowners receiving tax relief by increasing the income from $24,000 to $26,500. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, reduces the sales tax on food and food ingredients for human consumption from 5.5 percent to 5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, gives the purchaser of telecommunication services no more than 60 days, instead of 90, to receive a full tax refund on a returned purchase. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, deletes obsolete language that exempts certain tangible personal property for the spring sales tax holiday; increases from $1,500 to $1,600 the sales tax exemption for computers sold during the recurring August sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, defines the regulations physicians and those working under a physician's supervision must follow when performing cosmetic or aesthetic procedures or treatments. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As enacted, extends Tennessee residence commission, June 30, 2017. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 23 and Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, extends the Tennessee tobacco farmers certifying board, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 43, Chapter 36, Part 1.
As enacted, allows use of federally-insured deposits instead of certificate of deposit. - Amends TCA Section 9-1-118 and Section 9-4-504.
As introduced, authorizes a judge to order parties to mediation who have sworn petitions for orders of protection against one another. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.
As introduced, eliminates the state policy requirement to provide all medically acceptable contraception measures. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, prohibits deeds registered in response to mistaken assessments by assessors of property from being properly acknowledged or proven. - Amends TCA Title 28, Chapter 2, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 26, Part 1.

As introduced, requires notification to parents at the beginning of the school year and any time school fees are solicited or collected that payment of school fees is voluntary. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-110.

As enacted, with certain exceptions, requires that children entering kindergarten be five years of age on or before August 31 for the 2013-2014 school year and on or before August 15 for all school years thereafter; if the director of schools finds through evaluation and testing, at the request of the parent or legal guardian, that a child who is five years of age on or before September 30 is sufficiently mature emotionally and academically, then the child may be permitted to enter kindergarten. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, requires the board of pharmacy to publish a list of opioid drugs incorporating tamper or abuse resistance properties. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As enacted, enacts "The Henry Granju Act," which creates new reporting requirements related to drug overdoses. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, adds to the list of persons that may receive information from the controlled substance database any quality improvement committee of a licensed hospital, as part of the committee's confidential and privileged activities with respect to the evaluation, supervision or discipline of a healthcare provider employed by the hospital or any of its affiliates or subsidiaries, who is known or suspected by the hospital's administrator to be prescribing controlled substances for the prescriber's personal use. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 53, Chapter 11, Part 3; Section 53-11-402; Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 63, Chapter 10, Part 2 and Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 26.
As introduced, classifies willful failure to report information to the controlled substance database a misdemeanor criminal offense. - Amends TCA Section 53-10-307.

As introduced, provides that a person convicted of official misconduct, attempt or conspiracy to commit official misconduct or any other offense committed by a public official in office or relating to the duties of the office is ineligible for pretrial diversion or judicial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, adds that a guilty plea, nolo contendere plea, or finding of guilt for a felony arising out of a public employee's or official's office constitutes malfeasance in office requiring forfeiture of retirement benefits. - Amends TCA Section 8-35-124; Section 8-35-203 and Section 8-36-201.

As introduced, permits the commissioner of health or certain licensing boards to suspend on an emergency basis the license of a practitioner who is under any state or federal indictment involving controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, permits the commissioner of health or certain licensing boards to suspend on an emergency basis the license of a practitioner who is under state or federal indictment involving the sale or dispensing of controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As enacted, continues permanent rules filed with secretary of state after January 1, 2011.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of Ronald McDonald House new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of sale proceeds to Ronald McDonald House, for distribution to Tennessee chapters to further the mission of improving health, education and well-being of children. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, specifies that the proceeds collected from privilege taxes relating to tourism should be applied in the municipality in which the taxes were collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, requires publication of notice of maturity of school bonds issued by a county on the county's web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, changes a terminating event for receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship from attempt at any postsecondary institution of a specified number of semester hours to receipt of the scholarship for a fixed number of full-time equivalent semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, directs commissioner of finance and administration to certify the amount of surplus state revenue collected each year, and requires that appropriation act for subsequent fiscal year direct such amount be allocated to the rainy day fund. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the department of economic development division of energy and the University of Tennessee to pursue increased energy generation capacity at the West Tennessee solar farm by seeking the means and resources necessary to double the generating capacity originally planned for the solar farm. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee New Entrepreneur Tax Credit Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, makes a one-time reduction to the total amount of health insurance benefits paid on behalf of current and former legislators and administrative department heads and executive officials in the executive branch by $100 million; effective July 1, 2012, for former members and executive officials; effective at the election of 108th General Assembly for current members. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, decreases the time in which a hearing shall be given to an insurer when the department disapproves of a rate increase from 30 days after the disapproval or modification order to 10 days after the disapproval or modification order. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, requires the registry of election finance to give members of the general assembly email notification. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to publicize the photo identification requirement at least 30 days prior to early voting for the primary and general elections in 2012 via public service announcements on radio and television. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8, Chapter 3.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 166 in Maury County in honor of Dr. L. Paul Sands.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 7 in Maury County in honor of the late John Newton Woody.

As introduced, requires airport authorities to have no more than nine commissioners; grandfathers in any authority that has more than nine as of July 1. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 5 and Title 42, Chapter 3.
As introduced, includes senior living facilities in the places where sex offenders are prohibited from living within 1,000 feet of. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes any law enforcement official, instead of only highway patrol officers, to stop and test vehicles for noncompliance with headlamp requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

As enacted, requires a special education diploma be awarded to students who have satisfactorily completed an IEP with satisfactory attendance and conduct, but who have not passed the proficiency tests required for graduation with a regular diploma. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.
As introduced, changes sales tax holiday from the first weekend in August to the last weekend in July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, changes sales tax holiday from the first Friday in August through the following Sunday to the last Friday in July through the following Sunday. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004 and Section 67-6-393.
As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.
As introduced, enforces the Financial Records Privacy Act by criminalizing an unauthorized disclosure by a financial institution or financial institution's agent. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, creates Class E felony of aggravated cruelty to livestock, which is intentionally engaging in specified conduct in a depraved and sadistic manner that results in serious bodily injury or death to the animal and is done without lawful or legitimate purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked license plates for East Tennessee Children's Hospital; and allocates 50 percent of the proceeds from such plates to the hospital. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes Autism Speaks new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Autism Speaks to support organization's mission. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, allows a job tax credit for small, high-wage employers that create new jobs in high technology areas; requires approval by the commissioners of revenue and economic and community development. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2109.
As enacted, defines "Public Safety Answering Point" or "PSAP" to mean a facility that receives 911 calls and routes them to emergency services personnel. - Amends TCA Section 7-86-103.
As introduced, deletes provision that requires accident report if a person is injured or killed or the amount of damage is in excess of $400. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-104.
As introduced, deletes provision regarding the appointing authority of the defunct Tennessee board for economic growth. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 70.
As enacted, alters and adds limits to acquisition and installment account handling charges for loans. - Amends TCA Section 45-5-403(b).

As introduced, allows a mattress manufacturer, wholesaler or retailer to offer a comfort exchange policy pursuant to the sale of a mattress. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

As introduced, mandates a training session before the start of a school year that all evaluators in an LEA must attend in person before they can evaluate teachers and principals during the upcoming school year in order to promote consistency in evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires the bureau of TennCare to use the same reimbursement methodologies for public and private providers of ICF/MR services. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-105.
As introduced, requires certain pawnbrokers and scrap jewelry and metal dealers to be bonded. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 45.
As enacted, names bridge in Sullivan County in honor of the late Richard Lee Edwards, Sr.

As introduced, requires notice of government operations committee sunset hearings be posted on the division of state audit web site, deleting the current requirement that such notice be published in newspapers of general circulation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
As introduced, reduces public notice period for government operations committee sunset hearings, from 10 days to six days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29.
As enacted, enacts the "Small Business Incentive Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12; Title 48; Title 50 and Title 67.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding cooperative innovative programs. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the commission to create a new license for motor scooter dealers that do not sell other types of motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, reclassifies the Tennessee Walking Horse cultural license plate as a new specialty earmarked license plate; changes the distribution of revenue from 80 percent to the arts and 20 percent to the highway fund to 50 percent to the TN Walking Horse Breeders' and Exhibitors' Association, 40 percent to the arts and 10 percent to the highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, expands authorization of new specialty earmarked license plates for Sons of Confederate Veterans to include issuance of such plates for motorcycles. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, changes the annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend of August to the third weekend of July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, designates unpublished telephone numbers as confidential when in the possession of the emergency communications board or its designated agent. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

As introduced, provides that a federal employee who is not designated as a Tennessee peace officer may not make an arrest or conduct a search and seizure in this state without the written permission of the sheriff of the county in which the arrest, search and seizure will take place except under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 7 and Title 38, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, clarifies that in determining the willingness of each of the parents and caregivers to facilitate and encourage a close and continuing parent-child relationship between the child and both of the child's parents, the court must consider the likelihood of each parent and caregiver to honor and facilitate court ordered parenting arrangements and rights, and the court must further consider any history of either parent or any caregiver denying parenting time to either parent in violation of a court order. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 7 and Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, punishes shooting into a habitation or motor vehicle as reckless endangerment and defines the offense as a Class C felony without regard to the occupation of the habitation or motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-103.

As introduced, directs the department of safety to ensure the liability insurance requirements are equally applied to all motor carriers. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 8; Title 7, Chapter 51; Title 55, Chapter 4; Title 55, Chapter 3; Title 56, Chapter 7; Title 65, Chapter 15 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, decreases from 30 to 20 days from receipt of plan, the time within which the office of open records counsel must report back to a governing body as to whether the governing body's plan for electronic communication between members complies with the open meetings laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44.
As introduced, redefines a qualifying organization to employ at least 200 Tennessee residents, instead of 100. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 19.

As introduced, increases the work hours for a bona fide executive officer from 30 to 35 when determining whether a promissory note is considered an investment certificate. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 5.

As enacted, adds five homicide offenses to the list of violent offenses for which a DNA sample is taken and stored in the database upon arrest rather than conviction. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As enacted, increases from $300,000 to $500,000 the maximum amount of revenue and debt a municipality may have in order to qualify to contract with a certified municipal finance officer (CMFO) or a qualified individual who is exempt from CMFO certification for financial oversight instead of employing a CMFO. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 4.

As introduced, revises provisions governing what constitutes a quorum of the assessment appeals commission; changes reference from "trustee" to "assessor of property" in provisions governing back assessments and reassessments. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, authorizes law enforcement officials on duty to help persons gain entry to their locked motor vehicle without being licensed as locksmiths. - Amends TCA Section 62-11-105.
As introduced, enacts the "Courthouse Square Revitalization and Tourism Development Zone Act." - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, redesignates Masons and Tennessee Fraternal Order of Police license plates as specialty earmarked plates rather than new specialty earmarked plates and allocates revenues from such plates to such organizations. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises the requirements for a nursing home's certificate of need for qualified partial relocation of certain nursing homes. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 16.

As enacted, increases by $2.00 the filing fee charged by clerks and data fee entry chargeable by clerks, except in certain cases brought by the state and state agencies; increase only effective until July 1, 2016, unless continued by general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401 and Section 8-21-409.
As introduced, makes going faster than road conditions, weather and traffic patterns safely permit punishable as speeding. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, eliminates gift tax on transfers made on or after January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, allows a member of the armed forces stationed overseas or a Tennessee resident who has been living outside the U.S. due to employment to ship wine into the state by getting a $100 permit and paying the appropriate taxes. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, establishes reimbursement rate for counties holding state inmates as adjusted based upon the percentage of change in the average consumer price index as published by the United States Department of Labor. - Amends TCA Section 41-8-106.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a person to engage in camping on property owned by the state knowing that the area on which the camping occurs is not specifically designated for use as a camping area by the department or agency responsible for such land. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 29; Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, specifies the procedure that local governments must use in order to adopt mandatory sprinkler requirements for one-family and two-family dwellings. - Amends TCA Section 68-120-101.
As introduced, deletes portion of offense of harassment that is committed by communicating with or transmitting or displaying an image to another in a certain manner. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, revises certain criminal provisions and requirements for schools in regard to bullying and harassment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 49.

As introduced, clarifies that physicians must report injuries or wounds arising out of methamphetamine laboratory incidents to law enforcement; provides immunity from liability for good faith reports. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, revises provisions related to dues deductions if a certain percentage of members engage in a work stoppage; decreases amount of time for use of leave and benefits for chief elected officers of employee associations and other association members to attend association's annual meeting. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23 and Title 8, Chapter 50.

As enacted, authorizes towing trucks, while in the performance of duties involved with towing an abandoned, immobile, disabled or unattended motor vehicle, to display a white and amber light that is a strobe, flashing, oscillating or revolving system; clarifies use of similar lights on certain other vehicles. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-402.

As enacted, expands the drugs whose production, manufacture, distribution, sale or possession would be a crime under the present law offense regarding synthetic derivatives or analogues of methcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, prohibits county clerk from renewing owner's registration and registration plates if the owner has outstanding fines or fees owed to the county or any outstanding criminal warrants within the state. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-121 and Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes until July 1, 2013, for sufficient number of applicants for Sigma Gamma Rho license plates. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-261.

As enacted, makes the charging of costs against the respondent's estate permissive rather than mandatory when a conservator is appointed; adds to the requirements for the information that must be included in a petition for the appointment of a conservator. - Amends TCA Title 30, Chapter 3; Title 33; Title 34 and Title 71.

As introduced, revises initial academic requirements for eligibility and the amount of the award of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship beginning with students entering college in 2015-2016; recommends use of net lottery proceeds for TSAA grants for 10 years beginning with 2015-2016. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4.

As enacted, requires the general shortfall lottery subaccount to be maintained at $100 million instead of at $50 million; requires comptroller to make an annual report on the adequacy of reserves. - Amends TCA Section 4-51-111.

As introduced, requires the state funding board's approval of the lottery corporation's estimate of maximized net lottery proceeds and for payment of bonuses to lottery corporation executives. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51.

As enacted, clarifies that endoscopy technicians are sufficient assistants for a physician performing an endoscopic procedure in an ambulatory surgical treatment center; specifies the scope of practice for endoscopy technicians. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 57 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As enacted, specifies that an elementary school is any school serving any combination of kindergarten through grade "six," instead of "eight," and a middle school is any "school," instead of "elementary school," designed to serve grades 5 - 8 only, or any combination of grades 5 - 8; defines a "secondary school" as a school that provides secondary education and defines "secondary education" as education normally available and required by state standards to be taught to children enrolled in grades 7 - 12. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes the suspension or withholding of approval of a professional bondsman if such bondsman was convicted of the equivalent of a Class A misdemeanor in any state. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-125.

As enacted, creates new Class A felony theft provision if the amount stolen is 250,000 or more; allows state to aggregate value of property stolen in certain circumstances; and changes venue for all offenses graded by value. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As enacted, makes technical changes to clarify the offenses of soliciting sexual exploitation of a minor and exploitation of minor by electronic means to make language consistent and to copy from another section definitions for certain undefined terms. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-529.

As introduced, revises civil penalties for public utilities that commit extortion or unjust discrimination or create undue advantage from "not less than $500 nor more than $2,000" to "not less than one week's value of such undue or unreasonable preference or advantage". - Amends TCA Section 7-82-104; Section 48-69-119; Section 64-4-107; Title 65 and Section 68-221-518.

As enacted, authorizes replicas of certain historically-significant documents, such as the Magna Carta, Declaration of Independence and Ten Commandments, to be placed in local government public buildings. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 7 and Title 6, Chapter 54.
As introduced, exempts funeral merchandise from sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts farm gates from sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, removes the requirement that any driver or passenger of a motorcycle 21 years of age or older wear a motorcycle helmet. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

As introduced, permits motorcycle drivers and passengers, 21 years or older, to refrain from wearing a crash helmet with a health care coverage limit of at least $15,000. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.
As introduced, establishes a special joint committee to review and study the establishment of an occupational course of study for students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, to.
As enacted, requires health care providers to report injuries that appear to result from an illegal female genital mutilation. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, requires that sorghum molasses sold or offered for sale in Tennessee must be labeled as 100 percent pure or not pure; authorizes any person who suffers an injury or death, or an ascertainable loss of money or property, as a result of a violation of the bill to bring an action individually to recover actual damages. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, allows teachers and principals with superior value added growth data scores to choose those scores to comprise 50 percent or more of their evaluations based on standards set by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires parenting plans to specify the percentage of time a child will spend with the mother and the father and requires courts to report such percentage to the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 71.

As introduced, prohibits a person from transmitting or causing another person to transmit an unsolicited facsimile advertisement to any public elementary or secondary school or local education agency. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 5.

As enacted, specifies that no public funds of this state or any political subdivision thereof shall be allocated to the regulation or enforcement of any change made to certain rules regarding the employment of children in an agricultural setting. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 50, Chapter 3 and Title 50, Chapter 5.
As introduced, limits reproduction of handgun carry permit records. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

As enacted, clarifies that the requirement for the distribution to servers of service charges or gratuities automatically added to a bill does not apply to charges or fees paid by guests to stay at a guest ranch. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, prevents health care practitioners or facilities from asking a patient about gun ownership, possession or storage unless certain factors are present and prevents insurance companies from discriminating against an applicant or insured based upon gun ownership. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires category 7 pest control applicators to acquire 15 points of continuing education every three years with an annual maximum of eight points. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21, Part 1.

As introduced, provides $5,000 annual supplement to full-time classroom teachers who have taught in Tennessee public schools at least three years and who achieve National Board for Professional Teaching Standards certification. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-5609.

As enacted, specifies that a teacher may not teach a course in which an end of course examination is required for students to satisfy graduation requirements set by the state board of education, if the teacher's license does not carry a subject specific endorsement for the subject area of the course, unless the teacher demonstrates sufficient content knowledge in the course material by taking, at the teacher's own expense, and passing a standardized or criterion-referenced test for the content area. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, provides that 50 percent of the revenue from the sale of certain forfeited vehicles shall go to the state and the remainder to a local government when the state seizes the vehicle but the local government confiscates, tows, stores or conducts the sale of the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 33 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As introduced, exempts the sale of all gold and silver bullion that is used as a medium of exchange, security, or commodity from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, declares a defendant who is unlawfully present in the United States and has committed certain traffic violations may be deemed a risk of flight for bail purposes; authorizes clerks to set bail for such defendants at a higher amount than normally permitted. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As enacted, creates a new farm wine permit; authorizes a farm producer to transport grapes or fruit grown on the farm to a licensed winery for the winery to manufacture, bottle and label the wine as being the product of the farm holding the farm wine permit; places certain requirements on the licensed winery. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-201 and Section 57-3-207.

As introduced, requires gasoline retailers in this state to offer at least two gasoline pumps that dispense gasoline that does not contain ethanol at each retail station; authorizes the commissioner of agriculture to investigate and assess fines for noncompliance. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 60 and Title 67.
As introduced, makes K-12 teachers state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 99 in Rutherford County in honor of late Lance Corporal Justin Kyle Lewter.

As enacted, limits application of the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to counties having a population of more than 75,000 instead of 68,000; change does not affect the current applicability of the Act. - Amends TCA Section 66-28-102.

As enacted, provides civil immunity to medical doctor or osteopathic physician who makes a good faith report to law enforcement regarding an employee's unauthorized use of the doctor or physician's DEA registration number to write prescriptions. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 9 and Title 63, Chapter 6.

As introduced, provides that a prosecution can be commenced for certain offenses committed on or after July 1, 2012, within the applicable period established by law or within one year after the date on which the accused's identity is established through DNA evidence, whichever period is longer. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, deletes outdated provisions of sentencing law. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, provides that punishment for killing a police dog when it is acting in its official capacity is theft and punished according to the value of the animal, including the training, but in no event less than a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, designates a certain segment of State Highway 28 in Sequatchie and Marion counties as "Veterans' Memorial Park Highway."

As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have four years of experience in the use of highway construction equipment; withholds certain funds from Decatur County and reallocates such funds to counties subject to existing highway experience qualifications. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, requires property assessor to set parcel identification numbers for subdivided lots effective at time of division and to prorate assessment between parent property and divided parcels; provides supplemental tax resulting in added value to divided parcel assigned only to such parcel. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of brain injury awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to Brain Injury Association of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enhances the penalty for indecent exposure and public indecency where the crimes occur under certain circumstances on school property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 40.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of transportation to study the feasibility of widening a portion of Winchester Road in Shelby County in consultation with the departments of economic and community development and of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

As introduced, requires certain training and educational requirements on care givers for child care agencies and provides for certain eligibility for financial assistance under lottery scholarship and grant programs for such care givers. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 71.

As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offense of knowingly or recklessly maiming or harming a service animal and the Class C misdemeanor of interfering with a service dog in the performance of its duties and provides for restitution to the handler of the dog. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of human services to institute a mandatory drug testing program for all state employees and the speaker of the house and senate to jointly institute such a program for legislative employees including members of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Section 50-9-104.

As introduced, prohibits a person bidding on or awarded a state contract from making contributions to members of the general assembly or the governor during specified periods of time. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 12.
As introduced, institutes a $500 reward for reporting a felon in possession. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides that all records of a public charter school are open records to the same extent as those of public schools operated by LEAs; provides that the names of the sponsors and the governing body are open records. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, freezes in-state tuition and fees and room and board for three years at the public universities and community colleges. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires a prescription issued by a physician in order to obtain products with immediate precursor of methamphetamine from a pharmacy. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 63.
As introduced, requires cuts to a school district's budget to be made first to funds paid to professional organizations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, allows Tennessee lottery tickets to be purchased with debit cards in addition to cash. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits use of state funds to pay dues or other fees required for an LEA to join or be a member of a professional organization. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, broadens the notice of sale requirements for storage unit owners, and provides storage unit occupants with a remedy if the owner fails to abide by the notice of sale requirements. - Amends TCA Section 66-31-105.
As introduced, exempts sole proprietors from paying certain fees assessed by the secretary of state's office in relation to workers compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, increases expunction fee from $50.00 to $350 and requires a payment of $100 before the bureau issues a certificate of eligibility for diversion. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
As introduced, repeals the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102, Title 7, Chapter 51.
As introduced, allows any registered voter in Tennessee to vote by absentee ballot; revises other voting provisions. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6 and Title 2, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Election Day Registration Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7 and Title 2, Chapter 2.

As introduced, abolishes the court of judiciary on October 1, 2012, establishes new 16-member court of judicial conduct with appointments made by supreme court, governor, bar association and each caucus of general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As introduced, makes branding of livestock mandatory; requires facilities to obtain written permission of brand holder prior to processing or selling livestock. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 7.

As introduced, makes the failure of a sexual offender or violent sexual offender to provide a DNA sample as required by law a Class E felony violation of the Tennessee Sexual Offender and Violent Sexual Offender Registration, Verification and Tracking Act of 2004. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As introduced, names bridge in Sullivan County in honor of the late Richard Lee Edwards, Sr.
As introduced, establishes standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, authorizes attorneys' fees for a violation of open meetings law if the plaintiff substantially prevails on any part of the claim. - Amends TCA Section 8-44-106.

As introduced, requires allocation of half of surplus tax revenues to the rainy day fund under specified circumstances and directs commissioner of finance and administration to certify such amount each year. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes state board for licensing alarms systems contractors to refuse to issue a license to an applicant who has been convicted of a crime indicating lack of good moral character. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, changes deadline for submission of annual report concerning railroad companies' affairs to the department of transportation from February 1 to February 15. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-118; Title 7; Section 35-3-108; Section 55-8-147; Title 57, Chapter 4; Title 64, Chapter 2; Title 65 and Section 69-1-114.

As introduced, adds Chattanooga to the list of cities in which public notice by newspaper must be provided prior to any meeting of a railroad company's stockholders to approve the issuance of bonds and stock. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, requires that all written and oral examinations administered by the department of safety for issuance of driver licenses, intermediate driver licenses, temporary driver licenses and temporary intermediate driver licenses be in English only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

As introduced, deletes the June 30, 2012, repeal date for the reduced payment option available to persons in Davidson County whose licenses have been suspended for certain driving offenses and who have outstanding fines and costs. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502.
As introduced, prohibits bureau of TennCare from paying for psychotropic prescription drugs that are not used for medically indicated uses in the medical assistance program. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As enacted, revises various provisions of present law regarding pain management clinics. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1.

As enacted, requires the department of human services to develop a plan to implement a program of suspicion-based drug testing for each applicant who is otherwise eligible for temporary assistance for needy families (TANF). - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.

As introduced, increases the shareholder ownership requirement from 5 percent to 10 percent to obtain a deferred presentment license; establishes a multi-state automated licensing system for deferred presentment services; authorizes the commissioner to set fees and deadlines for applications; promulgates rules and regulations; and implements sharing agreements between government agencies to use the multi-state automated licensing system. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires the penalty for engaging in the business of a contractor without a license be adjusted every two years to reflect the percentage of change in the average CPI, all items-city average; requires the board to publish each adjusted amount on its web site. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

As enacted, revises obsolete language related to independent practitioner of social work for purposes of reimbursement under medical, hospital and medical service plans and insurance by replacing it with current licensure terminology of a person duly licensed to engage in independent practice as a licensed clinical social worker. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2401 and Section 56-7-2402.

As enacted, requires the department to conduct a study on the safety of motorcycle passengers under 18 years of age and report its results and recommendations to the senate transportation and safety committee and the house transportation committee by October 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, allows valid photograph identification cards issued to students at public institutions of higher learning in Tennessee to be used for voting. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, increases the time a civil judgment for restitution ordered as a condition of probation that remains unpaid would remain in effect from "10 years" to "20 years." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, requires the TBI to report sexual offender registration and certain related information to the FBI "within 48 hours of receiving such information" instead of "promptly." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.
As enacted, enhances the criminal classification of the offenses of indecent exposure and stalking when committed by a sexual offender. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, enacts "The BWC 5 Act," which requires recreational vehicles leased to consumers to have working carbon monoxide detectors; requires all lease agreements for RVs to state that the vehicle is equipped with a working detector; allows court costs and attorney's fees in civil suits for damages from failure to comply with this requirement. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax the purchase of solar panels for legitimate business or commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax the purchases of solar panels exclusively for residential use. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-334.
As introduced, extends property tax relief to the surviving spouse of a veteran whose death results from a service-connected disability. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

As enacted, prohibits a director of schools and board of education from using abolition of a position as a method of avoiding dismissal charges against a teacher and the accompanying due process rights attaching to the status of tenure.

As introduced, makes failure by local boards of education and their representatives or professional employees' organizations and their representatives to participate in good faith in collaborative conferencing unlawful. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, prohibits local board of education from avoiding or refusing to participate in collaborative conferencing; requires board to present a proposed MOU's content to professional employees and to provide opportunity for employees to express their concerns to the board before the board acts on the MOU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.
As introduced, requires local boards of education to provide payroll deduction options for employee benefits. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, revises requirements for apportionment of state sales taxes to eligible municipalities that plan economic development projects; authorizes municipalities to include subsequently annexed property as a part of a project under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1 and Section 67-6-103.

As introduced, broadens eligibility for the HOPE scholarship by removing the requirement that a military parent's home of record or residence is Tennessee if a student qualifies to be classified as an in-state student and meets other specified requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, amends the Criminal Injuries Compensation Fund to provide an attachment or lien on the judgment to satisfy child support arrearages in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 13.

As introduced, prohibits pain management clinics and prescribers at such clinics from prescribing certain drugs to a patient in an amount that exceeds the drug manufacturer's recommended dosage. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, changes T.C.A. to reflect renaming of the senate environment, conservation and tourism committee as the "senate energy and environment committee." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 43; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Professional Employer Organization Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 56 and Title 62, Chapter 43.
As introduced, enacts the "Equal Opportunity Scholarship Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, authorizes judge to order the use of an ignition interlock device for any person granted a restricted driver license; order may be with or without geographical restrictions, but if the device is ordered, then it must remain on the vehicle during the entire period of the restricted license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As eancted, expands present law to provide that it is not a defense to a violation of the DUI statute that a person is or was lawfully entitled to use an intoxicant, marijuana, controlled substance, or other drug. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, increases penalty for violation of DUI statute when child under 18 is in the vehicle to require that the mandatory minimum 30-day sentence for this offense be served consecutive to any sentence received for a violation of specified other alcohol-related offenses. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, clarifies that a person may be compelled to submit to an alcohol test under the implied consent law by other provisions of law, court order or search warrant. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.
As enacted, authorizes local boards of education to receive federal or private grants for educational purposes; specifies the process for the making of such grants. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
As enacted, clarifies existing law regarding term length and board membership of city and county library boards. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 3.
As introduced, creates the crime of "retail theft." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14 and Title 40.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of special license plates for concerns of police survivors (COPS). - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, decreases the notification timeframe for an enrollee or applicant to notify the bureau of any documentation changes from 30 days to 15. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, increases reporting requirements for the department of health, health care and services facilities, and entities receiving grants from annual to biannual. - Amends TCA Title 68.
