As introduced, deletes the requirement that recommendations regarding public needs allowance to the general welfare, health and human resources committee of the senate and to the health and human resources committee of the house be received no later than the second Tuesday in January 2010. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, establishes that the final study of medical assistance program and any participating managed care organizations be reported to the finance, ways and means committees of the senate and the house, the office of legislative budget analysis and the fiscal review committee on or before April 1 of each year, instead of April 15. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, removes the requirement that a defendant must use force against a law enforcement officer in order to commit the offense of resisting a stop, frisk, halt or search. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 6.
As introduced, requires THEC's annual report to be published prior to February 1 of each year, rather than February 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, makes elected and appointed public officials ineligible for diversion for criminal offenses committed in their official capacity or that involve the duties of their offices. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, revises certain requirements concerning retainage. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 34, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes any town, city, county, county with a metropolitan government, the state or any not-for-profit to purchase, preserve, and sell development rights. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-101 and Section 13-7-201.

As enacted, requires CTAS to conduct a study of county librarians' salaries in this state as compared to those in states bordering this state. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.

As introduced, requires any shooting range on lands managed by the agency to be open to access and use during normal business hours to all persons possessing a Tennessee hunting license. - Amends TCA Section 38-8-116 and Title 70.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor criminal offense for any person to knowingly dig, harvest, collect or remove wild ginseng from any land that such person does not own on any date not within the wild ginseng harvest season. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes counties to develop first responder teams to address emergency situations in their county; grants authority to such first responder teams to take certain measures to secure the affected area and minimize harm to persons and property. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1 and Title 7, Chapter 1.

As enacted, requires boards of commissioners for utility districts to provide notice to their customers at least two weeks prior to any board meeting at which the board members intend to select three nominees to certify to the county mayor to fill an existing or upcoming vacancy on the board; notice must include an invitation for the customers to submit the names of qualified persons to be considered for nomination. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307.
As introduced, enacts the "Electricians Licensing Act"; requires persons performing electrical work under a contract for more than $5,000 of work to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.
As introduced, exempts from taxation the purchases or leases of golf carts, equipment and lawn care products by golf course operators. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, provides that a person who has been licensed as a court reporter for at least five years and who is at least 55 years of age is not required to obtain continuing education credits as a condition for license renewal. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.

As enacted, increases the records expunction fee that is payable after completing diversion from $50.00 to $350, expands the purposes for which the diversion fee may be used and implements a new $100 fee that must be paid when requesting diversion. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6; Title 40, Chapter 32 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
As introduced, authorIzes collaborative practice between dentists and dental hygienists in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108.

As enacted, replaces the Tennessee wildlife resources commission (TWRC) with a 13-member fish and wildlife commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 11; Title 43; Title 44; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.

As introduced, establishes a 25 percent tuition waiver for children of members of the military stationed overseas; provided, that the student qualifies for in-state tuition. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, requires comptroller to audit annually the books and records of a virtual school operated or managed by a for-profit entity. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
As introduced, requires data from virtual schools to be reported on the annual report card of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires Tennessee students in Tennessee virtual schools to take the same proficiency tests as students attending other public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
As introduced, authorizes suit for trespass to be brought in any court of general jurisdiction in county where trespass occurred or where the trespasser resides. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires alcoholic beverage commission to promulgate rules and regulations restricting sale of certain high alcohol content beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As enacted, requires the alcoholic beverage commission to report certain information regarding high alcohol content beverages to the state and local government committees of the senate and house of representatives by January 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Lifelong Learning Accounts Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires the general assembly to meet in regular session every two years instead of each year; requires legislative staff to remain employed continually each year; requires state budget to be for two fiscal years instead of one; reduces frequency of reports submitted to general assembly from each year to every other year; directs code commission to change certain references to implement these changes. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 1; Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 20, Chapter 7, Part 1; Title 29, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 49; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 53; Title 54, Chapter 3; Title 55, Chapter 6; Title 56; Title 63; Title 64; Title 67, Chapter 4; Title 68, Chapter 211; Title 69 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires countdown timers be installed at all intersections with unmanned traffic safety cameras implemented after July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, provides that a person who is convicted of an offense involving a motor vehicle that injures or kills two or more first responders who are acting in the line of duty at the scene of or in route to or from an accident or medical emergency must serve any sentences received consecutively rather than concurrently. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-115.
As introduced, requires certain persons who install and maintain elevators to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 121.

As enacted, regulates student conduct on school buses; permits school personnel, including school bus drivers, to use reasonable force, subject to certain restrictions, in maintaining discipline. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 49.

As introduced, permits a grandparent with previously granted visitation rights to file a petition in opposition to relocation of a child and, under certain circumstances, to obtain custody over the child. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 36.

As introduced, reduces the amount of a surviving spouse's elective share by the value of any assets transferred, or deemed transferred, within the six months immediately preceding the decedent's death. - Amends TCA Title 30; Title 31; Title 32; Title 35 and Title 36.

As enacted, changes from "January 1, 2013" to "July 1, 2012" the effective date of Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011, which prohibits physicians from utilizing telemedicine to provide abortion services. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 246 in Williamson County in honor of the late Spc. Danny Gale Martin.
As enacted, designates certain segment of State Route 392 within Crossville as the "Milo Lemert Parkway".
As introduced, authorizes persons in Cumberland County to use dogs in the eradication of wild hogs. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, requires drug testing of persons filing new claims for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

As introduced, exempts certain adult day care services operated by nursing homes or assisted-care living facilities from licensure by the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 2, Part 4.

As introduced, requires certain roofing contractors and agents to make certain disclosures to solicited persons where an insurance claim has been made or is anticipated for the provision of roofing goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 56 and Title 62.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Federation of Garden Clubs and Wilson County - The Place to Be! special license plates; extends deadline for National Civil Rights Museum and Tennessee veterans special license plates to meet minimum order requirement. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, authorizes Riverview Restaurant, also known as the Catfish Place under the bridge, located in Cheatham County to be licensed as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, requires that in hormone replacement therapy clinics all hormone replacement therapy must be performed by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician or by a certified nurse practitioner or a physician assistant that is delegated such tasks by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, authorizes a mattress manufacturer, wholesaler or retailer to offer a comfort exchange policy pursuant to the sale of a mattress; includes a mattress returned pursuant to such a policy in definition of secondhand. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.
As enacted, names certain bridge on U.S. 70 in DeKalb County in honor of the late PFC Billy Gene Anderson.
As enacted, includes I-26 in Unicoi County within Purple Heart Trail. - Amends Chapter 741 of the Public Acts of 2006 and Chapter 767 of the Public Acts of 2004.

As introduced, permits a community college to begin operating at a location in the service area of another community college that has ceased operations at the location. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7 and Title 49, Chapter 8.

As enacted, enacts the "Welfare Roll to Payroll Act," which directs the commissioner of human services to conduct a summer study that will assess the feasibility of more work friendly assistance eligibility and benefits requirements in order to increase workforce participation. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires the reduction of Temporary Assistance to Needy Families (TANF) payments for parents or caretakers of TANF recipients whose children fail to maintain satisfactory progress in school. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, clarifies that either party in a workers compensation dispute may bring suit in the county in which the employee resided at the time of the injury when issues remain after the benefit review conference; reduces from $100 to $50.00 the maximum amount that the secretary of state may charge for certain fees concerning construction service providers and workers compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As enacted, provides that no statutory private right of action is created unless statute contains express language creating the right; prohibits implied rights of action unless certain requirements met, such as fact that there is no controlling statute and action based on common law. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that doctrine of joint and several liability does not apply in civil actions governed by comparative fault except for applicable cases involving the family purpose doctrine. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 29, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, codifies that with certain exceptions a landowner owes no duty of care to a trespasser and is not subject to civil liability for injury, death or property damage suffered by a trespasser while on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34.
As enacted, requires persons who have previously failed to appear in court as scheduled to post money or real estate as security for a bail bond. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-104.

As enacted, adds physician assistants to list of medical professionals who are exempt from subpoena to trial in a civil action but who are subject to subpoena to a deposition. - Amends TCA Section 24-9-101.
As introduced, creates the office of inspector general for fraud, waste, corruption and abuse within all departments and branches of state government. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, revises current law to restrict the entities to which the department of health may disburse federal Title X family planning funds to certain public agencies. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.
As introduced, prohibits pest control operators from offering or entering into no treatment contracts. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 62, Chapter 21.

As introduced, prohibits sexual offenders and violent sexual offenders from establishing a primary or secondary residence or accepting employment within 1,000 feet of a place of worship. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.
As introduced, creates different requirements for subdivisions and development in counties in which county-wide zoning has not been enacted. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4.
As introduced, transfers jurisdiction of the Off-Highway Vehicle Act from wildlife resources agency to department of environment and conservation. - Amends TCA Title 11; Title 68 and Title 70.

As introduced, provides that in a criminal case the trial judge has no authority to grant a defendant a new trial or set aside the verdict because the judge disagrees with the jury about the weight of the evidence. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 18.
As introduced, increases from five to seven days the notice required to a defendant prior to a hearing regarding abatement of a nuisance. - Amends TCA Title 23 and Title 29.

As introduced, exempts from property taxes and sales taxes civic leagues or organizations designated as Internal Revenue Code  501(c)(4) organizations and located in Hawkins County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, creates defense in prosecution of prostitution where a person is a victim of involuntary labor servitude, sexual servitude, or where the person is a victim as defined under the federal Trafficking Victims Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, corrects omitted language from offense prohibiting the manufacture of hallucinogenic plant salvia divinorum and synthetic cannabinoids. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As enacted, permits county medical examiners to access the controlled substance database, absolves civil and criminal liability for authorized users acting in good faith within the proscribed limits, and establishes a presumption of good faith action where a medical examiner accesses the information for the purpose of conducting an investigation into a death or making a report as required by the duties of the position. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 7; Title 39 and Title 53, Chapter 10.

As enacted, allows appointed and elected municipal court judges to solemnize marriages in any county of the state rather than in just the municipality in which the judge has jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As enacted, authorizes and encourages reverse articulation or reverse transfer agreements between the board of regents' community colleges and universities in the board of regents and UT systems and that are private SACS accredited institutions. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the department of revenue to include on its web site the minimum order requirements for cultural and new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, grants immunity from civil liability to an operator of an ice-skating rink who complies with certain responsibilities. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As enacted, permits private probation providers who meet certain qualifications and contract with the department of correction to supervise Class E felony offenders who are granted probation. - Amends TCA Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits operation of or supply of goods or services to public charter schools by foreign nationals or organizations controlled by foreign nationals; prohibits foreign nationals, other than those who are lawful permanent residents of the United States, from teaching in public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, includes certain reusable materials as finished goods or manufactured articles in the hands of the manufacturer for purposes of property taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As enacted, extends until June 30, 2013, for Donate Life new specialty earmarked license plates to obtain the minimum number of orders for issuance of such license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, grants immunity from civil liability and a defense to criminal liability for those who report certain injuries in good faith and specifies that the reporting requirement for those injuries is within 24 hours. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 39.

As introduced, requires notices of foreclosures, land sales, transactions involving real property and other legal notices required by statute be publicized by publishing notice in certain local newspapers and posting notice on certain web sites.

As introduced, requires any sentence received for the offenses of identity theft and identity theft trafficking to be served consecutive to any other offense committed as a result of the identity theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes the comptroller to access, for the purpose of conducting audits or program evaluations, the discount, rebate, pricing and descriptions of other financial agreements as submitted in a procurement or as a report to the contractor; specifies that no official, employee or agent of the state may release or provide for the release, in any form, of information subject to confidential custody under present law. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504; Title 56 and Title 63.

As introduced, defines "dividend" as distributions of income out of earned surplus to shareholders made on account of stock ownership and directly related to such ownership. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, designates the department of finance and administration as the state agency for the implementation of the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, which requires states to implement health care exchanges; specifies department may do all acts necessary or proper to carry out this implementation power. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 56 and Title 71.

As enacted, eliminates the gift tax effective January 1, 2012; does not absolve taxpayer of any liability for tax duly imposed prior to January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 6; Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As introduced, revises various provisions governing deferred presentment services, including provisions regarding qualifications for licensure; authorizes commissioner of financial institutions to require persons subject to Deferred Presentment Services Act to be licensed through a multi-state automated licensing system. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-107; Section 45-17-108; Section 45-17-110; Section 45-17-111; Section 45-17-119 and Section 45-17-104.
As introduced, exempts income derived from stocks and bonds of certain Subchapter S corporations from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As enacted, authorizes the issuance of overdimensional permits by TDOT to certain qualified vehicles to travel on the interstate at night. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-205.

As enacted, specifies that for a municipal election not held in conjunction with any other election, if a polling place is located outside of the boundaries of a municipality but the precinct the polling place serves includes residents of the municipality, then the election commission may designate a polling place outside, but closest to the geographic precinct within the limits of the municipality, the precinct it is to serve. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes a fee imposed on customers for transmitting money through certain entities; requires the department of revenue to administer the collection of said fee; establishes a fund for the moneys collected that can be utilized by the Tennessee bureau of investigation for certain activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts an initiative to improve program integrity in the CoverKids and TennCare programs. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.

As enacted, creates a new ground for initiating the termination of parental or guardianship rights that can be brought by one parent against the other parent based on the commission of severe child sexual abuse by such other parent. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 13; Title 39, Chapter 15 and Title 39, Chapter 17.
As enacted, makes permanent, instead of terminating in 2012, the municipal pilot program for dealing with abandoned construction. - Amends TCA Section 13-21-102.

As introduced, requires, in moving from the enrollment-based higher education funding formula to the outcomes-based funding formula, a 10-year period in which the hold harmless provision of the enrollment-based funding formula is phased out. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 2.

As enacted, revises the population figures from any county in excess of 200,000 in the present law to any county in excess of 335,000 based on the recent federal census which effectively means fireworks cannot be sold within the four largest counties; a conforming change removes language from the current law which would have permitted any county to continue selling fireworks if its population grew past 200,000 an exemption which applied to Rutherford County; such language is no longer necessary with the increased population to 335,000; clarifies that present law permits the sale of fireworks in the City of Lakeland in Shelby County at a stand where fireworks have been sold annually for at least 45 years. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-112.
As enacted, removes limitation on commercial advertising on school buses that requires such advertising to "be composed of lettering on a background color." - Amends TCA Section 49-6-2109.

As introduced, provides that the conveyance or real or personal property of a sexual offender used to violate a provision of the sex offender registry is subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

As enacted, adds the offense of promoting prostitution to the list of sexual offenses requiring registration under the sex offender registry and adds second offense promoting prostitution to the list of violent sexual offenses. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As enacted, provides that if a sexual offender is not incarcerated at the time of sentencing, the offender is to report to a probation officer for the purpose of giving a DNA specimen; provides that cost of sample is to be paid by the offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As introduced, revokes the beer permit and license to sell tobacco products and prohibits renewal of lottery retail contract for a period of one year if the owner or employee of a retail establishment is convicted of selling certain synthetic, analogue or imitation controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As enacted, clarifies that law permits prosecution and conviction for displaying sexual activity to a minor by electronic communication regardless of whether the victim is a minor or an undercover police officer posing as a minor. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, increases the punishment for assault and aggravated assault against health care providers. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

As enacted, adds all trained phlebotomists who are either operating under a hospital protocol, have completed phlebotomy training through an educational entity providing such training, or have been properly trained by a current or former employer to draw blood to the list of persons who are authorized to draw blood at the written request of a law enforcement officer for the purpose of determining whether a suspect has committed DUI; extends the same civil immunity and chain of custody requirements that apply under present law to persons who are authorized to perform blood draws on DUI suspects to all such trained phlebotomists. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, authorizes the general sessions judges of Williamson County to appoint judicial commissioners; clarifies that when the general sessions judges cannot agree on a judicial commissioner appointment, the chief legislative body shall appoint the judicial commissioner; however, the general sessions judges would still supervise that judicial commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 1.

As enacted, requires that officers who knowingly provide POST with false or misleading information concerning histories be decertified, removed from office, and be deemed ineligible to apply for a new law enforcement position in Tennessee; requires denial of application for POST certification of an applicant who knowingly provides POST with false or misleading information. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, requires THEC to make recommendations for changes to the lottery scholarship eligibility for GED recipients in light of impending changes to the GED test by the American Council on Education; requires the department of labor and workforce development, with the assistance of the department of education, the state board of education, and THEC to develop and implement a program for individuals who did not graduate from high school that will provide a means, other than the GED, to obtain a credential signifying completion of high school or its equivalent. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, creates a state bonus for teachers scoring 3 or higher on their evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires the delivery of newspapers and tabloids be only to persons who have requested such delivery. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, requires THEC to give notice of meetings of the consortium for cooperative innovative education to the senate and house education committees with an attached agenda; requires annual report of the consortium to state the number of times it met and summarize the work performed. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes persons to petition for expungement of records of conviction for certain non-violent, non-sexual misdemeanors and Class E felonies that were committed on or after November 1, 1989. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.
As introduced, requires each LEA to develop a policy that would require students to complete at least 75 hours of service learning prior to high school graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, includes "maintaining a safe environment" among the reasons for prohibiting persons other than staff, students, parents and persons with lawful business from entering school property during school hours. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, includes the commission of or attempt to commit a criminal gang offense within the definition of racketeering activity and enterprise for purposes of the Racketeer and Corrupt Organization Act (RICO). - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2.
As introduced, creates a separate offense for participating in criminal gang activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As introduced, revises various provisions of the Tennessee County Uniform Highway Law; makes qualifications for chief administrative officer of highway department uniform. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.

As introduced, directs a summer study by the department of human services to examine the efficiency of the department's sliding scale distribution of benefits to recipients whose income increased to the maximum amount to receive benefits. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2012 session of the 107th General Assembly.
As enacted, allows county boards of education to use the county's centralized purchasing system to provide a life insurance plan for employees. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes the sale of wine at retail food stores in any jurisdiction only upon approval in a referendum in such jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, requires the division of property assessments to determine whether the detachment of certain property from Davidson County and the attachment of the property to Wilson County would be contrary to the provisions of Article X, Section 4 of the Constitution of Tennessee concerning the area of a county and the distance from a county line to a courthouse of an adjoining county and report its findings to the state and local government committees by July 1, 2012.

As introduced, requires members who live within 50 miles of capitol building to be reimbursed actual expenses upon filing receipts, except such amount shall not exceed the federal employee allowance for expenditure reimbursement. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, eliminates the power of eminent domain for housing authorities and permits governing bodies to institute eminent domain proceedings on behalf of housing authorities. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 13 and Title 29.
As enacted, names bridge on S.R. 96 in Williamson County in honor of the late Master Sergeant James W. "Tre" Ponder III, U.S. Army.

As introduced, increases from two to three years time after designation into the system that the commissioner of environment and conservation have completed a comprehensive plan of development and protection and begun the process of acquisition. - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 60.
As introduced, revises highways on which outdoor advertising is prohibited. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-118.

As introduced, requires individual and group health insurance policies to cover neuropsychological testing for children who have been diagnosed with cancer who have undergone radiation or chemotherapy for cancer; requires commissioner of finance and administration to take all permissible action to obtain similar coverage for children on TennCare who are diagnosed with cancer on or after January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, criminalizes the act of filing a lien without a reasonable basis or legal cause to do so. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As enacted, allows local boards of education to conduct scheduled board meetings electronically in some circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, increases the range of fines from $100-$500 to $500-$1,000 for any person who fails to place concise wording describing the material used to make a receptacle or container used for burial, entombment or other final disposition of a human body or remains. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor for any corporation or other business entity that receives state grants, bonds or tax credits to make contributions to candidates for state or local public office or to PACs that contribute to state or local candidates during any two-year election cycle in which such grants, bonds or tax credits were received. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As enacted, prohibits outdoor advertising on state route 840 in Williamson County from state route 246 to one mile from the intersection with state route 100; clarifies that former Interstate 181 in Washington and Sullivan counties is now called Interstate 26. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-118.

As introduced, exempts an individual's residence including no more than one-half acre of contiguous land from execution for debts other than taxes and debts used to purchase the home or where the home was pledged as collateral for a debt. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for any person, including any individual or entity, to knowingly prepare, sign, or file any lien or other document with the intent to encumber any real or personal property when such person has no reasonable basis or any legal cause to place such lien or encumbrance on such real or personal property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As enacted, entitles a claimant to a refund of the state and local sales and use tax paid by the claimant to retailers as a result of the claimant's purchases of major appliances, residential furniture, or residential building supplies that are used in the claimant's primary residence to replace, repair, or restore such items that were damaged or destroyed in a federally declared natural disaster in this state occurring on or after January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, provides that a person is eligible for drug court if the person has been charged with but not convicted of a violent felony or does not have a pattern of convictions for violent misdemeanors. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 22, Part 1.

As introduced, limits the noneconomic damages a person may recover in a car accident if that person owns or operates a vehicle without financial responsibility. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39; Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires a judge to revoke a defendant's participation in a domestic violence intervention class if the defendant is convicted of a subsequent domestic assault offense while attending the class and requires that the new sentence run cumulative to the original sentence. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, adds additional language to the department's mission/purpose. - Amends TCA Section 37-5-102.
As introduced, expands the definition of dependent and neglected child to include a child who has contracted a sexually transmitted disease. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As enacted, requires that, if a report of child abuse alleges physical abuse, it will be in the best interest of the child that the child be referred to a child advocacy center or that the investigation be conducted by a child protective services investigator who is adequately trained in investigating physical abuse reports; prohibits any probation officer previously assigned to the child from performing the investigation under any circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits entities from discriminating on the basis of sexual orientation in practices and contracts. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 11; Title 12; Title 37; Title 39; Title 40; Title 49; Title 56; Title 57; Title 62; Title 65; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, grants adoption preference to a relative over a foster parent where a child has had substantial contact and interaction with that relative. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1 and Title 37.
As introduced, punishes the failure to protect a child from severe child abuse in the same manner as if the offender committed the severe child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, deletes requirement that new beds authorized for ICF/MR beginning July 1, 2006, should be filled by persons from the developmental centers. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-105.
As introduced, prohibits defendants charged with domestic assault from pleading to a lesser offense. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, enhances the financial penalty for violating an order of protection. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, punishes domestic assault as a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 16, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 13; Title 36, Chapter 3; Title 39 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
As introduced, authorizes Norris Landing Marina in Claiborne County to be issued a license as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, requires that a person convicted of committing a dangerous felony involving a firearm who is subsequently convicted of the same serve a minimum of 15 years imprisonment at 100 percent. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40.
As introduced, abolishes the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As introduced, effective January 1, 2013, creates a new defined contribution plan as a mandatory retirement package for newly hired state employees; closes existing defined-benefit pension plan to newly hired state employees; requires state agencies to contribute annually no less than 2 percent of a participating employee's salary to an individual account and to match employee contributions up to an additional 6 percent. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, effective July 1, 2012, creates a new defined contribution plan as a mandatory retirement package for newly hired state employees; closes existing defined-benefit pension plan to newly hired state employees; requires state agencies to contribute no less than 6 percent and up to 15 percent of a participating employee's salary to an individual account and contribute a certain rate to the defined benefits plan in order to cover the plan's unfunded liabilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.
As introduced, repeals the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102 and Title 7, Chapter 51.

As enacted, voids contractual restrictions on a physician's right to practice medicine if such physician is employed independently of a bona fide practice purchase and is terminated by an employing entity for reasons other than breach by the employee. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Section 68-11-205.

As introduced, requires the department of education to include in its annual report by LEA and statewide the number and percentage of teachers scoring each possible effectiveness rating on the teacher evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires the state architect to allocate energy efficient commercial building tax deductions from the IRS to persons designing such buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 15 and Title 12, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes metropolitan governments to levy an additional local sales tax on certain retail sales within a downtown development district for certain purposes. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, permits landlord to terminate rental agreement if tenant creates a hazardous or unsanitary, instead of hazardous and unsanitary, condition on the property; revises certain provisions regarding accounts for security deposits. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.

As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

As enacted, imposes certain requirements on persons providing roofing goods and services in regard to contracts for certain services; provides for certain notice; allows for cancellation of contract in certain circumstances if consumer discovers repair is not covered by insurance. - Amends TCA Title 47; Title 56 and Title 62.

As introduced, prohibits a private act hospital from entering into or renew a provider network or contract with a hospital or medical service corporation that contains an exclusive provider provision. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57, Part 5.
As enacted, requires the department of correction to study how to reduce the state's correctional healthcare costs. - Amends TCA Title 41.
As introduced, provides a sales and use tax refund for persons or entities installing a geothermal heat system in a residence or business. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than $1.00 per $100 of the assessed value of property by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than 25 percent by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits impact fees or adequate facilities taxes from being imposed on age-exclusive developments for persons 55 and older if children as permanent residents are also excluded; clarifies present acts imposing impact fees and adequate facilities taxes may be revised to reduce the fee or tax or remove types of property from being subject to such fees or taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2913.

As introduced, requires revocation or suspension for at least 60 days of beer sales permit held by any person who is convicted of a drug crime. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Section 8-21-401; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 57.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to revoke the tobacco license of a person convicted of a state drug offense for 60 days and requires the clerk of court to report convictions and pleadings to the commissioner for revocation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 67.

As enacted, establishes certain authorization regarding the posting of information on right to work laws; requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to create model notice language. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 2.
As introduced, adds new controlled substances to Schedule I hallucinogenic substances and stimulants and to Schedule II stimulants. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, creates new grade for offense of theft making theft over $500,000 a Class A felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As introduced, limits the ability of a title pledge lender to assess and collect, as reimbursement, a charge for repossession of a vehicle that is the subject of a title pledge agreement. - Amends TCA Section 45-15-111.
As enacted, enacts the "Traumatic Brain Injury Residential Home Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
As introduced, names segment of U.S. 31W within corporate limits of Millersville in honor of John W. Reynolds, Sr.
As introduced, establishes a flat homestead exemption of $50,000, per owned principal residence, for all Tennesseans, regardless of marital status or age. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2, Part 3.

As introduced, defines the term "agreement" to be the agreement between the commissioner of transportation and the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Transportation for purposes of defining unzoned industrial and commercial areas and the size, lighting and spacing of outdoor advertising. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 54.
As introduced, allows teachers to remove disruptive students from class pursuant to local board policies. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires a local government to include in any new, existing, or renewed contract involving unmanned traffic enforcement cameras that the contract must conform to any changes in state law. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, requires 10 percent reduction in energy use by state government entities by January 1, 2014, and an additional 10 percent reduction by January 1, 2016. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 68, Chapter 214.

As enacted, terminates the court of the judiciary and replaces it with a 16-person board of judicial conduct; revises provisions governing such a board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 17, Chapter 5.

As enacted, clarifies that it is lawful to purchase from and cause to be shipped to a personal residence in this state a black powder weapon, knife with a blade in excess of four inches or a sword or bayonet. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As enacted, allows securities or investment accounts held by bank trust departments to have a payable on death designated beneficiary. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 12.

As enacted, requires the state agency responsible for processing applications for grant funds relating to workforce development to accept electronic signatures in the same manner as it accepts physical signatures. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14; Title 47, Chapter 10 and Title 50.
As introduced, defines commercial sex act and criminalizes trafficking a person for commercial sex acts. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, limits amount candidate may personally loan campaign to $100,000 per election but does not limit amount candidate may contribute to campaign; creates voluntary spending limits for certain state and local candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, limits amount candidate may personally loan campaign to $100,000 per election but does not limit amount candidate may contribute to campaign; creates voluntary spending limits for statewide candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires a plaintiff receiving in a judgment less than 80 percent of the settlement amount offered in a lawsuit or a defendant owing a judgment more than 120 percent of the settlement amount offered in a lawsuit prior to trial to pay certain litigation expenses of the opposing party. - Amends TCA Title 25.

As introduced, requires students who score below proficient on TCAP test or do not demonstrate competency on end-of-course examination to attend summer school or receive tutoring in the subject tested at the expense of the student's parent and be retested prior to being promoted or receiving credit for course. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows a student who has completed an associates degree while receiving a Tennessee HOPE scholarship to be eligible for a Wilder-Naifeh technical skills grant to attend a Tennessee technology center in a diploma or certificate program, provided the student meets certain eligibility requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, exempts the diabetic supplies of blood glucose monitor test strips, lancets and visual reading and urine test strips from the sales and use tax. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, prohibits people from jumping off bridges that are 20 feet or more in height, punishable as Class C misdemeanor by fine only not to exceed $50.00 - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 11, Part 2 and Title 55, Chapter 8.
As enacted, exempts from income taxes the income from trust funds for perpetual care of a cemetery. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires trial courts to verify income and property of defendants seeking court-appointed counsel in non-capital criminal cases; creates a judgment lien in favor of state against defendants for unpaid attorney's fees and costs; provides that willful nonpayment of the judgment is criminal contempt; increases professional privilege tax for deposit in indigent defense fund; requires supreme court to adopt rules concerning qualifications and appointment of private attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16; Title 37; Title 40, Chapter 14 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

As enacted, removes requirement that board for licensing health care facilities report to the Tennessee code commission if the board fails to collect fees in amount sufficient to pay operating costs of board in any fiscal year; retains requirement that such report be sent to government operations committees. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-216(b).

As introduced, allows employees of board of probation and parole and board members to carry firearm during the course of official duties if they have a handgun carry permit and their job duties require them to have regular contact with probationers and parolees. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13 and Title 40, Chapter 28, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes an exception to the consent requirement for disclosure of medical records if the patient has been deceased for more than 10 years and the records requested are more than 50 years old; and allows state to charge up to $25.00 to the requester of the records. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 33, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, clarifies that public charter schools are public schools for the purposes of reporting pupil attendance and truancy. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, increases the number of days from 150 to 160 per year and from 75 to 80 per semester that a student must be present for classroom instruction for a student's TCAP scores to be attributable to a specific teacher. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, controls transfer and disposition of county school property lying in a city forming a new city school system or participating in the formation of a joint city school system. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.

As introduced, authorizes department of education to provide appropriate assistance to the transition planning commission responsible for the transfer of administration of a special school district to a county school system. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, permits creation of new city school systems and of joint city school systems in counties in which a school system has been consolidated with the county school system. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 49, Chapter 1.

As introduced, extends grace period for renewing a certificate to operate a pain management clinic from 90 to 120 days from the expiration date of the former certificate. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, deletes provision prohibiting district attorney from applying to judge for a wiretap order in marijuana cases in which the amount is less than 700 pounds. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, expands definition of municipality for occupancy tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.

As enacted, requires that the general internist member of theTennCare pharmacy advisory committee who participates in TennCare be appointed from a list of all general internists provided by interested medical groups, including but not limited to the Tennessee Chapter of the American College of Physicians. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-2401.
As enacted, permits certain Tennessee veterans who are students at public institutions of higher education to register for classes prior to the general student population. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, specifies that when a court orders a defendant charged with a misdemeanor to be evaluated for insanity or mental illness, the court must also order that any inpatient evaluation be completed within 30 days of admission to the facility. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 7, Part 3.

As introduced, requires listing of authorized institutions, which must be posted on the commission's web site, to be updated within 10 business days of a postsecondary institution's acquiring or losing authorization to operate. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 20.
As introduced, establishes process of reciprocal disclosure of witnesses for criminal trials. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 17.

As introduced, allows the results of a TBI-conducted drug or alcohol test to be introduced in evidence without the TBI employee being called as a witness if such notice is served on the defendant's attorney and the attorney has not objected within 10 days of receipt of notice. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, clarifies that referees have the power of a trial court and the same authority as the judge directing the case to the referee in Shelby County environmental court. - Amends Chapter 772 of the Public Acts of 1982, as amended.
As introduced, punishes by fine only, the Class C misdemeanor offense for failure to attend when summoned by the comptroller to provide books and records. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, provides for a 5 percent instead of 10 percent reduction of penalty when deficient nursing home pays the penalty on or before the due date. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the long-term care system. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, deletes authorization for demonstration project involving nursing homes and disabled volunteers. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, enacts the "Animal Fighting Enforcement Act," increasing penalties for certain offenses involving animal fighting. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, increases the Hall income tax exemption for taxpayers 65 years of age or older to $36,200 for single filers and $47,000 for persons filing jointly beginning January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires the chair of the commerce, labor and agriculture committee of the senate and the chair of the commerce committee of the house to invite and compile comments from members of the telecommunications industry concerning the regulatory actions of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, exempts certain residential real estate held by LLCs and limited partnerships as extended low-income housing commitments from property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, exempts from taxation the sale or purchases of certain equipment and products by qualified golf course operators; prohibits outdoor advertising for public- owned golf courses under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, defines "natural gas equipment" and "natural gas provider"; creates limited tort liability for natural gas providers if the proximate cause of the injury or damages was caused by certain acts of the ultimate consumer. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34, Part 2.
As enacted, includes rowing as an outdoor recreational opportunity for purposes of the Tennessee Adventure Tourism and Rural Development Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 11.

As enacted, clarifies to which judges certain financial disclosure laws apply; clarifies that newly elected judges may practice law to wind up their practice; revises other provisions governing judges. - Amends TCA Section 2-10-102; Section 17-2-112; Section 17-2-202; Section 17-1-105 and Section 23-3-102.

As enacted, specifies that upon the filing of any healthcare liability action, the named defendant may petition the court for a qualified protective order allowing the defendant and their attorneys the right to obtain protected health information during interviews, outside the presence of claimant or claimant's counsel, with the relevant patient's treating healthcare providers. - Amends TCA Section 29-26-121.
As introduced, enacts the "Offer of Settlement Act." - Amends TCA Title 20.
As introduced, creates a process to obtain punitive damages against an employer with vicarious liability for an employee agent. - Amends TCA Section 29-39-104.
As enacted, revises provisions governing interest rates on judgments. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As enacted, codifies the liability of a landowner to a trespasser. - Amends TCA Title 29.
As enacted, makes various changes to the appointment of counsel and guardians ad litem for indigent children and defendants in juvenile court. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-126 and Section 37-1-150.

As introduced, removes certain restrictions that limit the ability of a person to obtain a wholesaler or retailer license in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-210 and Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 7.

As enacted, removes the requirements that a missing child report be transmitted to the Tennessee bureau of investigation and that the TBI distribute the report. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39.

As enacted, removes obsolete provisions; creates license for military personnel living abroad to ship wine to this state. - Amends TCA Section 57-1-111; Title 57, Chapter 3; Section 57-2-101; Section 57-4-101 and Section 57-4-203.
As introduced, allows cities and counties to limit number of retail liquor stores to no less than one per 6,000 residents. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-208.

As introduced, expands nonconforming uses to those on contiguous land under common ownership and to land used, rather than in use, for the extraction of diminishing assets. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2.

As enacted, provides that as part of a defendant's alternative sentencing for a violation of domestic assault, the sentencing judge may direct the defendant to complete a drug or alcohol treatment program or available counseling programs that address violence and control issues including, but not limited to, a batterer's intervention program that has been certified by the domestic violence state coordinating council. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, states that a parent may not be awarded custody or visitation when the parent has been convicted of a violent crime and classified as violent or dangerous due to a mental health disorder. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6 and Title 37.

As introduced, enhances the punishment for domestic assault committed in the presence of a child; authorizes law enforcement, in their discretion, to file a report of harm with the department of children's services for a child abuse investigation. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department of safety and homeland security to establish and maintain a hotline where unsafe driving practices of tractor trailer operators can be reported. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, establishes a four-year parental involvement pilot program in the school system with the most schools in the achievement school district (ASD); limited to schools operated by the ASD that serve grades K-3 or any combination thereof. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, specifies that the employer, rather than the claimant, is responsible for overpayment of unemployment benefits when an award is overturned on appeal based on evidence that is submitted more than seven days after notice of the claim is sent to the employer. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires municipalities to report owner and address of unfit, blighted and deteriorated properties to the secretary of state for publication on secretary's web site until such condition is cured. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to appoint department attorney to indigent claimant in unemployment benefit appeal upon request when employer is represented by counsel at appeal; employer will be assessed $3,000 legal service fee if claimant prevails, otherwise cost comes from department's existing resources. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 23 and Title 50.
As introduced, prohibits animals in a driver's lap or between the driver and the driver's door while the motor vehicle is in motion. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As enacted, specifies that LEAs may expend BEP funds earned for non-classroom components for the purpose of employing a building manager for a school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, provides for more consideration of actual classroom experience for teachers in training; updates requirement of length of classroom observation and teaching for teachers in training from three quarters to two semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 56.

As introduced, requires the state board of education to promulgate a rule permitting the length of the school term to be calculated by instructional hours as well as the current number of instructional days. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3004.
As introduced, allows any operating LEA to convert to a special school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.
As introduced, improves retirement benefits of certain Tennessee public employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 7.

As introduced, criminalizes photographing a person without consent and with the knowledge that the person is in a private place or has a reasonable expectation of privacy; enhances the fine associated with false imprisonment, assault, criminal trespass and trespass by motor vehicle when those crimes are committed with the purpose of obtaining a photograph in violation of the new crime. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, expands the type of judge that may solemnize the rite of matrimony in any county in Tennessee to include judges of the municipal court of any municipality. - Amends TCA Section 36-3-301.
As enacted, designates segment of State Route 14 beginning at the Tennessee-Mississippi border north on Third Street to Jackson Avenue in Memphis as the "Blues Trail."
As enacted, revises structure and operation of certain county highway departments. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.
As enacted, designates U.S. 27 within City of Dayton as "Veterans Memorial Highway."
As enacted, designates the third full week in May as "Rescue Squad Week." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, names segment of U.S. 27 in Rhea County in honor of the late Hiram Green.

As enacted, allows commission to issue wholesale license to corporation that has acquired assets of a partnership or limited liability company operating in this state for 10 years if corporation has majority of its assets in Tennessee and officers actively present at licensed premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-203(g).

As introduced, permits a person possessing a nonresident seller's permit for wines and alcoholic beverages that are not registered under certain circumstances or not available from a manufacturer, winery or distiller to purchase alcoholic beverages from a Tennessee licensed wholesaler for resale outside the state. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-404 and Section 57-3-602.

As introduced, requires products sold as Tennessee wine or Tennessee sour mash whiskey to contain a certain percentage of products used in the manufacture of the wine or whiskey to be grown in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 57.
As introduced, requires the department to regulate petroleum underground storage tanks only to the extent required by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 215.
As introduced, appropriates a grant in the sum of $150,000 to the James K. Polk Memorial Association for renovation and improvement of the James K. Polk Home and surrounding property.
As introduced, adds a focus on innovative practices by providers in each of the grand divisions to the annual report on safety net access and adequacy. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-123.

As introduced, shifts authority to hear appeals from denials by local boards of education of charter school applications from the state board of education to the commissioner of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, requires a public hearing on any rule or regulation proposed by THEC prior to the rule or regulation becoming effective and requires any affected institution be given notice of the hearing and an opportunity to present evidence to the commission. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-2005.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of Boy Scouts of America new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to five Tennessee Councils of Boy Scouts to fund and support scouting programs and activities. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires a dental service plan corporation to show ability to pay the greater of operating expenses for six months or $10,000, instead of $2,500, in order to apply for license to operate a dental service plan. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires private corporations that collect sewer payments on behalf of municipalities to send consumers' water usage rates to the municipality if the corporation does not also collect payment for water usage. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 221.
As introduced, requires LEAs to graduate 85 percent of high school seniors with an intermediate unrestricted driver license. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 55.

As enacted, specifies that a garagekeeper or towing firm that does not verify ownership of a motor vehicle within three business days after taking possession of such motor vehicle pursuant to law or that does not notify by mail the owner of such motor vehicle within six days after taking possession would not be entitled to receive more than six days of storage-related expenses; provides for civil liability in certain circumstances for a garagekeeper or towing firm that fails to release a motor vehicle to a vehicle owner, secured creditor, lessor or lienholder. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1.

As enacted, creates a natural gas dealer's permit for persons or entities that dispense compressed natural gas to customers' vehicles through qualified natural gas dispensers; requires the permittee to remit the compressed natural gas tax imposed on the metered gas. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 11.

As introduced, exempts an event to which the entire membership of a standing committee or committees is invited from the gift prohibition subject to the same cost and reporting restrictions imposed on events to which the entire membership of the general assembly is invited. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of a Tennessee Sheriffs' Association new specialty earmarked license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As introduced, requires the state rather than the county to pay for mental health treatment of inmates charged with a misdemeanor in Greene County. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, expands definition of severe child abuse to include abuse resulting from a mother's ingestion of illegal drugs during pregnancy. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37, Chapter 1 and Title 39, Chapter 15.

As introduced, enacts the "Solid Waste Planning Act of 2012" to require consideration of economic activities concerning recycling when promulgating rules and regulations concerning solid waste and landfills; makes certain other changes and additions to present law concerning recycling. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As enacted, revises the provisions governing the threshold for public works that require a registered architect, registered engineer, or registered landscape architect. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 2.

As enacted, prohibits the disclosure of traffic citations from red-light cameras to consumer reporting agencies; prohibits such information from being identified in credit reports. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As introduced, requires an LEA to provide proof of a child's graduation from high school to certain persons within 15 business days, instead of the current 20, of the persons' written request for such proof. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, clarifies that judges may, but are not required to, order a rehearing of any matter heard before a magistrate appointed by a juvenile court, and that such rehearings shall be de novo based upon the record of the hearing before the magistrate. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits a court clerk from accepting the filing of another claim by a litigant who owes fees, taxes, costs and other expenses unless the litigant seeks injunctive relief to prevent irreparable injury or serious physical harm to the litigant. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 18; Title 20 and Title 28.

As introduced, allows persons age 60 and older to vote absentee upon request, instead of age 65 and older to conform to current age requirement of those authorized to obtain a nonphoto bearing driver license. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6; Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

As introduced, increases from a Class C misdemeanor to a Class B misdemeanor any developer or certain other persons offering or disposing of a time-share interval without having complied with the Time-Share Act of 1981. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 62, Chapter 13; Title 66 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires any increase in tuition at public institution of higher education to result in an equal decrease in the institution's annual appropriation and requires office of legislative budget analysis and comptroller to provide comments to the finance, ways and means and education committees on such decreases. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.
As introduced, criminalizes the assistance of unauthorized access to a service account and clarifies the criminal act of obtaining services without payment. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

As enacted, allows restaurant to have minimum of 40 seats instead of 75 seats for purpose of selling alcoholic beverages; clarifies that limited service restaurant may sell more than 50 percent food and still qualify for license. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4.

As introduced, revises authority or responsibility with respect to street construction and acceptance of public streets located within a subdivision in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-3-405.

As introduced, allows municipal regional planning commission, in counties that have not adopted zoning, to exercise subdivision approval within the planning commission's region without the approval of the county legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-106(d).

As introduced, redefines subdivision in municipal county and regional regulations by expanding the maximum size allowed for the subdivided parcels from less than five to less than 25 acres. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-401 and Section 13-4-301.

As introduced, specifies evidence of abandonment of non-conforming use, directs the governmental entity with jurisdiction to establish beginning and ending dates for the prescriptive period, and creates a rebuttable presumption of abandonment upon a governmental finding of credible evidence establishing a non-conforming use for the prescribed period. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

As introduced, permits the county mayor to retain veto power if serving as chair of the county legislative body; removes the authority of the county mayor to vote to break a tie when the county mayor is serving as chair; requires a two-thirds vote to override a veto instead of a majority vote. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-103; Section 5-5-109 and Section 5-6-107.

As introduced, authorizes members of boards of directors of credit unions to be compensated for services rendered, subject to review by the commissioner of financial institutions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As introduced, requires commissioner to include analysis of impact of utilizing regional water planning methods of other states on tax revenues in 2013 report to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, adds retired members of the Tennessee national guard to those who are authorized to receive discounted rates offered by the commissioner of conservation and environment for activities at state parks; requires discounted rates to be posted in a facility if the facility is one to which the rates apply; requires rates to be offered regardless of whether the state operates the facility or the facility is leased to or managed by a private entity. - Amends TCA Section 11-3-121.

As enacted, adds Morgan County to group of counties where the training season for coon dogs is at least six months, instead of having a training season from July 1 to the first day of the open season for hunting coons. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, revises teacher and principal evaluation system. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of Almost Home Animal Rescue new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50 percent of funds derived from sale thereof to such organization to rescue and relocate animals scheduled for euthanasia. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, authorizes clerks with electronic filing systems to charge $120 for each registered user of the system and to institute an 8-cent per page copy transaction fee; fee not applicable to the state; specifies that in any court where electronic filing, signing, or verification of papers has been authorized by local court rule, the state and any department or contractor of the state would not be required to file documents electronically, notwithstanding any local court rule. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401.

As introduced, increases, from $1,000,000 to $5,000,000, the single allowable exemption to be applied against net estate for state inheritance taxes; requires exemption amount to match exemption for federal estate taxes; requires state gift tax exemption to be the same as inflation adjusted exclusion amount for federal gift taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 3 and Title 67, Chapter 8, Part 4.

As enacted, specifies that any records obtained by or disclosed to a municipality or county by a holder of a state-issued certificate of franchise authority or any other cable or video service provider for the purpose of an audit or review will be confidential and not subject to the open records laws. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 59, Part 3 and Section 10-7-504.
As introduced, permits pharmacist, a pharmacy benefits manager or a covered entity to collect sales tax on diabetic supplies. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes collection of criminal court fines, costs and litigation taxes in same manner as civil debt. - Amends TCA Title 20 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires that criminal injury compensation funds made to minors be turned over to chancery or circuit court to be placed in an interest bearing account. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 29 and Title 34.

As enacted, extends the requirements for stopping at a railroad crossing when a railroad train is approaching to apply to situations when either a railroad train or any other on-track equipment traveling on a railroad track is approaching; failure to stop for on-track equipment will be a Class C misdemeanor, which is the same criminal classification for failing to stop at a train crossing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 4; Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 65.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing adult care home providers in regard to traumatic brain injury. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a transitional licensure program for professionals interested in teaching in grades 7-12 that does not require pedagogical study. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $1,000 for each unemployed person hired by a qualified small business; conditions the credit on the creation of at least five new qualified jobs; requires verification that unemployed persons have at least 20 weeks of unemployment benefits remaining as of the date of hire. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As enacted, changes time when department of revenue is notified of an annexation from prior to the annexation becoming effective to upon the annexation becoming effective. - Amends TCA Section 6-51-115.
As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions regarding virtual schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, limits advertising of ticket sales to retailer premises; prohibits advertising to promote the lottery via media. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.

As introduced, abolishes the recordation tax and abolishes the wetland acquistion fund, the local parks land acquisition fund, the state land acquistion fund and the agricultural resource conservation fund, which funds derive funding from the recordation tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Rights Initiative Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21.
As introduced, prohibits in Bluff City issuance of traffic citations based solely on evidence from unmanned traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.
As enacted, allows city of Estill Springs to permit nonresident property owners to vote in municipal elections upon two-thirds approval of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-53-102.

As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body to set the fee for participation in the litter removal program by first-time DUI offenders and permits the judge to find a person indigent for purposes of paying that fee. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-403.

As introduced, makes various changes to expunction of court files and records in juvenile court cases, allows unruly juveniles to petition for expunction of court files and records, and extends expunction to other scientific methods of establishing identity. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-155; Section 37-1-153 and Section 40-32-101.

As enacted, requires petitions in juvenile court cases to list the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child; requires a copy of the summons in such cases be sent to the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-121 and Section 37-1-120.

As enacted, states that training for guardians ad litem shall include early childhood, child and adolescent development provided by a qualified professional; requires permanency hearings for children in foster care to be held within 12 months of previous permanency hearing. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-149; Section 37-2-409 and Section 37-1-129.
As introduced, authorizes disclosure of public records of mental illness that are more than 70 years old. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 33.
