As introduced, authorizes nurse practitioners to issue universal do not resuscitate orders, which may only be issued by physicians under present law. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, clarifies that indecent exposure can exist where certain behavior appears to be sexual conduct to an ordinary observer. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, opens ICF/MR beds in private facilities to private pay and TennCare patients on a first-come, first-served basis. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As enacted, authorizes municipal separate storm sewer systems that become qualified local programs pursuant to department approval to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes phase I and phase II designated municipal separate storm sewer systems to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof. - Amends TCA Title 69.

As introduced, clarifies who is a parent for purposes of being on school premises; defines "parent" as parent, foster parent, legal guardian or person having physicial custody of a child. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, abolishes Cover TN advisory committee. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 30.

As enacted, creates sunrise provision for economic council on women with a termination date of June 30, 2013; revises certain provisions regarding appointments to council. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 4, Chapter 50, Part 1.

As introduced, imposes occupational privilege taxes on performers at adult cabarets, increases sales taxes on certain adult services, materials and products; places revenues in a fund for reduction of taxes on food and food products. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, creates Class E felony of aggravated cruelty to livestock, which is intentionally engaging in specified conduct in a depraved and sadistic manner that results in serious bodily injury or death to the animal and is done without lawful or legitimate purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, specifies that whenever practicable an exit interview shall be conducted with dismissed state employees; authorizes governor to offer buyouts to state employees in lieu of reductions in force. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30.
As introduced, authorizes removal for cause a member of the civil service commission who misses three consecutive meetings without an excuse. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 1.
As introduced, requires rules promulgated by commissioner of human resources that affect state employees to comply with the UAPA. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of human resources to provide a report to the governor regarding any reduction in force of state employees implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 4.
As introduced, removes requirement that age and sex be considered in qualifications for admissions for tests for promotion. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.
As enacted, repeals the cemetery advisory board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 46, Chapter 1, Part 3.
As enacted, creates sunrise provision for the interstate nurse licensure compact, June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 3.

As introduced, increases time in which petition challenging determination of capitalization rate, income estimates or land values must be filed with state board of equalization from 20 to 30 days prior to publication of notice of the availability of the proposed use value schedule in a newspaper of general circulation within the county. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 9, Part 3 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 10.

As enacted, extends from July 1, 2012, to July 1, 2015, the time period within which certain licensed money transmitters may obtain authority to own or control a credit card state bank; revises other provisions regarding credit card state banks. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 19.

As introduced, authorizes a person who has at least 13 years creditable service in the TCRS and seven years creditable service in the optional retirement plan for employment at Tennessee Tech University during a specific period of time to have the option of transferring membership from the optional retirement program to the TCRS. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.
As enacted, names field house at York Institute in honor of Charles Joseph Vaughn.

As enacted, authorizes municipal electric system or other governmental utility system to enter into an employment contract for a term not to exceed five years with the superintendent, general manager or chief executive officer of the electric plant. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52.
As introduced, exempts dividends from privately owned businesses from the Hall Income Tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As introduced, exempts sole proprietorships from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, revises certain criminal provisions to include certain disruptive and illegal conduct involving unions and employee organizations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12; Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, authorizes the issuance of licenses to teach in grades nine through 12 to persons who have taught at a postsecondary education institution, the students of which are eligible for lottery funded scholarships; such a license will only authorize the licensee to teach in the subject area in which the licensee taught at the higher education institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires suspicion-based urine drug tests of TANF applicants and recipients. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 50 and Title 71.

As introduced, establishes credit against franchise and excise tax liabilities for taxpayers who incur unreimbursed costs related to an employee's organ donation procedure. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As enacted, adds Cocke, Hawkins, Hamblen and Hancock counties to the Watauga regional library and changes region's name to the Holston River regional library. - Amends TCA Section 10-1-112.
As enacted, authorizes the city of Newport to impose a tax on the privilege of occupancy. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.

As introduced, provides that the department may only suspend or revoke license or impose civil penalty on an entity providing mental health and developmental disability services or alcohol treatment for breaches of duty of care and not based upon vicarious liability. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 2.

As introduced, provides that a wildlife officer who issues a citation for a violation of the wildlife laws is to set the time and date of the person's court appearance in a random manner without regard to what judge or judges are sitting. - Amends TCA Section 70-1-310 and Section 70-4-415.
As introduced, prohibits local or regional planning commission from prohibiting private road maintenance agreements in residential developments. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, states that teachers of non-academic subjects that are not measured by TVAAS data shall not be evaluated based on such data; allows each LEA to create an annual evaluation system for such teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, increases computer exemption during recurring August sales tax holiday from $1,500 to $1,750; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.
As enacted, requires that certain information regarding advanced placement courses and dual enrollment courses be included in commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, replaces obsolete language concerning tenure with current terminology. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 50.
As enacted, enacts the "Doe Mountain Recreation Authority Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 67.

As enacted, specifies that certain filing provisions would not apply to a commercial risk policy issued by an insurer of commercial risk insurance to an exempt commercial risk policyholder; specifies circumstances under which certain penalty provisions will apply to commercial risk insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

As introduced, authorizes an insurer to make, offer, or permit a preference or distinction in certain insurance policies based on membership in certain groups that are actuarially justified and not excessive, inadequate or unfairly discriminatory; authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to examine such insurers for compliance. - Amends TCA Section 56-5-315 and Title 56, Chapter 8.

As introduced, establishes means by which students with documented disabilities who do not meet high school academic qualifications for a HOPE scholarship can attend college, meet college academic requirements and receive the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, authorizes a court to order assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative to inpatient treatment for a person with mental illness. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, exempts the retail sale of the service of bathing animals from the sales tax imposed on laundering or dry cleaning of tangible personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, redefines an infamous crime for purposes of retaining the right of suffrage; authorizes incarcerated felons to vote except persons convicted of voter fraud, treason, first degree murder, or aggravated rape. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 20, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 29.

As introduced, clarifies that THDA annual report of its activities for the preceding year to the governor, comptroller of the treasury, and the general assembly is mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23.

As enacted, authorizes a commercially-operated recreational facility that meets certain characteristics to qualify as a premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; authorizes a restaurant around Center Hill Lake in DeKalb county that meets certain criteria to qualify as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, provides that the disciplinary counsel for the court of the judiciary is a state employee for purposes of defense by the attorney general when a civil action is commenced for an act or omission performed during the course of duties for the court of judiciary. - Amends TCA Section 8-42-103.

As introduced, creates an October 1, 2014, statute of repose for personal injury and death actions that accrued prior to the effective date of the Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 28.

As introduced, specifies the circumstances under which a pre-trial settlement offer may be made in a civil action; specifies the manner and circumstances under which costs or the monetary value of disputed property may be determined by a court in the event a settlement offer is made and rejected. - Amends TCA Title 20.

As introduced, changes the interest on judgments from 10 percent to a rate equal to the federal reserve weekly prime loan rate published by the commissioner of financial institutions for the calendar week preceding the judgment. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As enacted, requires the court in a civil case, on a trial court's granting of a motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim upon which relief may be granted, to award costs and reasonable and necessary attorney's fees incurred in the proceedings as a consequence of the dismissed claims to the party against whom the dismissed claims were pending. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27 and Title 29.
As introduced, authorizes the award of punitive damages in a civil action against a defendant based on vicarious liability under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have a high school diploma or equivalent and four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that in a health care liability action, a medical expert is limited to testimony concerning the standard of acceptable professional practice in the local community and testimony of the regional or national standard and why it is applicable is inadmissible. - Amends TCA Section 29-26-115.

As introduced, includes years of service to a political subdivision participating in the consolidated retirement system for which credit was established in the calculation of years of service for premium payment in retiree group insurance plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As enacted, corrects the chemical compound, Benzoylindoles, found in illegal drugs such as hallucinogenic plants, from "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 09)" to "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 098)". - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of a TN Cave Salamander new specialty license plate; provides that the sale proceeds shall be deposited into the wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, extends the time to meet the minimum order requirements for the Labrador Retriever Foundation new specialty earmarked plate until July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-353.

As introduced, changes from February to March the month in which an annual report must be filed by the Tennessee Regulatory Authority concerning all matters relating to its office. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer to file an inventory of all equipment and materials concerning road construction with the county governing body within 75 days after taking office instead of 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, authorizes Tennessee Breast Cancer Coalition new specialty earmarked license plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to the Tennessee Breast Cancer Coalition to support organization's mission. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, clarifies that certain trailers and semitrailers used in transporting rolled hay bales, rather than rolled alfalfa bales, are exempt from maximum width and height requirements for motor and other vehicles. - Amends TCA Section 55-7-202.
As introduced, requires law enforcement to notify, within 30 days of impoundment, the owner and lienholders having an interest in a methamphetamine vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As introduced, allows 40 days, instead of 30, to correct an unlawful sign. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.

As introduced, requires any contract, plan, or policy of insurance issued or renewed on or after July 1, 2012, that provides coverage for surgical first assisting benefits or services be construed as providing coverage for a registered nurse first assistant. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.
As introduced, requires voters in a primary election to acknowledge the political party primary in which they choose to vote most closely represents their views. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires a person to declare a statewide political party affiliation before voting in a primary election. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, revises and enacts provisions governing public officials receiving a benefit not otherwise authorized by law. - Amends TCA Section 39-16-402.

As introduced, authorizes metropolitan governments to levy an additional local sales tax, not to exceed statutory maximum, on retail sales within a downtown development district, if all funds derived from the tax increase are used to promote business activity or to provide improved government services in the district. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.

As introduced, adds a reference for certification of locksmiths to the most recent and recognized version of the American Locksmith of America Certification. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, changes the eligibile creditable retirement date to 25 years of service instead of 30 years for dispatchers of emergency communications districts of political subdivisions that have set a mandatory retirement age for police officers and firefighters. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86 and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits certain counties whose chief administrative officers of highway departments are exempt from state qualifications for holding such office from being eligible to receive state-shared fuel taxes or grant funds from the department of transportation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67.
As enacted, redefines "traffic or police officer" for purposes of traffic control or regulation. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 62.

As introduced, requires the department of human services to seek a waiver from the U.S. Department of Agriculture for cardholders' photos to be placed on EBT cards issued pursuant to the food stamp program and to submit implementation and cost information to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As enacted, adds Echinacea Tennesseensis as a state wild flower, along with the passion flower. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-306.

As introduced, prohibits any person from coercing, compelling or forcing a hospital to violate any person's free exercise of religion or religious beliefs; makes a violation a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
As enacted, revises provisions of the Uniform Commercial Code. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 1; Title 47, Chapter 2; Title 47, Chapter 2A and Title 47, Chapter 9.

As introduced, creates Class E felony of a district attorney general knowingly withholding or refusing to provide exculpatory information to a defendant and Class D felony if the defendant is convicted as the result of the violation and would have been acquitted if the evidence had not been withheld. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 4.
As introduced, specifies proper notice be given prior to inspecting a taxpayer's books and records concerning certain privilege taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 23.

As introduced, authorizes county legislative bodies to opt in to state law prohibiting the regulation of wild hog hunting on private property by the wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, changes the reporting deadlines for entries to the controlled substance database from at least monthly to at least every two weeks. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10.
As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As enacted, changes dates of harvest season for wild ginseng from August 15 through December 31 to September 1 through December 31 of each year; adjusts reporting requirement for ginseng dealers to reflect new start date of harvest season. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 28, Part 1 and Title 70, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As enacted, states that coverage made available in plans under the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 shall constitute minimum essential health coverage for purposes of compliance with certain federal minimum coverage requirements; specifies that operation consistent with the present law standards described in the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 would create a presumption that the operating entity is a "health care sharing ministry" under federal law regarding minimum essential coverage. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, opens all property managed by TWRA to recreational hunting and fishing by deleting authority of TWRA to restrict such areas for reasons of public safety, homeland security or as otherwise limited by law. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4 and Title 70, Chapter 5.

As introduced, limits the law enforcement authority of wildlife officers to the extent such officers are acting within their scope of authority for enforcing a violation of subject matter over which such officers have jurisdiction under boating regulations and enforcement of wildlife laws. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 69 and Title 70.

As introduced, directs the commissioner to implement a program of state inspection for intrastate consumption of meat, poultry or meat and poultry products and, to the greatest extent possible, to utilize the services of licensed veterinarians under contract with the department to perform the inspections. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires products sold at concessions on the premises of state postsecondary institutions be Tennessee products if the product being sold is made in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, exempts staple food from state sales tax; defines staple food to include fruits and vegetables, grains, dried beans, flour, meats, poultry, fish, and certain nutritious beverages; holds local governments harmless from the loss of state-shared tax revenues. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, prohibits the seizure by TWRA of any hunting equipment or guns when such seizure does not arise from the actual illegal taking of wildlife. - Amends TCA Section 70-6-201.

As introduced, authorizes breeding facilities to possess certain native species for purposes determined by and in accordance with rules promulgated by the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, creates a Tennessee exotic wildlife board within the department of agriculture; gives responsibilities to the board for wildlife held in captivity for commercial purposes and gives responsibilities to the wildlife resource commission for wildlife held in captivity for personal, non-commercial purposes. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 44 and Title 70.

As introduced, eliminates Tennessee residency and reciprocity requirements for persons employed as commercial helpers in the commercial fishing industry, limits the amount of time a commercial fishing license may be revoked or suspended, and limits commercial helper's license fees. - Amends TCA Section 70-2-101 and Section 70-2-205.

As introduced, requires the executive director of the TWRA to file a report with the general assembly on February 15 of each year that details annual property damage caused by wildlife and nuisance animals. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, limits the amount of time a commercial fishing license may be revoked or suspended. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.

As introduced, authorizes a state or local governmental entity to submit a bill to TWRA for removal of the carcass of dead wildlife from the roadway and requires TWRA to reimburse such entity for the cost of removal, burial and destruction. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-115.

As introduced, requires TWRA to perform a test for chronic wasting disease on deer and elk harvested or found dead on Agency wildlife management areas to be funded from proceeds of joint partnerships entered into for marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Section 70-1-302.

As introduced, allows person who is convicted of a nonviolent felony to petition the court for expungement of the public records of such felony after 20 years if the person has not committed any other felonies during the 20-year period and has completed all requirements for the offense, including restitution . - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.
As enacted, authorizes the diversion of harassing non-initialized 911 phone calls to a designated entity. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 3.

As introduced, clarifies that requirement that garagekeeper must notify owner of a rental car within three days of taking possession also applies when garagekeeper possesses a vehicle that was taken into custody by police as unclaimed or abandoned. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Section 66-19-103.

As introduced, requires entity actually towing vehicle to report vehicle registration information to local law enforcement when vehicle is towed pursuant to Uniform Landlord Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 5.

As enacted, implements various procedures concerning controlled substance analogues in the same manner in which those procedures are carried out concerning controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 29; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 57; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.
As introduced, includes service performed by election officials and election workers receiving over $1,000 in remuneration in definition of excluded service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, clarifies it is the sole responsibility of a municipality to appoint board members to a convention center where a city and a county had jointly participated in the construction of a convention center and the municipality purchased from the county all the county rights in such convention center. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

As enacted, requires the department of human services and juvenile court or district attorney general to undertake public awareness campaign in counties implementing responsible teen parent pilot project that includes the means the department may use to collect child support. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39.

As introduced, increases, from two to three months, the length of time that a probationer or parolee can remain in arrears or delinquent in paying supervision and rehabilitation contributions before the arrearage or delinquency constitutes sufficient grounds to revoke probation, parole, or release. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 40; Title 50 and Title 55.
As introduced, specifies that prejudgment interest begins to accrue on the date that process is effectuated unless an applicable contract specifies otherwise. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, defines "mineral interest" for purposes of a back assessment or reassessment of property taxes against a mineral interest owner. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires the accounting manuals provided by the boards of education covering the various phases of student body activity funds and other internal school funds to be published on the Internet for viewing by students, parents, and faculty. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes reference to the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee foreign language institute's annual report to include information on any monies received from private donors or government sources and schools with which the institute has collaborated or contracted. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes court clerks to petition for destruction of records in certain criminal cases that have been finally disposed of for at least 10 years. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to notify any organization sponsoring a specialty license plate when such plate has failed to meet the minimum issuance requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the license fee for any person engaging in the business of deferred presentment services in this state.

As introduced, increases from $1,000 to $2,000 the amount of civil penalty that the commissioner of financial institutions may assess for each transaction in violation, or each day that a violation occurs, of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends amend TCA.

As introduced, requires persons licensed under the Deferred Presentment Services Act to file annual reports of certain information with the commissioner of financial institutions by October 1 of each year instead of September 1.
As introduced, extends time period that timber purchaser must retain bill of sale from one year to 16 months. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, changes number of days within which a seizing agency must apply for a forfeiture warrant after seizing property from five to seven days. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, authorizes governmental entities to include language stating maximum penalty for offense of theft in signs warning public that theft of material from stone walls is theft. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, provides certain penalties for any person or entity selling or introducing certain synthetic drugs as products and labeling such drugs for a use that the person or entity knows or reasonably should know will not be the intended use. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 47, Chapter 18.
As introduced, revises disclosures required and cancellation provisions relative to time-shares and prohibits certain advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 32.

As enacted, allows state employee upon retirement to keep such employee's photo identification card issued by the state; requires sticker or other designation to be placed on the card; specifies such card may be used as valid photo id for voting purposes. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112 and Title 8.
As introduced, exempts persons who canceled their social security numbers from furnishing such information to obtain a driver license. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-321.

As introduced, states that either party to an adoption may enforce contract provision providing for open adoption or visitation; allows certain adopted children to be issued new certificate of birth upon reaching age of majority. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 68.

As introduced, adds carjacking and especially aggravated burglary to offenses for which a defendant is required to serve at least 85 percent of the sentence before release eligibility; provides that certain prisoners be released upon turning 65 if they have served 15 consecutive calendar years. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, enacts the "Responsible Coal Operators Act of 2012" to authorize the commissioner of environment and conservation to consider past practices when deciding whether to issue, renew or deny a permit issued under the Water Quality Control Act for a coal mine. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69.

As enacted, authorizes secretary of state to produce a virtual tour of the state capitol, capitol annexes and grounds and to publish the virtual tour on the web sites of the general assembly and secretary of state; authorizes secretary of state to distribute the virtual tour on electronic media, through the state library and archives, to public and private K-12 schools. - Amends TCA Section 4-8-101.

As introduced, authorizes a certain municipality to assess and collect a historic landmark preservation fee for certain purposes; authorizes such municipality to create a board of directors to ensure that the historic landmark is preserved, maintained and improved. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.

As introduced, exempts the sale of gold, silver and platinum coins and bullion that are used as mediums of exchange from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, directs the state oil and gas board to adopt regulations and governing standards for groundwater protection, including documentation of produced and waste fluids, by November 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, defines "fracking" and "trade secret" relative to well drilling; creates a notice requirement and prior approval from the state oil and gas board before any chemicals are injected into the wells; establishes a disclosure process if any injection is confidential or involves trade secrets. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes regulations governing groundwater protection standards that are no less stringent than those adopted by the American Petroleum Institute in Guidance Document HF1, First Edition, Hydraulic Fracturing Operations - Well Construction and Integrity Guidelines, October 2009 or any later revision. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, permits the court to terminate one parent's rights to a child but not the other where certain clear and convincing evidence is established. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 39.

As enacted, requires entity actually towing vehicle to report vehicle registration information to local law enforcement when vehicle is towed pursuant to Uniform Landlord Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Section 66-28-519.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee State Fair and Exposition Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires the department of education to provide funding to certain entities that assist students in the custody of the department of children's services in obtaining a GED. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 49.
As introduced, permits state appropriations or state funds to be made to the directors of schools association. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 21.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee organization of school superintendents and the Tennessee school boards association to collaborate to set and achieve goals related to the general improvement of education in the state. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.

As introduced, specifies that the letter from a physician verifying a person's disability must set forth the nature of the disability, when applying for a photo identification license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3 and Title 55, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes property tax relief for spouses of veterans whose deaths resulted from being deployed in support of peace operations. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-704.

As enacted, requires that the license plates for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom be redesigned upon utilization of the existing inventory of the current versions of such plates by the department or revenue; requires that a new license plate be designed and made available to honorably discharged veterans and active members of the U.S. armed forces serving in Operation New Dawn. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, revises membership of Tennessee wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of financial institutions to enforce title 47 (laws governing commercial instruments and transactions) against any entity regulated by the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As introduced, specifies that any customer installing water service is entitled to procure the equipment and supplies to be used for installation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 65.

As enacted, requires that in addition to the other penalties for reckless driving or reckless endangerment, the court will assess a fine of $50.00 to be collected into dedicated county fund and distributed from such fund for specific purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55.

As introduced, states that after the initial utilization review, additional information or follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health or chemical dependency patients shall be limited to no more than 10 percent of reviews performed by the utilization review agent for the previous year. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.

As introduced, requires licensed psychologists, psychological examiners, senior psychological examiners and certified psychological assistants, as a condition of renewal of their respective licenses, to complete three of continuing education requirements established by the board, which shall be obtained in a face-to-face, board defined Type 1 continuing education activity that pertains to ethics and Tennessee jurisprudence rational to the practice of psychology. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 11.
As introduced, authorizes psychologists licensed in this state to provide impairment ratings for mental injuries in workers' compensation cases. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows a person to carry a firearm during a judicial proceeding if the person is a judge, has a handgun carry permit and only carries the gun concealed while engaged in judicial duties. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1306.

As introduced, reclassifies the Tennessee Walking Horse cultural license plate as a new specialty earmarked license plate; changes the distribution of revenue from 80 percent to the arts and 20 percent to the highway fund to 50 percent to the TN Equine Association, 40 percent to the arts and 10 percent to the highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, prohibits state institutions of higher education from charging a fee to any higher education employee for parking. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding forfeitures of a cash bond or other surety as the result of a municipal traffic violation being transmitted to the TBI. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, increases from $50.00 to $350, the fee for expungement of records following completion of judicial diversion; requires payment of $100 fee prior to issuance of certificate of eligibility for diversion; revises how fee can be used. - Amends TCA Section 38-6-118; Section 40-32-101 and Section 40-35-313.
As introduced, requires department of safety to publish maximum fee amount that may be charged for vehicle ignition interlock device on department's web site. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, establishes a fee imposed on customers for transmitting money through certain entities; requires the department of revenue to administer the collection of said fee; establishes a fund for the moneys collected that can be utilized by the Tennessee bureau of investigation for certain activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, prohibits employee organization from using municipal name for fundraising efforts. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.

As introduced, clarifies that unused municipal school buildings may be used by private child care centers and kindergartens for the purpose of providing educational and child care services to the community. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, authorizes county boards of education, by agreement with city and special school districts, to allow students from such districts to access the county board's cooperative innovative high school program, if the city or special school districts have not established such program. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires the county mayor, county trustee and county board of education to make quarterly settlement of school funds from all sources, including the BEP and other state and federal funds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, permits local boards of education to enter into continuing contracts governing the use of each other's schools in case of casualty losses or natural disasters. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

As enacted, specifies that from and after the effective date of the transfer of the administration of the schools in a special school district to the county board of education pursuant to present law, then the restrictions on the creation of new municipal school districts will no longer apply with such a county. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-112.
As introduced, enacts the "Educate and Employ Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, prevents sex offenders from obtaining or renewing commercial drivers licenses as of July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.
As enacted, revises and clarifies various provisions of law related to probate matters. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 29; Title 30; Title 32; Title 33; Title 35 and Title 56.

As enacted, requires local board of education to approve budget for operation of county schools after the county legislative body's approval in accordance with Local Option Budgeting Law of 1993. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-101.

As introduced, limits virtual school enrollment to students of the LEA creating the virtual school; permits LEAs to contract with each other to offer joint virtual education programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.

As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to file a report with the state and local government committees and speakers of each house no later than February 15 of each odd-numbered year detailing the success or failure of a minor party in receiving recognition as a recognized minor party during the previous election cycle. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, requires local boards of education to adopt policies concerning a teacher's ability to relocate a student for the safety of the student and the safety of others. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires that on state-wide days of mourning for members of the military whose deaths are combat-related, the honor and remember flag be flown in addition to the state flag at half-staff over the capitol. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 9; Title 12 and Title 13.

As enacted, directs the board of the Tennessee corrections institute to establish criteria for determining whether to waive the minimum qualification standards to employ a jail administrator, workhouse administrator, jailer, corrections officer or guard in county jail or workhouse; and prohibits waivers for employees dishonorably discharged from the military, suffering from mental illness, convicted of domestic assault or any felony conviction. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-106.

As introduced, increases the maximum fine to $30,000 for initiating the manufacture of methamphetamine within 200 feet of a child. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53; Title 63; Title 67 and Title 68.

As introduced, changes the date of the first meeting of the joint legislative services committee at the call of the co-chairs to within 30 days, instead of 15 days, after the appointment of the members of the committee. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8, Chapter 44.
As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions governing scrap metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, revises information that must be filed when motor vehicles are sold to a motor vehicle dismantler and recycler; requires the department of safety to provide a means for statements to be filed electronically; makes falsification of required statements, with intent to defraud, the offense of forgery. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As introduced, expands department reporting requirements on the hazardous waste regulatory program. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 212.

As introduced, changes the definition of "home school student" for purposes of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship to require that a student be home schooled the last year of high school instead of the last two years of high school. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-902.

As introduced, expands categories of employees subject to routine periodic drug testing under the drug free workplace program to include persons who work in safety or security related positions. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 9.

As introduced, prohibits public and private employers from inquiring into a prospective employee's criminal background on an initial application for employment. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 47; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires recipients of federal assistance and benefits administered by state, county or municipal agencies to present photo identification in order to receive or access benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.
As enacted, establishes criteria for waiver of employee's 30-minute rest break or meal period by persons principally employed in service of food or beverages who receive tips. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As enacted, allows the name and address of the person that prepared an instrument that conveys or encumbers the title to real estate or personal property to appear anywhere within the instrument; revises other registration provisions. - Amends TCA Section 66-24-115.
As enacted, reduces the rate of assessment for the realty recordation tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.

As introduced, requires certain contractors of department of children's services to petition a court for an inpatient psychiatric evaluation of a child in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37 and Title 49.

As enacted, revises the punishment for the offenses of public indecency and indecent exposure and revises the definition of "public place" with regard to the offense of public indecency. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, establishes reclamation regulation under mineral surface mining law and not local zoning regulations as law governing specified reclamation activities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, defines limited service pharmacy permit as a permit issued by the board to an applicant that wants to provide peritoneal dialysis products for home patients in a setting for services not limited to scope and kind, but to time and conitions under which services are rendered. - Amends TCA Section 63-10-204.

As introduced, increases the offense from a Class C misdemeanor to a Class B, punishable by fine only, for any assessor or deputy assessor to willfully or knowingly permit or allow any property subject to taxation to be or remain unassessed or omitted from assessment, or to willfully or knowingly assess any property at less than the percentage of value required by law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 16; Title 17; Title 66; Title 67 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to study effects of tax incentives on industrial and tourism development and issue a report to the governor and legislature by January 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53 and Title 7, Chapter 88.

As enacted, requires that, if a court wrongly grants a default decision imposing an obligation for child support from or against an eligible individual protected under the federal Servicemembers Civil Relief Act, the court must issue an order to the individual receiving funds that the funds be returned and reimbursed. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 26; Title 27; Title 29; Title 36; Title 47 and Title 67.

As enacted, revises various provisions of the Agriculture Commodities Promotion Act, including provisions requiring certain reports by purchasers and provisions governing the membership of the beef promotion board. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes the peace officer standards and training commission to exempt from basic law enforcement training those police recruits who have earned a bachelor's degree in criminal science, provided they meet other training requirements. - Amends TCA Title 38.

As enacted, specifies that the Tennessee Hospital Association (THA) must use claims data received from the commissioner strictly for its own internal purposes and for internal purposes of its members. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1.

As enacted, specifies that LEAs and school administrators may not prohibit personnel from participating in constitutionally permissible religious activities on school grounds that are initiated by students at reasonable times before or after the instructional day so long as such activities are voluntary for all parties and do not conflict with the responsibilities or assignments of such personnel. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires at least 50 percent of the sample of school improvement plans reviewed by the office of education accountability to be comprised of plans from low-performing schools and low-performing LEAs; deletes reference to education oversight committee. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits promotion of third grade students based on participation in an LEA-approved research-based intervention. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.
As enacted, specifies that charter schools may promote or retain students based upon the students' demonstrated skills on the TCAP tests or upon their grades. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.

As enacted, authorizes a city in a county not participating in a region to join the state regional system as related to state purchasing contracts with approval by the secretary of state; requires the secretary of state to assess fees from participating cities for any additional cost of services under the state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 5.

As introduced, allows insurance providers in this state to develop plans that provide major medical insurance coverage for an illness requiring hospital care, without having to include certain mandated coverage as long as such mandated coverage is not essential to the provision of basic health care for the illness requiring hospital care. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As enacted, requires the department of education to establish within the school system with the most schools operated by the achievement school district (ASD) a four-year pilot program of assessment of kindergarten students. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires full funding of pre-K for students who are in school zones feeding into schools in the achievement school district that the district directly runs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, prevents car dealerships from being held vicariously liable when loaning a vehicle to a customer with proof of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As enacted, revises and adds to the considerations that the attorney general must make when deciding whether to object to a proposed public benefit hospital conveyance transaction. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 68.

As enacted, authorizes county legislative body to allow trustees to invest funds in state intermediate-term investment fund; specifies that any entity that is eligible to participate in the pooled investment fund may participate in the state intermediate-term investment fund. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-608.
As introduced, exempts income derived from stocks and bonds of certain Subchapter S corporations from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As enacted, prohibits title insurance companies and title insurance rating organizations from filing as part of their schedule of rates for title insurance, that part of the charge for title insurance applicable to search and examination in connection with insurance of title to real property located in counties with a population of less than 175,000 instead of those with less than 275,000. - Amends TCA Section 56-35-129.

As introduced, requires a dealer that engages in the liquefied petroleum gas business to submit evidence that the storage of flammable, combustible or explosive material shall not present serious health, safety and fire risks to structures within 1,000 feet of any storage facility owned by the dealer. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 135, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of Teamsters new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, removes prohibition on insurance companies making campaign contributions; removes PAC aggregate limitation on candidates; deletes report requirement on certain large contributions made within 10 days of election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 56, Chapter 3.

As enacted, allows members of the judicial nominating commission to serve successive terms; allows solicitor general and employees of the attorney general to serve on the commission; allows members to participate in meetings by telephone if three or fewer applicants; allows members continuance in court hearings if commission meeting scheduled. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes judge, after consideration of facts and circumstances surrounding the case, to require a person convicted of statutory rape for the first time to register as a sexual offender on the sexual offender and violent sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, broadens the purpose of certain statutory restrictions concerning who may enter school grounds during school hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, provides for mutual consent placement of teachers and alternate options for teachers not selected for positions through mutual consent. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, establishes a pay system for LEA instructional personnel based on performance. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires attorney general to report annually to judiciary committee of each chamber of the general assembly the number of persons prosecuted and convicted of unlawful drawing of real estate transfer documents. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires the department to pay pregnant women who are enrolled in TennCare and living in certain zip codes $50.00 for each prenatal office visit they attend from 2013-2018. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, revises various provisions related to elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-13-203(d); Section 2-14-106(a); Section 2-14-202(b); Section 2-2-111(b); Section 2-2-114(b); Section 2-2-129(a)(1); Section 2-3-101(a); Section 2-3-103; Section 2-4-108(b); Section 2-5-151(c); Section 2-6-102(a)(1); Section 2-6-103(a)(1); Section 2-8-104; Section 2-9-109(b) and Section 67-6-707(2).

As introduced, raises the dollar amount paid to election officials who attend the instructional meeting and serve at an election from $10.00 to $25.00 dollars; allows payment to those who attend meeting but don't serve in the election; raises the minimum dollar amount paid to election officials, judges, machine operators, and inspectors from $50.00 to $90.00 dollars on election day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 4 and Title 2, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the publishing of a sample ballot in a newspaper of general circulation at least five days before early voting only, instead of prior to early voting and prior to an election by the county election commission. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires that aluminum dross be disposed of in Benton County only in Class I landfills, prohibits increasing classification of existing landfills located within municipal boundaries in Benton County to Class I, requires local approval of increases in classification in counties and municipalities. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires any voucher issued under the Special Supplemental Food Program for Women, Infants, and Children to be redeemable only when purchasing items of lesser cost if multiple items with comparable nutritional value are available. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.
As enacted, limits liability of whitewater rafting companies in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, requires health care practitioners who are authorized to prescribe controlled substances to query the controlled substance database concerning the prescription history of certain persons and to make appropriate reports. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy to notify licensed pharmacies and pharmacists of changes to applicable rules, statutes, policies, and guidelines; requires the board to maintain a link on its Web site to applicable statutes, rules, policies, and guidelines; requires that licensees maintain at the sites of their practices a copy of the board's statutes, rules, policies, and guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 53 and Title 63.
As introduced, reuqires physicians to communicate certain information about mammographic breast density to patients. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, requires health insurance policies to cover communication of mammographic breast density information to patients; requires physicians to communicate mammographic breast density information to patients. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires pawnbrokers to file their daily transaction reports with the appropriate law enforcement agencies within the same timeframe as is currently required for the daily transaction reports of scrap jewelry and metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As enacted, establishes priority of right to the disposition of human remains and limits certain liability of funeral establishments and funeral directors. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires a biennial report by the office of research and education accountability on costs of school construction for use by the BEP review committee in considering the capital outlay component of the BEP. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49 and Title 67.
As enacted, clarifies and revises law concerning sales of nonpotentially hazardous foods prepared in home-based kitchens. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, revises definition of a border retail tourism development district to include a district located in a municipality that borders two states and is less than two miles from an intersection of two interstates. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Chronic Nuisance Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of an American Lung Association new specialty earmarked license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires department of education to recommend a teacher evaluation modification to the state board of education enabling local education agencies to set the frequency and extent of teacher evaluations to be completed for high performing teachers; requires implementation of teacher evaluation modification prior to 2013-2014 academic year; requires commissioner to report on modification recommended to education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, extends notice to property owners of public hearing concerning redevelopment plan from 10 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Title 29.
As introduced, requires department to conduct a study of mercury levels present in state rivers and streams. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 5; Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, removes provision that permits clerks, registers of deeds, trustees and sheriffs to retain payments made for special services as a trustee, receiver or special commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 22, Part 1.

As introduced, allows, until such time as the federal government reimburses Tennessee for monies erroneously received in connection with individuals erroneously enrolled in the Medicaid program, the commissioner of commerce and insurance to project income for any applicant on a state-based insurance exchange that would make such person ineligible for Medicaid; Tennessee will not be obligated to reimburse the federal government for erroneous payments if the applicant is subsequently determined eligible for Medicaid. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of finance and administration to adopt policies for writing off or cancelling any checks drawn on the state treasury that have not been redeemed. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 66, Chapter 29.

As introduced, requires that any proof of tolls incurred by jurors must include receipts. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 26, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 4, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 22, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, sets a 10-day period in which notice must be provided by a person seeking to collect a judgment out of funds held in the real estate education and recovery account. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires that any governmental employee, on whose behalf the government chooses to pay the professional privilege tax, use their certification or licensure in connection with their employment. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

As introduced, defines "state law" to be Tennessee statutes, rules and case law for purposes of the provision in the public records law exempting any records from disclosure that are confidential under "state law." - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, allows the commissioner to develop procedures setting forth circumstances under which direct deposit of state employees' compensation may be required. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10 and Title 8.

As introduced, establishes an Independent Formal Dispute Resolution Program for nursing homes, as required by the federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; directs that the program will have three independent members; and explains the qualifications required of each member. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, limits the purpose of any ordinance enacted by a home rule municipality, or enacted by a private act, with regard to an occupancy tax to those that directly increase tourism within the jurisdiction from which they are collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires that the proceeds collected from hotel occupancy taxes be used to directly increase tourism in the jurisdiction in which such taxes are collected. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits a county or municipal correctional officer to carry a firearm if the officer has completed POST firearms training and is authorized to carry by the sheriff. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, prohibits the use of unmanned aircraft or similar structures for the purpose of conducting investigations or surveillance where the investigating agency does not have a search warrant for the property under surveillance. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, creates a credit against the excise tax for a qualifying environmental project, which is a project in which the taxpayer makes an investment in excess of $100 million to eliminate mercury from the manufacturing process and operations of one or more existing chlor-alkali manufacturing and ancillary facilities and equipment in the state. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, authorizes formation of a broad-based school foundation, subject to certain conditions, by a school or its administrators or supporters; authorizes school foundations, although not in existence for at least five years, to be 501(c)(3) organizations for purposes of the Tennessee Charitable Gaming Implementation Law; removes requirement that 501(c)(3) organizations wanting to conduct an annual event to raise no more than $5,000 be in existence for five years; extends certain deadline for 2011-2012 annual event period. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, permits a member to request and be paid an advance on the monthly expense allowance up to 90 days in advance of the date the allowance is due and payable in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.
As introduced, requires LEAs to notify parents and guardians of disabled children of services available to such children. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, creates the local correctional officer training fund through the collection of a 10-cent fee for each completed telephone call or other electronic communication made by inmates housed in local jails or workhouses. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-104.

As introduced, enacts the "Taxpayer Transparency Act"; requires the commissioner of finance and administration to create and maintain a searchable budget database web site detailing certain state budgetary information. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.
As introduced, enacts the "Local Government Transparency Act". - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires the state rather than a county to pay for mental health treatment of inmates charged with a misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, names bridge on Greenvale Road in Wilson County in honor of the late Darrell Eugene "Crow" Sloan.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Land Use Review Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 13; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires TSAC to develop a short application form for use by students applying for lottery scholarships that are not restricted by income. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, establishes franchise and excise job tax credit for job creation under specified circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, removes requirement of separately considering the vicarious liability for noneconomic damages of a defendant and the liability of an agent, employee or representative of the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 39.
As introduced, deletes obsolete references within state lottery proceeds statute. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, revises outdated provision concerning eligiblity for teacher preparation programs and teaching. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, includes "persons" in definition of "family member" for purposes of determining which family members a private trust can do business with while maintaining exemptions from the Banking Act; redefines "family member"; revises other provisions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 20.

As introduced, requires commission to publish synopsis of report concerning level of participation in the grant program for traditionally underserved and underrepresented artists and art organizations. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, increases minimum length of kindergarten day to not less than five hours from not less than four hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, extends the amount of time from 90 to 120 days that owners of newly acquired medical equipment have to register the equipment with the health services and development agency. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, deletes obsolete statutory provisions pertaining to the commission. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 3.

As introduced, extends the time the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities has to respond to the comments from the public meeting from 35 to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 16; Title 33; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, specifies that if a member of the commission on aging and disability misses three consecutive meetings without a good excuse such member will be replaced. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.
As introduced, mandates that all employees of food service establishments or retail food stores shall wear disposable sanitary gloves while preparing food. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, establishes procedure by which taxpayers obtaining appraisals of their property dated after the assessment date of the current tax year may have the appraised value of their property adjusted for the next tax year by the assessor immediately upon presentation of the appraisal, if the assessor finds the appraisal to be sufficient evidence of value. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires the THEC to publish its annual report prior to January 15 of each year, instead of February 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the department to publish the energy division's annual report on the department web site. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

As introduced, clarifies meaning of "arts and crafts" within items to be produced and sold by inmates to include woodworking projects, crafts produced by metalwork, pottery, carvings, sketches, paintings, ornaments, knick-knacks, drawings, sundries, and sculpture. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 6 and Title 41.

As introduced, prohibits an employee of a Tennessee education lottery corporation who leaves the employment of the corporation from representing any vendor or lottery retailer before the corporation for a period of three years, instead of the current two, following termination of employment with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

As introduced, allows the department no more than 90, instead of 60, days to conduct a show cause hearing for the employer to demonstrate the employer's failure to secure payment of compensation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 4.
As introduced, decreases the amount of time for the commissioner to report to the governor after the end of a calendar year from 60 to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study casino gambling in Shelby County.

As introduced, increases from 10 to 14 years the age of abandoned, immobile or unattended motor vehicles that may be disposed of by demolishers without a title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes owners, lienholders and insurers of motor vehicles that have been towed to inspect such vehicles prior to paying any towing and storage fees. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16.

As introduced, requires the department to report to the health and welfare committee of the senate and health and human resources committee of the house by no later than July 15 of each year on the risks of community-associated MRSA infections. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires department to post web site information about assistance to private employers on the implementation of day care services as an employee benefit. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12.

As introduced, adds government operations committees to list of entities to which the department of human resources must submit monthly report of bona fide employee promotions. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 8.

As introduced, requires the department to report to the governor and general assembly on the savings derived from the sale of supplies, materials and equipment deemed to be surplus, obsolete or unused. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 11.

As introduced, extends the amount of time from 30 to 60 days that a complainant may file an application for reconsideration of an order finding no reasonable cause for a discriminatory practice. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, requires commissioner to periodically update listing of employees authorized to exercise functions of notary public. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 55.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 18 as "National Bird Dog Highway."

As introduced, creates Class E felony of a parent failing to make or knowingly refusing to make all reasonable efforts to report a missing child to appropriate authorities within 24 hours of when the child believed to be missing. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits defendants who make an appearance bond from being considered indigent for purposes of a court-appointed attorney. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, creates a Class A misdemeanor for an individual to either: knowingly prevent another individual from placing a telephone call to 911 or from requesting assistance in an emergency from a law enforcement agency, medical facility, or other agency or entity the primary purpose of which is to provide for the safety of individuals; or intentionally render unusable a telephone that would otherwise be used by another individual to place a telephone call to 911 or to request assistance in an emergency from a law enforcement agency, medical facility, or other agency or entity, the primary purpose of which is to provide for the safety of individuals. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires a board, commission, agency, or other governmental entity created pursuant to the provisions governing professions, businesses, trades, including professions of the healing arts, to provide electronic notice 45 days in advance of meetings to licensees who have provided an email address. - Amends TCA Title 62 and Title 63.

As introduced, increases from 85 percent to 100 percent the percentage of the sentence imposed that a person convicted of certain specified offenses must serve before being eligible for release. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 5.

As introduced, specifies that painting and striping motor vehicle to appear to be a law enforcement vehicle, when it is not in-fact a law enforcement vehicle, with intent to cause another to believe the vehicle is a law enforcement vehicle constitutes Class A misdemeanor offense of criminal impersonation. - Amends TCA Section 8-10-120; Section 8-8-219; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 55.

As introduced, creates office of solicitor general appointed by the general assembly to defend and prosecute cases in the interest of the state; revises duties of attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, authorizes the department of safety to charge for copies of motor vehicle records under the Uniform Motor Vehicles Records Disclosure Act. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 25.
As enacted, decreases time a scrap jewelry and metal dealer has to hold items from 30 days from date of purchase to 20 days from date of purchase. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2.

As enacted, specifies that if a treating physician determines that pain is persisting for an injured or disabled employee beyond an expected period for healing, then the treating physician, if the physician is a "qualified physician", may either prescribe or refer such employee for pain management, encompassing pharmacological, non-pharmacological and other approaches to manage chronic pain. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 56.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 385 in Shelby and Fayette counties as "Governor Winfield Dunn Parkway."

As introduced, requires the police officer standards and training commission to establish uniform standards concerning the amount of disclosure of information obtained from the previous employers of a law enforcement applicant. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 38.

As introduced, authorizes retailers and licensees selling liquor by the drink to offer discounts in such manner as the retailers and licensees deem appropriate as long as all taxes that are due and payable are paid on the full price of the product prior to the discount being offered and as long as the sale of the alcoholic beverage is not below the cost paid by the retailer or licensee to purchase the alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, allows the state or any political subdivision thereof to choose certain preferred resident vendors' bids over the bids of the lowest responsible bidders as long as the preferred vendors' bids are no more than 5 percent greater. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires person who must dispossess all firearms possessed because of an order of protection in effect or domestic assault conviction to also dispossess of any ammunition for such firearms. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, authorizes TWRA to issue sport fishing and hunting licenses for $10.00 to Tennessee residents who are 100 percent disabled and receive social security disability. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, subject to local approval, limits the hauling of litter and other materials to commercial or for-hire vehicles specially designed and manufactured for such purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 5 and Title 55, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, transfers oil and gas board from division of water pollution control to division of geology; modifies site preparation requirements for exploratory drilling and continuing educational requirements for drill and site supervisors. - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 1; Title 11, Chapter 5; Title 60; Title 68 and Title 69.

As enacted, authorizes the Inn at Long Branch on Dale Hollow Lake in Clay County to obtain a license as a premier type tourist resort; authorizes the sale of alcoholic beverages from on-premises consumption at the Oliver Hotel in Knox County; changes the meal criteria for the Buffalo River Resort so that such establishment will be required to have food available rather than being required to serve meals at least four days on a weekly basis in order to qualify as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for county or city school systems upon two-thirds vote of county or city governing body and approval in an election on the question by the voters; provides for qualifications of candidates; adjusts duties of the local board of education in county or city school systems electing superintendents. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to knowingly transport or release into the wild, or cause to be transported into or within the state, live wild-appearing swine into or within the state without appropriate documentation from the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, allows home school students to participate in interscholastic athletics at the school the student would be authorized to attend if the student registers as a home school student and meets academic and conduct requirements as required for other students. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, permits retired correctional officers and inmate relations coordinators to carry firearms if certified. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, limits ability of local governments to place employment practices, standards or other requirements that impose or mandate certain employee benefits on businesses that deviate from, modify, supplement, add to, change or vary in any manner from state statutorily imposed or recognized requirements. - Amends TCA Section 4-21-102 and Section 7-51-1802.
