As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Electronic Recordation of Custodial Interrogations Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires commission to suspend or revoke a license or permit instead of imposing a fine after the third violation of certain offenses within a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1.

As enacted, corrects typographical error in Public Chapter 901 by inserting the word "or" in section specifying that remedies under the chapter are cumulative. - Amends TCA Section 36-5-2103 and Chapter 901 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, changes the size requirements of the posted notice for a metals recycling facility. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, requires annual report of the Tennessee Agricultural Museum to be submitted to the commerce, labor and agriculture committee of the senate and the agriculture committee of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 43.

As introduced, authorizes the director of the division of health related boards to maintain a central file of paper and electronic documents and to receive notice of meetings of agencies within the division. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, revises procedures relative to promulgation of rules by the division of consumer affairs. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, increases from one to two the number of free sport fishing days. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As enacted, provides that an employer permitting a person with a handgun carry permit to carry a handgun on the employer's property does not constitute an occupational safety and health hazard to the employees. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 3.
As enacted, establishes provisions governing survival of certain rights of actions in regard to a surviving spouse who has abandoned the deceased spouse. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 5.

As introduced, imposes a one-cent per ounce privilege tax on bottled soft drinks containing sugar; reduces from 5.5% to 4.5% the retail sales tax rate on food, which includes soft drinks. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises the trauma center funding law; includes licensed Level IV institutions in definition of trauma center. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 59.
As enacted, creates a special coordination committee to coordinate transportation efforts of state and local government. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.

As enacted, exempts ambulances from requirement that each for-hire motor carrier providing passenger transportation service in a motor vehicle or motor vehicles designed or constructed to accommodate and transport eight or more passengers, or any motor vehicle transporting passengers who are TennCare enrollees eligible for such transportation services under TennCare, maintain at least $1,000,000 in liability insurance, drug test operators, conduct biennial physical exams of operators, and conduct annual safety examinations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 51 and Title 65.
As introduced, limits right to recover noneconomic damages by a motorist who does not comply with the financial responsibility law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 56, Chapter 7.

As introduced, clarifies that it is not a defense to the unlawful possession of drug paraphernalia that the object alleged to be drug paraphernalia has not yet been used or did not contain a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, adds certain persons to the controlled substance database advisory committee; requires the committee to release certain database information to the Tennessee bureau of investigation and to a manager or prosecution unit conducting any investigation, adjudication or prosecution that involves a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 53, Chapter 10; Title 63 and Title 68.
As enacted, removes the property tax on stocks for loan, investment, and cemetery companies; specifies the manner in which the excise tax on such companies would be allocated. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of the group insurance for state officials and employees to the department of finance and administration; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, lowers tax rate on retail sale of food from 5.5 percent to 5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, increases annual income amount of certain elderly taxpayers who are eligible for property tax relief from $24,000 to $26,500 for tax years 2011 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, delays collection efforts for any taxpayer with not-for-profit status pending final outcome of litigation challenging tax assessment on ground that taxpayer was tax-exempt. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires commissioner to report to comptroller any penalty waivers and taxpayers whom special investigations found violated criminal tax laws but were not reported to district attorney; requires comptroller to report annually to finance, ways and means committees waived penalties and amount of lost revenue from failing to prosecute; corrects incorrect code reference. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 14 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 8.
As introduced, requires hospitals to report annually on community benefits they provided. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-310.
As enacted, requires hospitals to provide parents of newborns with certain information concerning Pertussis disease and immunizations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, clarifies that any person engaged in selling any quantity of unauthorized substances is liable for the tax; clarifies that the presumption that a person is a merchant does not apply when the person is actually engaged in selling any quantity of substances. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 28.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Administrative License Revocation Act." - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 50 and Title 55.

As enacted, provides that a Tennessee Distinguished Service Medal may be awarded on behalf of the people of the state of Tennessee to an individual serving on active duty who has been killed in action, while engaging in certain military service. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1 and Title 58, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As enacted, exempts not-for-profits owning and operating water companies from 3 percent gross receipts tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, requires certain prospective recipients of the Tennessee HOPE access grant to enroll in an eligible postsecondary institution no later than 28 months following graduation from high school. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As enacted, requires that each business that provided disabled parking spaces prior to April 25, 2006, provide van-accessible parking spaces as soon as such provision is readily achievable; specifies that each business that provides only one specially marked parking space must convert such specially marked parking space into a van-accessible parking space when such conversion is readily achievable. - Amends TCA Section 55-21-105.

As introduced, prohibits both the driver and passenger of a motor vehicle from consuming an alcoholic beverage or possessing an open alcoholic beverage container within the passenger area. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, requires longevity pay for eligible state employees who previously worked for health departments of home rule municipalities; establishes eligibility criteria. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23.

As introduced, requires county and municipal legislative bodies to conduct a public hearing on necessity of condemning property and approve the exercise of eminent domain by a majority vote prior to any property being condemned and taken by such bodies. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17.

As introduced, grants property owner, or a deceased owner's heirs or assigns, whose land is taken by eminent domain the right to repurchase such property if the condemning entity does not use the property for the purpose for which it was condemned or if the entity sells the property within 10 years of condemnation. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17, Part 10.
As enacted, designates "Gold Star - Blue Star Memorial Bridge" on U.S. 321 in Loudon County.

As introduced, requires that 95 percent of revenue from traffic violations resulting from traffic surveillance cameras be earmarked solely for educational needs of local governing entity. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As enacted, requires licenses issued by the department of commerce and insurance and licenses required to work as athlete agents, lobbyists, and K-12 public school teachers to be denied, suspended, or revoked, if student loans are not paid. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 49 and Title 56.

As introduced, subject to local approval, reallocates proceeds from the hotel/motel tax from the general fund for county general revenue, with 90 percent being allocated to the tourism fund and 10 percent, minus the trustee's commission, being allocated to the Anderson County chamber of commerce for economic development purposes. - Amends Chapter 193 of the Private Acts of 1990; as amended.

As enacted, allows Anderson County register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents maintained on computers; also allows register of deeds to redact social security numbers on recorded documents at request of certain persons if practicable. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-515.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As introduced, mandates that civil leave and compensation be provided to state employees when they are subpoenaed to testify at trial. - Amends TCA Title 24, Chapter 4.

As introduced, removes exception allowing a defendant not otherwise eligible to be sentenced to community correction rather than incarceration if the defendant has special needs that are best treatable in the community. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 36.
As enacted, enacts the "Victims of Crime Executive Clemency Notification Act." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 27.

As enacted, establishes requirements for retired law enforcement officer to become certified to carry a firearm in this state in the same manner and to same extent as active law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As enacted, creates exceptions to the exclusionary rule for good faith mistakes and technical violations in a search warrant. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, adds language to not construe any limitations on obtaining compensation under the workers' compensation statute to limit third party actions against tort-feasors. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, makes materials containing any quantity of ephedrine or pseudoephedrine a Schedule III controlled substance and exempts immediate methamphetamine precursors if they are not in form that can be used in manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, provides that court or jury may take into consideration the defendant's personal income and ability to pay when determining the amount of criminal fine to assess, if any. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.
As introduced, increases from 10 to 15 the number of days prior to a sentencing hearing that a presentence report shall be filed. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires TennCare MCOs to contract with nursing homes and associated physicians and hospitals in their service area under the Long-Term Care Community Choices Act of 2008. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, exempts food and food ingredients for human consumption except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from the state sales and use tax beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, reduces the sales and use tax on food and food ingredients for human consumption except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from 5.5% to 2.75% beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, authorizes magistrates to require a defendant to wear a global positioning monitoring system as a condition of bail in any domestic violence, stalking, aggravated stalking, or especially aggravated stalking case or in any case in which the defendant is in violation of an order of protection; the defendant must pay for the use of such system if able. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Section 39-17-315 and Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, requires a written memorandum of understanding between a law enforcement agency and a LEA for school policing to include employment standards, hours of training, hours of work and assignment to specific schools; requires under such agreements that alternative schools be staffed by school resource officers who are full time. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 42.
As introduced, mandates loss of sick leave benefits by teachers who falsify medical information submitted to the sick leave bank trustees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, extends period of time from 30 days to 30 business days for county legislative body to act on resolution or ordinance to levy one cent local gasoline tax following filing of petition with county legislative body to levy such tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, prohibits information relative to violations captured by unmanned traffic surveillance cameras from being transmitted to credit reporting agencies. - Amends TCA Section 55-8-198.

As enacted, requires the treasurer to hold any abandoned military medal until the owner or owner's heirs or beneficiaries can be identified for the return of the medal; allows the treasurer to appoint a custodian such as a veterans' organization to hold such medal; imposes other requirements related to such medals. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, requires candidates and political campaign committees to report any contribution received or expenditure made to the registry of election finance within 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, extends jurisdiction to chancery courts for certain claims against governmental entities. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305.
As introduced, extends jurisdiction over claims against governmental entities or governmental entity employees to chancery courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-313.

As introduced, provides that circuit and chancery courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over claims filed against governmental entities, and provides that general sessions courts have concurrent jurisdiction with those courts. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-307.
As introduced, prohibits issuance of a water quality control permit that would alter any ridgeline that is more than 2,000 feet above sea level. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits issuance of a water quality control permit that would alter any ridgeline that is more than 2,000 feet above sea level. - Amends TCA Title 59 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including, but not limited to, marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, requires high school curriculum to include courses on Tennessee history and the free enterprise system, as approved by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.
As introduced, prohibits using cell phone while driving in an activated school zone; violation is Class C misdemeanor punishable by $50.00 fine only. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, creates a Class D felony offense for possessing a prescription drug, which was acquired outside of Tennessee, with the intent to sell such drug. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 53, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As introduced, effective 2012, increases from $1,000,000 to $1,750,000 the maximum exemption against net estate; requires amount be adjusted for inflation every three years; requires publication and notification of any change. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, under certain circumstances, allows members of the Tennessee consolidated retirement system to change from the optional form to the regular form of retirement in favor of a different beneficiary in the event of divorce. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-606.
As introduced, prohibits specified ticket scalping activities. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 11.
As introduced, prohibits general assembly from raising tax rate on food above 5.5% beginning on July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, specifies that alternative schools must obtain the individualized education plan (IEP) and related records of a student entering the alternative school with an IEP. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3402.

As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires department of education to develop guidelines for LEA policies on concussions in sports and cheerleading activities; requires LEAs to develop policies and procedures regarding the identification and handling of concussions and head injuries that are consistent with the guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, limits additional proximate but noncontiguous property included within megasite to 750 acres. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
As introduced, effectuates additional employee longevity payments conditionally included in FY 2010-2011 appropriations bill. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, institutes Tennessee small business sales tax holiday program. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires the department of environment and conservation to conduct, or have conducted, a study of dams in this state that are currently exempt from regulation under the Safe Dams Act because they are diversion weirs, farm ponds or wastewater impoundment barriers. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1; Title 64, Chapter 3 and Title 69, Chapter 11.
As enacted, adds state government telephone subscribers to do not call registry. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 4.
As introduced, requires reports to and by the select committee on long-term care concerning recent long-term care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, creates a special joint committee to study the creation of a department of aging and adult services. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 13; Title 33; Title 34; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, permits any registered Tennessee voter to vote absentee. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniform Access, Competition, and Consumer Fairness Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 5.

As enacted, changes date of presidential preference primary from first Tuesday in February to first Tuesday in March; changes the qualifying deadline for candidates in a county primary held in February in presidential election years from "the first Thursday in November" to "the second Thursday in December" and specifies that candidates in municipal elections held in conjunction with the presidential preference primary election must file their nominating petitions by the second Thursday in December. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, specifies that if Tennessee's lethal injection protocol is held unconstitutional, defendants sentenced to death by lethal injection shall be executed by any lethal injection protocol upheld by the United States supreme court versus "any constitutional method." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2 and Title 40, Chapter 23, Part 1.
As enacted, authorizes repeal of Tennessee River Resort District status by two-thirds vote of legislative body of jurisdiction. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103.
As enacted, adds executive director of development district in which a megasite is located to megasite board. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
As introduced, revises certain provisions concerning payment of claims to non-governmental, nonprofit healthcare research institutions. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

As enacted, provides that real and personal property used in commission of human trafficking offenses is subject to judicial forfeiture seizure and provides for disposition of funds from forfeited assets. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11, Part 7 and Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Human Trafficking Resource Center Hotline Act." - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3.

As introduced, increases punishment for fourth or subsequent domestic assault or criminal violation or order of protection from Class A misdemeanor to Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As enacted, mandates that group and individual insurance policies cover hearing aids for children covered by the policy. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, authorizes court ordered assisted outpatient treatment in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As enacted, authorizes local governments to establish community gardening programs. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes the use of flashing white and/or amber lights displayed to the front of a motor vehicle operated by an organ procurement organization or a person under an agreement with an organ procurement organization when transporting an organ for human transplantation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.

As enacted, removes the six-year limitation on the duration of non-compete agreements between a healthcare provider and an employing or contracting entity; applies the present law limitations on non-compete agreements for physicians to such agreements for osteopathic physicians. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, authorizes certain courts to attach a copy of the court's order to the tax books under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires ice cream truck workers to submit to a criminal background check and prohibits persons on the sexual offender registry or convicted of certain sexual offenses from being employed as such workers. - Amends TCA Title 40; Title 53; Title 55 and Title 68.
As introduced, increases the penalty for the offense of boating under the influence of an intoxicant to approximate DUI penalties. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 55 and Title 69.
As introduced, removes loan companies and cemetery companies from tax on shares of stock. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 11.

As enacted, directs the perinatal advisory committee within the department of health to study issues and policy options relating to hospital discharge and follow-up care procedures for premature infants born less than 37 weeks gestational age to ensure standardized and coordinated processes are followed as premature infants leave the hospital from either a Level 1 (well baby nursery), Level 2 (step down or transitional nursery) or Level 3 (neonatal intensive care unit) unit and transition to follow-up care by a healthcare provider in the community. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, permits persons to be listed on ballot as a candidate of a partisan organization if such organization has filed with the state election commission a petition with 2,500 signatures of registered voters and a copy of its bylaws. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires parents of truant students to attend counseling, mentoring, or parenting classes; requires truant students to receive counseling or mentoring; alters community service requirement for parents or guardians of truant students adjudicated unruly; creates task force on truancy. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 30.
As introduced, authorizes the commissioner to institute dog training programs in juvenile facilities. - Amends TCA Title 37.

As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, requires animals be restrained while in the interior of a motor vehicle in motion. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes all required notices and answers concerning administrative actions to be served or filed personally or by certified mail; if served personally the time runs from the date of service and if by certified mail from the postmarked date. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act for a contractor to require a person to waive a right of lien in violation of law. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 47, Chapter 25; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

As introduced, allows the board of education to grant teachers tenure at any time between their third and tenth years of service; eliminates judicial review of decision to suspend or dismiss a teacher for incompetence, inefficiency, neglect of duty, unprofessional conduct or insubordination. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, relieves lottery retailers from payment for stolen unsold instant lottery tickets if retailer notifies law enforcement and the lottery corporation as soon as practicable upon discovery of theft, and if within 72 hours of the issuance of a police report concerning the theft, a copy of the report is filed with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts manufacturers from certificate of compliance requirement when applying for retail license; allows manufacturers to sell certain merchandise. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.
As introduced, allows common carriers to accept for shipment and to transport the products of manufacturers to points within the state. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2 and Title 57, Chapter 3.
As enacted, authorizes a hospital to designate an entity to report the hospital's discharge claims data with the commissioner of health. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-108(a).
As introduced, allows manufacturers to obtain license to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3 and Title 57, Chapter 4.
As introduced, enacts the Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
As enacted, enacts the "Equal Access to Intrastate Commerce Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

As enacted, specifies that when a defendant commits a homicide or assault against a pregnant woman, the woman's fetus, regardless of viability, is also considered a victim of the offense. - Amends TCA Section 39-13-107 and Section 39-13-214.

As introduced, includes "real property" in the definition of "equipment" and allows the Tennessee local development authority to enter into a loan agreement with a county for the fair market value of certain real property. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31, Part 5.
As introduced, "Historic Rock Castle", I-65 at Vietnam Veterans Parkway and State Route 386 at Indian Lake Road.

As enacted, abolishes eligibility for carryovers for purposes of ad valorem tax equity payments made to telecommunications service providers. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103; Section 67-6-221 and Section 67-6-222.

As introduced, adds certain rights regarding challenges and refunds to the Taxpayer Bill of Rights; revises procedures regarding disputed taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.
As enacted, revises provisions governing obligation to pay property taxes during an assessment appeal. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-1512.

As introduced, removes judicial discretion to apportion costs between the parties and clarifies that the prevailing party is entitled to recover costs. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27; Title 29, Chapter 11; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 29, Chapter 5.
As introduced, adds emergency medical services personnel to mandatory retirement provisions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35 and Title 8, Chapter 36.

As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, revises requirements applicable to ambulatory surgical treatment centers in which abortions are performed in regard to required insurance coverage, requirements for the administrator of the facility and the civil penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 10, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, revises requirements applicable to ambulatory surgical treatment centers in which abortions are performed in regard to required insurance coverage, requirements for the administrator of the facility and the civil penalties for violations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, clarifies that abortions performed during viability of the fetus must be performed in a hospital. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 2 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.

As introduced, prohibits the board of veterinary medical examiners from requiring a certified governmental animal control agency to have a full-time licensed veterinarian on staff in order to obtain a certificate to perform chemical capture. - Amends TCA Title 44 and Title 63.
As introduced, requires appellate judges be retained by 75 percent of persons voting rather than by a majority of voters. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, requires persons serving process to not have been convicted of a felony. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 21, Chapter 1.
As introduced, restores sovereign immunity from liability for dangerous conditions on unpaved county roads where OHV use is permitted. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-203.

As introduced, allows state building commission, attorney general and commissioner of correction to proceed on proposal or contract for correctional services if select oversight committee on correction, fiscal review committee and state and local government committees have not reported any comments in 30 days after receiving the proposal or contract. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 24.
As enacted, designates certain segments of I-24 and I-75 in Chattanooga as the "Sgt. Tim Chapin Memorial Highway." - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 54, Chapter 21.

As introduced, removes judicial discretion to apportion costs based on equity and permits recovery of certain litigation costs by the successful party to certain civil actions. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 27; Title 29, Chapter 11; Title 29, Chapter 34 and Title 29, Chapter 5.

As introduced, authorizes drug testing for reasonable cause of persons who receive public assistance benefits; authorizes termination of benefits of persons testing positive for controlled substances who do not enroll in a drug treatment program. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 18 and Title 71.
As introduced, requires all physicians' offices that perform five or more abortions annually to be licensed as ambulatory surgical treatment centers. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, authorizes certain property to be classified as affordable housing rental property for tax assessment purposes. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.

As enacted, establishes the Blue Alert system to provide rapid dissemination of information to aid in detection of persons when law enforcement officer is killed, injured or suspiciously missing in line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, decreases from 30 to 20 the number of days following a conviction for a traffic violation that a commercial vehicle operator must notify employer of the conviction. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires department to notify TDOT's division of multimodal resources when any county is designated as a "citizen transportation area." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 10; Title 38; Title 39; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires department of revenue to study its administration of the new specialty earmarked plate program and report recommendations to reduce unnecessary administrative burdens to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, requires department of transportation to prepare a long-range transportation plan that includes state-controlled bridges and highway improvements that will be revised and submitted annually to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 47; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.
As introduced, urges commissioner to use wildflowers native to each grand division in new wildflower plantings. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of various special license plates; extends minimum order deadline for certain plates and redesignates certain plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, increases the distance of the required unobstructed view of stopped vehicles upon any highway outside of a business or residential district from 200 feet to 300 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, extends sight distance required for certain parked vehicles from 200 feet to 250 feet. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, defines "surveillance camera" as used in the rules of the road. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 54 and Title 55.

As enacted, clarifies that persons who reside in counties that do not require the display of a motor vehicle privilege tax decal on their license plates are not required to display any such decal. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, declares that bond requirement for all public contracts in excess of $100,000 is subject to change based on the consumer price index for the previous calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 12; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires TDOT to provide supplemental report of progress of Tollway Act pilot program to general assembly by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9; Title 12; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 67.
As introduced, increases from three to five years moratorium between time plate has become obsolete and invalid until re-authorization by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, provides for the naming of certain roads and bridges in honor of certain specified persons and provides for the placement of other certain signage. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, extends deadline for Civil War Preservation special license plates to meet minimum order requirement; authorizes issuance of Music City Alumni Chapter of Western Kentucky University; names segment of State Route 68 in Monroe County the "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway". - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, increases from three to five years the period of time that must elapse before an obsolete new specialty earmarked plate may be re-issued; specifies the type of plates that may not be re-issued in this period. - Amends TCA Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, revises duties of the commissioner to require the estimated dollar amount needed to implement the long range and coordinated statewide transportation plan be reported to the general assembly every year or more frequently as the commissioner may determine. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 54.
As introduced, provides for issuance of Cave Salamander special license plate; proceeds to be deposited in the wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54 and Title 55.

As introduced, removes provision providing that certain highway signs are paid from the highway fund subject to appropriation by the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55 and Title 65.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of hummingbird awareness new specialty earmarked plate; allocates 50 percent of funds produced from sale thereof to wildlife resources fund. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, requires department of revenue to issue dealer plates with distinctive numbering system. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 54; Title 55; Title 65 and Title 67.
As introduced, unless the context provides otherwise, specifies the criteria for being deemed a Tennessee citizen or resident. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 36 and Title 68, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires the board of regents and the board of trustees for the University of Tennessee system to develop a verification process to establish the lawful presence of applicants for admission; prohibits the admission of applicants unlawfully present in the United States to either system. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.

As enacted, clarifies that money deposited in the police pay supplement fund can only be used for the payment of police pay supplements and such other payments as may be authorized by the police pay supplement statute. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, decreases from 10 to five days the time for the supreme court clerks to deliver to the attorney general and reporter the supreme court opinions; decreases from 60 to 30 days the time for the attorney general and reporter to publish reports of such opinions. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 96 in Rutherford County as "James C. McKnight Bridge."

As introduced, prohibits counties and cities from imposing more stringent regulations on a lawfully operated private or nonprofit ambulance service than the regulations imposed on the county or city ambulance service. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.
As introduced, requires license for a facility to perform outpatient elective cosmetic medical procedures or treatment. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes municipality or county that compensates counsel for county election commission to select that counsel instead of allowing the commission to select their own counsel. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1.

As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review current policies, rules and regulations pertaining to transitional licensure options and make recommendations relative to certain items. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, lowers the civil penalty for violations concerning gas pipeline systems from an amount not to exceed $10,000 per violation for each day that such violation persists to an amount not to exceed $5,000. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As enacted, increases the penalties for discharging a firearm into a habitation. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, imposes higher classifications for certain violent crimes that are committed by three or more persons; sets the presumptive sentence for such crimes classified as Class A felonies at the maximum within the range; describes indictment parameters. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, increases the penalty for possessing a firearm if the defendant has a prior felony conviction involving force or violence from Class E to Class C felony and from Class E to Class D if prior conviction is for drug offense. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides that the department of correction cannot incarcerate a prisoner in a private contract prison facility if the security classification for the prisoner is higher than the private facility is designed to house. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As introduced, prohibits recovery in a medical malpractice case for negligent diagnosis or treatment that decreases a patient's chances of avoiding death or any other adverse medical condition when the death or other adverse medical condition would have occurred even if the defendant had not been negligent. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.
As introduced, eliminates post-conviction relief at the state level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 16; Title 29; Title 38; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, requires that any award of punitive damages in a civil action be divided equally with the plaintiff and with the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 20; Title 22; Title 23; Title 29; Title 33; Title 36; Title 39; Title 45; Title 47; Title 49; Title 65; Title 66; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes possession, storage, use, manufacture, transport, and sale of fireworks in Hawkins County. - Repeals Chapter 617 of the Private Acts of 1947.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to develop and implement a reporting plan to track the costs of civil litigation in which discovery of insurance limits is allowed in Tennessee as compared to other states and the federal system. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, requires the popular election of state trial court judges, appellate court judges, and supreme court judges; makes other revisions for filling vacancies. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5; Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 3; Title 17, Chapter 4 and Title 17, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, limits certificates of need to facilities and removes equipment and services from the certificate requirements. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, extends biodiesel manufacturers' incentive fund one additional year, until June 30, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, prohibits the use of cell phones in school zones while warning lights are flashing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, requires that honey sold or offered for sale in Tennessee must be labeled as 100 percent pure or not pure; authorizes any person who suffers an injury or death, or an ascertainable loss of money or property, as a result of a violation of the bill to bring an action individually to recover actual damages. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.

As introduced, provides that the red flag required to be attached to a load that projects beyond the rear of a motor vehicle may be made of plastic pliable material instead of cloth. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, allows certain local governmental entities to enter into memoranda of understanding with employee representative organizations. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 50.

As enacted, includes certain nonprofit entities in Davidson County which operate in conjunction with a metropolitan hospital authority within the definition of "governmental entity" in the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29.

As introduced, deletes the requirement that taxes remitted by NHL and NBA players be solely used for expenses associated with securing current, expanded or new events for municipally-owned indoor sports facilities. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-1703.
As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for residential use from sales taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts solar panels purchased for legitimate business purposes or commercial uses from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, authorizes public library directors to reasonably restrict the access of any person listed on the sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires the consortium for cooperative innovative education to evaluate annually the need for legislation to assist in development of programs enabling high school students to earn college credit and to present its findings and conclusions in its annual report; changes date annual report is to be made from February 15 to January 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes two definitions that are not used in the lottery scholarship program and deletes an obsolete provision. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, enhances the penalties for a second or subsequent conviction of domestic assault. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As enacted, removes the provision whereby only students in K-12 who were enrolled in and attended a public school during the previous school year are eligible to participate in a virtual public education program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
As introduced, removes specifically defined categories of veterinary facilities and excludes from the definition of "veterinary facility" certain premises. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 12.
As introduced, provides additional exceptions to the Tennessee Residential Lending, Brokerage and Servicing Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-13-201(b).

As enacted, requires notice of termination of director of schools to comply with same requirements as notice of extension of a director's contract; requires termination of contract of director of schools to be first item on the agenda of the board meeting at which such action is to be considered. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203.
As introduced, requires health insurance coverage of certain treatments for ectodermal dysplasia, cleft lip and cleft palate for children. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, exempts an animal from having a rabies inoculation if a veterinarian determines in writing that the inoculation would compromise the animal's health, but the owner must still be responsible for the fees. - Amends TCA Section 68-8-103.

As enacted, creates a presumption that HIV acquired by emergency medical worker was suffered in the line of duty unless the contrary is shown by preponderance of the evidence. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51, Part 2.
As enacted, makes various changes regarding child custody determination for a mobilized member of the armed forces. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, clarifies that before returning a severely abused child to the home where abuse occurred the court must find by clear and convincing evidence that the child will be safe from further abuse, including written findings of fact. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-130.

As introduced, requires all public, private or volunteer fire agencies to conduct criminal background checks on paid or volunteer fire protection personnel applicants, and includes rescue squad personnel. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 102.
As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by Hardeman County may be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101 and Section 54-7-202.

As enacted, abolishes certain statutorily created, legislative oversight committees and assigns certain responsibilities to certain legislative standing committees. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Section 36-5-112; Title 37; Section 39-13-530; Section 40-34-107; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, extends the 25 percent tuition discount at state operated institutions of higher education that is presently available to children of full-time public school teachers and technology coordinators to children of public school support personnel who are employed at least 25 hours per week. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, abolishes all special school districts on July 1, 2012; requires municipal school districts and county school districts to attempt to consolidate by July 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, creates a Class B misdemeanor, punishable by a $2,500 fine and mandatory driver license suspension, for operating a vehicle with the intent to obstruct certain private or public property. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor, punishable by fine of $2,500, to knowingly produce, manufacture, distribute, sell, offer for sale, or possess with intent to produce, manufacture, distribute, sell or offer for sale any product composed of any amount of methcathinone that is not lawfully prescribed or approved by the FDA. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, revises the provision regarding the sale of alcoholic beverages in certain unincorporated areas. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, requires a minimum of four hours of daily direct care to nursing home resident with 3.2 hours of nursing assistant care and 0.8 hours of licensed nursing care. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.
As introduced, effective July 1, 2010, requires each local board of education to adopt an AIDS education program for its high schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, prohibits the sale of energy drinks at a business with a license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink; designates the offense as a Class A misdemeanor, punishable only by fine and suspension of an offender's license or permit to serve or sell liquor by the drink. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 57.

As introduced, requires the commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to conduct a joint study, to be presented to the general assembly on or before February 15, 2012, on the impact of the expiration of federal renewal community incentive programs on urban municipalities and the implementation of other economic development and tax incentive programs for urban communities. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As introduced, requires the department of transportation to mark the appropriate exits for certain hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 54-5-706.

As introduced, adds enlistment and active duty service in a branch of United States Armed Forces as a possible condition of pretrial diversion for a defendant who is 21 years or younger and eligible for military service. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, enacts the "Tax Cut and Job Creation Act." - Amends TCA Title 67.
As enacted, designates first full week in March each year as "Volunteer Firefighters Week"; such dates shall not be a legal holiday under state law. - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, permits a county to pay the cost of obtaining and recording the bond required for constables. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 10, Part 1.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding utility districts, water systems and wastewater systems including provisions governing a required bond and annual audit; revises law regarding the filling of vacancies on the board of commissioners of a utility district and the filling of vacancies in the office of a utility district commissioner and removes certain exceptions to various requirements regarding utility districts. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.

As enacted, specifies that a personal property schedule may be amended only for certain reasons and that the failure of a taxpayer to receive the schedule would not excuse the taxpayer from filing the schedule by March 1. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to conduct a study of the statutory law and cases involving the manner in which delinquent property taxes are reported by the trustee and collected by delinquent tax attorneys. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, specifies that the comptroller will serve as vice chair of school bond authority, in addition to serving as secretary; specifies authority may prescribe its rules and regulations and govern its proceedings as it deems advisable; specifies that a majority of authority constitutes a quorum and confirming vote of three members is required. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, removes obsolete reference to the public deposits task force. - Amends TCA Title 9.

As introduced, increases the bond a county property assessor must post from $10,000 to $25,000 and removes the present law provision stating that the governing body of any county by a 2/3 vote may elect whether or not county officials must post a bond. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 18; Title 49; Title 54 and Title 67.

As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to report the status of all local governments' and local government entities' debt management policies, including total outstanding debt, to the state and local government committees of each house by the second Tuesday in March. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.

As introduced, requires the director of the office of legislative budget analysis to report by the second Tuesday in January to the speakers of each house, the education committees of each house, and the comptroller, if the commissioner of education fails to provide the revised BEP funding formula for the ensuing fiscal year by January 1. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 8; Title 37 and Title 49.

As enacted, clarifies that auditee records, intra-agency and interagency communications, draft reports, schedules, notes, memoranda and other records relating to an audit or investigation are confidential and not open for public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, removes specific reference to Tennessee Education Association in permissible requests for assistance from state board of education and for speaker of the house's appointment to Tennessee financial literacy commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 4 and Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.

As introduced, for inheritance tax purposes, excludes from decedent's gross estate the special use value of certain family owned farmland; exempts from additional taxation certain woodland and conservation transactions; exempts up to $5 million or 50 percent of the value of certain land covered by conservation easements. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, defines "quarrying" as the extraction, removal and mechanized processing of any mineral, including clay, stone, gravel, phosphate rock, metallic ore, limestone, marble, chert, sand, dimension stone and any other solid mineral or substance of commercial value, except coal and deep metal mining, found in natural deposits in the earth, for barter or sale for purposes of county and municipal zoning. - Amends TCA Sections 13-7-101 and 13-7-201.

As enacted, provides that aggravated criminal trespass is also committed if the trespasser destroys or vandalizes a gate, fence, lock or other barrier in order to gain entrance to the property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4.

As enacted, changes the sentence for the offense of rape of a child from a minimum of 25 years to a minimum Range II sentence; permits a Range III sentence to be imposed if appropriate. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, clarifies necessity, requirement and statutory responsibility of the county to fund all county election commission expenses including compensation of its employees and election officials, expenses incurred in holding elections, and all fees incurred due to the filing or defense of a lawsuit. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-109.
As introduced, prohibits county clerk from registering or renewing registration if owner has parking tickets within such county that are more than 60 days past due. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, removes the requirement that unconsciousness be "protracted" in cases where "serious bodily injury" results from strangulation. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires all documents, petitions or papers filed to be examined by the appropriate election official prior to accepting the items to ensure accuracy and that filing deadlines have been met; if accepted then it is conclusively presumed that all requirements have been met and the document, petition or paper is timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, clarifies terms and policies associated with harassment, intimidation and bullying. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As enacted, clarifies provisions for creation, operation and governance of certain regional airport authorities. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 9, Part 1 and Title 42, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires state treasurer to study current efforts of depositing state funds that provide specific assistance to eligible state depositories that are community banks, and recommend enhanced efforts to the senate and house finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.

As enacted, authorizes TWRA to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote agency goals and objectives including the development of marketing opportunities. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 70, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As enacted, removes a statutory reference to notice provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act that are no longer in existence; establishes certain immunity for local board of education and school official in regard to entry or use of school property by others outside of regularly scheduled school activities. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.

As introduced, requires annual progress report of governing body of a public charter school to be made to the executive director of the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, revises membership of the solid waste disposal control board, the water quality control board, and the air pollution control board. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of the "Neighborhood Preservation Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows corporations to contribute to candidates and certain multicandidate political campaign committees; allows use of corporate funds for certain political activity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, transfers regulatory authority over municipality operating electric plant that provides cable, video programming, Internet or similar services to Tennessee Regulatory Authority for such services. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Immigration Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As enacted, revises the pilot project requirements for convenient voting centers in certain municipal elections; extends pilot project to be in Knox, Hamblen, Shelby and Rutherford counties. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.

As enacted, revises various election law procedures concerning registration notification forms, times for appointment of election officials, inclusion of voter's date of birth on application to vote absentee, and establishing a mechanism for non-resident property owners to vote absentee by mail. - Amends TCA Section 2-12-111(a); Section 2-2-107(a); Section 2-2-115(b); Section 2-4-102(a); Section 2-5-211(b); Section 2-6-102(a)(1); Section 2-6-102(b); Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Section 2-6-202(a)(3).

As enacted, retains authority for a municipality or municipal agency to participate in, sponsor, conduct, or administer a cooperative purchasing agreement for the procurement of any supplies or any services other than construction, engineering or architectural services or construction materials with one or more other local governments outside of this state but removes authority for such cooperative agreements to be within this state. - Amends TCA Section 12-3-1009.

As introduced, revises Tennessee HOPE scholarship program to permit payment of the scholarship award during summer school as well as during fall and spring semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As enacted, specifies procedures for determining retired law enforcement officer's eligibility to carry a firearm under federal law. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Protection from Secondhand Smoke for Children Act." - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

As enacted, authorizes filings for personal risk insurance that provide for an overall statewide rate increase or decrease of no more than 15% in the aggregate for all coverages that are subject to the filing to take effect the date it is filed. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires corporation policies and procedures concerning competitive bidding of major procurement contracts to be reviewed and approved by the procurement commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 4, Chapter 56.

As enacted, requires office of research and education accountability to compile activities and recommendations of statewide education reform initiatives and report to governor and education committees as requested. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Immigration Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, allows five instead of three corporate officers who are engaged in the construction industry to apply for an exemption from the requirements that they be covered by workers' compensation insurance. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, adds Buffalo River Resort in Perry County to the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption, if local legislation body adopts resolution adopting resort as premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, prohibits public employees from having a payroll deduction to a political action committee or for dues for membership organizations that use funds for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 7 and Title 8.
As introduced, enacts the "Animal Fighting Enforcement Act," increasing penalties for certain offenses involving animal fighting. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, deletes current statutory language that authorizes the commissioner at rulemaking hearings to administer oaths, receive oral and documentary evidence, and exercise subpoena power. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for certain counties or cities upon two-thirds vote of governing body; any such ordinance or resolution once approved is not operative until approved in an election; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.
As introduced, requires the department of education to post teacher effect data by LEA and school in which the teacher is employed on the Internet. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6.

As introduced, requires that 50% of funds expended for in-home visitation programs be expended on evidence-based programs for the fiscal year 2011-2012 and 75% for each year thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, requires a radiologist assistant to work in the employ or at the direction of a radiologist. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, states that the board of medical examiners is authorized to promulgate rules and regulations to administer the Genetic Counselors Licensing Act. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, provides for licensure or certification of radiology practitioner assistants as radiologist assistants. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the maximum civil penalty that may be imposed each day that a person performs any activity that requires a certificate of need without first obtaining the required certificate of need. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, allows the commissioner of health to bring an action to enforce a civil penalty assessed against a deficient nursing home in general sessions court as well as in circuit or chancery court. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, increases from $200 to $500 the amount of indebtedness that requires newspaper advertisements, three different times, announcing a pending court-ordered judicial sale. - Amends TCA Title 35.

As introduced, allows the respondent in a contested case to continue the date of the first scheduled hearing until both parties certify that they are ready for the hearing; allows either party to make a motion to set the hearing if unreasonable delay occurs. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, adds an additional element to the actuarial study of TennCare to include an analysis of the effect of reduction of payments to providers on the provision of care. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As enacted, authorizes a dental service plan corporation to limit participation by dentists if the dental plan is providing or managing dental benefits for the impoverished uninsured on behalf of or as required by any governmental entity. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.
As enacted, allows dental service plans to make payments to dentists electronically if the dental service plan also receives claims from dentists electronically. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 30.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of economic and community development, in consultation with MTAS and CTAS, to study the effects of state and local tax incentives on the economic development of municipalities and counties. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, enacts the "Access to Pediatric Rare Disease Treatment Information Act." - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes the use of a duplicate capias for the arrest or surrender of an individual when the clerk is unavailable to provide a certified capias. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As enacted, requires that in taking into account the child's best interest for purposes of a child custody arrangement, the court shall order a custody arrangement that permits both parents to enjoy the maximum participation possible in the life of the child. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-106 relative to child custody.

As introduced, places burden of proof on agency taking disciplinary action at each step when disciplining a higher education employee, and for final step requires administrative law judge from secretary of state hear the case. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes reimbursement from the criminal injuries compensation fund for the reasonable costs of temporary lodging for the victim of domestic violence, not to exceed 14 days. - Amends TCA Section 29-13-106.

As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals requirement that satellite offices for the register of deeds be maintained outside the county seat. - Repeals Chapter 242 of the Acts of 1899; and any other acts amendatory thereto.
As enacted, requires utilization of census 2010 geography in establishment or alteration of precincts after March 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Section 2-3-102.
As introduced, creates pilot project in Shelby County requiring a seller of scrap jewelry or precious metals to give thumbprint on purchaser's transaction log. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-203.

As introduced, allows clerk of court in which an action was initiated to transmit the transcript and original documents to clerk of court to which venue was transferred through e-mail in addition to physical transfer of records, upon agreement of both clerks. - Amends TCA Title 20.
As introduced, provides for extension of statutes of limitations and statutes of repose in the event the governor declares a disaster. - Amends TCA Title 28.
As introduced, requires a lien book to be kept in the register's office of the county where the land lies. - Amends TCA Title 25.

As introduced, requires the treasurer's annual report to include the total amounts received and paid out of the criminal injuries compensation fund and the number of claims for compensation asserted. - Amends TCA Title 29.
As enacted, names "SPC Michael E. Harr Memorial Bridge" on S.R. 126 in Sullivan County.
As enacted, names "Orville Depew 'Dick' Kitzmiller and Riley Lee Milhorn Memorial Bridge," on S.R. 75 in Sullivan County.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report to certain legislative committees concerning implementation of certain aspects of federal health care reform legislation. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 33; Title 53; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, exempts income derived from cemetery trusts from state and local taxation. - Amends TCA Title 46, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As enacted, requires hospitals to have certain persons authenticate verbal orders. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As enacted, replaces references to mental retardation with references to intellectual disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 10; Title 37; Title 48; Title 49; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.
As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, authorizes commissioner to implement procedure to award certain federal transportation enhancement grant funding directly to established nonprofit organizations for acquisition and preservation of civil war battlefield sites and that preference be given to nonprofit civil war preservation organizations over state agencies. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.
As introduced, requires proof of compliance with financial responsibility law prior to registering motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, makes all records pertaining to licensure or registration by owners of security systems held or kept by a governmental entity confidential; includes all information, photos, presentations, schematics and surveys. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

As enacted, removes requirement that written notice of termination of teacher contain a statement that such notice was authorized by a majority vote of the local board of education with the name of the teacher receiving such note being recorded in the minutes of the board. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-409.

As introduced, clarifies that any reserve balance remaining unexpended at the end of a fiscal year in the Tennessee financial literacy commission's account will not revert to the general fund but will remain available to be used by the commission for commission purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 31.
As introduced, inserts TCA code citation in regard to reference to state school bond authority. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, specifies that restrictions imposed by board of trustees of the baccalaureate education system trust fund program regarding the substitution of another individual for the original beneficiary must be no less stringent than that required by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 8.
As enacted, sunsets the current post-conviction defender commission; creates a new post-conviction defender oversight commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 40, Chapter 30.

As introduced, allows governor to employ additional counsel to the attorney general or in lieu of the attorney general if the governor determines it is in the interest of the state following consultation with the attorney general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, allows private entity to provide a roll off construction or demolition debris container to a person requesting such container even if the site is located in a municipality that has granted an exclusive franchise for the collection, removal and disposal of solid waste. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 211.
As introduced, requires commissioners of certain water utility districts in Lawrence County to be elected by the customers of the utility district. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307.
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 412 in Lewis County as "John Andrew Carroll Memorial Bridge."
As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 43 in Lawrenceburg as "H.O. Sam Garrard Memorial Highway."
As introduced, prohibits department from promulgating rules to impose fees on public safety agencies for the registration and inspection of x-ray machines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 202, Part 5.

As introduced, removes the requirement that a defendant have a BAC of .20 and a prior conviction to meet the requirements of aggravated vehicular homicide and includes, as a part of the offense, a BAC of .08 in addition to any amount of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates to members and associate members of organization without 1,000 plate minimum and allocates 50% of revenues derived from sale thereof to organization's charitable foundation; deletes authorization for National Fraternal Order of Police new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises the provisions governing using a spotlight to locate deer. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As enacted, requires bounty hunters to undergo a criminal background check. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-318.
As introduced, requires bounty hunters to have a handgun carry permit. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-318.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement officer not engaged in duties from carrying firearm on school property during school hours unless the officer shows proof of being officer upon request; deletes requirement that officer notify the school principal. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1350.

As introduced, adds to list of events triggering extraordinary reporting requirements by licensed money transmitters the institution of any official investigation by a government entity with jurisdiction over financial laws. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 9; Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2; Title 45, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the department of education to develop an athletic concussion policy for adoption by each LEA and commands insurance companies issuing policies to certain entities for accident coverage to require those entities develop an athletic concussion policy and procedures. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 56.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Labrador Retriever Foundation new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to Labrador Retriever Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits THEC to post its annual report on its Web site and provide a summary of the report to the standing committees on education in lieu of disseminating the full report to the committees. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, simplifies lottery scholarship statutes by removing obsolete and unnecessary provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, revises various provisions governing utility districts that fail to take affirmative action or provide services and consolidation of a financially distressed district with another district. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

As introduced, requires commissioner of health to report on or before January 31, 2012, with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in the disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires all health insurance entities to report the number of approvals and denials of physician requests for preauthorization for admissions and imaging tests to certain officials in a form that categorizes the information by age, gender, ethnic group and cost savings for denials. - Amends TCA Title 56.
