As introduced, requires health care practitioners to report patient injuries caused or suspected to be caused by domestic violence or abuse to the department of health within 15 days of the date the practitioner has knowledge or suspects the cause of such injuries are the result of such violence or abuse rather than on a monthly basis. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, specifies that injuries to domestic violence victims and sexual assault victims shall not be reported to law enforcement unless the injured person consents to a report. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, exempts information concerning adult victims of domestic abuse or sexual assault from being mandatorily reported by doctors and hospitals to law enforcement unless the patient consents to such reporting. - Amends TCA Section 38-1-101.
As introduced, defines Fairfield Glade as a governmental entity under the Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20.
As enacted, increases the auctioneer's fee for sale of real property at public sale under any order or decree of any court from 6 percent to 8 percent.

As introduced, allows certain fiduciaries and related persons to purchase property of a minor or disabled person without court approval when it is done by public auction. - Amends TCA Section 34-1-116.

As introduced, requests the commissioner of revenue to explore the possibility of developing an on-line filing system which would permit the automatic deduction from the collectors business account for the payment of the tax due on sales of mixed drinks and setups upon the filing of the monthly statement by the collector where the collector has supplied the commissioner with the collectors bank account number, the bank transit routing symbols and number and an authorized signature as filed with the payee bank. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-410.

As introduced, includes organic milk and milk products under the Dairy Industry Promotion Act, which authorizes producers of milk and milk products on a commercial basis to levy upon themselves an assessment on milk products for the purpose of financing or contributing to the financing of a program of promoting, advertising, researching and other methods designed to increase the consumption, use and sale of domestic milk and milk products.
As introduced, requires plants and seeds sold in Tennessee to be labeled to indicate open pollination, genetic modification, or hybridization. - Amends TCA Title 43.
As introduced, requires owners of Class I wildlife in Roane County to attach tracking devices to the animals. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As enacted, specifies that the county executive of Roane County may designate a person from the office of the county sheriff or from the county office of emergency management to accompany an agent of TWRA when inspecting a Class I wildlife facility in Roane County. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, subject to local approval, permits the city of Harriman to raise its occupancy tax from a rate not to exceed 5 percent to a rate not to exceed 7 percent. - Amends Chapter 115 of the Private Acts of 1995.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 50 years the maximum period of time that an economic impact plan can provide for allocating property taxes to a county industrial development corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3.

As introduced, makes technical changes to remaining terms involving mental retardation and the division of intellectual disabilities services to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, provides for additional notice to legislative committees, lengthens certain reporting deadlines and authorizes additional assistance to the commissioner of intellectual and developmental disabilities concerning determining the fiscal impact of certain changes impacting certain licensees of the department of mental health. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, provides that on or before October 1, 2012, any person who provides satisfactory proof that such person graduated from a court reporting program in this state prior to January 1, 2012, will be licensed to practice as a court reporter. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 9, Part 6.
As introduced, permits UT or TBR's farm employees to carry weapons on farms owned, used or operated by public higher education institutions. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1309.

As introduced, increases from three to four years the time period an owner must not have resided at transferred property to be exempt from residential property disclosure. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.
As introduced, deletes requirement that executive director of the real estate commission have passed the broker's examination. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 13.
As introduced, enhances the offense of aggravated assault where death results from Class C or D felony to Class B felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, adds a horticulturist and a person with ornamental lawn and turf experience to the pest control board. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 21.
As enacted, makes the use of precinct-based optical scanners by a county election commission discretionary instead of mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to promulgate rules pertaining to automobile clubs and associations. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Adventure Tourism and Rural Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 11; Title 54; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 70.
As introduced, increases exemptions from Hall Income Tax for single filers from $1,250 to $2,400 and for joint filers from $2,500 to $4,800. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As introduced, eliminates Hall Income Tax for tax years 2012 and thereafter. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.
As introduced, allows Morgan County to use jury coordinators instead of jury commissioners for the selection and attendance of jurors. - Amends TCA Section 22-2-101.
As enacted, designates segment of U.S. Highway 27 in Rhea County as "Tyler Leon Sneed Memorial Highway."
As enacted, revises the manner in which a person applying pesticides may be supervised. - Amends TCA Section 62-21-102.

As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch, and beginning with the November 2012 election to be elected by the qualified voters of this state, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.

As introduced, creates the office of solicitor general of Tennessee in the executive branch to be appointed by joint vote of the general assembly, with all current duties of the attorney general and reporter, other than activities associated with reporting functions, transferred to the office of solicitor general. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 6.
As enacted, makes the jury coordinator law applicable to Rhea and Morgan counties, which were previously excluded from such law. - Amends TCA Title 22.

As enacted, specifies that if a county has been reimbursed for housing convicted felons for a continuous period of three or more fiscal years and has received the maximum amount allowed per prisoner per day as reasonable allowable costs during this period, then the county would thereafter be presumed to be entitled to the full maximum amount allocated per prisoner per day as reimbursement of reasonable allowable costs for housing such prisoners. - Amends TCA Section 41-8-106.

As enacted, clarifies and updates the language of various provisions of law regarding the powers of incorporated municipalities; generally removes archaic language and comports the powers to be compliant with other general law provisions. - Amends TCA Title 6.
As introduced, removes restrictions on county redesignating county mayor as county executive; specifies duties for county attorney. - Amends TCA Title 5.

As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, clarifies the period of time included in statements filed prior to primary and general elections; clarifies that an unexpended balance of contributions in a deceased candidate's campaign account may be allocated to any institution of public or private education in the state. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, clarifies that any legal authority shall be cited in the written denial of a public records request. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.

As introduced, increases size of voting precincts from 5,000 registered voters to 6,000 registered voters; requires one voting machine for every 800 registered voters instead of 1,000 voters. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, allows ethics commission or commission staff to provide information on the status of a complaint to the named complainant and to the alleged violator. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10; Title 3, Chapter 6; Title 4, Chapter 55 and Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.

As introduced, requires counties receiving correctional incentive subsidies to submit an accounting of such expenditures to the commissioner; if the facility has not been certified pursuant to state jail standards, prohibits grant of future subsidies unless required expenditures are made; authorizes the commissioner to reimburse counties for actual improvement expenditures. - Amends TCA Title 41.

As enacted, renames the "Tennessee distinguished service medal" as the "Tennessee fallen heroes medal". - Amends TCA Section 8-30-306; Section 49-7-102; Title 58, Chapter 7; Title 58, Chapter 3 and Section 67-5-704.
As enacted, provides for the manufacturing and retail sale of high alcohol content beer; revises various provisions of law regarding alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, calls for a run-off election in the event that there is a tie for county or civil district office. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Military and Overseas Voters Act." - Amends TCA Title 2.
As enacted, revises filing deadlines for employer disclosure reports from within 45 days of March 31 and September 30 to within 45 days of June 30 and December 31. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As introduced, inserts a statutory citation in regard to a reference to the board of claims in provisions regarding insurance for the state. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8 and Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 9.

As introduced, authorizes a county mayor, when disposing of an unclaimed body at public expense where no relative or medical examiner claims the body, to do so by cremation or burial; cremated remains may be interred, entombed or inurned. - Amends TCA Section 68-4-103.
As introduced, authorizes lump sum death benefit to beneficiary for noncontributory member dying prior to retirement as if such member had been a contributory member. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-107.
As introduced, authorizes Oneida Special School District to issue bonds.

As introduced, increases cash amount higher education employee in an optional retirement program may withdraw upon terminating employment from 50% to 100% of such employee's accumulated account. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.

As introduced, provides that veterans or current members of the United States armed forces who are not residents of Tennessee shall be classified as out-of-state students but shall not be charged out-of-state tuition rates. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, revises eligibility criteria for pretrial and judicial diversion programs. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, authorizes a licensed wholesaler holding a basic permit under the Federal Alcohol Administration Act as an importer to import alcoholic beverages and wine under certain circumstances; permits a licensed wholesaler to deliver alcoholic beverages and wine by common carrier to a retailer only in certain quantities. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 3.
As introduced, requires that a defendant pay $250 upfront prior to making an agreement with the prosecution to suspend prosecution. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, permits home school students to obtain HOPE scholarships as entering freshmen if such students achieve a high school GPA of 3.0 or an ACT score of 21. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-908.
As introduced, establishes tax credit for angel investors who invest in qualified Tennessee businesses. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As enacted, authorizes the East Tennessee regional agribusiness marketing authority to plan, acquire, construct, improve, extend, furnish, equip, finance, own, operate and maintain a wastewater treatment and collection system within the region served by the authority. - Amends TCA Title 64.
As introduced, clarifies that the term "intoxicating liquors" does not apply to any beverage with alcohol content by weight of 5 percent or less. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, clarifies that inmates and their baggage are to be searched for all contraband, not just instruments of escape. - Amends TCA Title 41.
As introduced, redesignates the second Monday in September each year as American Indian Day instead of the fourth Monday in September each year. - Amends TCA Title 15.

As introduced, requires the county building commissioner to return by mail a copy of a certificate of insurance or workers' compensation policy within 15 working days, instead of 10 working days, to the person who obtained the permit. - Amends TCA Title 13.
As introduced, requires that electronic copies of the state owned property inventory be provided to designated officials as well as paper copies. - Amends TCA Title 12.
As introduced, redefines "natural emergency" to specifically include forest fires, hurricanes, and tornadoes. - Amends TCA Title 58.

As introduced, increases the number of interested persons necessary to petition an agency requesting the adoption, amendment, or repeal of a rule from five or more to 10 or more. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer of each entity subject to public records to inform employees and appointees about the requirements of state law concerning public records and the entities' policies for administering public records statutes. - Amends TCA Title 10.

As introduced, requires development and periodical offering of seminars to state employees on financial planning and utilization of state benefits as part of such financial plan. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires every railroad operating trains within the state to notify the commissioner of transportation of the telephone number of its registered agent for service of process. - Amends TCA Title 7.
As introduced, increases from 30 days to 40 days time period prior to effectiveness of a municipal annexation ordinance. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, adds to the duties of the county attorney the duty to consult with and advise other elected county officials, their deputies and their employees as to the application and enforcement of federal and state laws pertinent to carrying out their official duties. - Amends TCA Title 5.

As enacted, extends the period within which an annual event may be held during the annual event period beginning July 1, 2011, and ending June 30, 2012, from within 28 calendar days of the event date listed in the application to within 45 calendar days of the event date listed in the application; makes other various changes to provisions regarding filing deadlines and omnibus lists. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, requires election officials to inspect filings for sufficiency and timeliness; establishes conclusive presumption that accepted filings are sufficient and timely filed. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires the general assembly to provide funding for unfunded mandates which place increased expenditures over certain amounts on local governments; prohibits an agency of state government from creating a new fee in any year in which the general state revenues to the agency have decreased from the previous year. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 53.
As enacted, expands state election commission to seven members permanently. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 11, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of two memorial license plates to recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross and the Air Medal. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes licensing of certain all terrain vehicles (ATVs); allows local governments to authorize use of such ATVs on certain public highways. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As enacted, regulates pain management clinics and requires that such clinics apply for certification as such a clinic with the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As introduced, removes the authority for a municipality to build powder magazines at a safe and prudent distance from the limits of the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, increases the penalty for failure to pay a special assessment or installment levied by a local government on property located within a central business improvement district from 0.5% per month of the amount of such assessment or installment to 1%. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, for purposes of property tax classification and assessment, provides that real property does not include property determined by Tennessee courts to be personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, removes authorization of graduate students in audiology at public institutions of higher education to evaluate, prescribe and dispense hearing aids; removes prohibition on employees of hearing centers at public institutions of higher education serving private-practice patients in publicly owned facilities or referring patients to their own private practices; permits state public colleges and universities to establish and operate clinical and dispensary programs in speech pathology, speech therapy and audiology for the purpose of educating students and generating financial support necessary to operate and make necessary improvements to those programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 27.

As introduced, enacts the "Electronic Publication of Legal Notices Act of 2011"; applies only to Hamilton County and municipalities located in Hamilton County. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54 and Title 8, Chapter 21.
As introduced, transfers contested case hearings currently under jurisdiction of the department of revenue to the office of the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5 and Title 67.
As enacted, enacts the "I Hate Meth Act." - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, specifies that knowingly exposing a child to the making of methamphetamine is aggravated child endangerment. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes enhanced penalties for promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine or initiating the process of manufacture of methamphetamine in a school zone. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires that 100% of the sentence imposed for attempts to commit murder in the first degree shall be served, minus certain credits; prohibits release eligibility for persons committing such offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the setting of bail in certain DUI-related cases. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 11.
As enacted, permits an officer to test the blood alcohol content of certain drivers regardless of whether they consent. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As enacted, authorizes certain persons with a disability to obtain photo identification license upon proof of identity to the satisfaction of the commissioner of safety. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.
As introduced, prohibits rezoning of private property by local government without written consent of property owner. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

As enacted, makes several additions to present law concerning the sale of alcoholic beverages; expands the definition of "Tennessee River resort district" to include a limited service restaurant located within a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes a manufacturer of intoxicating liquors or drinks in certain localities to be issued a license by the alcoholic beverage commission for on-premises consumption of the liquors or drinks produced at the licensed facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.

As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, expands the definition of historic performing arts center to permit the sale of alcoholic beverages and wine at the Relix Variety Theatre located in the downtown north redevelopment zone of Knoxville. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, permits certain entities to limit the liability of a landowner to the entity for certain activities on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, makes a person who is charged with statutory rape by an authority figure ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.

As introduced, provides that if an attorney, post-conviction defender or district public defender in a criminal case is found to have provided ineffective assistance of counsel, that attorney cannot receive any further state funds for legal services until the attorney obtains continuing education, counseling or training that addresses the reason for the attorney being ineffective. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 40.

As introduced, provides that no arrest warrant or criminal summons shall issue without the written approval of the applicable district attorney if the affiant knows the person to be arrested or summoned is a law enforcement officer. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, returns collection of gross receipts tax to county clerks and designated city officials. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

As introduced, exempts any person who has successfully completed all handgun training of not less than four hours as required by any branch of the military from paying the $115 handgun carry permit application and processing fee. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, in regard to forfeited deposits to spay or neuter program, specifies that in Hawkins County forfeited deposits will be used to defray operational expenses of the programs, including, but not limited to, costs for purchasing food, medications, tests, upgrades for the animal housing areas, or any other supplies or products that would improve the quality of life for dogs or cats in such programs, but may not be used to pay salaries of persons employed by any agency located within the county. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17, Part 5.

As enacted, replaces "non-residential methadone treatment facility" with "nonresidential substitution-based treatment centers offering treatment for opiate addiction." - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, enacts the "Telephone Cooperative Transparency Act of 2011," which requires telephone cooperatives to comply with open meetings and public records laws. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44; Title 10, Chapter 7 and Title 65, Chapter 29.

As introduced, requires hard or electronic copies of pre-need contracts and pre-need insurance arrangements be maintained; deletes prohibition against promises of a rebate, discount or reduction in price upon the death of any person. - Amends TCA Section 62-5-409 and Section 62-5-411.

As enacted, specifies that dental hygienists are authorized to perform stain removal on teeth in addition to performing those tasks that they are authorized to perform under present law. - Amends TCA Section 63-5-108.

As enacted, prohibits an operator from engaging in rock harvesting without having first obtained a permit or a notice of coverage under a general permit from the commissioner of environment and conservation; imposes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires local governing body of municipalities or counties to approve location of each traffic enforcement camera placed or located within such jurisdiction after July 1, 2011; establishes penalty up to $50.00 plus court costs. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, operating a motorcycle registered in another state to comply with mandatory motorcycle equipment laws from state in which motorcycle is registered. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 3.

As introduced, exempts from requirement to wear a helmet while riding a motorcycle nonresidents, 21 years of age or older, from states that do not require motorcycle helmets. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

As introduced, increases penalty for failing to provide evidence of financial responsibility from $100 fine to $250 fine for first offense and $500 fine and mandatory impoundment of driver's motor vehicle for second or subsequent offense. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12; Title 55, Chapter 16 and Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Tennessee Self-Service Storage Facility Act. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 31.

As introduced, allows the clerk of probate court to enter an order dismissing without prejudice probate cases which have no order of disposition, have been open for at least 18 months, and administration of the estate remains incomplete. - Amends TCA Section 18-6-106.

As enacted, exempts antique vehicles being registered for antique motor vehicle license plates from emissions testing requirement imposed in certain counties for motor vehicle registration. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4; Title 55, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 201.
As introduced, creates the Tennessee Home Construction Jobs Development Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 60 and Title 13, Chapter 23.
As introduced, requires that the loan limit prescribed for state banks take into consideration the credit exposure to derivative transactions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2.

As introduced, prohibits any private act hospital from conditioning receipt of medical staff privileges at such hospital or an affiliate of such hospital on any economic criteria unrelated to quality of care or professional competence. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, revises provisions governing description of property in notice of judicial or trust sale; authorizes the postponement and rescheduling of a foreclosure sale without further newspaper publication under certain circumstances, unless prohibited by contract. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.
As introduced, enacts the "Prescription Integrity Act of 2011," which regulates therapeutic substitution of medications. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires the comptroller of the treasury to review the land acquisition of any hospital authority to determine whether such acquisition would negatively impact businesses in the surrounding area, including but not limited to, health care related businesses. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, increases the penalty for a fraudulent act or practice in connection with the offer, sale or purchase of any security from $5,000 to $6,000. - Amends TCA Title 48.
As introduced, allows winery to sell and transport up to 3,000 cases of wine to restaurants and hotels licensed to serve wine for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-207.

As introduced, provides that failure of a drug and alcohol test, or refusing the test, in a drug-free workplace makes the injured employee ineligible for workers' compensation benefits related to an injury; removes requirement for proximate causation. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.

As introduced, implements an integrated sex education program in place of the family life curriculum and authorizes parents to maintain an action against an outside instructor or organization for teaching students about material prohibited by the curriculum guidelines. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 49 and Title 68.

As enacted, provides that when the department of labor and workforce development conducts unemployment hearings that personnel records and other business records that are in the possession of a claimants employer and that are relevant to a claim are admissible and may constitute proof of misconduct, regardless of whether such evidence is hearsay or whether corroborated by direct witness testimony, if such evidence is accompanied by an affidavit of its custodian or other qualified person certifying the evidence as a business record. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

As introduced, increases the time in which the secretary of state has to return an application for a construction services provider's workers' compensation exemption from 10 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.
As introduced, excludes employees working under certain employment contracts for 999 or less hours from qualifying for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Section 50-7-303.

As introduced, requires that on or after July 1, 2011, if any private act hospital authority operates ambulance service and such ambulance service carries forward a net operating deficit for two consecutive calendar years, such ambulance service shall be subject to general procurement laws. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, revises various provisions relative to business organizations. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.

As introduced, requires the department of health to make available for public inspection all federal return of organization exempt from income tax (Form 990) for all private act hospital authorities in this state. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, clarifies various provisions relative to business organizations and revises various provisions regarding documents from such organizations that are filed with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.
As introduced, changes references from "names" to "nominees" in regard to appointments to advisory council on workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29; Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, clarifies a reference to the department of the treasury in provisions governing the public utility assistance program for small and minority-owned businesses. - Amends TCA Section 65-5-112 and Section 65-5-113.
As introduced, removes reference to security for public deposits task force, which no longer exists, in provisions governing collateral pool for public deposits. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4.
As introduced, limits increase in value of certain real property. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, amends first degree murder statute to include felony murder, during a felony drug offense, of a law enforcement officer engaged in official duties. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13.

As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26 and Title 63, Chapter 6.
As introduced, establishes provisions governing the employment of physicians by licensed nursing homes and their affiliates. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, provides for a department of health program to augment the provision of adult emergency dental services for indigents. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, provides for revocation of licenses or certificates of a dentist, dental hygienist, or dental assistant if the licensee or registrant fails to pay license or registration fee within 90 days, instead of 60 days, after such fee becomes due. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, creates an advisory council that shall study the potential impact of tort reform measures on anticompetitive activities engaged in by hospitals, insurance companies and health care professionals and whether or not such impact, if any, would increase or decrease the overall cost of healthcare in this state. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 24; Title 25 and Title 29.
As introduced, establishes requirements for skilled nursing facility liability actions. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 26.

As introduced, establishes that procedures for the certification, recertification and decertification of health benefit plans as qualified health plans shall be implemented. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 28.
As enacted, enacts the "Eligibility Verification for Entitlements Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires reference in governor's budget document to personal income and appropriations from state tax revenues from 10 years prior to current year and fiscal year, instead of from 1977 and from fiscal year 1977-1978. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

As introduced, prohibits a local government from requiring a private employer to pay the employer's employees wages in excess of the amount required under state or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, allows a court to order electronic tracking devices for first time violators of orders of protection; requires a court to order such devices for second and subsequent violations; all costs to be paid by the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.

As enacted, adds a "family recreation center" to the list of establishments within 1,000 feet of which an adult-oriented establishment or adult cabaret is prohibited from locating. - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, requires person with two or more convictions for driving under the influence to maintain double the amount of liability insurance, deposit of cash, or bond filed with the commissioner of safety in order to comply with financial responsibility laws. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, increases penalty for leaving the scene of an accident when a minor child is injured from Class A misdemeanor to Class E felony. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 1.
As introduced, requires municipalities to employ licensed engineers to prepare bid specifications and estimates for all street improvements over $25,000. - Amends TCA Section 54-4-204.
As introduced, requires 10 percent of registered voters in district to recall municipal office holder if district smaller than the municipality. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-151.

As enacted, authorizes industrial development corporations located in municipalities in which urban brownfield redevelopment projects are located to prepare and submit economic impact plans for the development of such projects. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.

As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As enacted, broadens transaction exemptions under the Tennessee Securities Act of 1980. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 2.

As introduced, returns administration and collection of the business privilege tax to county clerks and designated city officials in Shelby, Davidson, Knox, and Hamilton counties. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-904 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.
As introduced, regulates the activities of radiology benefit managers with respect to orders or recommendations of treating physicians. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires victim of domestic violence filing for order of protection and respondent to attend one hour of domestic violence counseling prior to hearing on the order; requires costs of counseling to be assessed against the respondent in certain cases. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6.

As introduced, authorizes a court to order a first time violator of an order of protection to attend counseling and pay for such counseling, in addition to optional counseling for the victim; authorizes a court to order a $3,000 fine for each subsequent violation in addition to other penalties. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "J. Marlin Goodman Memorial Bridge."
As introduced, requires officers to ask for proof of insurance for any traffic violation, moving or otherwise. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, eliminates state lottery January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 6; Section 39-15-413 and Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits the back assessment of property taxes on any growing crops owned by certain entities; clarifies that growing crops includes pine plantations and saplings. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 10; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 6 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 8.
As introduced, deletes the retail sales tax imposed on food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, requires that motor vehicle registration plate is illuminated at all times headlights are required to be displayed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4.
As enacted, designates bridge on U.S. Highway 64 in Giles County as "William B. Long Memorial Bridge."

As enacted, authorizes certain municipality located in a tier 3 enhancement county, acting through the authorization of the board of public utilities or other board or supervisory body having responsibility for the gas department or electric department, to loan funds from the gas department or electric department to an eligible industrial development corporation for the purpose of economic development or industrial development, or both, in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54.
As introduced, permits a dependent spouse to acknowledge receipt of notice by written acknowledgement if not as provided under the Tennessee Rules of Civil Procedure. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-2366.

As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the feasibility and recommend ways and means of establishing incentives including tax credits by local governments and the state to encourage people to conserve land.

As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; subject to a hearing, authorizes license suspension or revocation for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires the department of labor and workforce development to create an office of lawful employment enforcement, staffed by three persons, whereby random audits of employers shall be conducted for compliance with prohibitions under state law concerning the hiring of illegal aliens. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires certain employers to use the federal work authorization system (e-verify) to verify the legal status of employees; creates penalties for failure to comply. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.

As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, prohibits any public employer from contracting with a private employer who fails to verify the legal status of the private employer's employees; creates penalties. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 50.
As introduced, removes members of the general assembly as eligible participants in the state employees health care plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As introduced, adds "manufactures or produces Tennessee products, including agricultural products," to the definition of Tennessee-based business enterprise. - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 4; Title 43; Title 44; Title 47; Title 57; Title 59; Title 60 and Title 70.

As introduced, removes additional state sales tax on single articles priced between $1,600 and $3,200; authorizes local sales tax on single articles priced up to $3,200 and requires the $3,200 limit be increased annually for inflation beginning July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-202 and Section 67-6-702.
As introduced, authorizes certain distribution of state sales tax revenues to municipalities within Madison County. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, allows person age 65 or older who is unable to obtain copy of such person's birth certificate to vote by executing affidavit of identity. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 19 in Haywood County as "Reverend Clay Evans Road".
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for businesses maintaining health programs or pension plans in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.

As introduced, requires identification of appropriation items impacting single legislative districts; requires majority vote on each item by full finance committees; requires 2/3 vote on each item for approval on floor. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 9.

As introduced, clarifies that renewal of contractor license must be effectuated 30 days prior to expiration. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 26, Chapter 7; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes an employer subject to certain state employment law penalties to send written notification of the employer's intention to challenge the assessment of penalties electronically to an e-mail address designated by the commissioner of labor and workforce development. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 50.

As introduced, specifies the date for a referendum by which a special school district board of education seeks to transfer administration of the district's schools to the county board of education; requires that, if the voters approve the transfer, the transfer shall occur on the second July 1 following the election. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.

As introduced, increases annual Hall income tax exclusion from first $1,250 to $7,500 for individual returns and from first $2,500 to $15,000 for joint returns beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance allocated to a member who has $20,000 in such allowance to revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.
Enacts "Tennessee Congressional Redistricting Commission Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.
Enacts "Tennessee Fair and Independent Congressional Redistricting Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16; Title 4, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 8, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires records of statements filed with registry of election finance be kept for length of candidate's term of office or two years whichever is later. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, restricts amount of per diem and mileage reimbursement to amounts set in 2010 beginning with the next general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires any amount of postal and printing allowance of more than $10,000 not be transferred to a new member when the former member retires, loses an election, resigns or is otherwise removed from office but revert back to the general fund. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires cost of any remodeling, paint, furniture or other improvements to a member's state office to be paid from such member's postal and printing allowance. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, allows a credit against franchise and excise taxes for the purchase of Tennessee goods or services. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, creates an annual sales tax holiday for eligible veterans on the Saturday and Sunday before Memorial Day; exempts certain property from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, removes the fee that the state fire marshal charges for review and approval of plans and specifications prior to construction or alteration of certain types of buildings or structures. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, creates a sales tax holiday for the first weekend of March and October of each year for senior citizens; exempts certain items. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax certain baby items intended for traveling, feeding, and daily living. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, increases penalty for disorderly conduct within 500 feet of a funeral or memorial service from Class C misdemeanor to Class B misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 3.
As introduced, allows student attending a state university to use student identification card as evidence of identification. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires THEC to develop a tuition waiver program for students within four courses of completing a baccalaureate degree who have been out of school for at least five years. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, exempts from sales tax any over-the-counter drug for human use dispensed without a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, provides that photo identification licenses issued by the department of safety to persons 18 and over will be free to recipients. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to award a community development block grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 6; Title 13 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the department of transportation to award a safe routes to schools grant to the Tennessee contractor with the lowest bid, unless such contractor's bid is more than 10% greater than the lowest bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 21; Title 54, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 2, Part 1; Title 54, Chapter 4 and Title 55, Chapter 20.
As introduced, allows early voting for regular November election starting August 15 instead of 20 days before election day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 6, Part 1.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study establishing grant program to assist first-time home buyers in economically distressed areas.

As introduced, requires the task force on charter schools to study the personnel requirements that result from the creation of charter schools and make recommendations to the general assembly about the impact of charter school expansion in the future by January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, makes a one-time reduction to the total amount of health insurance benefits paid on behalf of current and former legislators, and administrative department heads and executive officials in the executive branch, by $100 million; effective July 1, 2011, for former members and executive officials; effective at the election of 108th general assembly for current members. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As enacted, requires any proposed landfill owner to provide notice to persons owning property within a three-mile radius of such landfill at least 15 days in advance of any public hearing scheduled regarding applications for the construction of the proposed landfill by having signs erected on all roads leading directly to the proposed landfill site. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits courts from hindering the collection of taxes administered by the commissioner of revenue, except as provided in present law regarding taxpayer remedies for disputed taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 18.

As introduced, clarifies that bonds to refund outstanding obligations will be sold and state bonds will be issued consistent with adopted finance transaction policies. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 21 and Title 9, Chapter 9.

As introduced, permits certain utilities providing water to only initiate a rate proceeding once every six years; provides that books, records and documents that authority has access to for rate regulation for certain utilities providing water are considered public records. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, permits polling places to close one hour later and requires that the county election commission give 30 instead of 15 days' notice as to the time at which polling places will open. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 3.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the delivery of community services by various agencies.
As introduced, adds additional restrictions on the use of tax revenues relative to obligations involving the Tennessee Governmental Tort Liability Act. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-402.
As introduced, removes confidentiality of certain nonprofit entity records concerning contractors. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 10.

As enacted, provides that offenses of wiretapping and electronic surveillance do not apply to person who installs software on a computer the person owns if such software is intended solely to monitor and record the use of the Internet by a minor child of whom such person is a parent or legal guardian. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6.
As introduced, changes the terminating events for receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship beginning with the 2012-2013 academic year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, changes high school academic requirements for initial receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.
As introduced, changes high school academic eligibility requirements for initial receipt of the HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, expands purposes for which hot mix asphalt produced by local governments can be used. - Amends TCA Section 12-8-101.

As enacted, authorizes display of P.O.W.-M.I.A. flag at state capitol and each county courthouse and city or town hall on any day U.S. flag is displayed at such buildings. - Amends TCA Title 58, Chapter 4, Part 3.
As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, mandates that employees without a teaching license be hired on an at-will basis rather than on a yearly contract and specifies that the director may only dismiss nontenured, licensed employees for certain conduct. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.

As introduced, requires the local board of education to maintain a record of teacher dismissal and suspension hearings of tenured teachers in addition to the results of those hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

As introduced, permits, on a case-by-case basis, a child who has not reached five years of age by September 30 to enter school, if a parent requests early entrance and the LEA determines early entrance is in the best interest of the child. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires the department of commerce and insurance to cooperate fully with the department of health in all aspects of the transfer of the board of pharmacy and the long term effects of such transfer including prompt submission of any requested documents or records. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1; Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 31; Title 56, Chapter 57; Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 32 and Title 63.

As introduced, permits a city or county that owns all or some portion of real or personal property used to provide health care to sell the asset and use the proceeds as it sees fit, without any notice to the attorney general and reporter; authorization applies only if city or county opts in. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 62.

As introduced, prohibits any local legislative body from negotiating with local police association or fireman association concerning the terms or conditions of professional service if no local boards of education are allowed to negotiate with a professional employees' organization or teachers' union concerning the terms or conditions of professional service. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires that LLPs list partnership interests in the partnership agreement. - Amends TCA Title 48 and Title 61.
As introduced, prohibits a local government from establishing a magazine or gun powder storage facility within one mile of a daycare facility or school. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, prohibits public higher education employees from engaging in activities that do not constitute work stoppages, but disrupt or reduce the institution's educational services or impair the ability of the institution's employees or agents to perform their duties. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As enacted, revises law concerning submission of economic impact plans in Davidson County. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53.
As introduced, makes certain adjustments to statutes pertaining to sales and use taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Section 67-6-202.

As introduced, authorizes the Hamilton County legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.

As introduced, authorizes the county legislative body to call for a special election if the next general election is more than 180 days from the time a vacancy in the office of county mayor occurs. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-104.
As enacted, enacts the "Border Region Retail Tourism Development District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, authorizes certain persons arrested for or charged with misdemeanor offenses, while protesting or challenging the legalization or performance of abortion procedures, to petition for destruction of public records pertaining to such arrests or charges. - Amends TCA Section 40-32-101.

As introduced, allows a person convicted of a misdemeanor offense for the first time who is put on probation, successfully completes probation and does not commit another offense for three years, to have public records of misdemeanor conviction expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes state fire marshal to exempt certain buildings from mandatory sprinkler requirements adopted by local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 120.
As introduced, requires the commissioner of education's annual report to be issued on July 1, rather than November 1, of each year. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, permits use of small American flags to decorate graves at Tennessee veterans' cemeteries on Veterans' Day, subject to federal law. - Amends TCA Title 46, Chapter 6.

As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding public charter schools, including provisions regarding the governing body of a public charter school, public charter school applications, and funding for public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires Tennessee higher education commission to provide data in its annual report on the rate at which students receiving scholarships and grants pursuant to this part graduate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 5 and Title 49.

As introduced, changes from December 1 to February 1 the date by which the commission shall triennially report its findings of the study of independent nonprofit colleges and universities. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, removes authorization for the commissioner of education to remove from office any local board of education member who fails to attend the annual training as prescribed by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to keep on file the certifications for electronic voting systems. - Amends TCA Section 2-20-104.

As enacted, requires any county election commission desiring to use ballot-on-demand technology to have approval by the coordinator of elections 60 days before any election; requires the coordinator of elections and the state election commission to provide an approved list of available ballot-on-demand technology vendors from which the county election commission must select for use. - Amends TCA Section 2-5-209.
As enacted, clarifies counties to which certain court jurisdictional provisions of the Governmental Tort Liability Act apply. - Amends TCA Section 29-20-305 and Section 29-20-307.
As introduced, limits the amount of the handling charge assessed to not more than the amount of the check, draft, or order if such instrument is less than $30.00. - Amends TCA Section 47-29-102.

As introduced, requires payor banks to process items sequentially as indicated by the numbers on the bank drafts on the day items are charged against a customer's account; places limits on handling charges for insufficient funds if items are not processed sequentially. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the department of education to devise an additional alternative assessment for certain students with disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6; Title 49, Chapter 10 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

As introduced, removes repeated language in the provisions governing the qualifications for a barber instructor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 50; Title 56; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, makes changes to the membership and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As enacted, requires the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the current elementary and secondary curriculum standards for the subject of United States and Tennessee government. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, creates offenses of use and possession of certain devices with the intent to commit, aid, or abet any unlawful activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As introduced, requires a retailer to disclose that instructions provided with a good are not in English. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As introduced, requires licensed motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers to maintain records of each vehicle purchased for seven years rather than three. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2; Title 55 and Title 62, Chapter 9, Part 1.
As introduced, creates joint congressional communications committee of general assembly; authorizes changing of congressional districts between apportionment. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 3.

As enacted, requires the first AED received by a school to be placed in a location that can be readily accessed, which may include those areas used for physical education or activity. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-122.
As introduced, lowers maximum rate that municipalities are authorized to charge for hotel occupancy tax from 5% to 4%. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.

As enacted, allows state agencies to provide free and discounted services to the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation; requires that the Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation bear any costs associated with the operation of the general assembly's chambers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.
As enacted, specifies the manner of obtaining fingerprints of certain applicants under the Uniform Debt-Management Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 55.

As enacted, specifies that all records containing the results of individual teacher evaluations administered pursuant to the policies, guidelines, and criteria adopted by the state board of education would be treated as confidential and would not be open to the public; specifies that the LEA, public charter school, state board of education, or department of education may access and utilize such records as required to fulfill their lawful functions. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As enacted, allows taxpayers and the commissioner or the commissioner's delegate to enter into agreements extending the one-year statute of limitations period for filing suits in chancery court challenging denied claims for refund. - Amends TCA Section 67-1-1802.

As enacted, authorizes the issuance of revenue or letter rulings on an expedited basis; allows the commissioner to determine a reasonable fee for such service, subject to certain specified maximum amounts. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As enacted, revises various provisions related to the notice of the right to foreclose that must be sent by the lender to the debtor prior to foreclosure; effective January 1, 2013, deletes certain notice requirements. - Amends TCA Section 35-5-117.
As enacted, enacts the "Tourism Development Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative form of mandatory outpatient treatment. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, reestablishes the judicial council with a sunset date of two years; requires judicial council to meet twice a year while legislature is in session. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 16, Chapter 21, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes the investigative panel of the court of the judiciary to request that a judge file a written response to a complaint filed against the judge within 20, rather than 30, days after service of notice. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 5.

As enacted, permits the district attorney to apply for an order to wiretap if the interception may provide evidence of a criminal gang offense by a criminal gang member. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes the board for licensing health care facilities to establish rules and regulations concerning the operation and licensing of pain management facilities. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, authorizes a municipality to issue revenue bonds for a public facility acquired, improved or constructed by a third party including a private entity, notwithstanding any local charter provision or other law to the contrary. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 32 and Title 7, Chapter 33.

As introduced, clarifies that alcoholic beverages may be served in any structure, location, open air or dining facility located on Blackberry Farm property. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102(20)(F)(iii) and Section 57-4-203.

As introduced, deletes the authorization in present law that two or more central business improvement districts may overlap and encompass some or all of the same properties. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 84.

As introduced, requires the governor to proclaim a statewide day of mourning for any member of the armed services who dies as a result of injuries sustained from a service connected, combat-related cause. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

As introduced, authorizes the governor to proclaim a statewide day of mourning for any member of the armed services who dies as a result of injuries sustained from a service connected, combat-related cause. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-406.

As introduced, redefines city governing body to include board of mayor and aldermen as it applies to the consolidation of certain governmental and corporate functions, and to the creation of metropolitan governments. - Amends TCA Section 7-1-101 and Section 68-211-835.

As enacted, specifies that no contract offered by any insurer, dental service plan, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental services, and no contract or participating provider agreement with a dentist may require that a dentist who is a participating provider, provide services to an enrollee at a fee set by, or subject to the approval of, the dental service plan, insurer, third party administrator or other party that covers any dental plan services unless the dental services are covered services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 10.

As introduced, requires principal to consider best interests of child before permitting a child to delay entering school after reaching the mandatory age for beginning school; revises from 30 to 15 days when a child withdrawn from a public school must re-enter public school or be home-schooled. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3001.
As introduced, authorizes persons to ride a motorcycle without a helmet if they are 21 and have at least $15,000 of medical insurance coverage. - Amends TCA Section 55-9-302.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises procedure for determining the tax on the privilege of participating in an amusement; to be determined annually by the county legislative body in accordance with established criteria, rather than imposing a set fee. - Amends Chapter 2 of the Private Acts of 1981; as amended.
As enacted, makes various changes to home school requirements. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3050.

As introduced, requires each LEA to determine each student's, and each health care facility to determine each patient's, citizenship and immigration status; aggregate reports of students and patients to be delivered to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 49 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, allows court to infer that DNA obtained from exculpatory evidence does not match applicant's profile and that offense was committed solely by person whose DNA profile is derived from such evidence. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 30, Part 3.

As introduced, requires school year to begin no earlier than fourth Monday in August unless the department of education grants a waiver; requires department to create a timeline detailing how state will meet federal school choice notification requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits personnel from MTAS, CTAS, the state planning office, regional development districts or human resource agencies from assisting state or local government in the selection process for professional services.
As introduced, requires delegates from Tennessee attending a federal constitutional convention to vote according to the demands of the Tennessee general assembly.

As introduced, directs the general assembly to appoint a committee to review all federal laws and regulations for constitutionality; requires the committee to submit for a vote of the general assembly all federal laws and regulations it deems to be invalid under the Tennessee or federal constitutions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, allows homeless person to vote at county election commission office; requires such person to execute affidavit of identity prior to voting. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 2 and Title 2, Chapter 7.
As enacted, establishes job qualifications for directors of local emergency management agencies. - Amends TCA Title 58.

As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school, reduces the number of years in which the HOPE scholarships may be received from five to four and alters the dual enrollment grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, creates new offenses involving motor fuel transporters offloading motor fuel at a retail station. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

As introduced, redefines owner for purposes of mechanics' and materialmen's liens to specify that an owner is an owner of real property that a lien claimant seeks to attach or sell under process. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 11.

As introduced, requires the re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for counties or municipalities operating school systems; provides for qualifications of candidates. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-203 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 3.

As introduced, establishes a conclusive presumption that a beryllium employee, employee with cancer or silicosis, or other employee covered under the federal Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation Act has an occupational disease for the purposes of state workers' compensation claim. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, enacts the "Pay Equity in the Workplace Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As enacted, directs the state board of education, in consultation with the department of education, to review the curriculum standards for civics education to determine whether the course of instruction in all public schools is designed to effectively and rigorously educate children in local, state and federal government. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 10.
As introduced, makes various changes to the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
As introduced, revises the Tennessee Title Pledge Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.

As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, excludes certain residential mortgage transactions from the application of the Tennessee Home Loan Protection Act; creates a pilot project in Shelby County for voluntary mediation prior to the foreclosure of loans entered into under such act. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45, Chapter 20, Part 1.
As introduced, requires mortgage counselor be consulted before an adjustable rate mortgage can be completed. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, creates presumption that person making sale of tangible personal property to persons in this state that have been solicited by independent contractors or other representatives in Tennessee is responsible for sales tax on such sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, requires employers to pay tipped employees wages at a rate of at least $6.55 per hour. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 2.
As introduced, provides for discounted rates to certain uninsured persons for emergency, inpatient or outpatient care at licensed healthcare facilities. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes juvenile court to hold a hearing and take evidence if necessary before determining whether a parent is indigent; states that indigent parent shall not be required to pay for child's nonsecure alternate accommodations. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 37.
As enacted, allows commission to assess costs for administrative hearings; revises certain requirements for servers permit. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, changes name of Tennessee highway patrol to be Tennessee state patrol. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16; Title 38, Chapter 8; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes a municipal electric system to provide cable and Internet related services in an area 10 miles beyond the system's service area. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 1 and Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 6.
As enacted, clarifies that misdemeanor probation services may also be provided by a public company other than a municipality or county. - Amends TCA Section 40-35-302.

As enacted, requires approaching vehicles to move into other lane from a stationary utility vehicle with flashing lights if such lane change can be safely made. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, revises retirement provisions for general sessions judges, from Group 1 to Group 4 level. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the period of time in which a person cited for not wearing flotation device must provide proof of legal age; extends from 30 to 45 days time for proving age may be extended at discretion of officer. - Amends TCA Title 69.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding high-voltage lines. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 103.

As introduced, requires the statewide policy council for the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities to attend to identifying issues relating to delivering health care to the department's service recipients with particular attention to issues involving TennCare and health care facilities regulated by the department of health. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, imposes $4.00 fee on each new case filed in all courts, instead of earmarking $2.00 out of all the general filing fees already charged by court clerks, for computer hardware purchases or replacement; in Knox County, makes same $4.00 fee mandatory instead of authorizing clerk to charge $2.00 data entry fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.

As introduced, provides that nonexempt methamphetamine precursors may only be sold after pharmacist has consulted with prospective buyer and has no reason to believe that the person will use it in the illegal manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, creates David Crockett commission to oversee erection of monument or statue honoring David Crockett.

As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7.

As introduced, deletes statutory requirement that certain health clubs post either a bond of $25,000 or an audited financial statement with the department of commerce and insurance. - Amends TCA Section 47-18-321.
As introduced, provides for TennCare and health insurance coverage of telemedicine services. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 71.
As introduced, authorizes state agencies to provide free and discounted services to Tennessee Intercollegiate State Legislature Foundation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 20.
As enacted, allows city of New Market to permit nonresident property owners to vote in municipal elections upon 2/3 approval of municipal legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-53-102.

As introduced, increases from one to two years the expiration date of temporary permits the board may issue to dietitians, and increases the renewal period from six months to one year. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As enacted, establishes state house of representatives districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As enacted, establishes state senate districts. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As enacted, establishes the state's congressional districts. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
As introduced, makes appropriations to defray the costs of certain enactments of the 2011 annual session of the 107th General Assembly.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As enacted, revises various provisions of law governing taxes, including certain sales tax and franchise/excise tax credit provisions. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 49; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.

As enacted, revises various tax provisions including provisions regarding gains on sales of assets designated as goodwill and Class VII assets, local option taxes with respect to industrial and farm machinery, sales tax credits to dealers, and electronic tax return filings and payments. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 67 and Chapter 1134 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As enacted, delays effective date of certain streamlined sales tax provisions until July 1, 2013; specifies that if the headquarters staff employee position does not remain filled during the investment period, the taxpayer must repay any franchise tax credit or refund taken relating to such position, plus interest; extends certain filing deadlines when due date falls on legal holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67; and Chapter 530 of the Public Acts of 2009 and Chapter 602 of the Public Acts of 2007.

As introduced, decreases from four to three the number of directors for the authority by removing position presently filled by joint agreement among the governor, the speaker of the senate and the speaker of the house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding charter schools, including provisions governing students eligible to attend; removes caps on number of public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, revises requirements to be commissioner of education to only require the commissioner to have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.

As introduced, removes the requirement that if the commissioner of education ceases to be the commissioner, then such former commissioner must remain a member of the teacher evaluation advisory committee until the committee ceases to exist. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302.

As introduced, authorizes the secretary of state to make a determination regarding whether or not a publication is a "newspaper of general circulation" for purposes of the publication of notices relative to foreclosures, land sales, transactions involving real property, or other legal notices required by statute. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 17; Title 18; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 46; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 59; Title 61; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69 and Title 70.
