As introduced, clarifies that a manager of a school placed in the achievement school district will determine whether a teacher may continue "employment," instead of "teaching," at the school. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.

As enacted, changes date by which assignments for the following school year and notices of termination must be sent to school personnel from May 15 to June 15; specifies that director of schools must decide if a teacher is qualified for an open position; changes various requirements for obtaining tenure and other tenure-related provisions. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5.

As enacted, enables students who first received the Tennessee HOPE scholarship, HOPE access grant or HOPE scholarship for nontraditional students in the fall semester 2009 or thereafter, to receive such lottery-funded scholarships and grants in the summer semester, in addition to the fall and spring semesters; revises the law on terminating events for the HOPE scholarship or access grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4.

As introduced, increases the grace period for active military members stationed outside of continental United States to renew vehicle registrations from "14 days" to "30 days" after the member's return to the state; revises when a registration plate must be attached to the rear of a truck. - Amends TCA Title 55; Title 65 and Title 66.

As enacted, creates exception for commercial driver license holders and violations occurring in a commercial motor vehicle to the prohibition on the department of safety suspending a driver license for failing to appear in court on a traffic citation unless the request for suspension is made within six months of the violation. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502(a)(1)(l).

As enacted, authorizes a court to order defendants who are in custody and are found not guilty by reason of insanity of a felony offense against the person, such as felony sex offenses, assaults, kidnappings, and robberies, to remain in custody after the verdict to receive an outpatient mental health evaluation. - Amends TCA Section 33-7-303(a).

As enacted, redefines "developmental disability"; makes technical changes to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 4; Title 5; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 37; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71, Chapter 6.

As introduced, specifies that authorization for commissioner of health to remove non-narcotic, over the counter drugs from schedule of dangerous drugs does not apply to non-exempt products containing an immediate methamphetamine precursor that must be kept behind the pharmacy counter. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-403.
As enacted, specifies proper venue for proceedings in which a child who is in the custody of the department of children's services is alleged to be unruly. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-111.
As introduced, specifies that assistance under the program for the care and treatment of persons suffering from hemophilia would be subject to availability of funds. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, adds the conference of state bank supervisors and the money transmitter regulators association to list of entities to which the department of financial institutions may release confidential information concerning licensees and applicants, if such organizations enter into confidentiality agreements with the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 7.

As enacted, authorizes the commissioner to require assignments of independent review organizations on a random basis if random assignments are required by the U.S. department of health and human services. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 61.

As enacted, removes provisions regarding the small employer carrier committee and risk-assuming and reinsuring carriers under the Tennessee Small Employer Group Health Coverage Reform Act and rewrites law regarding accident and sickness insurance rates. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, enacts the "Revised Tennessee Captive Insurance Act." - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 13.
As enacted, extends the tax on intermediate care facilities for the mentally retarded to July 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Section 68-11-830.
As introduced, exempts certain persons or entities from requirement to obtain a license as a general contractor or home improvement contractor. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
As enacted, designates segment of State Highway 109 in Sumner County as "Tommy Marlin Highway."
As introduced, revises the licensing of elevators. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 121.

As introduced, decreases the time an insurer of commercial risk insurance has to file rates, supplementary rate information, policy forms and endorsements with the commissioner from 15 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5, Part 3.

As introduced, renames the position of small business advocate the small business center and transfers the function from the office of the comptroller of the treasury to the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 8, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Section 12-3-813.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Job Tax Credit Act." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee New Entrepreneur Tax Credit Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As enacted, revises various provisions of workers' compensation law regarding construction services providers. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.
As introduced, authorizes the use of telemedicine to provide medical care to prisoners in a jail or workhouse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 41; Title 63 and Title 68.
As introduced, delays implementation of the voter confidence act for two years. - Amends TCA Title 2, and Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2008 as amended by Chapter 612 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Section 45-17-102; Section 45-17-103; Section 45-17-104; Section 45-17-105; Section 45-17-106; Section 45-17-107; Section 45-17-108; Section 45-17-109; Section 45-17-110; Section 45-17-111; Section 45-17-113; Section 45-17-114; Section 45-17-115; Section 45-17-116; Section 45-17-117; Section 45-17-118 and Section 45-17-119.
As introduced, redefines check and defines payment instrument for the purposes of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.
As introduced, lowers the required amount of net assets that an applicant must have to be eligible for a pawnbroker's license from $75,000 to $50,000. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires reports concerning title pledge lenders to be submitted annually rather than biennially. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 15.
As enacted, revises various provisions of law regarding deferred presentment services. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 17.

As enacted, allows law enforcement agencies to exchange confiscated firearms with other law enforcement agencies for body armor and ammunition as well as for other firearms. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As enacted, authorizes the acceptance of partial payment of delinquent property taxes by the county trustee under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-2001.
As introduced, requires businesses to show evidence of payment of personal property taxes prior to issuance of a business license. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-723.
As introduced, requires that all property taxes be paid in full on any property subject to the Property Tax Freeze Act. - Amends TCA Section 67-5-705.
As introduced, revises qualifications for being elected or appointed to office of sheriff. - Amends TCA Section 8-8-102.
As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, allows theater in Knox County to sell alcoholic beverages for consumption on premises. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, requires commissioner of human resources to develop criteria to distinguish applicants based on applicants' unique characteristics, history and abilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 30, Part 3.

As introduced, restates authority for counties, cities and towns to take property by eminent domain for a public purpose; revises the procedure for resolving just compensation issues when counties, cities and towns take property by eminent domain for a public purpose. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20; Title 29, Chapter 17 and Title 29, Chapter 16.

As introduced, enacts the "Lawful Presence Enforcement Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 29; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 55; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, enacts the "White-tailed Deer Breeding and Farming Act." - Amends TCA Title 44; Section 70-4-403 and Section 70-4-413.

As enacted, provides that the marketing, sale, offering for sale, issuance, making, proposing to make and administration of a service contract shall not be construed to be the business of insurance and shall be exempt from regulation as insurance pursuant to title 56. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, directs the department of revenue and the department of finance and administration to promptly furnish certain information required for the state funding board to estimate state revenues for the upcoming fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 9-4-5202.
As enacted, creates the Tennessee interagency cash flow committee. - Amends TCA Section 4-29-234 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 6.
As enacted, adds "unmanned free-floating devices capable of producing an open flame, such as, but not limited to sky lanterns" to the definition of special fireworks.

As introduced, permits a temporary license or permit for beer to be issued for events sanctioned by a municipal or county government to be held in conjunction with a fair or on publicly owned municipal parks, streets or sidewalks where the event is held within the municipality and the streets are cordoned off to permit only foot traffic. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, removes certain responsibilities of the executive director of the district public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes utilities to send notices of discontinued service by electronic mail for nonpayment of services. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, clarifies the responsibility of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority to preserve universal service consisting of basic local exchange telephone service at comparable rates and carrier of last resort obligations for rural incumbent local exchange telephone companies and telephone cooperatives. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, makes certified nurse assistant services for certain quadriplegics a covered medical service under TennCare. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires court to consider the behavior and attitude each parent has displayed with regard to familial obligations, including but not limited to any instances of adultery while married to the child's other parent, when making a custody determination. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 4 and Title 36, Chapter 6.
As introduced, exempts new, and newly relocated, small businesses from excise tax liability for a period of five consecutive tax years. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, prohibits budgetary expenditures on programs enacted by congress without constitutional authority or funding. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.
As introduced, clarifies that electric cooperatives have no authority to offer incentives that effectively exclude or limit the use of alternative fuel sources. - Amends TCA Section 65-25-205.

As enacted, creates an exception to the general prohibition against assigning security interests in trust funds that are held for use in connection with the purchase of motor vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 35; Title 47 and Title 55.

As introduced, designates, as confidential records, certain information submitted to local industrial development corporations by applicant seeking PILOT benefits. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, increases the penalty for a second, third, or subsequent offense of selling of secondhand mattresses without the required tag. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.

As introduced, creates various gun show offenses, including prohibiting any person who is not a licensed firearms dealer from transferring a firearm to another person if any part of the transfer takes place at a gun show or within 1,000 feet of a gun show. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires comprehensive energy audits of state buildings, state-owned facilities and commercial buildings, with audit results to be conspicuously displayed in the buildings. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 13.
As introduced, establishes manner for determining years of service under certain voluntary separation plans. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51.

As introduced, grants an across-the-board salary increase of $2,000 to each full-time employee and a proportionate share to each part-time employee of UT and TBR for the fiscal year that begins July 1, 2011, and ends on June 30, 2012.
As introduced, includes livestock and equine animals in the class of animals protected against aggravated cruelty to animals. - Amends TCA Section 39-14-212.
As introduced, enacts the Tennessee Animal Abuser Registry. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, requires notice and opportunity to be heard, as well as appeals process, for issuance of permits for drilling oil and natural gas. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Section 69-3-105.
As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, establishes a two-year adult offender re-entry demonstration pilot project. - Amends TCA Title 40 and Title 41.

As introduced, encourages racial, gender and ethnic diversity among the appointed membership of a transitional planning commission created pursuant to a Section 49-2-502 transfer of a special school district to the county. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.
As introduced, establishes a report card for parents in order to encourage parental involvement and accountability in public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, deletes the energy efficient schools initiative and transfers remaining amounts in the energy efficient schools council fund to the lottery for education account. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49.

As introduced, makes possession of between 1/1000 and 1/8 of an ounce of marijuana a fine only $250 minimum Class A misdemeanor with the first $250 of the amount of the fine going to the drug court in the county of conviction. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.
As enacted, clarifies certain provisions governing the casting of a provisional ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires the department of human services to expend at least 2 percent of the Child Care and Development Funds block grant on activities to improve the quality of child care. - Amends TCA Section 71-3-502.
As introduced, prohibits requiring vendors with the state of Tennessee to waive any legal remedies against the state. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 12.

As introduced, permits city and special school district with boundaries contiguous with the city limits to specify by contract that funding from the city to the district shall be used half for operations of the district and half for bond issue for maintenance and construction at existing schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As enacted, permits a city and a special school district with coterminous boundaries to specify by contract that city funding for the district shall be used half for district operations and half for issuance of bonds and, upon agreement of the city legislative body and the school board at the time that the bonds are issued, proceeds of any such bond issue shall be used for maintenance and construction at schools existing at the time the bonds are issued. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As introduced, tolls statute of limitations for filing claim against state employee with claims commission as of the date suit is filed or criminal prosecution instituted in which claimant and employee or employee's agency participate. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-402.

As introduced, prohibits governmental entities from denying access to records available for public inspection because a governmental entity is involved in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding or contemplating involvement in civil litigation or a criminal proceeding, provided that such records were in existence and available for public inspection prior to initiation or contemplation of the litigation or proceeding. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires the department to promulgate as a rule by means of cross-reference the manual relating to the child care certificate program and requires administrative hearings in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires certain government-run proceedings that impose sanctions against a licensed entity to include notice and a hearing before an administrative law judge, and further clarifies that such licensed entity does not have to waive such rights when contracting with the state. - Amends TCA Section 4-5-320.

As introduced, authorizes board of claims to determine claims for compensation by persons granted declaratory judgments for state agency's termination of program participation without compliance with rulemaking process. - Amends TCA Section 9-8-108.
As introduced, requires native grasses to be used to cover landfill sites that have been filled or closed to further operations. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, requires companies locating in state to establish defined benefit plans and health insurance prior to receiving tax credits and state funding. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 53 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires mandatory mediation between a bank or other financial institution and a borrower before foreclosure proceedings may be instituted on a deed of trust, mortgage, or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value. - Amends TCA Title 35 and Title 45.

As introduced, authorizes unemployment insurance benefits to individual who leaves work or is discharged due to circumstances resulting from being victim of domestic violence. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires that certain structures maintain or acquire photo-electric smoke detectors. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-412; Title 68, Chapter 102, Part 1; Title 68, Chapter 11 and Title 68, Chapter 120, Part 1.

As introduced, extends time for foreclosure notice; requires notice be given to borrower of foreclosure counseling; requires mortgage loans be based upon ability of borrower to repay such loans. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Small Business Protection Act" to require combined reporting for franchise and excise tax purposes; reduces sales tax on food from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires comptroller to study financing programs available to hospitals that have received both essential access payments and disproportionate share payments for infrastructure and capitol improvement needs. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires law enforcement agencies seeking to conduct undercover investigations on school grounds to place certain authorities on notice prior to conducting such investigations. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 49.
As introduced, prescribes certain procedures to govern the abolition of city school districts. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission established relative to certain transfers of administration effectuated pursuant to Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, converts the three ex officio members of a Section 49-2-502 transitional planning commission from voting to non-voting members. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, urges the respective appointing authorities, in making appointments to a transition planning commission, to ensure that appointments reflect the ethnic and gender demographic makeup of their respective jurisdictions. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, modifies the membership of the transition planning commission. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, establishes certain procedures for creation of special school districts related to transfers of administration effectuated under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.
As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of certain special school districts. - Amends amend Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, establishes certain procedures to govern creation of municipal school systems related to transfers of administration under Section 49-2-502. - Amends Chapter 1 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, requires the comptroller to perform a financial audit of any school district seeking to convert to a special school district, if such conversion is permitted. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As introduced, requires each owner of a commercial building to have for that building a comprehensive energy audit conducted; notice of the results of such audit shall be displayed to all tenants and potential tenants of the building. - Amends TCA Title 13.
As introduced, requires landlords of residential property to furnish an energy audit on any premises for rent before entering into a lease on such premises. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 3.

As introduced, extends from 10 to 20 days the time for a parent who has surrendered a child for adoption to revoke such surrender. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 37, Chapter 2, Part 4 and Section 40-14-103.
As introduced, permits certain employees of Tennessee federally qualified health centers to participate in the Tennessee consolidated retirement system. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, requires law enforcement officer investigating an allegation of domestic abuse to file a report with the officer's supervisor within 48 hours of the initial investigation whenever possible. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 39.

As introduced, requires department to utilize scale of 100% when reporting progress in the Tennessee report card for schools beginning with the report for the 2012-2013 school year. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, decreases fine for making aggravated nonemergency 911 calls from $2,500 to $500; earmarks proceeds of fines to 911 call center in city where call originated. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, removes all requirements or restrictions regarding traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires all poultry processed in this or other states and sold in this state to state whether arsenic was fed to poultry at any time prior to processing. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Arsenic Feeding Law." - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 2 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, clarifies that sales tax does not apply to sales of agricultural products from farmer to consumer; specifies that agricultural products includes certain meats and prepared food items containing farm-raised ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 43; Title 44; Title 53 and Title 67.
As introduced, expands the Dairy Industry Promotion Act to include organic milk and milk products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 19, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits Tennessee from participating in the implementation of the federal REAL ID Act of 2005, which mandates a national identification card for each citizen of the United States. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 55.

As introduced, specifies that the Dairy Law of the state of Tennessee does not prohibit the independent or partial owner of any hoofed mammal from using products made from the milk from such animal for the owner's personal consumption or other personal use; present law addresses only the milk from such animals. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 3.
As introduced, restores the right to trial by jury in quo warranto actions contesting the validity of municipal annexation. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-111.
As introduced, requires commissioner to appoint advisory council on pest plants and invasive species. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 6.

As introduced, encourages the department of health to conduct a study concerning exposure to fluoride to the extent funds are specifically provided in the general appropriations act; any study conducted by the commissioner, to the greatest extent possible, should include utilizing the research personnel and tools available through the public and private teaching hospitals located in this state. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1; Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires agencies filing rules with the secretary of state provide a cost-benefit analysis on state and local governments of such rules. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, allows an officer to conduct a blood alcohol test upon reasonable suspicion, instead of probable cause, that a driver was intoxicated for any driver involved in an accident resulting in serious injury or death. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-406.

As introduced, specifies, in regard to present requirement for an officer to cause a driver to submit to a test to determine the alcohol or drug content of the driver's blood if the officer has probable cause to believe that the driver was driving under the influence and such driving resulted in an accident causing injury or death to another, that the test be taken "immediately". - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, prohibits LEAs from denying equal access to LEA employees to all domestic professional employees' organizations offering membership to all certificated personnel and removes prohibition against LEAs prohibiting communications on school premises. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As introduced, permits THEC, UT and TBR to provide information on lottery scholarships in the normal course of business and recruitment of Tennessee students on the annual lottery scholarship day. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, enacts the "Kristen Azevedo Act" regarding background checks on persons applying to work at higher education institution in housing facilities who will have access to student rooms or apartments. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, removes obsolete language from provision on fiscal procedures used by institutions of the board of regents. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 8.

As enacted, specifies that temporary absence of a member of a county board of education to serve in the military does not constitute a vacancy in office and is not subject to provisions of the code requiring a temporary replacement. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-202.
As introduced, modifies nursing facility diversion requirements at time of nursing home admission concerning home and community-based services. - Amends TCA Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, specifies that state government's purchasing preference for Tennessee goods includes building materials and requires local governments to use the same purchasing priorities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 12 and Title 49.

As introduced, makes changes to the membership of and terms of members on the textbook commission; provides that textbooks shall be available to any citizen at the citizen's expense; allows commission to appoint subject matter experts to advise the commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 22.

As introduced, requires TennCare managed care organizations (MCOs) to allow TennCare enrollees to request particular providers for non-emergency ambulance service and requires all providers to be reimbursed on same basis whether or not they are in the MCO's network. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, requires that members of a school board have a bachelor's degree. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor punishable by mandatory 30 days in jail for a non-participant in a sports event to assault a sports official and Class E felony if more than five assemble to assault a sports official. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, revises licensing requirements for surplus lines agents. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14 and Title 56, Chapter 6.

As enacted, revises certain requirements which a person must meet in order to qualify for election or appointment to the office of sheriff; revises law regarding verification of POST certification of any person seeking the office of sheriff; and removes certain provisions regarding when a person runs for sheriff or is elected as sheriff and does not possess a current and valid peace officer certification. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1 and Title 38, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, includes entertainment services in services the theft of which constitutes theft of services; specifies that a person commits theft of services by intentionally obtaining services by forgery or false statement, in addition to deception, fraud, coercion, false pretense or any other means, to avoid payment for the services; specifies that victims may report violations and testify. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, allows the attorney general to recover in a civil action property or proceeds obtained through or as a result of unlawful conduct. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 39.
As introduced, revises various provisions governing billboard regulation and control. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.
As introduced, revises licensing requirements for surplus lines agents. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 14 and Title 56, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires commissioner of TDOT to provide status report on certain highway projects to the chairmen of the transportation committees of the house and senate by November 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, decreases toll bridge rate for a four-horse wagon, loaded or unloaded, from 35 to 25. - Amends TCA Title 54.
As introduced, makes 911 calls and transmissions of such calls confidential. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 1 and Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As enacted, provides for issuance of photo identification license free of charge to person who signs an affidavit stating the person: does not have a valid government issued photo identification; is a registered voter in this state; and needs the photo identification license for voting purposes. - Amends TCA Title 55.
As introduced, decreases from three to two the number of members necessary to constitute a quorum of the state aeronautics commission. - Amends TCA Title 42.
As enacted, reduces from three to one the number of copies of building and utility codes adopted by reference that must be maintained by county clerk for public use. - Amends TCA Section 5-20-102.

As enacted, enacts the Tennessee Lawful Employment Act; revises other provisions of law regarding employment of persons unlawfully present in the country. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39 and Title 50.
As enacted, enacts the "Refugee Absorptive Capacity Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 45 and Title 71.

As enacted, changes various requirements for registration of athlete agents, providing notice of athlete agent activities to higher education institutions and penalties for violations of Athlete Agent Reform Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 21.
As enacted, enacts the "Freedom in Contracting Act." - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes electric cooperatives to provide services anywhere such services are currently provided by wireless cable (microwave) systems. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 25, Part 2.

As enacted, allows substitute teachers to be employed by local education agency or third party public or private employer through agreement with the LEA; states that substitute teachers employed by third party shall be subject to same unemployment benefit eligibility conditions as those employed by LEAs. - Amends TCA Section 49-5-709.

As introduced, lowers the period of time from four to three years for extending the investment period for required capital investment for an excise tax credit based on the amount of capital investment in industrial machinery. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 20.

As introduced, requires commissioner to file annual report as to projects receiving transportation enhancement grants. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 51 and Title 54.

As introduced, requires individuals applying for food stamp program benefits, unemployment benefits, and families first assistance to submit to drug testing; prohibits felons of certain drug crimes from receiving certain benefits. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires department to impose statewide approval of any transitional license preparation program that has received, at a minimum, National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE) candidacy status. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1.

As enacted, creates the Class A misdemeanor offense of sexual contact by an authority figure which is defined as an adult with supervisory or disciplinary power over a minor, unlawfully kissing the minor for the purpose of sexual arousal or gratification. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39.

As enacted, enacts the "Carmen Burnette Act of 2012," which requires cardiopulmonary resuscitation programs to implement hands-on practice and skills testing to support cognitive learning, as opposed to merely cognitive training. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 12.
As introduced, requires local board of education to maintain a record of dismissal and suspension hearings as well as the results of such hearings. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 5.

As introduced, requires director of schools' acceptable Internet use policy to include provisions that encourage the use and understanding of the Internet as an educational tool in preparing students for college and career readiness. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes authority to transfer fund balance in the fire prevention fund to the state general fund at end of each fiscal year. - Amends TCA Section 68-102-142.
As enacted, revises enforcement provisions of unmanned traffic surveillance cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for American Red Cross; allocates 50% of proceeds to Tennessee chapters of American Red Cross. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, extends time period for Habitat for Humanity new specialty earmarked plates to meet minimum issuance requirements until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, suspends annual and percentage pay increases to the minimum compensation for county officials for a period of five years. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 24.

As enacted, authorizes an LEA to be the sponsor of a charter school; if an LEA seeks to sponsor a charter school, then the state board of education would serve as the chartering authority. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires nonprofit entities, that contract with the commissioner of education to manage schools or LEAs in the achievement school district, to be registered with the secretary of state or to be 501(c)(3) organizations; prohibits for-profit partnerships from managing such schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-614.
As introduced, increases fine for first offense of violating "Katie Beth's Law" from fine not to exceed $100 to fine not to exceed $250. - Amends TCA Title 47 and Title 68, Chapter 14.
As introduced, removes the sales tax on retail sales of food and food ingredients. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that a person who had severe and persistent mental illness at the time of committing murder in the first degree cannot be executed but may be sentenced to life imprisonment or life without parole. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 2.

As introduced, requires commissioner of health to report on or before January 31, 2012, with legislative recommendations to legislative committees after consulting with the commissioner of environment and conservation concerning issues involved in the disposing of needles. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, requires state board of education to notify local school systems of specific prerequisite requirements and the courses of study for which the prerequisites apply at least one year prior to the effective date of any prerequisite courses for vocational technical education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes hunting wild hogs at all times in Overton County. - Amends TCA Section 70-4-116.
As introduced, exempts persons 70 or older from Hall Income Tax beginning in tax year 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts persons 65 or older from Hall Income Tax beginning in tax year 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes police departments to impound motor vehicles upon driver's failure to provide proof of financial responsibility. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 16.

As introduced, allows children, up to 24 years of age, of retired teachers with 25 years service to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated area technical-vocational school or state-supported institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires juvenile detention facilities to report annually to the department of education on the number of youth served, dates of entry and exit and demographic information. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires that providers of services, material, and equipment in state and local building contracts meet energy efficiency standards. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, establishes procedure for deducting from amount bid on state building commission project the estimated energy cost savings attributable to bidder's design modifications and proposals. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, establishes requirements for home health companies to provide assistance with medication to clients; requires background checks of employees, recordkeeping, and waiver. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires that a person be in full compliance with the Financial Responsibility Law of 1977 prior to having vehicle registration approved or renewed. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires school districts to pay education providers, contracting with the department of children's services to provide education to children in the department's custody, for each child from the district an amount equal to that paid by the district for children attending public schools. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires that one of the seven members of the board of funeral directors and embalmers must be a representative of a multi-facility owner and operator of funeral homes, cemeteries or crematories. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As enacted, requires a local board of education to allocate funding in an amount equal to the per pupil state and local funds received by the LEA to state licensed residential mental health facilities on a prorated daily basis for the student's length of stay, provided certain criteria have been met. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37; Title 41 and Title 49.
As introduced, opens enrollment in charter schools to all students eligible to enroll in Tennessee public schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, requires LEAs to establish a transparent and uniform method of calculating all terms and costs related to any lease, lease-purchase agreement, or other contract or agreement executed between the LEA and a charter school for the use of the LEA's educational facilities; establishes certain requirements regarding underutilized and vacant property; specifies uses of capital outlay funds by charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As enacted, delays the implementation of certain provisions concerning the procurement commission and related topics; makes substantive changes in certain parts of procurement commission legislation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 3; Title 12, Chapter 4; Title 12, Chapter 2; Title 41, Chapter 22, Part 4; Title 71, Chapter 4, Part 7 and Chapter 1098 of the Public Acts of 2010.

Requires commissioner of economic and community development to report to finance chairs as to use of contingent FMAP funding appropriated to the department in the FY 2010-2011 annual appropriations act. - Amends Chapter 1108 of the Public Acts of 2010.
As introduced, declares certain goods that are made in Tennessee are not subject to the commerce clause of the federal constitution. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, for counties which provide county-wide fire protection and which fund fire protection services from revenue as an alternate to establishing fire tax districts, requires the annual budget to identify specific revenues and amounts generated by situs-based taxes and other revenue sources that have been shared with municipalities which are used to fund such fire protection services. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 58, Chapter 2.

As introduced, provides that an officer making a lawful stop or detaining a person who violates certain traffic offenses shall cause the seizure of the person's vehicle if the person is unlawfully present in the United States. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As enacted, reconstitutes the board of directors for the Four Lake regional industrial development authority and makes certain other changes concerning the management of the authority. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29, Part 2 and Title 64, Chapter 5, Part 2.
As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body of a county that has enacted county-wide zoning to create a design review committee (DRC). - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, authorizes commissioner of TDOT to contribute annually to fund ferries that substantially add to interstate commerce in the state. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 11, Part 3.

As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district whose boundaries are coterminous with the city's boundaries to maintain effort in funding such school system; requires automatic increase in maintenance of effort if there is an increase in the number of students in the school district or inflation occurs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.

As introduced, requires TSAC to develop, implement, and administer student loan repayment programs for nurses who perform community service or accept employment with the state. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 49, Chapter 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires county trustees to return any commissions received over the amount required to operate the trustee's office to the school fund, provided the amount returned shall not exceed the amount received from the school fund. - Amends TCA Section 8-11-110.

As enacted, changes time within which fiscal review committee must submit a fiscal note on legislation from within 7 days of introduction or request to within 10 days of introduction or request. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8.

As enacted, provides that liability for legal and financial obligations pertaining to real property subject to a lease and payment in lieu of tax (PILOT) agreement remains with the person who transferred title to the municipality or corporation; provides immunity for the municipality or corporation. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53, Part 3 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.
As introduced, requires insurers to state in bold face type in an insurance policy whether an insured is entitled to assign benefits to a healthcare provider. - Amends TCA Section 56-7-120.

As introduced, requires the recipient or beneficiary to provide written notice to the state before initiating any legal proceeding to pursue recovery from a third party. - Amends TCA Section 71-5-117.
As introduced, makes certain hospital provider reimbursement information involving the program a public record. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, revises offense of producing, manufacturing, distributing, or possessing with intent to produce, manufacture, or distribute the active chemical ingredient in the hallucinogenic plant salvia divinorum or the synthetic cannabinoids JWH-018, JWH-073, HU-210 and HU-211 to include other synthetic cannabinoids. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Stax Museum of American Soul Music new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to the Stax Museum. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for the United States Green Building Council; allocates 50% of proceeds to the United States Green Building Council. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires a city in which there is located a special school district with ADM of 10,000 or more and 75 percent of the district's students are eligible for free and reduced price lunch to maintain effort in funding such school system. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3.

As introduced, makes it a violation of the Consumer Protection Act to use any word in an advertisement or trade name referring to a governmental entity that may tend to mislead consumers to believe a private entity is acting for or on behalf of, or has a direct or indirect relationship to a governmental entity, when such use is false, inaccurate, or misleading. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, requires an assignment of a deed of trust to be properly recorded with the register of deeds within 10 days of the date of assignment. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 10; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 24, Part 1.

As introduced, requires certain counties that levy a payroll tax to reduce the county real property tax rate in an amount sufficient to offset all revenue derived by the county from such payroll tax; requires certain municipalities that levy a payroll tax to reduce the municipal real property tax rate in an amount sufficient to offset all revenue derived by the municipality from such payroll tax. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, creates the Tennessee municipal government economic development and opportunity grant fund. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement agencies and employees from practicing biased-based policing against persons residing unlawfully in the United States; provides penalties for such violations. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 55.

As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay restitution to victims and be current on child support obligations and court costs to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.

As introduced, establishes a ceiling of 100 percent for interest rates on payday loans; defines "payday loan" as short-term cash loan or funds provided to an individual in anticipation of future receipt of wages. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, clarifies that any CD-ROMs or digital products sold with textbooks and workbooks shall be exempt from sales tax. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, specifies that for purposes of the present tobacco tax law, "cigarette" includes any cigarette produced by a cigarette rolling machine at a retail establishment; adds various requirements regarding such cigarettes and rolling machines operators. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 43 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires inspection of livestock by agriculture crimes unit within department of agriculture to precede inspection by county agricultural extension agents in response to alleged offenses being committed against livestock. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 43.

As enacted, specifies that it is not an offense for a manufacturer of gambling devices to knowingly own, manufacture, assemble, design, possess, buy, sell, rent, lease, store, repair, transport, print or make any gambling device or record solely intended for gambling outside of Tennessee and in compliance with federal law. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, requires the comptroller to audit private act hospital authorities. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, corrects a code reference to clarify what conditions raising a presumption of abandonment must be satisfied in order for intangible property to be subject to the custody of this state as unclaimed property. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, revises various provisions of the Uniform Disposition of Unclaimed Property Act, including certain reporting requirements and minimum dollar values that must exist. - Amends TCA Section 66-29-113 and Section 66-29-115(f)(4).

As introduced, authorizes Davidson County clerk to perform vehicle inspections, and collect a fee up to $37.50 for such inspection, prior to issuing certificate of title for a rebuilt motor vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21, Part 7; Title 18, Chapter 6 and Title 55, Chapter 3.

As enacted, specifies that the right to a secret ballot in union certification elections will only apply to extent that secret ballots are permissible under state or federal law and that, in any such elections where secret ballots are permissible, no alternative means of designation may be used as convincing evidence of employee majority support; such right may not be waived by means of an agreement between a union and an employer; not applicable to union contracts entered into before July 1, 2011, or that involve both employees within and without Tennessee when the employer conducted business within Tennessee before July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, requires annual report to the general assembly as to participation in the Local Tourism Development Zone Business Tax Act. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 88, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 30.

As introduced, requires secretary of state to file copy of governor's statement concerning an agency exemption from provisions of UAPA due to federal funding conditions with chairs of the government operations committees. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, includes East Fork Stables in the definition of premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; designates certain other facility as premier type tourist resort for purposes of sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, enacts the "Farm Land Protection Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 7; Title 29 and Title 43.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Farm Winery Law." - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, requires certain civil service lay off provisions to apply to reductions in force of University of Tennessee employees. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-134.
As introduced, adds to description of a premier type tourist resort in Blount County that the resort maintains a rock climbing facility. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-101.

As introduced, redefines beer to include beverages with up to 12 percent alcoholic content; allows retail package stores to sell beer. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 2; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4; Title 57, Chapter 5; Title 57, Chapter 6 and Title 57, Chapter 9.

As introduced, clarifies that there are circumstances in which a firearm can be carried in a public park and clarifies that it is firearms, clubs and knives that are prohibited in parks and not weapons already regulated such as machine guns and explosive weapons. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13; Title 40, Chapter 14; Title 40, Chapter 35; Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 34 and Title 70.
As introduced, clarifies that deputy sheriffs assigned to courthouse security may be POST certified but are not required to be. - Amends TCA Section 5-7-108.

As introduced, requires a contract entered into between a developer or owner of property and a prime contractor to include specific information concerning the manner in which the developer or owner plans on financing the project; as a condition to the finalization of the contract, such information is subject to being verified by the prime contractor. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 45; Title 49; Title 62, Chapter 6 and Title 66.

As introduced, clarifies that the general contractor of a commercial construction project shall select the three individual construction services providers who may be exempt from workers' compensation coverage while working on the commercial construction project. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 56.

As introduced, rewrites present exemption to requirement that motor vehicle dismantlers must obtain copy of certificate of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap, to apply to motor vehicle manufactured in a year prior to issuance of certificates of title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Prescribed Burning Act." - Amends TCA Title 11, Chapter 4, Part 8 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires persons enrolling children for the first time in public schools to submit the student's social security number, a visa as issued by the United States, or certain birth certificates; requires schools to submit certain enrollment information to the department of education for inclusion in the department's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49 and Title 49.
As introduced, changes qualifications for the office of sheriff for all persons running for sheriff on and after July 1, 2011. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, transfers responsibility for mowing of rights-of-way and litter collection on state highways from department of transportation to department of correction; requires TDOT to pay TDOC for use of necessary prison labor. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 5, Part 1.
As introduced, increases maximum fine imposed for disorderly conduct at funerals and other similar services from $50.00 to $500. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-317.
As introduced, extends time period for meeting initial issuance requirements for Civil War Preservation new specialty earmarked license plates until July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, revises authority of commissioner of commerce and insurance to investigate insurance agents; revises rights of insurance agents under investigation; revises penalties imposed against insurance agents. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-112; Section 56-6-117; Section 56-6-120 and Section 56-8-107.

As introduced, requires contracting agents to be registered by the department of commerce and insurance and prohibits unauthorized access to services or discounts under a provider network contract. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 2.

As introduced, defines a restaurant located in a jurisdiction that has elected Tennessee River resort district status as having inside capacity of at least 40 and outside seating capacity of at least 75. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Gun Owners Improvement Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 49, Chapter 6 and Title 70.
As introduced, allows a court to dismiss a financial responsibility case if the defendant did not have financial responsibility at the time of certain violations. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-139.
As introduced, authorizes the sale of air conditioner evaporator coils or condensers to scrap metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 9.

As enacted, authorizes up to four special censuses in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 51, Part 1; Title 6, Chapter 56, Part 1; Section 54-4-203; Section 57-5-205 and Section 67-6-103.

As enacted, adds Cocke County to those counties where distilleries may be located without conducting an additional referendum if within the boundaries of the county both retail package sales and liquor-by-the-drink have been approved through voter referendum. - Amends TCA Section 57-2-103.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.
As introduced, specifies that funds allocated in the classroom component of the BEP for textbooks must be expended for textbooks and other instructional materials. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes any state court judge who possesses a valid handgun carry permit and who completes both 16 hours of POST court security training and eight hours per year of POST firearm training to possess a firearm in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, specifies that beginning with the 2011-2012 school year, a student in the third grade may not be promoted to the next grade level unless the student has shown a basic understanding of curriculum and ability to perform the skills required in the subject of reading as demonstrated by the student's grades or standardized test results; such student may be promoted if the student participates in an LEA approved research-based intervention prior to the beginning of the next school year; act does not apply to any student who has an IEP pursuant to the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, adds a plumber representative to the state board for licensing contractors. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Section 62-6-104.
As introduced, designates segment of State Route 143 in Carter County as "Sen. Robert "Bob" Burleson Parkway."

As introduced, authorizes a judge at any level who has a handgun carry permit to possess a handgun at all times and in the same places as a law enforcement officer is authorized. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, alters various provisions regarding removal of a member of a utility management review board from office. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 82.

As introduced, expands period, from 15 to 30 days, for interested persons to be notified by the division of radiological health prior to the issuance of a permit to or hearing an appeal from radioactive waste processors. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 68.

As introduced, provides civil and criminal immunity for person threatening or using lawful force to protect real property from severe environmental degradation caused by feral hogs; lawful force includes the use of dogs. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 11, Part 6 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, requires county legislative bodies in a county in which the county school system converts to a special school district to continue to levy a countywide property tax for school purposes. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, establishes certain requirements for electronic prescribing and electronic prescribing software. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 10.

As enacted, changes the evidence requirement from a preponderance of the evidence to clear and convincing evidence for rebutting the presumption that drugs or alcohol were the proximate cause of an injury from a drug test result or the refusal to submit to a drug test. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6 and Title 50, Chapter 9.

As introduced, allows the next-of-kin of a patient in a state hospital to access the records of such patient if the patient has been deceased more than 10 years and the records are more than 50 years old. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.
As introduced, permits the legislative body of Cheatham County to impose the fire tax as a flat fee to fund county-wide fire and emergency services. - Amends TCA Section 5-17-107.

As enacted, specifies that a person does not compromise their amateur status for purposes of the Tennessee Athletic Commission Act of 2008 by competing in an event held by a sanctioned olympic organization. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 115.
As enacted, names flyover that connects Interstate 40 eastbound to Briley Parkway northbound in Nashville in honor of late Ralph M. Cohen.

As introduced, permits judge to donate a communication device or access device that is legal to own but was used in an unlawful manner to an LEA or not-for-profit organization in lieu of destroying the device as contraband. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.

As introduced, requires persons registering or paying property taxes on real property to designate an address of residence that notice of legal and administrative proceedings, whereby the real property is the subject, may be sent to meet proper service of process. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 29; Title 66 and Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes Tennessee licensed wineries to conduct business at no more than two additional satellite locations after obtaining a satellite permit and paying a fee to the alcoholic beverage commission. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As introduced, prohibits an award of exemplary or punitive damages for an unfair or deceptive practice that is a willful or knowing violation of consumer protection law if the court has already awarded three times the actual damages sustained. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, directs that no hospital that is a subsidiary or an affiliate of a private act hospital is exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires certain economic development contracts to be submitted to the chief executive officer of the affected jurisdiction and to the state treasurer within 15 days of the execution of such agreement rather than 10 days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 17.

As enacted, requires charitable organization that solicited and received contributions exceeding $25,000 related to a disaster occurring in this state on or after May 1, 2010, to file a quarterly financial report with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 1, Part 5 and Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

As introduced, provides that any private act hospitals authority's records shall be open to public inspection, except as otherwise provided by state statute or federal law. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, provides for revocation of driver license for nonpayment of litigation taxes, court costs or fines in certain circumstances; provides payment plan option and hardship exemption. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 40, Chapter 24, Part 1; Title 50 and Title 55.

As introduced, clarifies that certain private act hospital authorities are not exempt from antitrust law, federal or state, otherwise applicable to private hospitals. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-501 and Section 7-57-502.

As enacted, revises various criminal provisions relative to the use of any bank, savings and loan association, savings bank or subsidiary's trade name or trademark. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 56.
As introduced, requires for-hire limousine passenger services to be regulated by the Tennessee regulatory authority. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 65.
As introduced, grants state recognition to certain Indian tribes, bands, and groups; provides means for other Indian tribes, bands, and groups to receive state recognition. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires that clerks must state actual fee that is charged to use a credit card instead of stating either the percentage rate of the fee or the actual fee. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 21.
As enacted, increases certain fees sheriffs and constables may collect. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-901.
As introduced, repeals the Tennessee Voter Confidence Act. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 20.

As introduced, effective September 1, 2011, creates division V of circuit court of 21st judicial district with the judge to be appointed by the governor and serve until September 1, 2014; at August 2014 general election, a judge shall be elected for division V for a full 8-year term; district consists of Hickman, Lewis, Perry and Williamson counties. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 16, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As introduced, allows a reviewing court to award an appellee's attorneys' fees and related filing costs if the court determines that an appeal is frivolous or taken solely for delay. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 25 and Title 27.

As enacted, allows an employer to offset an employee's wages if the employee owes the employer money that the employer loaned or advanced the employee, in certain situations. - Amends TCA Title 26 and Title 50.

As introduced, specifies that no managed care entity is exempt from antitrust law, regardless of whether or not such entity contracts with a private act hospital authority that has such an exemption. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 7; Title 10; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, requires local governments to participate in workers' compensation. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8; Title 29, Chapter 20; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 50, Chapter 6.
As enacted, authorizes increase to the maximum amount of the allowance that may be provided to members of boards of public utilities. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 52, Part 1.
As introduced, increases from 180 to 200 days the minimum time required before a dry cleaner or launderer may dispose of unclaimed garments. - Amends TCA Title 66.
As introduced, authorizes conductor to put off non-paying passenger at any regular station instead of any station or convenient point. - Amends TCA Title 65.
As introduced, assigns personal, civil, and criminal liability to private security guard using unauthorized deadly force. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, increases from three to four months the period of time in which a person with a claim against a dissolved limited partnership may commence a proceeding to enforce the claim after receiving notice that the claim was rejected. - Amends TCA Title 61.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of commerce and insurance to convene a working group of representatives from the insurance industry and the medical professions to study recent trends concerning various issues affecting the health insurance industry and the medical professions. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57; Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, deletes requirement that department prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43.
As enacted, makes various changes and additions to present law concerning insurance, in regard to confidentiality and Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, increases from 11 months to one year the period of time in which an appointment of proxy is effective by a shareholder in a for-profit corporation. - Amends TCA Title 48.

As introduced, allows a warehouse to require payment from a person whose unfixed storage period has expired at least 45 days, instead of 30 days, after sending proper notice to the person. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, increases from 90 to 100 calendar days the period of time in which application from bank without regulatory rating of one or two shall be deemed approved for branch facilities. - Amends TCA Title 45.
As introduced, redefines dairy farm to include all milk-producing animals instead of limiting it to cows. - Amends TCA Title 44.

As introduced, authorizes the state insurance committee to establish a program under which citizens of Tennessee may buy into and be covered under the same group insurance health care plan offered to all state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27, Part 2.
As enacted, establishes procedures for pharmacies to transfer Schedule II prescriptions in accord with certain federal and state requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of Tennessee Equine Association new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates 50% of funds produced from sale thereof to such association. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Roy Bell & David O'Guin Memorial Bridge"
As enacted, designates bridge on S.R. 438 in Perry County as "Dickson Augustus Weems Memorial Bridge"
As introduced, clarifies that persons age 65 or older are not required to show identification with a photograph in order to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7.

As introduced, allows a voter, who does not possess the required proof of identification, to appear in person at the county election commission office during the early voting period, sign an affidavit of identity, and pose for a digital photograph; thereupon, the voter would be allowed to vote in the election. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.
As introduced, enacts the "Safe Dams Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 11.
As introduced, allows TBI to perform familial DNA searches in order to locate biological relatives of an individual whose DNA profile was taken from a crime scene. - Amends TCA Title 38 and Title 40.

As introduced, creates a Class A misdemeanor offense for the manufacture, sale, offer for sale, advertisement, or distribution of any caffeinated alcohol drinks; defines caffeinated alcohol drink. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As enacted, requires the office of coordinated school health, in the department of education, to report to the general assembly by August 1, 2012, on the implementation of the requirement of each LEA to integrate at least 90 minutes of physical activity per week into the instructional school day for elementary and secondary school students. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires department to develop and maintain Internet Web site to provide certain information on state revenue, expenses and opportunities for public involvement. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, creates new offenses involving motor fuel transporters offloading motor fuel at a retail station. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8 and Title 65, Chapter 15.

As enacted, authorizes Lexington, by ordinance adopted by a two-thirds vote, to levy an occupancy tax on the privilege of staying in any hotel or motel in Lexington; the ordinance to set the rate and further set forth the manner of collection and administration of the privilege tax; requires that all proceeds received by the municipality from the tax be deducted for tourism development. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 14.

As enacted, authorizes the Beech River watershed development authority to create the position of board member emeritus and establishes the qualifications for such position. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 1.

As introduced, allows person issued a restricted driver license to drive to and from a doctor's office, hospital, pharmacy or other location to obtain necessary medical care or to obtain an item for which the person has a prescription. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, allows individuals to be exempt from the workers' compensation requirements if such individual is a member of a recognized religious sect or division and is an adherent of established tenets or teachings of such sect or division by reason of which such individual is conscientiously opposed to acceptance of the benefits provided by the workers' compensation laws. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires loose material hauled in open bed of certain motor vehicles to be covered by tarpaulin in addition to present requirement limiting height of load. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 7.
As introduced, extends publication of notice of any sale of land from 20 days to 30 days. - Amends TCA Title 35, Chapter 5.
As introduced, limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 125. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, requires additional $10.00 payment be made to election official that accompanies the officer of elections to the county election commission on election day. - Amends TCA Section 2-4-109.
As introduced, authorizes local government entities to file motions to prevent litigation opponents from using the Public Records Act in lieu of discovery. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Prohibition of Covenants Providing for Transfer Fees Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 66.

As enacted, broadens application of lighting requirements for vehicles or trailers transporting certain loads at night to apply to such loads projecting three and one-half feet or more, rather than four feet or more, beyond rear of vehicle's body. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9, Part 4 and Title 65, Chapter 15.
As introduced, enacts the "Broadband Infrastructure for Regional Economic Development Act of 2011." - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, requires non-binding, advisory referendum on the performance of the director of schools to be held every four years in coordination with the election of governor. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 49.
As introduced, exempts mechanical or HVAC contractors installing duct detectors on HVAC systems from the alarm contractors licensing act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 32.

As enacted, authorizes the sale of nonpotentially hazardous foods that are prepared in home based kitchens at a person's personal residence, a community or social event, including church bazaars and festivals, and flea markets, in addition to authorizing the sale of such foods at farmer's markets; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1 and Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As enacted, authorizes persons who are licensed to sell eggs to sell, offer, or expose for sale, or have in the person's possession for sale, all eggs produced by the person unless limited otherwise by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As enacted, revises conditions under which grandparent visitation can be awarded. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, changes the name of the association that nominates members for the governor to appoint to the board of optometry. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 8.
As introduced, excepts insurance producers from continuing education requirements related to licenses if those producers meet certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-107.

As introduced, authorizes the spouse of a deceased recipient of a Purple Heart memorial registration plate to receive two such registration plates for no cost. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As introduced, requires commissioner of finance and administration to seek an amendment to the TennCare waiver to require TennCare enrollees to seek all of their nonemergent primary care from public health departments; requires MCOs to contract with public health departments; requires bureau of TennCare to provide certain financial assistance to local health departments. - Amends TCA Title 49; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, limits number of children that may be accepted at a drop-in center on a snow day to 100. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, increases from 30 to 45 days the time for filing appeal from final action of solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, requires that bathrooms in food producing and distributing establishments supply both hot and cold running water. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, permits commissioner of commerce and insurance to terminate temporary permit for operating cemetery by giving written notice of at least 20 days, instead of 10 days, before effective date of termination. - Amends TCA Title 46.

As introduced, requires department to report to general assembly following each meeting on transportation service for persons with developmental disabilities, mental illness, and serious emotional disturbance. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As introduced, removes the requirement that a court determine whether a defendant is a danger to the community prior to releasing the defendant on bail for being charged with vehicular assault, vehicular homicide or driving under the influence. - Amends TCA Section 40-11-118.

As introduced, authorizes the cost of veterinary services and final disposal or burial expenses in determining the value of a police dog, fire dog, search and rescue dog, service animal or police horse knowingly and unlawfully killed without the owner's effective consent. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50; Title 13; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 44; Title 50; Title 62 and Title 66.
As enacted, rewrites law regarding the disposition of stolen property that is in the possession of a pawnbroker. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, enacts the "Public Improvement District Act." - Amends TCA Title 7.

As introduced, requires all meetings of transition planning commissions created to develop plans pursuant to the transfer of the administration of schools in special school districts to county boards of education be subject to the open meetings law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, and Chapter __ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 25 / House Bill 51).

As introduced, sets awards from net lottery proceeds for certain postsecondary scholarships and grants at the amount the student initially received or at the amount awarded for initial recipients in the current semester of enrollment, whichever is greater. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1 and Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, requires state departments, agencies and entities to reduce paper and paper products annually by 5 percent starting on July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.
As enacted, enacts the "Move on When Ready Act." - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires a county election commission to accept and not return a mail voter registration form received within seven days prior to the registration deadline if the form lacks postage or has insufficient postage. - Amends TCA Section 2-2-109.
As introduced, enacts the "Crime-Free School Zone Act." - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 49.
