As introduced, requires the state election coordinator to study the feasibility of permitting registered voters who reside outside the precinct listed as their permanent residence on their permanent voter registration card to vote only for candidates running for statewide office; the study will not address property rights voting; the coordinator must report the results of the study to the general assembly by February 28, 2012.

As introduced, provides for the state sales tax on food and food ingredients, which is presently 5.5 percent, being reduced by 0.5 percent per year in any fiscal year following a year in which the amount of surplus state revenue collected above budgeted estimates exceeds $50 million. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As enacted, allows lobbyist to attend annual ethics course provided for members of the general assembly to meet annual training requirement. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, moves presidential preference primary to first Tuesday in May from first Tuesday in February to coincide with county primary date. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 1; Title 2, Chapter 5, Part 2; Title 2, Chapter 12, Part 1 and Title 2, Chapter 13.
As introduced, creates a special committee of public citizens to review which licensed or certified professions can be deregulated.
As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarships to be awarded during summer school as well as during fall and spring semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, specifies, with certain exceptions, that new fee or fee increase promulgated by state agency rule in accordance with UAPA will take effect on the July 1 following the expiration of the 90-days after filing with the secretary of state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, requires the state to assume the entire cost of any mandatory costs it imposes on local education agencies as its compliance with the constitutional duty to share in costs imposed on local governments. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49.
As enacted, urges employers to develop programs under which their employees with children in school can take time off to volunteer in their children's schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, prohibits the governor and members of the general assembly from creating or controlling multicandidate political campaign committees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.
As introduced, increases maximum number of members who may serve on certain solid waste authority boards from 15 to 17. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211, Part 9.

As introduced, specifies subjects that may be addressed by a planning commission in regulations governing the subdivision of land; requires that notice of hearings be published on commission's Web site if the commission maintains a Web site. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-4-303.

As introduced, revokes outgoing mail privileges of inmates convicted of sexual offenses and not registered as sexual offenders for contact by mail with victims and victims' families. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2 and Title 41.
As introduced, enacts the "Land Bank Authority Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 65 and Title 66.

As introduced, authorizes a tiered level credit against sales and use tax, and franchise and excise tax, for any qualified company that expands or relocates to counties with certain unemployment rates. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, provides for the classification of certain property as affordable housing rental property. - Amends TCA Title 13 and Title 67.

As introduced, creates a joint committee on the study of job creation in this state; provides that the committee shall report to the general assembly no later than January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 49 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires a referendum be conducted before a publicly funded entity can be sold or leased; "sale or lease" means that more than 30 percent of the assets of the entity are subject to sale or lease. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

As introduced, prohibits the sale of a catalytic converter to a junk yard if the seller fails to present either proof of ownership of the vehicle from which the converter was removed or a sales receipt for the converter; classifies the offense as a Class B misdemeanor, punishable only by fine of $500. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 47; Title 55 and Title 68.

As introduced, adds to Schedule I controlled substances: 3,4-Methlyenedioxymethcathinone (Methylone); 3,4-Methylenedioxypyrovalerone (MDPV); 4-Methylmethcathinone (Mephedrone); 3-Methoxymethcathinone; 3-Fluoromethcathinone; and 4-Fluoromethcathinone. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4 and Title 40.

As introduced, specifies that only business days are to be counted for purposes of calculating 10-day period for acceptance of partial payments of property taxes prior to tax lien sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, reduces from 5.5 percent to 4.5 percent the sales tax rate on food. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires county trustee to notify commissioner of education within 10 days of payment of funds of dissolved special school district to the county board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 5.

As introduced, requires director of schools of each LEA to submit report on alternative schools to the commissioner of education instead of the senate and house education committees; requires commissioner to include compilation of these reports in commissioner's annual report. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, eliminates required annual study by the state board of education of the weight of textbooks; requires commissioner of education to perform the study one time every five years and permits study to be done more often if the commissioner determines it to be necessary. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, allows designees of named members of THEC to serve in members' places. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1 and Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
As introduced, increases computer exemption during recurring August sales tax holiday from $1,500 to $1,650; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly.
As introduced, authorizes the state of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its interest-bearing bonds and bond anticipation notes for certain purposes.

As introduced, requires annual report on state agency lease payments to be posted on department Web site and filed with office of legislative budget analysis. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 9.

As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and board of regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.

As introduced, assigns the state employee staff responsible for the administration of the group insurance for state officials and employees to the department of finance and administration; requires that grant payments under the grant assistance program for nursing home care be made monthly or quarterly instead of monthly; deletes obsolete language for spring sales tax holiday. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 33; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 42; Title 43; Title 44; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 61; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, corrects definition of "regional accrediting association" for HOPE scholarship purposes to change the name of the Northwestern Association of Schools and Colleges to its present name of the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires applications for establishment of charter schools to provide, in addition to the names and addresses of the members of the governing body, a telephone number or email address for each member. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As enacted, adopts "Tennessee" by John R. Bean as an official state song. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 3.

As introduced, clarifies that facilities revolving fund may be used in support of routine maintenance expenditures including janitorial services at capitol and legislative complexes. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4 and Title 9.

As enacted, specifies that TCA titles 50 and 56 provide the sole and exclusive statutory remedies and sanctions applicable to an insurer, person, or entity licensed, permitted, or authorized to do business under title 56 for alleged breach of, or for alleged unfair or deceptive acts or practices in connection with, a contract of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, reforms system of K-12 teacher tenure. - Amends TCA Section 8-36-821 and Title 49.

As enacted, increases contribution limits to reflect change in the CPI; allows corporations to contribute to candidates; revises certain other provisions regarding campaign funds. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, authorizes local boards of education to enter into capital leases and build-to-suit capital leases of real or personal property for the use, construction, repair or renovation of school buildings and facilities. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 9 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires submission of special school district board minutes to county board of education and department of education within five business days after affirmative administrative action for abolition of the special school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 13; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, requires TSAC to annually prepare a status report for governor and general assembly on the Tennessee HOPE foster child tuition grant program. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, decreases the time in which the district attorney is required to notify the child protective team of whether prosecution is justified or appropriate in view of the circumstances from 15 to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55.

As introduced, allows local boards of education to establish funds to accept donations from individuals, corporations or other entities to fund educational field trips and permits recognition of such donors within guidelines of the department of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As enacted, requires organizations that supply mental health and developmental disability services to check the registry that contains the names of any persons who have been determined to have abused, neglected, misappropriated or exploited the property of vulnerable individuals and not hire or use as a volunteer any individual listed on the registry; requirements apply to organizations that contract with the division of intellectual disabilities services for residential services, day services or supported employment services.

As introduced, allows a victim of domestic abuse, sexual assault, or stalking to terminate a lease or rental agreement if notice and documentation that tenant is a victim are presented to landlord. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, requires local boards of education to develop and implement an evaluation plan to be used annually for the director of schools; authorizes certain municipalities to request county election commission to conduct a referendum regarding creation of new school in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requests chancellor to study tenure and report to education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, adds University of Tennessee System and Board of Regents as recipients of THEC's annual report on scholarship and grant programs data. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 31; Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 9, Chapter 4 and Title 49.
As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 1.
As introduced, requires state insurance committee to establish a supplemental health insurance program that pays cash benefits for state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.

As introduced, requires a board of public utilities to meet within 14 days of appointment to elect a chair instead of 10 and requires notice of meetings to be posted on the board's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 34; Title 7, Chapter 52; Title 7, Chapter 82 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 10.

As introduced, makes technical changes to remaining terms involving mental retardation and the division of intellectual disabilities services to reflect changes made by 2010 Public Chapters 734 and 1100. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes code commission to make changes to effectuate Chapters 734 and 1100 of the Public Acts of 2010 with respect to references to mental retardation and similar terms and the creation of the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 33; Title 40; Title 48; Title 49; Title 55; Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, provides for additional notice to legislative committees, lengthens certain reporting deadlines and authorizes additional assistance to the commissioner of intellectual and developmental disabilities concerning determining the fiscal impact of certain changes impacting certain licensees of the department of mental health; creates committee to examine fiscal notes and other costs associated with transferring the function of licensing services and facilities from the department of mental health to the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 33; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires health insurance entities to establish both internal and external grievance and appeals processes to permit review of coverage and payment determinations; corrects TCA cross-reference. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 32 and Title 56, Chapter 7.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 68 in Monroe County as "Bob 'Single Wing' Harrill Memorial Highway."

As introduced, creates special account in general fund from which the annual educational incentive payments will be made to certain eligible county officials; previously, the payments were made from the general fund. - Amends TCA Section 5-1-310 and Section 67-4-409.
As enacted, establishes requirements for the supervision of nurses and physician assistants by certain physicians when engaged in interventional pain management. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As enacted, authorizes counties and cities to prohibit, by ordinance, smoking outside of hospitals or in the public areas immediately outside of a hospital building and its entrances, including public sidewalks. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes municipalities and counties, by resolution or ordinance, to prohibit landlords from leasing real property to persons unlawfully present in the United States; requires the attorney general and reporter to draft and defend such resolutions and ordinances upon written request. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 66.

As enacted, provides that the HIV test a sexual offender is required to undergo must be performed within 48 hours after the presentment of the indictment or information and with or without the request of the victim; adds aggravated rape of a child and statutory rape by an authority figure to the list of offenses requiring HIV testing of the alleged perpetrator. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

As introduced, raises the threshold for a certificate of need for capital expenditures for nonhospital health care institutions from $2 million to $2.5 million; makes health care institutions responsible for attorneys' fees in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, allows certain individuals who meet certain criteria to transfer previous service from Group 1 to Group 3 of the retirement system if certain conditions are timely met. - Amends TCA Section 8-34-101(3); Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 6; Section 8-34-716 and Section 8-35-105.

As introduced, requires ECD to report annually to office of legislative budget analysis in addition to joint select committee on business taxes regarding Tennessee job skills program. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7, Chapter 53; Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 8, Chapter 24; Title 9, Chapter 16; Title 9, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 3; Title 13, Chapter 16; Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 50, Chapter 7; Title 64, Chapter 6; Title 65, Chapter 5 and Title 67.

As enacted, prohibits a health care institution that treats drug abuse patients from being held liable for any damages resulting from the introduction of harmful substances into an indwelling catheter placed in the patient, provided that the health care institution informs the patient of such immunity. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 33, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 11.

As introduced, deletes provisions concerning Tennessee board for economic growth serving as an advisory commission to the commissioner of economic and community development as board was repealed in 2009; requires commissioner to report on job creation programs and opportunities to finance, ways and means committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 67.
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12 and Title 67.

As enacted, clarifies that purchases by and for the legislative department are exempt, subject to the policies of the board of standards, from the operation of the present law provisions governing public purchases. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3.
As introduced, directs the proceeds of a sale of weapons confiscated by a judicial drug task force to the judicial drug task force for law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, deletes requirement that members of charitable gaming oversight committee be from different grand divisions. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, requires annual event tickets to include either the mailing address or telephone number of the 501(c)(3) organization in addition to the name of the 501(c)(3) organization. - Amends TCA Title 3.
As introduced, specifies that expenses of members are paid in accordance with Article II, Section 23 of the Constitution of Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, provides that the general contractor shall determine the three construction services providers that may be awarded exemptions from carrying workers' compensation insurance on themselves. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-914.

As enacted, specifies that, under law regarding records open to public inspection, "public record" or "state record" does not include the device or equipment that may have been used to create or store a public or state record. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, makes a lien filed by a municipality for the cost of maintaining real property that is not being maintained the same priority of lien as a lien for property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.
As introduced, defines "destroy" for purposes of the Billboard Regulation and Control Act of 1972. - Amends TCA Section 54-21-102.
As introduced, subjects property and revenues of airport authorities to taxation and requires authority approval for vendor fee increases. - Amends TCA Title 42, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits law enforcement officers or agencies from collecting or maintaining information about political or religious views of an individual or group unless it directly relates to criminal investigation and subject of information is believed to be involved. - Amends TCA Title 38.
As introduced, designates American Baptist College as an eligible independent postsecondary institution for purposes of lottery scholarships. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.
As introduced, urges municipalities and counties to develop grants to preserve and rehabilitate historic residential homes. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As enacted, allows three or more sexual offenders to establish primary or secondary residence together if the property on which they live has been zoned for a use other than residential or mixed use by the appropriate local zoning laws. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of agriculture to appoint a qualified organization to be the sole and exclusive operator of a fair known as the Tennessee State Fair. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.
As introduced, provides for the regulation of the sale and identification of honey products. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15 and Title 53.
As introduced, authorizes the state apiarist to place certain registration and safety requirements on beekeepers. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.
As enacted, revises certain provisions of law regarding electrical inspections and changes the date by which swimming pools have to be equipped with alarms. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As enacted, provides that no county, municipality, consolidated government, or other political subdivision of this state may adopt or continue in effect any ordinance or resolution prohibiting the establishment or maintenance of honeybees in hives, provided that such establishment or maintenance is in compliance with the Tennessee Apiary Act of 1995. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 15.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to report on the status of in-service training funds for higher education during certain fiscal years and requires the commission to include certain discounts in reports on the status of funding. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 49.
As introduced, requires commissioner of revenue to post cost of living adjustment amounts on the department's Web site. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 10.

As introduced, extends time between notification of department and collection of tax from first day of the month occurring 30 days from notice of legislative action to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 7.

As introduced, revises the prohibtion on an insurance company or affiliate of an insurance company owning 15 percent or more of the voting securities or other voting ownership interest of a TNInvestco to increase the allowable ownership interest to 25 percent. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 13; Title 64; Title 65 and Title 67.

As introduced, prohibits multicandidate political campaign committee from contributing to candidate after the fourteenth day before an election instead of after the tenth day. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires report by the commissioner of revenue to the study committee to examine and make recommendations regarding fiscal policy on the issue of natural disasters concerning administration of the sales tax refund program enacted in response to the May 2010 natural disaster. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows eligible financial institutions and qualified business enterprises to carry forward any unused amount of credits against franchise and excise tax liabilities beyond the tax years in which the applicable credits originated. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4.
As introduced, extends time for filing a duplicate copy of an amended return from 30 days to 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.

As introduced, requires the annual BEP report to be submitted on October 1 of each year to the governor, state board of education, select oversight committee on education, and education committees of the senate and house of representatives.
As introduced, specifies that students who are related by blood or marriage cannot be assigned to classes based only on the fact that they are related. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, specifies the type of documentation a person may attach to the required statement filed in support of a refund claim for taxes paid on petroleum products. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3.
As introduced, exempts private land used as an easement or right of way by a governmental entity from property taxation during the period of use. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, changes from "not sooner than 30 days" to "not sooner than 40 days" time within which lessor must give notice regarding non-payment of rental fees. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, requires that for purposes of determining the maximum dollar amount of an insurance policy when converting an insurance policy, the amount of such policy shall be rounded up to $20.00 instead of $10.00. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, adds to the content of fiscal notes a job implication statement to estimate if the measure would increase, decrease or not significantly impact jobs. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.

As introduced, permits the disclosure of confidential tax information or returns to state or federal authorities if the information or return is relevant to the authority's functions, regardless of the existence of any reciprocal agreements. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires annual report by the commissioner of revenue concerning payments in lieu of taxes from the Tennessee valley authority to the finance, ways, and means committees of the senate and house of representatives. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires preference to services by Tennessee bidder if cost of service is not 10% greater than cost of other similar services of similar expected quality that are not offered by a Tennessee bidder. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56 and Title 12.

As introduced, creates special joint committee to study the establishment of a rural infrastructure fund to assist economically distressed rural areas of the state. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 13; Title 54 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires all employers to register with the E-Verify system and verify the employment eligibility of all employees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 12; Title 16; Title 38; Title 39; Title 45; Title 50 and Title 70.
As introduced, extends ordinary duration of driver licenses from five to eight years; increases fees for driver licenses and photo identification cards. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, mandates that any insurer that provides health insurance coverage for cancer chemotherapy treatment must provide coverage for a prescribed, orally administered anticancer medication used to kill or slow the growth of cancerous cells. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, adds certain enforcement responsibilities to the employee misclassification advisory task force. - Amends TCA Section 50-6-919.
As introduced, makes a person who is charged with sexual exploitation of a minor ineligible for suspension of prosecution and pretrial diversion. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 15.

As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding additional information and follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency patients; specifies that exemptions from the utilization review standards for certain agents do not apply to the standards for outpatient mental health and chemical dependency care. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.
As introduced, adds as a consumer protection violation representing that an Internet-based ticket sale price has increased after the sale is completed. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1.

As enacted, adds firefighters and certain emergency services personnel to statute permitting law enforcement officers and certain TBI employees to request that an arrestee's blood be tested for certain infectious diseases. - Amends TCA Title 41 and Title 68.
As introduced, establishes criteria for evaluations of certified employees of LEAs and grievance of such evaluations by teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes current statutory language which authorizes the commissioner of commerce and insurance to assess investigatory and hearing costs. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As enacted, enacts the "Special Education Behavioral Supports Act," amending current restrictions on isolation and restraint in special education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10, Part 13.

As introduced, creates Class D felony aggravated assault offense of a person sentenced to confinement in an adult or juvenile facility throwing urine, blood or other bodily fluids upon an officer of the facility, intending the fluid to make contact with the officer and reasonably knowing the officer would find it offensive. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits any county, municipality or LEA from appropriating public funds generated from taxpayers to fund professional trade associations or associated public interest groups; removes authorization to use taxpayer funds for membership dues and traveling expenses incurred in attending meetings of Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1; Title 5, Chapter 7; Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 2.
As enacted, provides an unpaid leave of absence for members of the Tennessee state guard and civil air patrol. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 33, Part 1.
As introduced, creates grant program to assist processors of recycled plastic to be used as raw material in manufacturing. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 211.

As introduced, revises annual report date to general assembly from first Monday of February each year to first Monday of March each year. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 3; Title 4; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 12; Title 13; Title 35; Title 42; Title 47; Title 48; Title 64; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.
As introduced, enacts the "Ticket Broker Licensing Act." - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, authorizes the transfer of a juvenile from juvenile to adult court if the juvenile commits an aggravated assault against an employee of a juvenile detention facility to which the juvenile has been committed or is confined. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the Tennessee wildlife resources agency to post the annual report of estimated acreage closed, opened, and added on its Web site. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, changes the punishment for the offense of abuse of a corpse from a Class E felony to a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-312.

As introduced, applies the Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to all counties for rental or lease agreements entered into or renewed on or after July 1, 2011; currently the Act only applies to counties with a population of more than 68,000. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes issuance of new specialty earmarked plates for Donate Life; 50% of the proceeds from sale of such plates earmarked for Tennessee Donor Services to raise awareness of organ and tissue donation. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits the department of environment and conservation from issuing permits related to surface mining activities under certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 221 and Title 69.
As introduced, extends time to resubmit a corrected municipal solid waste region plan from 60 days to 75 days and corrects reference to state agency. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, allows a student with a documented medical disability that restricts the student's attendance to part-time to petition for an extension of time in which to receive a Tennessee HOPE scholarship; revises law regarding the dual enrollment grant. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, authorizes commissioner of finance and administration to enter into agreements with certain citizen support organizations to donate monetary gifts, goods or services to be used by Volunteer Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3.
As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7%. - Amends Chapter 219 of the Private Acts of 1988.
As introduced, revises certain provisions pertaining to cable television services. - Amends TCA Section 67-6-103 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2.
As introduced, exempts sale of water for certain agricultural purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; allows franchise and excise tax credit for employers equal to certain portion of wages paid to each new full-time employee who was previously unemployed. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Reemployment Act of 2011"; authorizes franchise and excise tax credit of $5,000 to employers for each newly hired employee previously receiving unemployment compensation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.

As introduced, exempts sale of food and food ingredients, except prepared food, alcoholic beverages, candy, dietary supplements, and tobacco, from state sales and use taxation beginning January 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, authorizes certain allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 12.
As enacted, authorizes licensure and regulation of businesses where customers can make wine for personal, home consumption. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-703 and Title 57.
As introduced, requires licensure of independent insurance adjusters. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, allows an aggrieved party to appeal a workers' compensation specialist's order of future medicals in a workers' compensation case after judgment or settlement. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, changes the amount and time period within which a person can purchase base ephedrine and pseudoephedrine from a pharmacy and decreases the amount of base necessary for the offense of promoting the manufacture of methamphetamine. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, permits parents to see the body of an adult child prior to the commencement of an autopsy; authorizes the state to restrict a parent from touching the body to the extent necessary to preserve evidence. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 38 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires the state or a local subdivision to post results of a feasibility study relative to converting a right-of-way into a hiking-bicycle trail on the appropriate Web site of the state or local subdivision. - Amends TCA Title 11.

As introduced, extends authority of commissioner of labor and workforce development to enjoin operation of a business or to order monetary penalties to include workers' compensation premium fraud by an employer. - Amends TCA Title 50.

As introduced, reduces the time within which the board for licensing contractors is to post disciplinary actions on its Web site from 30 days to two business days; changes reference to an advertising campaign to a public information campaign about the board's disciplinary efforts. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.

As introduced, creates a statutory physical invasion of privacy and constructive invasion of privacy cause of action; creates a fund where half of any civil penalties collected are deposited, with the other half going to prosecuting counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 66.
As introduced, imposes requirements on municipalities and counties for operation and new locations of traffic enforcement cameras. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.
As introduced, extends deadline for applications for 2011-2012 annual events for five days after effective date of act. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17, Part 1.
As introduced, makes it unlawful to hunt on private lands or waters within 100 yards of a visible dwelling house. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As enacted, specifies, in certain situations, that if the owner of the vehicle is not present, then prior to any person, firm or entity towing a vehicle, such person, firm or entity must notify local law enforcement of the vehicle identification number (VIN), registration information, license plate number and description of the vehicle; local law enforcement must keep a record of all such information which would be available for public inspection. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16; Title 55, Chapter 21, Part 1; Title 66, Chapter 19, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28, Part 5.

As introduced, requires Tennessee housing development agency to study feasibility of establishing a Tennessee foreclosure mediation program. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35; Title 45; Title 47 and Title 66.
As introduced, prohibits certain types of late fees from being charged in consumer contracts. - Amends TCA Title 47.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee higher education commission to create common application and common financial aid application to be used by all higher education institutions within the state university and community college system and the University of Tennessee by the 2012-2013 academic year. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, lowers the fees authorized to be charged for deferring the presentment of a check or for making a title loan and lowers the interest authorized to be charged for making a title loan. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, allows a court to consider the reasonable preference of a child, who is 10 instead of 12, when determining whether to allow a custodial parent to move more than 100 miles from the noncustodial parent.

As introduced, requires local law enforcement to make every reasonable effort to have a visible presence during the time a door-to-door campaign is scheduled upon the written request of the public official conducting such campaign. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, requires TSAC to publish eligibility requirements for the minority teaching fellows program. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-706.
As introduced, requires members of the general assembly to attend annual cultural awareness training. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1.

As introduced, extends authority for certain persons in Davidson County whose driver licenses have been suspended for failure to pay fines older than five years to pay outstanding judgment at reduced rate by payment plan over 10-month period. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502.
As introduced, limits actions taken by students while at school or on school grounds that are grounds for criminal charges being filed. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, defines installation and deinstallation services for sales tax purposes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, directs the comptroller to study issues relating to the letting of contracts for weatherization services by the department of human services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

As enacted, directs the office to study certain issues related to the use of old warrants and related process by local law enforcement and to report to the house and senate judiciary committees on or before February 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 41.
As introduced, provides for a special probation punishment for certain first offense marijuana violators who are age 18-21. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, makes it a criminal offense punishable by fine and community service only to knowingly wear pants below waistline to show underwear or buttocks; earmarks proceeds of fines to equipment for school activities. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 49.
As introduced, establishes a Tennessee civil rights education commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8 and Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits an insurer from taking an adverse action against a consumer based primarily on the consumer's insurance score, credit reports, or other credit information or based primarily on the fact the consumer does not have a credit account. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 56.
As introduced, prohibits an insurance company from setting rates based upon the zip code of the applicant's place of residence or employment. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 5.

As introduced, permits a candidate who has been assessed a civil penalty by the registry of election finance in an amount in excess of $5,000 to make installment payments; requires ouster proceedings be initiated if after the qualifying deadline the candidate fails to make payments in accordance with the agreement entered into with the registry. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 8.
As introduced, requires first or second term inmates without high school diplomas or GEDs to attend GED examination preparation classes. - Amends TCA Title 41, Chapter 21.
As introduced, requires the commissioner to study the feasibility of sunsetting sales exemptions on a staggered schedule to be followed by their reauthorization every 10 years. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires 24-hour notice of approximate time of removal pursuant to writ of possession and holds plaintiff liable for damages to defendant's removed personal property if notice requirements are not followed. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 66, Chapter 28.

As introduced, defines employee for purposes of adult-oriented establishments and prohibits employees from living on the same premises or in the same building as the establishment. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.

As introduced, requires protective devices in shopping carts equipped with child seats; establishes that the failure to comply with such requirement violates the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.
As introduced, requires each person employed to work at an adult-oriented establishment or adult cabaret to be at least 21 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 57.

As introduced, clarifies that a juvenile court may order that a child be assigned a long-term mentor or receive counseling services if the child is found to be a delinquent child based on conduct involving the use of a firearm and adds any offense involving the use of a firearm to the list of offenses for which a juvenile court may transfer a juvenile to adult court. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, directs LEAs to make reasonable efforts to determine if students have health care insurance and to report findings to commissioner of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, allows a student who as an entering freshman meets all nonacademic requirements, but not the academic requirements for a HOPE scholarship, to qualify for the scholarship by meeting the collegiate grade point average continuation requirements after enrolling in an eligible postsecondary institution. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, permits Tennessee HOPE scholarship recipient to maintain academic eligibility by maintaining good standing at the eligible postsecondary institution in which the student is enrolled; changes initial eligibility requirements for certain students to conform to the change in the continuing eligibility requirement. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, creates the ASPIRE work study program to provide additional postsecondary financial assistance from net lottery proceeds to students receiving both the Tennessee HOPE scholarship and the ASPIRE award. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires drivers to submit proof of compliance with the financial responsibility law prior to registering car; establishes fines for failure to comply with such law. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 12 and Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, allows the governor to employ special counsel in certain situations and adds additional duties for the attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.

As introduced, clarifies that authority for department of revenue's officers to enforce provisions of tobacco tax law does not limit attorney general's duty to enforce or defend Tobacco Master Settlement Agreement. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As introduced, under certain circumstances, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to capture visual images of persons, except elected officials; increases penalties for assault, false imprisonment, criminal trespass, trespass by motor vehicle, unlawful observation, and reckless driving when done with intent to capture such images. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 3; Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 4 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 2.

As introduced, requires rental agreement under Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act to include, as an addendum, energy audit of estimated energy usage at dwelling unit. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 28.
As enacted, requires LEAs to implement a project-based assessment in civics at least once in grades 4-8 and at least once in grades 9-12. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, authorizes state funding board to require public entities to adopt the model finance transaction policies created by the board and clarifies that such policies would include budgeting and capital planning, finance transaction management, investment, and risk management. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 15; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 9.
As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of Joe DeLong.
As introduced, expresses intent to name appropriate bridge or section of highway in Warren County in honor of the late Jeremy Brown.

As introduced, requires department of financial institutions, with assistance from state treasurer, to develop guide to enhance deposits of state funds into eligible community banks, and disseminate such information to banks across state. - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.

As introduced, states that law enforcement will be deemed to have probable cause to search any known member of a criminal gang or person wearing clothing or insignia indicating affiliation with a criminal gang if the gang has been implicated in the death of a U.S. law enforcement officer killed in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, states that a person who provides personal support services to clients living in their own private residence must, prior to assisting the client with medication, have received training in medication assistance developed by a registered nurse. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes five-year statute of limitations for disciplinary actions against physicians by the board of medical examiners, and against osteopathic physicians by the board of osteopathic examination. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5; Title 28; Title 29, Chapter 26; Title 63, Chapter 6 and Title 63, Chapter 9.
As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $2,000 for each full-time employee job created by a qualified small business. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, names Tennessee National Guard Armory in Tullahoma in honor of Command Sergeant Major Howard Boswell.

As introduced, deletes requirement that department of agriculture prepare annual report concerning activities of the Tennessee agricultural museum board for approval by the governor. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 44.
As enacted, expresses intent to name certain bridge in Franklin County in honor of the late D. Alex Stephens.

As introduced, allows a judge who has a permit to carry a handgun and is in the actual discharge of duties as a judge to carry a handgun while in the courtroom. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.
As introduced, removes the jury's ability to sentence a defendant convicted of first degree murder to death. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, requires a residential property disclosure form to include information on the average utility cost for the property over the previous calendar year. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 5.

As introduced, raises the age to be an entertainer in a cabaret or other adult-oriented establishment from 18 to 21; requires any political subdivision that has or adopts an ordinance regulating such establishments to require certain information be provided by a person applying for a permit as an entertainer. - Amends TCA Title 7.
As introduced, requires the department of human services to develop and administer a child care assistance program for low income and at risk children. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 3, Part 5.

As introduced, subject to local approval, changes the term of office for mayor from two years to four years beginning with the August 2012 local election. - Amends Chapter 603 of the Private Acts of 1949; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the due dates for property taxes in the City of Elkton. - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended and rewritten.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, raises monetary limit on purchases that do not require prior approval of the board of mayor and aldermen, from $1,000 to $5,000; raises limit on purchases that do not require competitive bidding, from $5,000 to $10,000. - Amends Chapter 192 of the Private Acts of 1994.

As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the mayoral term from two years to four years and alters the election cycle so that city elections are held in November in 2014, 2016, and every other year thereafter.

As introduced, subject to local approval, beginning with the 2014 city election, moves the election of the mayor and board of aldermen to coincide with the November general election. - Amends Chapter 350 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes county mayor to nominate persons for membership on the board of commissioners of the Tennessee Technology Corridor Development Authority; authorizes board to review the environmental and developmental impact of medium and high density residential developments. - Amends Chapter 148 of the Private Acts of 1983; as amended.
As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal years beginning July 1, 2010, and July 1, 2011.

As enacted, revises certain provisions of law necessary for implementation of appropriations act, including authorizing and prohibiting the transfer of certain funds; terminating the local planning assistance section of the department of economic and community development; and clarifying the duties of certain governmental entities. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2011-2012 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $200 million or 1.65 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.

As enacted, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for 2010-2011 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the state's economy by $250 million or 2.15 percent. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 4, Part 52.
As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $273 million.

As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds and anticipation notes of up to $106.4 million for purpose of grants to the Southeast Tennessee Development District and the Industrial Development Board of the City of Memphis and Shelby County.
As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal year beginning July 1, 2010.

As introduced, subject to local approval, designates the four at-large aldermanic positions as A,B,C, and D and requires that candidates select and designate the position being sought. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 294 of the Acts of 1903.
As introduced, subject to local approval, requires two readings for passage of an ordinance instead of three. - Amends Chapter 683 of the Private Acts of 1951.

As introduced, subject to local approval, permits flexibility for the development tax to be collected at the time a building permit is issued or to defer collection until a certificate of occupancy is issued. - Amends Chapter 28 of the Private Acts of 1997.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 551 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.
As introduced, modifies requirements for membership on the board of trustees for the Cookeville Regional Medical Center Authority. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999, as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter.
As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the position of road commissioner. - Amends Chapter 130 of the Private Acts of 1927; as amended.
As introduced, requires county assessors to audit the value and levels of assessment of public utility property located in their respective counties. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 13.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter. - Amends Chapter 99 of the Private Acts of 1973.

As introduced, subject to local approval, requires reading of ordinances on two different days, rather than three, prior to adoption; authorizes mayor to appoint a director of public works, subject to confirmation by the city council; increases salary of mayor. - Amends Chapter 235 of the Private Acts of 1945; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter.
As introduced, subject to local approval, modernizes the city charter. - Amends Chapter 135 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to establish staggered terms for the aldermen, to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the recorder and revise the duties of the recorder, and to eliminate the need for periodic reappointment of the police chief. - Amends Chapter 450 of the Acts of 1901.
As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the hotel-motel tax from an amount not to exceed 5% to an amount not to exceed 7.5%. - Amends Chapter 145 of the Private Acts of 1979.
As introduced, establishes tuition waiver at public institutions of higher education for dependents of first responders who are killed in the line of duty. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, extends the period in which an eligible person may collect extended unemployment benefits pursuant to the federal Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, changes method of electing the five members of the South Carroll County Special School District board of education from election of one member from each of five districts to election of all members on a district wide basis. - Amends Chapter 278 of the Private Acts of 1955; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes city to set criteria for awarding contracts by ordinance, rather than by charter provision, in accordance with the Municipal Purchasing Law. - Amends Chapter 327 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell bonds of up to $150 million.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Title 9 and Title 45.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 or June 2011 to expire December 1, 2014 or 2016. - Amends Chapter 298 of the Private Acts of 1972.
As enacted, revises certain provisions regarding tort actions and damages. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 47.
As introduced, repeals Chapter _ of the Public Acts of 2011 (Senate Bill 632 / House Bill 600). - Repeals Chapter ___ of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, requires that taxpayer-funded family planning services and programs to be provided through the county health departments or, alternatively, by the department of health; prohibits payment of such family planning funds to third-party providers or private organization or entities. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.
As introduced, enacts the "Caylee Anthony Act." - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, penalizes a parent for failing to report a missing child. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 374 in Clarksville as "Officers David Scott and Yamil Baez-Santiago Memorial Parkway."
As introduced, permits the sale of consumer fireworks in Shelby County by deleting language that prohibits the sale of fireworks in such county. - Amends TCA Section 68-104-112.
As introduced, removes authority of Tennessee wildlife resources commission and TWRA to regulate hunting of wild hogs on private land. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As enacted, allows persons age 60 and older to vote absentee upon request, instead of age 65 and older; effective until July 1, 2017. - Amends TCA Section 2-6-201(5).
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee Works Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 50, Chapter 7.
As introduced, appropriates $15 million to the board of regents to provide funding for equipment and program expansion at the technology centers. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, institutes Tennessee small business sales tax holiday program. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, requires the University of Tennessee to develop a plan that will double the output of the West Tennessee solar farm by 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to maintain a publicly accessible database of commercial real estate that is available for sale throughout the state. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires the department of economic and community development to ensure the full development of the West Tennessee megasite; appropriates funds for such purpose. - Amends TCA Title 64, Chapter 6.
As introduced, enacts the "Equal Opportunity Scholarship Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, provides that a prosecution can be commenced for certain offenses committed on or after July 1, 2012, within the applicable period established by law or within one year after the date on which the accused's identity is established through DNA evidence, whichever period is longer. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, makes knowingly killing a police dog that is acting in its official capacity a Class D felony. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, requires commissioner to include analysis of impact of utilizing regional water planning methods of other states on tax revenues in 2013 report to general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that no statutory private right of action is created unless statute contains express language creating the right; prohibits implied rights of action unless certain requirements met, such as fact that there is no controlling statute and action based on common law. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that doctrine of joint and several liability does not apply in civil actions governed by comparative fault except for applicable cases involving the family purpose doctrine. - Amends TCA Title 20, Chapter 6, Part 1 and Title 29, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, codifies that with certain exceptions a landowner owes no duty of care to a trespasser and is not subject to civil liability for injury, death or property damage suffered by a trespasser while on the landowner's land. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 34.
As introduced, requires compliance with state and federal constitutions as well as judicial decisions in passing congressional redistricting plan. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 16, Part 1.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.

As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography; clarifies provisions concerning districts, terms and vacancies prior to November 2012 elections; clarifies that house districts are not affected by reapportionment of county legislative bodies. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.
As introduced, updates reference to 2010 TIGER system; clarifies contiguity by water is sufficient. - Amends TCA Section 2-16-103.
As introduced, clarifies that senate must comply with applicable federal statutes. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-102.
As introduced, updates references to 2010 TIGER system and geography. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-103.

As introduced, limits ability of local governments to place employment practices, standards or other requirements on businesses that deviate from, modify, supplement, add to, change or vary in any manner from state statutorily imposed or recognized requirements. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-1802.

As introduced, requires increases in property tax rates higher than 1 percent by a county or municipality to be approved through a referendum; authorizes the referendum process. - Amends TCA Title 2; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 67.

As introduced, revises provisions governing liability of landowners who permit others to use their land for recreational purposes free of charge. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 49 and Title 70, Chapter 7.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Civil Rights Initiative Act." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 21.

As introduced, adds carjacking and especially aggravated burglary to offenses for which a defendant is required to serve at least 85 percent of the sentence before release eligibility; provides that certain prisoners be released upon turning 65 if they have served 15 consecutive calendar years. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, limits advertising of ticket sales to retailer premises; prohibits advertising to promote the lottery via media. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Linked Deposit Act." - Amends TCA Section 4-29-236; Title 9 and Title 45.
As enacted, specifies that charter schools may promote or retain students based upon the students' demonstrated skills on the TCAP tests or upon their grades. - Amends TCA Section 49-6-3115.
As introduced, appropriates $130 million to the board of regents for the purpose of constructing a science building at MTSU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires review and approval of the state funding board before a local government could borrow money or contract for or issue debt if the debt of the local government is greater than 10 percent of the assessed valuation of its taxable property or if the proposal for new debt would exceed such 10 percent level. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 9.
As enacted, names Murfreesboro National Guard Armory in honor of the late First Lieutenant William Eric Emmert.

As introduced, prohibits gifts to a member of the general assembly, the value of which exceeds $50.00, and which is also made available to the general public; provides an exception to this prohibition. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As introduced, revises current law to restrict the entities to which the department of health may disburse federal Title X family planning funds to certain public agencies. - Amends TCA Section 68-34-105.

As introduced, allows a student who has completed an associates degree while receiving a Tennessee HOPE scholarship to be eligible for a Wilder-Naifeh technical skills grant to attend a Tennessee technology center in a diploma or certificate program, provided the student meets certain eligibility requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, deletes provision stating that a court may permanently modify a decree of child custody or visitation in the event that a parent volunteers for permanent military duty as a career choice. - Amends TCA Section 36-6-113.

As introduced, requires students who score below proficient on TCAP test or do not demonstrate competency on end-of-course examination to attend summer school or receive tutoring in the subject tested at the expense of the student's parent and be retested prior to being promoted or receiving credit for course. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows teachers and principals with superior value added growth data scores to choose those scores to comprise 50 percent or more of their evaluations based on standards set by the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, expands, subject to certain restrictions, the private universities or colleges that are permitted to have police forces. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-118.

As enacted, requires the alcoholic beverage commission to report certain information regarding high alcohol content beverages to the state and local government committees of the senate and house of representatives by January 30, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 1; Title 57, Chapter 3; Title 57, Chapter 4 and Title 57, Chapter 5.

As introduced, allows a mattress manufacturer, wholesaler or retailer to offer a comfort exchange policy pursuant to the sale of a mattress. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 15, Part 2.
As enacted, expands authorization of new specialty earmarked license plates for Sons of Confederate Veterans to include issuance of such plates for motorcycles. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As enacted, revises provisions governing the filling of vacancies occurring on the board of commissioners of certain multi-county utility districts. - Amends TCA Section 7-82-307 and Title 7, Chapter 82, Part 6.

As introduced, effective July 1, 2012, creates a new defined contribution plan as a mandatory retirement package for newly hired state employees; closes existing defined-benefit pension plan to newly hired state employees; requires state agencies to contribute no less than 6 percent and up to 15 percent of a participating employee's salary to an individual account and contribute a certain rate to the defined benefits plan in order to cover the plan's unfunded liabilities. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 1; Title 8, Chapter 25, Part 3; Title 8, Chapter 34; Title 8, Chapter 36 and Title 8, Chapter 37.

As introduced, prohibits controlled substance analogues that have substantially same chemical structure as a controlled substance or have a similar effect on the central nervous system as a controlled substance and punishes the offense the same as the controlled substance to which it is similar. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the department to pay pregnant women who are enrolled in TennCare and living in certain zip codes $50.00 for each prenatal office visit they attend from 2013-2018. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, changes date for annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend in August to the last weekend in July each year. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As enacted, enacts the "Uniformity in Tax Increment Financing Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 9 and Title 13.

As introduced, creates felony offenses for concealing, harboring, shielding from detection, transporting, or any attempt thereof, certain persons in this state; provides that certain property utilized in committing such offenses be subject to forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41 and Title 50.
As introduced, establishes standards for state recognition of Native American Indian tribes. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, prohibits bureau of TennCare from paying for psychotropic prescription drugs that are not used for medically indicated uses in the medical assistance program. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As enacted, creates Class A misdemeanor offense of knowingly or recklessly maiming or harming a service animal and the Class C misdemeanor of interfering with a service dog in the performance of its duties and provides for restitution to the handler of the dog. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.

As introduced, allows home school students, including those in schools conducted by parents associated with an organization that conducts church-related schools, to participate in extracurricular athletics if the student meets the academic and conduct standards required of other participants; prohibits, subject to certain conditions, charging home school students participation fees by public schools and tuition by private schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-50-801 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, establishes a standard, which excludes certain expenses, to be used by the authority for determining justness and reasonableness of water utility rates. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 65, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that a person may be prosecuted, tried and punished for producing obscene material, sexual exploitation of a minor, aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor or especially aggravated sexual exploitation of a minor, no later than 25 years from the date the child becomes 18 years of age. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 2.
As enacted, codifies the Acts of the 2011 legislative session.

As introduced, creates Class E felony of aggravated cruelty to livestock, which is intentionally engaging in specified conduct in a depraved and sadistic manner that results in serious bodily injury or death to the animal and is done without lawful or legitimate purpose. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 2.
As introduced, requires publication of notice of maturity of school bonds issued by a county on the county's web site. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, requires court, when competency of a criminal defendant to stand trial is an issue, to hear testimony to determine if the defendant poses a likelihood of serious harm if ordered for an evaluation of competency on an outpatient basis. - Amends TCA Title 33, Chapter 7, Part 3.

As introduced, changes a terminating event for receipt of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship from attempt at any postsecondary institution of a specified number of semester hours to receipt of the scholarship for a fixed number of full-time equivalent semesters. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, creates Class E felony for failure of a child's parent to report within one hour of the time the parent discovers or should discover that the child is dead or that the child is missing for more than 48 hours. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4.

As enacted, authorizes any county that adopts either or both of the litigation taxes authorized by law to also adopt a resolution by a two-thirds majority vote of the legislative body to use those funds, in addition to the purposes described in law, for the purpose of obtaining and maintaining software and hardware associated with collecting, receiving and maintaining records for law enforcement agencies. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 6.

As enacted, adds offenses the conviction of which requires the offender to be on the methamphetamine registry, makes registry retroactive and revises procedure by which methamphetamine-related convictions are transmitted to TBI from clerk's office. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4.

As introduced, prohibits pain management clinics and prescribers at such clinics from prescribing certain drugs to a patient in an amount that exceeds the drug manufacturer's recommended dosage. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 53; Title 63 and Title 68.

As enacted, changes T.C.A. to reflect renaming of the senate environment, conservation and tourism committee as the "senate energy and environment committee." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 11; Title 43; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.

As enacted, transfers Title 68, Chapter 103, relative to working in proximity to high-voltage lines, into Title 50, Chapter 3, relative to the Occupational Health and Safety Act, effective July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 50 and Title 68, Chapter 103.

As enacted, criminalizes possession, use, transfer or installation of software designed to manipulate retail records of transactions for evading payment of sales tax to the state. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 67.
As enacted, names bridge on U.S. 127 in Cumberland County in honor of late Frederick A. Hassler, U.S. Army.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of revenue to revoke business licenses for the illegal sale of synthetic drugs and the local beer boards to revoke the beer license of a business selling such drugs. - Amends TCA Section 8-21-401; Section 39-17-452; Title 57, Chapter 5 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 7.

As enacted, changes references from "county audit division" to "comptroller of the treasury" and "department of audit" in provisions regarding judicial information system advisory committee members; the county financial management system; and audits of the solid waste authority. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 16 and Title 68.

As enacted, classifies as a confidential record the emergency contact information for any state, county, municipal or other public employee or former employee, or of any law enforcement officer in the employ of a public college or university. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7.
As enacted, removes the 2012 repeal date for the Tennessee's Transitioning Youth Empowerment Act of 2010. - Amends TCA Section 37-2-417 and Chapter 1065 of the Public Acts of 2010.

As introduced, revises provisions governing placement of child outside the care of the child's parent or guardian by a court order as grounds for the initiation of the termination of parental rights. - Amends TCA Section 36-1-113.

As introduced, revises provisions governing the department's reciprocity with other states' confidentiality requirements and confidentiality of NAIC information; adds to the definition of "company action level event" under the Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Act. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2; Title 56, Chapter 22; Title 56, Chapter 44 and Title 56, Chapter 44.
As enacted, revises provisions governing deposit of securities in clearing corporation. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 2 and Title 56, Chapter 3.

As enacted, adopts the 2010 ADA Standards for Accessible Design as the standards to be followed to make a building accessible to those with physical disabilities when constructing or altering a public building. - Amends TCA Section 68-120-204(a)(1).

As enacted, extends provisions regarding employee compensation and indemnification for officers killed in the line of duty to police officers employed by the state. - Amends TCA Section 7-51-208(a)(2).

As enacted, revises provisions governing the exercise of police powers by department employees and governing the authority of certain department employees to carry firearms. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-609 and Section 39-17-1350.

As enacted, clarifies purposes of FastTrack programs; requires certain reports be submitted to secretary of state; revises other provisions governing The Tennessee Job Growth Act of 2005. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-715; Section 4-3-716 and Section 4-3-717.

As introduced, classifies as confidential the due diligence materials submitted by a company to the department of economic and community development; confidentiality applies until such time as the provider of the material no longer requires its confidentiality. - Amends TCA Section 4-3-730.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing school accountability and achievement school district. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 6 and Title 49, Chapter 13.
As introduced, removes prohibition on using records from students eligible for special education services under federal law as part of the value added assessment. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-606.
As introduced, revises various provisions governing pupil-teacher ratios and salaries. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1; Title 49, Chapter 3, Part 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 4.

As introduced, requires commissioner of environment and conservation to impose certain conditions to provide mitigation of impact when issuing a permit for an activity that will cause alteration of aquatic resources in waters. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
