As introduced, establishes an exception to the consent requirement for disclosure of medical records if the patient has been deceased for more than 10 years and the records requested are more than 50 years old; and allows state to charge up to $25.00 to the requester of the records. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 33, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits local or regional planning commission from prohibiting private road maintenance agreements in residential developments. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, defines the term "agreement" to be the agreement between the commissioner of transportation and the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Transportation for purposes of defining unzoned industrial and commercial areas and the size, lighting and spacing of outdoor advertising. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 54.
As introduced, creates different requirements for subdivisions and development in counties in which county-wide zoning has not been enacted. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor to knowingly transport or release into the wild, or cause to be transported into or within the state, live wild-appearing swine into or within the state without appropriate documentation from the department of agriculture. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, prohibits certain counties whose chief administrative officers of highway departments are exempt from state qualifications for holding such office from being eligible to receive state-shared fuel taxes or grant funds from the department of transportation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1 and Title 67.

As introduced, states that teachers of non-academic subjects that are not measured by TVAAS data shall not be evaluated based on such data; allows each LEA to create an annual evaluation system for such teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes a commercially-operated recreational facility that meets certain characteristics to qualify as a premier type tourist resort for purposes of the sale of alcoholic beverages for on-premises consumption; authorizes a restaurant around Center Hill Lake in DeKalb county that meets certain criteria to qualify as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102.

As enacted, continues the career and technical class size extension pilot project in the Metro Nashville public schools; provides that the pilot shall only be used in schools or programs implementing the career academy or small learning community model. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As introduced, revises disclosures required and cancellation provisions relative to time-shares and prohibits certain advertisements. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 32.
As enacted, designates unpublished telephone numbers as confidential when in the possession of the emergency communications board or its designated agent. - Amends TCA Section 10-7-504.

As enacted, clarifies provisions regarding forfeitures of a cash bond or other surety as the result of a municipal traffic violation being transmitted to the TBI. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 38, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, terminates salary adjustments for any judge who is convicted of or pleads guilty or no contest to a felony constituting official malfeasance. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, revises provisions related to dues deductions if a certain percentage of members engage in a work stoppage; decreases amount of time for use of leave and benefits for chief elected officers of employee associations and other association members to attend association's annual meeting. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23 and Title 8, Chapter 50.

As introduced, requires annual authorization by state employees of certain portions of payroll deductions for employee associations; provides for record keeping of those organizations and for voluntary withdrawal of nonmandatory dues by employees. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 23.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for any person, including any individual or entity, to knowingly prepare, sign, or file any lien or other document with the intent to encumber any real or personal property when such person has no reasonable basis or any legal cause to place such lien or encumbrance on such real or personal property. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 1.

As enacted, expands definition of "uses" and "conducts" to include "transport" and "conceal" for purposes of the money laundering criminal offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40 relative to criminal offenses and criminal procedure.

As enacted, requires that, if a report of child abuse alleges physical abuse, it will be in the best interest of the child that the child be referred to a child advocacy center or that the investigation be conducted by a child protective services investigator who is adequately trained in investigating physical abuse reports; prohibits any probation officer previously assigned to the child from performing the investigation under any circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, establishes a four-year parental involvement pilot program in the school system with the most schools in the achievement school district (ASD); limited to schools operated by the ASD that serve grades K-3 or any combination thereof. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act." - Amends TCA Title 1; Title 8 and Title 10.
As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions governing scrap metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 62.

As introduced, requires the department of education to include in its annual report by LEA and statewide the number and percentage of teachers scoring each possible effectiveness rating on the teacher evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, reclassifies the Tennessee Walking Horse cultural license plate as a new specialty earmarked license plate; changes the distribution of revenue from 80 percent to the arts and 20 percent to the highway fund to 50 percent to the TN Equine Association, 40 percent to the arts and 10 percent to the highway fund. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, revises teacher and principal evaluation system. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires law enforcement to notify, within 30 days of impoundment, the owner and lienholders having an interest in a methamphetamine vehicle. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

As enacted, requires a special education diploma be awarded to students who have satisfactorily completed an IEP with satisfactory attendance and conduct, but who have not passed the proficiency tests required for graduation with a regular diploma. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 60.

As introduced, increases annual Hall income tax exclusion from first $1,250 to $7,500 for individual returns and from first $2,500 to $15,000 for joint returns beginning January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2, Part 1.

As introduced, adds retired members of the Tennessee national guard to those who are authorized to receive discounted rates offered by the commissioner of conservation and environment for activities at state parks; requires discounted rates to be posted in a facility if the facility is one to which the rates apply; requires rates to be offered regardless of whether the state operates the facility or the facility is leased to or managed by a private entity. - Amends TCA Section 11-3-121.

As introduced, prohibits a private act hospital from entering into or renew a provider network or contract with a hospital or medical service corporation that contains an exclusive provider provision. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 57, Part 5.

As introduced, authorizes county boards of education, by agreement with city and special school districts, to allow students from such districts to access the county board's cooperative innovative high school program, if the city or special school districts have not established such program. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires the county mayor, county trustee and county board of education to make quarterly settlement of school funds from all sources, including the BEP and other state and federal funds. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.

As introduced, permits local boards of education to enter into continuing contracts governing the use of each other's schools in case of casualty losses or natural disasters. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 49.

As introduced, clarifies that unused municipal school buildings may be used by private child care centers and kindergartens for the purpose of providing educational and child care services to the community. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5; Title 49, Chapter 6; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 49, Chapter 2.

As enacted, specifies that from and after the effective date of the transfer of the administration of the schools in a special school district to the county board of education pursuant to present law, then the restrictions on the creation of new municipal school districts will no longer apply with such a county. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-112.

As introduced, increases tax on gasoline and diesel products one cent a year for the next five years; allocates funds from increase in tax to counties and cities. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 3, Part 9.

As enacted, voids contractual restrictions on a physician's right to practice medicine if such physician is employed independently of a bona fide practice purchase and is terminated by an employing entity for reasons other than breach by the employee. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-204 and Section 68-11-205.

As enacted, requires that, if a court wrongly grants a default decision imposing an obligation for child support from or against an eligible individual protected under the federal Servicemembers Civil Relief Act, the court must issue an order to the individual receiving funds that the funds be returned and reimbursed. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 25; Title 26; Title 27; Title 29; Title 36; Title 47 and Title 67.

As enacted, revises and adds to the considerations that the attorney general must make when deciding whether to object to a proposed public benefit hospital conveyance transaction. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 68.

As enacted, authorizes judge to order the use of an ignition interlock device for any person granted a restricted driver license; order may be with or without geographical restrictions, but if the device is ordered, then it must remain on the vehicle during the entire period of the restricted license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, clarifies that a person may be compelled to submit to an alcohol test under the implied consent law by other provisions of law, court order or search warrant. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As eancted, expands present law to provide that it is not a defense to a violation of the DUI statute that a person is or was lawfully entitled to use an intoxicant, marijuana, controlled substance, or other drug. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As enacted, establishes priority of right to the disposition of human remains and limits certain liability of funeral establishments and funeral directors. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.

As introduced, authorizes a 20 percent tax credit for a qualified purchaser of solar panels and related solar energy technology to be installed in a residence or business; allows the credit to be applied against sales and use taxes and franchise and excise taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, permits pharmacist, a pharmacy benefits manager or a covered entity to collect sales tax on diabetic supplies. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 67.

As introduced, establishes means by which students with documented disabilities who do not meet high school academic qualifications for a HOPE scholarship can attend college, meet college academic requirements and receive the scholarship. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As enacted, directs the board of the Tennessee corrections institute to establish criteria for determining whether to waive the minimum qualification standards to employ a jail administrator, workhouse administrator, jailer, corrections officer or guard in county jail or workhouse; and prohibits waivers for employees dishonorably discharged from the military, suffering from mental illness, convicted of domestic assault or any felony conviction. - Amends TCA Section 41-7-106.
As introduced, authorizes a court to order assisted outpatient treatment as an alternative to inpatient treatment for a person with mental illness. - Amends TCA Title 33.

As enacted, provides that if a sexual offender is not incarcerated at the time of sentencing, the offender is to report to a probation officer for the purpose of giving a DNA specimen; provides that cost of sample is to be paid by the offender. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 35, Part 3.

As enacted, clarifies that either party in a workers compensation dispute may bring suit in the county in which the employee resided at the time of the injury when issues remain after the benefit review conference; reduces from $100 to $50.00 the maximum amount that the secretary of state may charge for certain fees concerning construction service providers and workers compensation. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, decreases the notification timeframe for an enrollee or applicant to notify the bureau of any documentation changes from 30 days to 15. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, deletes authorization for demonstration project involving nursing homes and disabled volunteers. - Amends TCA Title 68.
As introduced, increases reporting requirements for the department of health, health care and services facilities, and entities receiving grants from annual to biannual. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, deletes the requirement that recommendations regarding public needs allowance to the general welfare, health and human resources committee of the senate and to the health and human resources committee of the house be received no later than the second Tuesday in January 2010. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, establishes that the final study of medical assistance program and any participating managed care organizations be reported to the finance, ways and means committees of the senate and the house, the office of legislative budget analysis and the fiscal review committee on or before April 1 of each year, instead of April 15. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the long-term care system. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As introduced, provides for a 5 percent instead of 10 percent reduction of penalty when deficient nursing home pays the penalty on or before the due date. - Amends TCA Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, revises provisions of the Uniform Commercial Code. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 1; Title 47, Chapter 2; Title 47, Chapter 2A and Title 47, Chapter 9.

As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections to file a report with the state and local government committees and speakers of each house no later than February 15 of each odd-numbered year detailing the success or failure of a minor party in receiving recognition as a recognized minor party during the previous election cycle. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires municipalities to report owner and address of unfit, blighted and deteriorated properties to the secretary of state for publication on secretary's web site until such condition is cured. - Amends TCA Title 13.

As introduced, criminalizes photographing a person without consent and with the knowledge that the person is in a private place or has a reasonable expectation of privacy; enhances the fine associated with false imprisonment, assault, criminal trespass and trespass by motor vehicle when those crimes are committed with the purpose of obtaining a photograph in violation of the new crime. - Amends TCA Title 20; Title 29; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, punishes by fine only, the Class C misdemeanor offense for failure to attend when summoned by the comptroller to provide books and records. - Amends TCA Title 67.
As introduced, reduces from 12 to 10 the number of months that a former member's legislative email will be forwarded to a private email account on request. - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, increases from 90 days to 120 days the notice period that clerks must provide to the state librarian and archivist before destroying books or records, in order that such documents may be examined for historical value. - Amends TCA Title 18.

As introduced, increases from $400 to $450 the penalty for conspiring not to report a newly hired employee to the department of human services for purposes of checking for child support arrearages and establishing paternity. - Amends TCA Title 36.

As introduced, requires the film, entertainment and music commission to notify any member of the general assembly who requests notification of a proposed production activity in the member's district; allows a county to qualify as an eligible enhancement county during a 36-month period instead of 24-month period for purposes of the job tax credit. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 49; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Section 67-4-2109 and Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, allows insurance companies to offer preference or distinction in property, marine, casualty, or surety insurance as to form or policy, certificate, premium, rate, benefits, or conditions of insurance, based upon membership, nonmembership, or employment of any person by or in certain groups. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, permits employees with valid handgun carry permits to store firearm in employer's public access parking lot provided it is in a locked vehicle and in a glove box or compartment not visible from outside the vehicle; provides employers with ability to prohibit firearms in employer parking lots in some circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, allows a person to carry a firearm during a judicial proceeding if the person is a judge, has a handgun carry permit and only carries the gun concealed while engaged in judicial duties. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-1306.

As enacted, states that coverage made available in plans under the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 shall constitute minimum essential health coverage for purposes of compliance with certain federal minimum coverage requirements; specifies that operation consistent with the present law standards described in the Memphis Plan Act of 1991 would create a presumption that the operating entity is a "health care sharing ministry" under federal law regarding minimum essential coverage. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, exempts certain residential real estate held by LLCs and limited partnerships as extended low-income housing commitments from property taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, requires the chair of the commerce, labor and agriculture committee of the senate and the chair of the commerce committee of the house to invite and compile comments from members of the telecommunications industry concerning the regulatory actions of the Tennessee Regulatory Authority. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As introduced, requires a public hearing on any rule or regulation proposed by THEC prior to the rule or regulation becoming effective and requires any affected institution be given notice of the hearing and an opportunity to present evidence to the commission. - Amends TCA Section 49-7-2005.
As introduced, limits general assembly members' terms to 12 years in the house and 12 years in the senate. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 1, Part 1.
As enacted, revises and clarifies various provisions of law related to probate matters. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 29; Title 30; Title 32; Title 33; Title 35 and Title 56.

As enacted, authorizes a city in a county not participating in a region to join the state regional system as related to state purchasing contracts with approval by the secretary of state; requires the secretary of state to assess fees from participating cities for any additional cost of services under the state contracts. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 5.
As enacted, prevents car dealerships from being held vicariously liable when loaning a vehicle to a customer with proof of insurance. - Amends TCA Title 55.

As introduced, adds a reference for certification of locksmiths to the most recent and recognized version of the American Locksmith of America Certification. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department of education to provide funding to certain entities that assist students in the custody of the department of children's services in obtaining a GED. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 49.
As introduced, permits state appropriations or state funds to be made to the directors of schools association. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 21.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee organization of school superintendents and the Tennessee school boards association to collaborate to set and achieve goals related to the general improvement of education in the state. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.

As enacted, requires that the license plates for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom be redesigned upon utilization of the existing inventory of the current versions of such plates by the department or revenue; requires that a new license plate be designed and made available to honorably discharged veterans and active members of the U.S. armed forces serving in Operation New Dawn. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, makes various changes to expunction of court files and records in juvenile court cases, allows unruly juveniles to petition for expunction of court files and records, and extends expunction to other scientific methods of establishing identity. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-155; Section 37-1-153 and Section 40-32-101.

As enacted, states that training for guardians ad litem shall include early childhood, child and adolescent development provided by a qualified professional; requires permanency hearings for children in foster care to be held within 12 months of previous permanency hearing. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-149; Section 37-2-409 and Section 37-1-129.

As enacted, requires petitions in juvenile court cases to list the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child; requires a copy of the summons in such cases be sent to the legal parents and any persons alleged to be the biological father of the child. - Amends TCA Section 37-1-121 and Section 37-1-120.
As introduced, exempts persons who canceled their social security numbers from furnishing such information to obtain a driver license. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-321.
As introduced, specifies proper notice be given prior to inspecting a taxpayer's books and records concerning certain privilege taxes. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 23.

As enacted, allows the name and address of the person that prepared an instrument that conveys or encumbers the title to real estate or personal property to appear anywhere within the instrument; revises other registration provisions. - Amends TCA Section 66-24-115.
As enacted, reduces the rate of assessment for the realty recordation tax. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-409.
As introduced, specifically includes provider-specific prescribing data within the confidentiality granted to medical records. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2.
As introduced, includes service performed by election officials and election workers receiving over $1,000 in remuneration in definition of excluded service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits unauthorized use of governmental seals, emblems or insignia; permits secretary of state and other officials to authorize the use of seals, emblems or insignia in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8; Title 12 and Title 39, Chapter 16.

As introduced, limits virtual school enrollment to students of the LEA creating the virtual school; permits LEAs to contract with each other to offer joint virtual education programs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.

As enacted, requires local board of education to approve budget for operation of county schools after the county legislative body's approval in accordance with Local Option Budgeting Law of 1993. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-101.
As introduced, authorizes the department of safety to charge for copies of motor vehicle records under the Uniform Motor Vehicles Records Disclosure Act. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 25.

As introduced, requires the chief administrative officer to file an inventory of all equipment and materials concerning road construction with the county governing body within 75 days after taking office instead of 60 days. - Amends TCA Title 54.

As enacted, requires CTAS to conduct a study of county librarians' salaries in this state as compared to those in states bordering this state. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 10.
As introduced, allows retired teachers' children who are under 24 years of age to receive a 25 percent discount at any state-operated institution of higher learning. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, specifies that the letter from a physician verifying a person's disability must set forth the nature of the disability, when applying for a photo identification license. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 50, Part 3 and Title 55, Chapter 51, Part 1.
As introduced, extends time period that timber purchaser must retain bill of sale from one year to 16 months. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As introduced, changes number of days within which a seizing agency must apply for a forfeiture warrant after seizing property from five to seven days. - Amends TCA Title 39.

As introduced, authorizes governmental entities to include language stating maximum penalty for offense of theft in signs warning public that theft of material from stone walls is theft. - Amends TCA Title 39.
As enacted, adds Echinacea Tennesseensis as a state wild flower, along with the passion flower. - Amends TCA Section 4-1-306.
As introduced, exempts the retail sale of the service of bathing animals from the sales tax imposed on laundering or dry cleaning of tangible personal property. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes each type of new specialty earmarked plates to be personalized so long as no duplicate registration numbers are issued to the same type of plate classification. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires any contract, plan, or policy of insurance issued or renewed on or after July 1, 2012, that provides coverage for surgical first assisting benefits or services be construed as providing coverage for a registered nurse first assistant. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.

As introduced, requires individual and group health insurance policies to cover neuropsychological testing for children who have been diagnosed with cancer who have undergone radiation or chemotherapy for cancer; requires commissioner of finance and administration to take all permissible action to obtain similar coverage for children on TennCare who are diagnosed with cancer on or after January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 71.
As introduced, punishes the failure to protect a child from severe child abuse in the same manner as if the offender committed the severe child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, specifies that LEAs may expend BEP funds earned for non-classroom components for the purpose of employing a building manager for a school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, authorizes a person who has at least 13 years creditable service in the TCRS and seven years creditable service in the optional retirement plan for employment at Tennessee Tech University during a specific period of time to have the option of transferring membership from the optional retirement program to the TCRS. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 35, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes county legislative bodies to opt in to state law prohibiting the regulation of wild hog hunting on private property by the wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 70.

As introduced, changes the eligibile creditable retirement date to 25 years of service instead of 30 years for dispatchers of emergency communications districts of political subdivisions that have set a mandatory retirement age for police officers and firefighters. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86 and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.
As enacted, revises and enacts various provisions regarding virtual schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, changes time when department of revenue is notified of an annexation from prior to the annexation becoming effective to upon the annexation becoming effective. - Amends TCA Section 6-51-115.

As enacted, provides that as part of a defendant's alternative sentencing for a violation of domestic assault, the sentencing judge may direct the defendant to complete a drug or alcohol treatment program or available counseling programs that address violence and control issues including, but not limited to, a batterer's intervention program that has been certified by the domestic violence state coordinating council. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits defendants who make an appearance bond from being considered indigent for purposes of a court-appointed attorney. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14; Title 16; Title 37, Chapter 1; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 55, Chapter 10, Part 4.

As introduced, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 12; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 50.
As introduced, requires that a person give identification when requested by law enforcement that are enforcing criminal laws. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits employment discrimination based on an applicant or current employee's ownership, storage, transportation or possession of a firearm that is otherwise in accordance with state and federal law. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40 and Title 50.

As introduced, requires persons licensed under the Deferred Presentment Services Act to file annual reports of certain information with the commissioner of financial institutions by October 1 of each year instead of September 1.

As introduced, increases from $1,000 to $2,000 the amount of civil penalty that the commissioner of financial institutions may assess for each transaction in violation, or each day that a violation occurs, of the Deferred Presentment Services Act. - Amends amend TCA.
As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the license fee for any person engaging in the business of deferred presentment services in this state.

As introduced, prohibits public and private employers from inquiring into a prospective employee's criminal background on an initial application for employment. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 13; Title 47; Title 49; Title 50 and Title 71.

As enacted, adds the offense of promoting prostitution to the list of sexual offenses requiring registration under the sex offender registry and adds second offense promoting prostitution to the list of violent sexual offenses. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As introduced, redefines an infamous crime for purposes of retaining the right of suffrage; authorizes incarcerated felons to vote except persons convicted of voter fraud, treason, first degree murder, or aggravated rape. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 20, Part 1 and Title 40, Chapter 29.
As introduced, authorizes until July 1, 2013, for sufficient number of applicants for Sigma Gamma Rho license plates. - Amends TCA Section 55-4-261.

As introduced, prohibits a person bidding on or awarded a state contract from making contributions to members of the general assembly or the governor during specified periods of time. - Amends TCA Title 2 and Title 12.
As introduced, requires local boards of education to provide payroll deduction options for employee benefits. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2, Part 2.
As introduced, prevents employers and landowners from prohibiting individuals licensed to carry from storing guns in locked, personal vehicles. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.
As enacted, requires the board of pharmacy to publish a list of opioid drugs incorporating tamper or abuse resistance properties. - Amends TCA Title 53.
As introduced, creates a separate offense for participating in criminal gang activity. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 35.

As enacted, includes the commission of or attempt to commit a criminal gang offense within the definition of racketeering activity and enterprise for purposes of the Racketeer and Corrupt Organization Act (RICO). - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12, Part 2.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of an American Lung Association new specialty earmarked license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As enacted, authorizes new mechanisms for merging or dissolving housing authorities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 20.

As introduced, requires health insurance policies to cover communication of mammographic breast density information to patients; requires physicians to communicate mammographic breast density information to patients. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 63.
As introduced, reuqires physicians to communicate certain information about mammographic breast density to patients. - Amends TCA Title 63.
As enacted, authorizes the diversion of harassing non-initialized 911 phone calls to a designated entity. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 86, Part 3.

As enacted, specifies that the Tennessee Hospital Association (THA) must use claims data received from the commissioner strictly for its own internal purposes and for internal purposes of its members. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 1.
As introduced, removes prohibition on collaborative conferencing concerning payroll deductions for political activities. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.
As introduced, requires each LEA to develop a policy that would require students to complete at least 75 hours of service learning prior to high school graduation. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, expands the definition of dependent and neglected child to include a child who has contracted a sexually transmitted disease. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 1, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department of human services to seek a waiver from the U.S. Department of Agriculture for cardholders' photos to be placed on EBT cards issued pursuant to the food stamp program and to submit implementation and cost information to the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 71, Chapter 5, Part 3.

As introduced, requires revocation or suspension for at least 60 days of beer sales permit held by any person who is convicted of a drug crime. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Section 8-21-401; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 57.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to revoke the tobacco license of a person convicted of a state drug offense for 60 days and requires the clerk of court to report convictions and pleadings to the commissioner for revocation purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 67.

As enacted, implements various procedures concerning controlled substance analogues in the same manner in which those procedures are carried out concerning controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 7; Title 8; Title 10; Title 29; Title 36; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 55; Title 57; Title 62; Title 63; Title 65; Title 67 and Title 68.

As introduced, expands categories of employees subject to routine periodic drug testing under the drug free workplace program to include persons who work in safety or security related positions. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 9.
As introduced, requires drug testing of persons filing new claims for unemployment benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 50.

As introduced, adds an additional faculty member and student member to the board of regents; makes terms of such members two years and one year as a nonvoting member, one as a voting member; removes a position on the board reserved for a person now deceased. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-201(a) and (b).

As enacted, eliminates certain reporting duties of higher education institutions and governing boards; eliminates requirement that applicants for certain positions in residence halls pay for background checks; requires board of regents employees to receive longevity payments with their regular paychecks. - Amends TCA Section 4-22-103; Section 8-23-206; Section 8-44-108(b)(3) and Section 49-7-149.
As enacted, allows the court to award back pay to a tenured faculty member whose dismissal the court finds was not appropriate. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-304.

As enacted, declares that teacher effect data made available to teacher preparation programs are not public records and will be used only in evaluating the preparation programs; requires each institution or postsecondary system receiving the estimates to develop a policy to protect the confidentiality of the data. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-606.
As introduced, clarifies that public charter schools are public schools for the purposes of reporting pupil attendance and truancy. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires a biennial report by the office of research and education accountability on costs of school construction for use by the BEP review committee in considering the capital outlay component of the BEP. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49 and Title 67.

As enacted, revises various provisions of the Agriculture Commodities Promotion Act, including provisions requiring certain reports by purchasers and provisions governing the membership of the beef promotion board. - Amends TCA Title 43, Chapter 29, Part 1.

As introduced, increases the number of days from 150 to 160 per year and from 75 to 80 per semester that a student must be present for classroom instruction for a student's TCAP scores to be attributable to a specific teacher. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, prohibits impact fees or adequate facilities taxes from being imposed on age-exclusive developments for persons 55 and older if children as permanent residents are also excluded; clarifies present acts imposing impact fees and adequate facilities taxes may be revised to reduce the fee or tax or remove types of property from being subject to such fees or taxes. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-2913.

As introduced, provides for re-establishment of elected office of school superintendent for county or city school systems upon two-thirds vote of county or city governing body and approval in an election on the question by the voters; provides for qualifications of candidates; adjusts duties of the local board of education in county or city school systems electing superintendents. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, extends notice to property owners of public hearing concerning redevelopment plan from 10 days to 14 days. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 31; Title 13, Chapter 20 and Title 29.
As enacted, adds additional language to the department's mission/purpose. - Amends TCA Section 37-5-102.

As introduced, grants adoption preference to a relative over a foster parent where a child has had substantial contact and interaction with that relative. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 1 and Title 37.
As introduced, prohibits defendants charged with domestic assault from pleading to a lesser offense. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, enhances the financial penalty for violating an order of protection. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, punishes domestic assault as a Class A misdemeanor. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3; Title 16, Chapter 15; Title 29, Chapter 13; Title 36, Chapter 3; Title 39 and Title 40, Chapter 35.
As introduced, provides for mutual consent placement of teachers and alternate options for teachers not selected for positions through mutual consent. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires that any proof of tolls incurred by jurors must include receipts. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 26, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 4, Part 1; Title 16, Chapter 3, Part 1 and Title 22, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of finance and administration to adopt policies for writing off or cancelling any checks drawn on the state treasury that have not been redeemed. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 9 and Title 66, Chapter 29.

As introduced, sets a 10-day period in which notice must be provided by a person seeking to collect a judgment out of funds held in the real estate education and recovery account. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 62, Chapter 13 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires that any governmental employee, on whose behalf the government chooses to pay the professional privilege tax, use their certification or licensure in connection with their employment. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 17.

As introduced, defines "state law" to be Tennessee statutes, rules and case law for purposes of the provision in the public records law exempting any records from disclosure that are confidential under "state law." - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, allows the commissioner to develop procedures setting forth circumstances under which direct deposit of state employees' compensation may be required. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 1; Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 10 and Title 8.
As enacted, authorizes local boards of education to receive federal or private grants for educational purposes; specifies the process for the making of such grants. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 2.
As introduced, replaces obsolete language concerning tenure with current terminology. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, creates Class C misdemeanor of a law enforcement officer unlawfully installing a tracking device on a person or object and establishes a procedure whereby the district attorney can apply to a court for permission to install a tracking device for a specified period for specified offenses. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 6.

As introduced, prohibits the use of unmanned aircraft or similar structures for the purpose of conducting investigations or surveillance where the investigating agency does not have a search warrant for the property under surveillance. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, broadens the purpose of certain statutory restrictions concerning who may enter school grounds during school hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.
As introduced, repeals licensure for locksmiths. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11.
As introduced, repeals requirement that manicurists be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 4.
As introduced, changes the reporting deadlines for entries to the controlled substance database from at least monthly to at least every two weeks. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 10.

As introduced, requires an LEA to provide proof of a child's graduation from high school to certain persons within 15 business days, instead of the current 20, of the persons' written request for such proof. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 6.

As introduced, prohibits a court clerk from accepting the filing of another claim by a litigant who owes fees, taxes, costs and other expenses unless the litigant seeks injunctive relief to prevent irreparable injury or serious physical harm to the litigant. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 18; Title 20 and Title 28.

As introduced, requires certain jails and detention facilities to report annually to the department of correction the number of persons arrested, booked or confined who are not U.S. citizens or whose citizenship status cannot be determined; requires the department to report annually such information to the house and senate speakers and judiciary committees. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 40 and Title 41.
As enacted, clarifies that a tax form, as such term is used in the part, means any form issued by the United States internal revenue service. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1, Part 7.
As introduced, creates a state bonus for teachers scoring 3 or higher on their evaluations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires a dealer that engages in the liquefied petroleum gas business to submit evidence that the storage of flammable, combustible or explosive material shall not present serious health, safety and fire risks to structures within 1,000 feet of any storage facility owned by the dealer. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 135, Part 1.
As introduced, exempts income derived from stocks and bonds of certain Subchapter S corporations from the Hall income tax. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 2.

As introduced, removes provision that permits clerks, registers of deeds, trustees and sheriffs to retain payments made for special services as a trustee, receiver or special commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 22, Part 1.

As enacted, specifies that LEAs and school administrators may not prohibit personnel from participating in constitutionally permissible religious activities on school grounds that are initiated by students at reasonable times before or after the instructional day so long as such activities are voluntary for all parties and do not conflict with the responsibilities or assignments of such personnel. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, defines "Public Safety Answering Point" or "PSAP" to mean a facility that receives 911 calls and routes them to emergency services personnel. - Amends TCA Section 7-86-103.
As enacted, authorizes issuance of Teamsters new specialty earmarked license plates. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, allows 40 days, instead of 30, to correct an unlawful sign. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 21.

As introduced, includes years of service to a political subdivision participating in the consolidated retirement system for which credit was established in the calculation of years of service for premium payment in retiree group insurance plan. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 27.
As enacted, names field house at York Institute in honor of Charles Joseph Vaughn.

As introduced, requires the coordinator of elections, in conjunction with the commissioner of safety, to equip a mobile unit or units to travel throughout the state to issue photo identifications to those meeting the requirements to obtain a photo identification free of charge to vote. - Amends TCA Section 2-11-202; Section 2-7-112 and Section 55-50-336.

As introduced, extends from 20 to 30 days the period of time to file a written notice of appeal before a citation or assessment becomes final for a violation of the rules and regulations promulgated by the oil and gas board. - Amends TCA Title 60.

As introduced, increases from two to three years time after designation into the system that the commissioner of environment and conservation have completed a comprehensive plan of development and protection and begun the process of acquisition. - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 60.

As introduced, authorizes members of boards of directors of credit unions to be compensated for services rendered, subject to review by the commissioner of financial institutions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 4, Part 2.
As enacted, revises multiple provisions of the Tennessee Business Corporation Act. - Amends TCA Title 48.

As enacted, authorizes issuance of Autism Awareness new specialty earmarked license plates; allocates proceeds to ASMT, Inc., for distribution to ASMT, Inc., Autism Society of East Tennessee, and the Autism Society of the MidSouth as nonprofit organizations dedicated to informational and referral services in their respective grand divisions. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, increases time in which petition challenging determination of capitalization rate, income estimates or land values must be filed with state board of equalization from 20 to 30 days prior to publication of notice of the availability of the proposed use value schedule in a newspaper of general circulation within the county. - Amends TCA Title 66, Chapter 9, Part 3 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 10.

As introduced, authorizes the commissioner of financial institutions to enforce title 47 (laws governing commercial instruments and transactions) against any entity regulated by the commissioner. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47.

As enacted, authorizes formation of a broad-based school foundation, subject to certain conditions, by a school or its administrators or supporters; authorizes school foundations, although not in existence for at least five years, to be 501(c)(3) organizations for purposes of the Tennessee Charitable Gaming Implementation Law; removes requirement that 501(c)(3) organizations wanting to conduct an annual event to raise no more than $5,000 be in existence for five years; extends certain deadline for 2011-2012 annual event period. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 17; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.

As introduced, changes from February to March the month in which an annual report must be filed by the Tennessee Regulatory Authority concerning all matters relating to its office. - Amends TCA Title 65.

As enacted, revises the punishment for the offenses of public indecency and indecent exposure and revises the definition of "public place" with regard to the offense of public indecency. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, revises information that must be filed when motor vehicles are sold to a motor vehicle dismantler and recycler; requires the department of safety to provide a means for statements to be filed electronically; makes falsification of required statements, with intent to defraud, the offense of forgery. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.
As introduced, expands department reporting requirements on the hazardous waste regulatory program. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 212.

As introduced, establishes reclamation regulation under mineral surface mining law and not local zoning regulations as law governing specified reclamation activities. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7 and Title 59, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As enacted, authorizes any town, city, county, county with a metropolitan government, the state or any not-for-profit to purchase, preserve, and sell development rights. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-101 and Section 13-7-201.

As introduced, includes certain reusable materials as finished goods or manufactured articles in the hands of the manufacturer for purposes of property taxation. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 2.

As introduced, establishes a veteran-owned business assistance program to be administered by the department of economic and community development. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7; Title 48, Chapter 102, Part 4 and Title 58.

As introduced, revokes the beer permit and license to sell tobacco products and prohibits renewal of lottery retail contract for a period of one year if the owner or employee of a retail establishment is convicted of selling certain synthetic, analogue or imitation controlled substances. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51; Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 4; Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 1 and Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 10.

As introduced, removes requirement of separately considering the vicarious liability for noneconomic damages of a defendant and the liability of an agent, employee or representative of the defendant. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 39.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to notify any organization sponsoring a specialty license plate when such plate has failed to meet the minimum issuance requirements. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, requires the Tennessee foreign language institute's annual report to include information on any monies received from private donors or government sources and schools with which the institute has collaborated or contracted. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes reference to the select oversight committee on education. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires the accounting manuals provided by the boards of education covering the various phases of student body activity funds and other internal school funds to be published on the Internet for viewing by students, parents, and faculty. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, exempts a person 60 years of age and older who does not have a valid driver license with a photo from the requirements of showing a photo identification when signing an application for ballot to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, provides individuals age 65 and older with the option to decline jury duty service. - Amends TCA Title 22.
As introduced, changes the annual sales tax holiday from the first weekend of August to the third weekend of July. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.

As enacted, makes it a Class A misdemeanor for a person 18 years of age or older to knowingly promote or organize a gathering of two or more minors in a public place with the intent to provide a location for such minors to engage in public indecency; any personal property used in the commission of a violation of this offense would, upon conviction, be subject to judicial forfeiture. - Amends TCA Title 39; Title 40; Title 67; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, specifies that painting and striping motor vehicle to appear to be a law enforcement vehicle, when it is not in-fact a law enforcement vehicle, with intent to cause another to believe the vehicle is a law enforcement vehicle constitutes Class A misdemeanor offense of criminal impersonation. - Amends TCA Section 8-10-120; Section 8-8-219; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 55.
As enacted, designates segment of S.R. 385 in Shelby and Fayette counties as "Governor Winfield Dunn Parkway."

As introduced, clarifies that owners, publishers, operators and employees of a publisher, television station or radio station are not liable for distributing false or misleading advertising matter regarding a mortgage loan unless they know that the matter is false or misleading. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 1; Title 45, Chapter 13 and Title 45, Chapter 5.
As enacted, revises provisions governing the extension of a contract to provide correctional services. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 41.

As introduced, allows alleged violator 10 days from receipt of letter from district attorney, instead of 15 days, to pay bad check plus fees prior to commencement of criminal action. - Amends TCA Title 40.
As introduced, increases the civil penalty for unfair sales practices by dealers of petroleum products from $1,000 to $1,500. - Amends TCA Title 47.
As introduced, defines "textbook" for purposes of the duty of the state board to prescribe textbooks and materials for the public schools. - Amends TCA Section 49-1-302.

As introduced, requires office of education accountability to submit a copy of its report on monitoring system and school improvement plans to the finance, ways and means committees, in addition to the education committees. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, revises various references through Tennessee Code Annotated from "medical malpractice" to "health care liability" and from "medical malpractice action" to "health care liability action" to conform to the provisions enacted by the 2011 session of the 107th General Assembly in the Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Section 7-57-502; Section 8-42-101; Section 8-21-401; Section 9-8-307; Section 10-7-504; Section 28-3-104; Section 29-26-118; Section 29-26-119; Section 29-26-120; Section 29-26-121; Section 29-26-122; Section 29-26-202; Section 29-20-310; Section 29-26-115; Section 29-26-116; Section 29-26-117; Section 37-5-314; Section 56-3-111; Section 56-30-115; Section 56-31-114; Section 56-32-110; Section 56-32-130; Section 56-54-101; Section 56-54-102; Section 56-54-103; Section 56-54-104; Section 56-54-105; Section 56-54-106; Section 56-7-1001; Section 56-7-101; Section 56-7-115; Section 56-8-104; Section 56-13-104; Section 56-19-125; Section 56-2-201; Section 56-27-115; Section 61-1-306; Section 62-3-121; Section 63-25-110; Section 63-27-112; Section 63-3-119; Section 63-30-111; Section 63-31-109; Section 63-4-114; Section 63-5-124; Section 63-51-105; Section 63-51-111; Section 63-51-117; Section 63-6-214; Section 63-6-219; Section 63-6-221; Section 63-6-234; Section 63-8-120; Section 63-9-111; Section 63-9-117; Section 63-11-215; Section 63-12-124; Section 63-13-209; Section 63-23-108; Section 68-140-311; Section 68-140-511 and Section 68-11-223.

As introduced, requires the board of pharmacy to report to the senate health and welfare committee and health and human resources committee of the house concerning the drugs it has approved to be dispensed by local health departments by February 1 of each year. - Amends TCA Section 63-10-205.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of health to report, by January 15, 2013, to certain house and senate committees concerning the effects of telemedicine. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 23.

As introduced, requires that a common carrier's exemption authorization number be included on any certificate of exemption given to a dealer in order for a common carrier to qualify for a reduced sales tax rate on purchases. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, increases the grace period for active military members stationed outside of continental United States to renew vehicle registrations from "14 days" to "30 days" after the member's return to the state; revises when a registration plate must be attached to the rear of a truck. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 65 and Title 66.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Border Region Retail Tourism Development District Act. - Amends TCA Title 7 and Title 67.
As introduced, specifies that a federal license to sell alcoholic beverages does not mean a federal excise tax receipt. - Amends TCA Title 7; Title 55; Title 57 and Title 67.
As introduced, extends time for filing appeal of final actions of a region or authority from 30 days to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 67; Title 68 and Title 69.

As introduced, changes the date of the annual actuarial report by the comptroller of the treasury concerning TennCare from April 15 to March 31; increases the frequency of the bureau of TennCare's reports on the pharmacy rebate program from quarterly to monthly. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.
As introduced, prohibits animals in a driver's lap or between the driver and the driver's door while the motor vehicle is in motion. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8, Part 2.

As introduced, removes certain restrictions that limit the ability of a person to obtain a wholesaler or retailer license in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-210 and Title 57, Chapter 3, Part 7.
As introduced, adds community service as punishment for simple possession or casual exchange of certain controlled substances. - Amends TCA Section 39-17-418.

As introduced, requires the production of a photo identification when an electronic benefits transfer card from a department of human services administered program is used to make a purchase. - Amends TCA Title 71.

As introduced, expands nonconforming uses to those on contiguous land under common ownership and to land used, rather than in use, for the extraction of diminishing assets. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2.
As enacted, permits certain Tennessee veterans who are students at public institutions of higher education to register for classes prior to the general student population. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, requires local boards of education to adopt policies concerning a teacher's ability to relocate a student for the safety of the student and the safety of others. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, authorizes Norris Landing Marina in Claiborne County to be issued a license as a premier type tourist resort. - Amends TCA Section 57-4-102 and Section 57-4-102.

As introduced, specifies evidence of abandonment of non-conforming use, directs the governmental entity with jurisdiction to establish beginning and ending dates for the prescriptive period, and creates a rebuttable presumption of abandonment upon a governmental finding of credible evidence establishing a non-conforming use for the prescribed period. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.

As introduced, allows municipal regional planning commission, in counties that have not adopted zoning, to exercise subdivision approval within the planning commission's region without the approval of the county legislative body. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-106(d).

As introduced, allows a member of the armed forces stationed overseas or a Tennessee resident who has been living outside the U.S. due to employment to ship wine into the state by getting a $100 permit and paying the appropriate taxes. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, allows cities and counties to limit number of retail liquor stores to no less than one per 6,000 residents. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-208.
As introduced, allows teachers to remove disruptive students from class pursuant to local board policies. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, designates May 2012 as "Motorcycle Safety and Awareness Month."

As enacted, extends until June 30, 2013, for Donate Life new specialty earmarked license plates to obtain the minimum number of orders for issuance of such license plate. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.

As introduced, establishes regulations governing groundwater protection standards that are no less stringent than those adopted by the American Petroleum Institute in Guidance Document HF1, First Edition, Hydraulic Fracturing Operations - Well Construction and Integrity Guidelines, October 2009 or any later revision. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, directs the state oil and gas board to adopt regulations and governing standards for groundwater protection, including documentation of produced and waste fluids, by November 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, defines "fracking" and "trade secret" relative to well drilling; creates a notice requirement and prior approval from the state oil and gas board before any chemicals are injected into the wells; establishes a disclosure process if any injection is confidential or involves trade secrets. - Amends TCA Title 60, Chapter 1 and Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, freezes in-state tuition and fees and room and board for three years at the public universities and community colleges. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, exempts the state and local governmental entities from liability for homeowners' association fee, restrictive covenants and certain obligations when the governmental entity acquires real property to enforce its tax lien. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 24 and Title 67, Chapter 5, Part 25.
As introduced, prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of an individual's status or history of unemployment. - Amends TCA Title 50.
As introduced, prohibits use of taxpayer generated funds for payment of membership dues to the Tennessee school boards association. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-2001.
As introduced, requires cuts to a school district's budget to be made first to funds paid to professional organizations. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2 and Title 49, Chapter 3.
As introduced, requires that every newborn be tested for lysosomal storage diseases. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 5.
As introduced, authorizes board to permit registered dental assistants to expose and process dental radiographs. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, requires notification of certain boards when a temporary writ of injunction is issued by a court against a business holding a license or permit issued by such agencies; also requires notification when a business holding such a license is declared by a court to be a nuisance; suspension to be for a certain period of time. - Amends TCA Title 4; Section 4-3-1304; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Section 8-21-401; Title 29, Chapter 3 and Section 68-1-101.

As introduced, authorizes the commission to conduct criminal history background or fingerprint checks on a random sample of permittees or licensees; increases each application fee by $50.00 to cover the cost of checks to be deposited in a special background check fund. - Amends TCA Title 57.

As enacted, includes "persons" in definition of "family member" for purposes of determining which family members a private trust can do business with while maintaining exemptions from the Banking Act; redefines "family member"; revises other provisions. - Amends TCA Title 45, Chapter 2, Part 20.

As introduced, requires commission to publish synopsis of report concerning level of participation in the grant program for traditionally underserved and underrepresented artists and art organizations. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, increases minimum length of kindergarten day to not less than five hours from not less than four hours. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, extends the amount of time from 90 to 120 days that owners of newly acquired medical equipment have to register the equipment with the health services and development agency. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, removes requirement that voter needs photograph identification prior to voting; restores former requirement that voter present identification for purpose of comparing signature on the application for ballot. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As enacted, revises provisions governing compensation to exonerated persons. - Amends TCA Title 9, Chapter 8, Part 1.
As introduced, deletes obsolete statutory provisions pertaining to the commission. - Amends TCA Title 37, Chapter 3.

As introduced, states that after the initial utilization review, additional information or follow-up utilization review for outpatient mental health or chemical dependency patients shall be limited to no more than 10 percent of reviews performed by the utilization review agent for the previous year. - Amends TCA Section 56-6-705.
As enacted, revises certain provisions regarding the reporting of medical treatment for sexual assault or domestic abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36 and Title 38.

As introduced, requires certain contractors of department of children's services to petition a court for an inpatient psychiatric evaluation of a child in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 33; Title 37 and Title 49.
As introduced, removes requirement that a person must pay restitution to victims and court costs to have right of suffrage restored. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 29, Part 2.

As introduced, increases the range of civil penalties assessed for any commercial breeder that advertises, sells or offers to sell any companion animal without a valid license from the commissioner from $50-$1,000 to $100-$2,000. - Amends TCA Title 44, Chapter 17, Part 7.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Animal Abuser Registration, Tracking and Verification Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 39.

As introduced, requires attorney general to report annually to judiciary committee of each chamber of the general assembly the number of persons prosecuted and convicted of unlawful drawing of real estate transfer documents. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 66.
As introduced, mandates that all employees of food service establishments or retail food stores shall wear disposable sanitary gloves while preparing food. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, specifies that if a member of the commission on aging and disability misses three consecutive meetings without a good excuse such member will be replaced. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 71, Chapter 2.

As introduced, extends the time the department of intellectual and developmental disabilities has to respond to the comments from the public meeting from 35 to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 16; Title 33; Title 56 and Title 68.

As enacted, authorizes judge, after consideration of facts and circumstances surrounding the case, to require a person convicted of statutory rape for the first time to register as a sexual offender on the sexual offender and violent sexual offender registry. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5 and Title 40, Chapter 39, Part 2.

As enacted, requires the department of education to establish within the school system with the most schools operated by the achievement school district (ASD) a four-year pilot program of assessment of kindergarten students. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires full funding of pre-K for students who are in school zones feeding into schools in the achievement school district that the district directly runs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires purchaser of property at delinquent tax sale to record copy of the decree that ordered the sale within three days of purchase to serve as notice of purchaser's interest during the redemption period. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, creates new category of Level I adult care home under Long-Term Care Community Choices Act. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, includes in definition of underutilized and vacant property of an LEA schools in which the number of students enrolled is less than 50 percent of the school's capacity; authorizes comptroller to conduct a review of the LEA's catalog of underutilized and vacant property, if requested. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, changes grounds for revocation of a public charter school agreement from failing to make AYP for two consecutive years to failing to meet achievement benchmarks of the state's academic accountability system for five consecutive years; allows revocations for failure to meet academic accountability to be appealed to the state board of education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.

As introduced, prohibits lenders from entering into transactions in which a person or entity, for certain consideration, provides funds to another person involved in a legal action and the person receiving the funds assigns to the person or entity the contingent right to receive a part of the proceeds or the legal action's settlement or award; voids contracts resulting from such transactions; makes such prohibited behavior a violation of the Consumer Protection Act of 1977. - Amends TCA Title 45 and Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, exempts staple food from state sales tax; defines staple food to include fruits and vegetables, grains, dried beans, flour, meats, poultry, fish, and certain nutritious beverages; holds local governments harmless from the loss of state-shared tax revenues. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 1; Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 2 and Title 67, Chapter 6, Part 3.
As introduced, clarifies that sheriffs have a duty to enforce county ordinances and resolutions. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 8.

As introduced, authorizes the Sullivan County legislative body, by two-thirds majority vote, to levy a privilege tax of $25.00 in all civil and criminal cases, such revenue to be used exclusively to provide representation for indigent criminal defendants. - Amends TCA Section 67-4-601.
As enacted, extends date from July 1, 2012, to July 1, 2014, on expansion of urban growth boundaries for certain tracts of land 10 acres or smaller. - Amends TCA Section 6-58-104.
As introduced, authorizes purchase of insurance to protect against breach of fiduciary duty by public officials and employees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 29.

As introduced, redefines subdivision in municipal county and regional regulations by expanding the maximum size allowed for the subdivided parcels from less than five to less than 25 acres. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-401 and Section 13-4-301.

As introduced, permits the county mayor to retain veto power if serving as chair of the county legislative body; removes the authority of the county mayor to vote to break a tie when the county mayor is serving as chair; requires a two-thirds vote to override a veto instead of a majority vote. - Amends TCA Section 5-5-103; Section 5-5-109 and Section 5-6-107.

As introduced, specifies that the amount of the fine for failing to use a child restraint system in a rear facing position is $75.00, and not a maximum of $50.00; requires that children up to age two, instead of one, must be protected in such systems. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 9.

As enacted, specifies that an independent postsecondary institution that was an eligible independent postsecondary institution for lottery scholarship purposes, but became ineligible because of a change in the definition of eligible independent postsecondary institution, will, until June 30, 2016, remain in eligible status so long as it is accredited by SACS. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-902(11)(B).

As introduced, revises authority or responsibility with respect to street construction and acceptance of public streets located within a subdivision in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 13-3-403 and Section 13-3-405.

As introduced, deletes the June 30, 2012, repeal date for the reduced payment option available to persons in Davidson County whose licenses have been suspended for certain driving offenses and who have outstanding fines and costs. - Amends TCA Section 55-50-502.
As introduced, terminates the advisory committee on women's health. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 68, Chapter 1, Part 18.

As enacted, creates a credit against the excise tax for a qualifying environmental project, which is a project in which the taxpayer makes an investment in excess of $100 million to eliminate mercury from the manufacturing process and operations of one or more existing chlor-alkali manufacturing and ancillary facilities and equipment in the state. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, provides that wildlife officers have the right to inspect the license of a person who is engaged in the taking or possessing of wildlife but are subject to same constitutional standards as law enforcement officers for other searches of persons or places. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 6, Part 1.

As introduced, establishes the drug enforcement and education fund from forfeitures, seizures, confiscations sales and fines derived from the activities of judicial district drug task forces to be used for awarding grants to local law enforcement agencies for drug education, methamphetamine restoration and general law enforcement purposes. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40, Chapter 33.
As introduced, deletes provision that requires accident report if a person is injured or killed or the amount of damage is in excess of $400. - Amends TCA Section 55-12-104.

As enacted, makes charter schools subject to open meetings law; requires charter schools to maintain a web site and post certain notices and information on the web site in certain situations; makes charter school records open records to the same extent as records of public schools operated by LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 13.
As enacted, limits liability of whitewater rafting companies in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, revises membership of Tennessee wildlife resources commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 70.

As introduced, expands notice requirement for contested case hearings, from reasonable notice to 30 days notice; prohibits appeal of order of continuance in hearings until order permitting appeal is issued; authorizes petition for attorney's fees and costs by persons in contested case hearings. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 5.
As introduced, eliminates the state policy requirement to provide all medically acceptable contraception measures. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 68 and Title 71.
As enacted, designates the third full week in May as "Rescue Squad Week." - Amends TCA Title 15, Chapter 2, Part 1.
As introduced, requires the department to regulate petroleum underground storage tanks only to the extent required by federal law. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 215.
As introduced, makes K-12 teachers state employees. - Amends TCA Title 8 and Title 9.

As introduced, authorizes phase I and phase II designated municipal separate storm sewer systems to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof. - Amends TCA Title 69.

As enacted, authorizes municipal separate storm sewer systems that become qualified local programs pursuant to department approval to administer their own NPDES storm water construction permitting programs and the review thereof. - Amends TCA Title 69, Chapter 3, Part 1.
As introduced, redefines the duties of the executive director of the public defenders conference. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 14 and Title 9, Chapter 4.

As introduced, directs the information gathered through the family support program to be provided to the house health and human resources committee and the senate health and welfare committee. - Amends TCA Section 33-5-212.

As introduced, requires person who must dispossess all firearms possessed because of an order of protection in effect or domestic assault conviction to also dispossess of any ammunition for such firearms. - Amends TCA Title 36, Chapter 3, Part 6; Title 39, Chapter 13 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, allows the state or any political subdivision thereof to choose certain preferred resident vendors' bids over the bids of the lowest responsible bidders as long as the preferred vendors' bids are no more than 5 percent greater. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3 and Title 12, Chapter 4.

As introduced, prohibits health care providers and facilities from charging an uninsured patient who pays in full with cash more than the lowest charge received from a health insurer for the health care service. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, requires pawnbrokers to file their daily transaction reports with the appropriate law enforcement agencies within the same timeframe as is currently required for the daily transaction reports of scrap jewelry and metal dealers. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1, Part 2 and Title 45, Chapter 6, Part 2.
