As introduced, authorizes corporate authorities of municipalities to hold landowners responsible for maintaining and securing vacant property; authorizes municipalities to establish registries by which to effect service of process and notice on landowners. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54, Part 1.
As enacted, revises various provisions of the Locksmith Licensing Act. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 11.

As enacted, provides that nothing in present law regarding vocational services for the blind/blind vendors will limit the ability of an institution that is governed by the University of Tennessee or the state university and college system to contract for food services (cafeterias, restaurants, food courts and catering services) in new buildings or on new campuses provided that a site suitable to the institution, after consultation with the department, is also made available for a blind vendor to manage and operate automated vending machines and/or a counter service as jointly agreed to by the institution and department in the new building or on the new campus. - Amends TCA Section 49-8-118 and Section 71-4-502.

As introduced, enacts the "Millionaires' Tax Act." - Amends TCA Title 3; Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 16; Title 30; Title 36; Title 39; Title 40; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 61; Title 62; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 71.

As introduced, clarifies that referees have the power of a trial court and the same authority as the judge directing the case to the referee in Shelby County environmental court. - Amends Chapter 772 of the Public Acts of 1982, as amended.

As introduced, redefines "employee" under the Tennessee Lawful Employment Act to mean "any Tennessee resident" instead of "any individual"; requires employers who enroll in E-Verify to use such program; changes date by which certain employers must comply with certain provisions of the Act from January 1, 2013 to January 1, 2014. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 1.

As enacted, urges the comptroller, in conjunction with the department of environment and conservation and the department of revenue, to study laws and policies dealing with Tennessee's taxation of recycled products using a raw material in the manufacturing process; and investigate any tax policy or make any recommendation that would help promote Tennessee's businesses using more recycled material in their manufacturing process. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As introduced, authorizes a certain municipality to assess and collect a historic landmark preservation fee for certain purposes; authorizes such municipality to create a board of directors to ensure that the historic landmark is preserved, maintained and improved. - Amends TCA Title 6; Title 13; Title 57 and Title 67.

As introduced, requires recipients of federal assistance and benefits administered by state, county or municipal agencies to present photo identification in order to receive or access benefits. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 71.

As introduced, defines limited service pharmacy permit as a permit issued by the board to an applicant that wants to provide peritoneal dialysis products for home patients in a setting for services not limited to scope and kind, but to time and conitions under which services are rendered. - Amends TCA Section 63-10-204.

As introduced, increases the offense from a Class C misdemeanor to a Class B, punishable by fine only, for any assessor or deputy assessor to willfully or knowingly permit or allow any property subject to taxation to be or remain unassessed or omitted from assessment, or to willfully or knowingly assess any property at less than the percentage of value required by law. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 16; Title 17; Title 66; Title 67 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires commissioners of economic and community development and revenue to study effects of tax incentives on industrial and tourism development and issue a report to the governor and legislature by January 15, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 53 and Title 7, Chapter 88.

As enacted, authorizes the county legislative body to set the fee for participation in the litter removal program by first-time DUI offenders and permits the judge to find a person indigent for purposes of paying that fee. - Amends TCA Section 55-10-403.

As introduced, specifies that the employer, rather than the claimant, is responsible for overpayment of unemployment benefits when an award is overturned on appeal based on evidence that is submitted more than seven days after notice of the claim is sent to the employer. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires commissioner of labor and workforce development to appoint department attorney to indigent claimant in unemployment benefit appeal upon request when employer is represented by counsel at appeal; employer will be assessed $3,000 legal service fee if claimant prevails, otherwise cost comes from department's existing resources. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 23 and Title 50.

As introduced, exempts an event to which the entire membership of a standing committee or committees is invited from the gift prohibition subject to the same cost and reporting restrictions imposed on events to which the entire membership of the general assembly is invited. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 6.

As enacted, corrects the chemical compound, Benzoylindoles, found in illegal drugs such as hallucinogenic plants, from "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 09)" to "Pravadoline (WIN 48, 098)". - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop an evaluation instrument to permit teachers to assess new teacher evaluation systems, including the Tennessee Educator Acceleration Model, and their implementation. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the state board of education to develop a weighted instrument for evaluation of applicants for teaching positions with LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, authorizes persons to petition for expungement of records of conviction for certain non-violent, non-sexual misdemeanors and Class E felonies that were committed on or after November 1, 1989. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32.
As introduced, creates special joint committee to study casino gambling in Shelby County.

As introduced, changes school personnel in positions for which no teaching license is required from at-will employees to at-will employees for the first two years of employment and then employees on year-to-year contracts in years thereafter; allows director of schools to dismiss such employees for cause after giving written notice of the charges and a hearing. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-301.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Election Day Registration Act." - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7 and Title 2, Chapter 2.

As introduced, requires the speakers of the house and senate to develop and implement a job applicant drug testing system for members and employees of the general assembly. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 50.

As introduced, creates student athlete trust fund to provide one-time payments to public higher education Division 1 athletes upon graduation that are funded from athletic department revenue, does not apply if causes loss of revenue due to loss of membership in NCAA, requires THEC to direct requesting of a waiver from NCAA to allow implementation. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, changes the date of the first meeting of the joint legislative services committee at the call of the co-chairs to within 30 days, instead of 15 days, after the appointment of the members of the committee. - Amends TCA Title 3 and Title 8, Chapter 44.

As introduced, authorizes owners, lienholders and insurers of motor vehicles that have been towed to inspect such vehicles prior to paying any towing and storage fees. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16.

As introduced, increases from 10 to 14 years the age of abandoned, immobile or unattended motor vehicles that may be disposed of by demolishers without a title. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 16, Part 1.

As introduced, requires the department to report to the health and welfare committee of the senate and health and human resources committee of the house by no later than July 15 of each year on the risks of community-associated MRSA infections. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires department to post web site information about assistance to private employers on the implementation of day care services as an employee benefit. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 12.

As introduced, adds government operations committees to list of entities to which the department of human resources must submit monthly report of bona fide employee promotions. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 8.
As introduced, transfers bomb and arson section within the department of commerce and insurance to the Tennessee bureau of investigation. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 6 and Title 68, Chapter 102.
As introduced, requires commissioner to periodically update listing of employees authorized to exercise functions of notary public. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 49, Chapter 1 and Title 55.

As introduced, requires the department to report to the governor and general assembly on the savings derived from the sale of supplies, materials and equipment deemed to be surplus, obsolete or unused. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 11.
As enacted, revises various provisions governing adult care home providers in regard to traumatic brain injury. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 11, Part 2.
As introduced, authorizes nurse practitioners to issue universal do not resuscitate orders, which may only be issued by physicians under present law. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, increases the range of fines from $100-$500 to $500-$1,000 for any person who fails to place concise wording describing the material used to make a receptacle or container used for burial, entombment or other final disposition of a human body or remains. - Amends TCA Title 32; Title 47; Title 62, Chapter 5 and Title 68.
As introduced, opens ICF/MR beds in private facilities to private pay and TennCare patients on a first-come, first-served basis. - Amends TCA Title 71.
As enacted, exempts from income taxes the income from trust funds for perpetual care of a cemetery. - Amends TCA Title 67.

As enacted, changes from "January 1, 2013" to "July 1, 2012" the effective date of Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011, which prohibits physicians from utilizing telemedicine to provide abortion services. - Amends TCA Title 63 and Chapter 434 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, changes the definition of "home school student" for purposes of the Tennessee HOPE scholarship to require that a student be home schooled the last year of high school instead of the last two years of high school. - Amends TCA Section 49-4-902.

As introduced, requires licensed psychologists, psychological examiners, senior psychological examiners and certified psychological assistants, as a condition of renewal of their respective licenses, to complete three of continuing education requirements established by the board, which shall be obtained in a face-to-face, board defined Type 1 continuing education activity that pertains to ethics and Tennessee jurisprudence rational to the practice of psychology. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 11.

As introduced, revises definition of a border retail tourism development district to include a district located in a municipality that borders two states and is less than two miles from an intersection of two interstates. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1.

As introduced, revises definition of a border retail tourism development district to include any district located in municipalities whose corporate limits are within 25 miles of two state borders, and a district boundary is within 30 miles from a state border and five miles from an existing interstate. - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 40, Part 1.
As enacted, extends the deadline for the Niswonger Children's Hospital special license plate to meet the minimum order requirement to July 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, creates a duty to warn and report certain threats of suicide to certain entities or persons. - Amends TCA Title 33 and Title 39.
As enacted, clarifies and revises law concerning sales of nonpotentially hazardous foods prepared in home-based kitchens. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 8, Part 1.

As introduced, provides that good faith statements in an application for life insurance that are in error are not grounds to deny a claim arising out of such life insurance policy. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.

As enacted, authorizes the air pollution control board to issue TDEC commissioner authority to grant variances for certain open burnings and emissions testing requirements. - Amends TCA Section 68-201-118.
As introduced, adds two speaker appointed members to the Tennessee agricultural hall of fame board. - Amends TCA Title 43 and Title 67, Chapter 5.
As introduced, specifies that the maximum fine for any bicyclist failing to comply with the rules of the road is $50.00. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, creates a new farm wine permit; authorizes a farm producer to transport grapes or fruit grown on the farm to a licensed winery for the winery to manufacture, bottle and label the wine as being the product of the farm holding the farm wine permit; places certain requirements on the licensed winery. - Amends TCA Section 57-3-201 and Section 57-3-207.
As enacted, revises various provisions regarding public charter schools. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, increases notice requirement from 10 to 15 days that the commissioner must give to a holder of a milk sampler's license before a revocation hearing. - Amends TCA Title 53.

As introduced, authorizes sheriffs to approve certain contracts between designated secondary transportation agents and hospitals to transport persons with mental illness from a hospital to another treatment resource or hospital for compensation. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As enacted, names bridge on U.S. 64 in Giles County in honor of the late James E. Wells.

As introduced, directs the department of correction to promulgate rules and regulations on the use of spit masks in prisons; prohibits restricting a prisoners blood circulation and breathing with the use of spit masks. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 40, Chapter 7 and Title 41.

As enacted, requires LEAs to include in student discipline codes a prohibition on students wearing on school grounds during the school day clothing that exposes underwear or body parts in an indecent manner that disrupts the learning environment. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, revises provisions governing bonds for municipal officials and employees. - Amends TCA Title 6.
As introduced, prohibits truck stops within 1/2 mile of residential areas; applies only to Davidson and Shelby counties. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 24.
As introduced, requires certain persons who install and maintain elevators to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 121.

As introduced, makes vehicle used to elude or escape from police subject to seizure and forfeiture using the same procedure as vehicles used in drug violations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 16, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 33, Part 2.
As introduced, revises school attendance requirements and truancy. - Amends TCA Title 37 and Title 49.

As introduced, creates office of solicitor general appointed by the general assembly to defend and prosecute cases in the interest of the state; revises duties of attorney general and reporter. - Amends TCA Title 8.
As introduced, establishes process of reciprocal disclosure of witnesses for criminal trials. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 17.

As introduced, requires any sentence received for the offenses of identity theft and identity theft trafficking to be served consecutive to any other offense committed as a result of the identity theft. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14, Part 1.
As enacted, directs the legend of animal friendly new specialty license plates to bear "Spay/Neuter"; plates to be issued only after exhaustion of existing stock. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 4.
As introduced, authorizes non-resident landowners to hunt on land that they are the sole owner of without purchasing a license. - Amends TCA Title 70.
As introduced, expands definition of small employer to include employers employing one or two employees. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7, Part 22.

As introduced, permits the bureau, if necessary in performing the duties of the bureau, to utilize dogs that are trained to detect chemicals and compounds used to make explosives and explosive devices. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits the transfer of a possessory interest in a deed of trust, mortgage or other lien securing the payment of money or other thing of value on an owner-occupied residence while a foreclosure is pending. - Amends TCA Title 29; Title 35, Chapter 5; Title 45, Chapter 20; Title 47 and Title 66.

As introduced, requires certain notices be given to neighboring property owners when a zoning ordinance, subdivision plat, or annexation is being proposed. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 13.
As enacted, designates the month of July each year as "Tennessee Genealogy Month." - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 1, Part 4.

As introduced, allows municipal corporation to begin or cease enforcement of traffic ordinances on campus within 45 days, rather than 30 days, of a higher education institution requesting it. - Amends TCA Title 38; Title 39; Title 40 and Title 49.

As introduced, requires TDEC commissioner to submit the annual recommendations regarding options for the protection of watersheds and the control of sources of pollution in order to assure the future quality of potable drinking water supplies throughout the state by February 15 of each year. - Amends TCA Title 69.

As introduced, provides that a member of the judicial performance evaluation commission is not eligible to seek or be appointed to an appellate judgeship for a period of one year immediately following conclusion of the member's service on the commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, increases from $500 to $1,000 the civil fine for undertaking or attempting to undertake the practice of court reporting without a license or knowingly presenting or filing false information with the licensing board. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 29 and Title 20, Chapter 9.
As enacted, establishes requirements relative to non-participating manufacturers and importers for non-participating manufacturers. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 26.
As introduced, specifies that a landowner has a cause of action to recover damages against a person unlawfully hunting on the landowner's property. - Amends TCA Title 29 and Title 70.

As enacted, codifies position of committee's executive director who is hired subject to majority vote of committee; attaches committee to general assembly for administrative purposes. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 7.

As enacted, creates a pilot project in Hancock, Union, Grainger, Claiborne, Cocke, Jefferson, Hawkins, Hamilton and Knox counties regarding suspension or revocation of beer permit or license upon suspension or revocation of alcohol beverage license or permit and suspension or revocation of alcohol beverage license or permit upon suspension or revocation of beer permit or license. - Amends TCA Title 57, Chapter 4, Part 2 and Title 57, Chapter 5, Part 1.

As introduced, states that withdrawal of or change to an automatic veto for adoption contact shall be effective immediately upon receipt of the written request by the department. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37 and Title 40.

As introduced, authorizes municipality to establish ownership registry for buildings that have been vacant in excess of 30 days and set other registration requirements to insure that the municipality has means to serve notice and execute service of process. - Amends TCA Section 6-54-113.
As introduced, treats drug use that affects a child in utero as child abuse. - Amends TCA Title 36; Title 37; Title 39 and Title 40.

As introduced, allows the clerk of the court to specify the form of the bond that is required to be posted by the utility district that is exercising eminent domain in conjunction with a highway project. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 23; Title 7, Chapter 82; Title 29, Chapter 16; Title 29, Chapter 17 and Title 54.

As introduced, permits local governments to enter capital leases or built-to-suit capital leases for buildings. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 9; Title 12; Title 49 and Title 67.

As introduced, clarifies that certain notice dates and approvals or disapprovals under the Local Government Public Obligations Act of 1986 are required in 15 business days instead of 15 days. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 9.

As enacted, requires the department of education to develop a model parental involvement contract that may be used by LEAs and to encourage LEAs to enter into voluntary parental involvement contracts with students' parents or guardians. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As enacted, allows a charitable organization to calculate reserves using the Annuity 2000 Mortality Table and other interest assumption, or other mortality table; allows organization to maintain a separate Tennessee account; allows the commissioner to designate a later time for the organization to submit an audited report. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 52.

As enacted, replaces the Tennessee wildlife resources commission (TWRC) with a 13-member fish and wildlife commission. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 11; Title 43; Title 44; Title 67; Title 69 and Title 70.
As introduced, increases, from 60 to 65, the age for mandatory retirement of state law enforcement officers. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 34, Part 7 and Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

As introduced, provides that veterans may obtain a handgun carry permit without payment of the $115 processing fee and renew a permit without payment of the $50.00 renewal fee. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, exempts students entering higher education institutions who were born before January 1, 1970, from any requirement of proof of vaccination against any disease. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, provides that the disciplinary counsel for the court of the judiciary is a state employee for purposes of defense by the attorney general when a civil action is commenced for an act or omission performed during the course of duties for the court of judiciary. - Amends TCA Section 8-42-103.

As introduced, establishes certain rights of non-governmental entities holding a vested contractual right to payment of fees or assessments in regard to property acquired by the state, a county or municipality at a tax sale. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As enacted, allows notice by delivery service alternatives to certified or registered mail, return receipt requested as authorized by federal law in regard to notice to a taxpayer of a tax lien suit. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, prohibits certain colleges and universities in this state from denying recognition, privileges or benefits to a student organization or group on the basis of religious content of the organization's or group's speech or the manner in which the organization or group determines its organizational affairs. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As enacted, deletes the repeal date of June 30, 2012, of certain provisions regarding sellers of herbs and natural health information exchanges. - Amends TCA Section 63-6-205.

As introduced, changes a nonacademic eligibility requirement for receipt of Tennessee HOPE scholarship by home schooled student from being home schooled for two years immediately preceding completion of high school to being home schooled for one year immediately preceding completion of high school. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires that all public buildings mark stair edges with 2-inch thick black and yellow non-slip low vision tape of at least 2-inch thickness; for purposes of exterior steps, black and yellow non-slip paint conforming to the same requirements is permissible. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 68 and Title 71.

As introduced, authorizes a franchise and excise tax credit of $1,000 for each unemployed person hired by a qualified small business; conditions the credit on the creation of at least five new qualified jobs; requires verification that unemployed persons have at least 20 weeks of unemployment benefits remaining as of the date of hire. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 4, Part 21.
As enacted, redefines "traffic or police officer" for purposes of traffic control or regulation. - Amends TCA Title 55 and Title 62.
As enacted, enacts the "Tennessee State Fair and Exposition Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 12; Title 43 and Title 67.

As enacted, requires entity actually towing vehicle to report vehicle registration information to local law enforcement when vehicle is towed pursuant to Uniform Landlord Tenant Act. - Amends TCA Section 66-28-519.

As introduced, exempts from use tax materials purchased by a sports authority or its designee, if the materials are used in the construction or improvements of such entity. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As enacted, authorizes and encourages LEAs to partner with individuals, community and faith-based groups and organizations and for-profit and nonprofit entities to devise parental involvement programs that reward schools and classes and honor parents for participating in parenting classes that increase parental involvement in education and schools. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 70.
As introduced, enacts the "Tennessee Land Use Review Act." - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 13; Title 27; Title 29 and Title 68.
As enacted, classifies consumer specific energy usage data, except for aggregate monthly billing information, as a private record. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, prohibits entities investing $20 million or more in the Iranian energy sector from contracting with public entities in Tennessee for goods or services valued at $1 million or more. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8 and Title 12.
As introduced, increases the return date of service of process from 20 to 30 days, as to inform the necessary parties of the eminent domain hearing. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 17.
As introduced, makes certain changes to background check requirements for teachers. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 10 and Title 49, Chapter 5.
As introduced, makes various changes to the garnishment summons form to be served by the sheriff or other applicable officer. - Amends TCA Title 26, Chapter 2.

As introduced, extends the amount of time from 30 to 60 days that a complainant may file an application for reconsideration of an order finding no reasonable cause for a discriminatory practice. - Amends TCA Title 4.
As introduced, prohibits state institutions of higher education from charging a fee to any higher education employee for parking. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, defines credentialed individuals and authorizes unlicensed, but board certified, orthotists and prosthetists to work under the supervision of a licensed orthotist or prosthetist. - Amends TCA Title 63, Chapter 2 and Title 63, Chapter 3.

As enacted, clarifies definition of "authority" in provisions governing regional transportation authorities to include reconstituted authority of Middle Tennessee; removes reference to power of regional transportation authorities to condemn property pursuant to the provisions governing such authorities in furtherance of mass transit and transportation plans; revises the present law limits of tort exposure for parties who contract with the regional transportation authority (RTA) for the provision of commuter rail transit services, facilities, or functions upon a rail line or rail line right-of-way owned and maintained by a governmental entity. - Amends TCA Title 29, Chapter 20 and Title 64, Chapter 8.

As introduced, increases the written notice requirement, from 30 days to 45 days, for someone requesting a hearing before the commissioner for a disapproved or modified insurance filing. - Amends TCA Title 56.

As introduced, confers immunity upon publisher or owner of newspaper or other publication that advertises a firearm for sale, for which a background check requirement does not apply, for any liability relating to such transaction, unless the publisher or owner knows either or both parties to transaction were prohibited from possessing firearm. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 13.

As introduced, requires contractors mowing right-of-ways to give prior notice to utility operators; requires utility operators to stake or mark utilities after receiving such notice; removes liability of contractors for damage caused to utilities if the utility operators fail to stake or mark the utilities after notice is given. - Amends TCA Title 65, Chapter 31.
As enacted, names pathway surrounding Tennessee Bicentennial Mall in honor of Andrea Conte.

As introduced, deletes provision prohibiting district attorney from applying to judge for a wiretap order in marijuana cases in which the amount is less than 700 pounds. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As enacted, extends the date from July 1, 2011, to July 1, 2012, for a facility where autopsies are performed to receive accreditation from the National Association of Medical Examiners. - Amends TCA Section 38-7-105.
As introduced, enacts the "Chronic Nuisance Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 7, Chapter 51.
As introduced, allows attorney members of judicial nominating commission to have continuance in trial court hearings if commission meeting scheduled. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.
As introduced, criminalizes the assistance of unauthorized access to a service account and clarifies the criminal act of obtaining services without payment. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 14.

As enacted, exempts motor vehicle dismantlers and recyclers or scrap metal processors from obtaining a copy of title before purchasing motor vehicle for scrap if the vehicle was manufactured more than 12 years ago; specifies that state law preempts any local regulation in regard to age of vehicle that may be purchased without title and in regard to waiting period for crushing. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 17, Part 1 and Title 55, Chapter 3, Part 2.

As enacted, requires that in hormone replacement therapy clinics all hormone replacement therapy must be performed by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician or by a certified nurse practitioner or a physician assistant that is delegated such tasks by a licensed physician or licensed osteopathic physician; establishes other requirements. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, requires private corporations that collect sewer payments on behalf of municipalities to send consumers' water usage rates to the municipality if the corporation does not also collect payment for water usage. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7 and Title 68, Chapter 221.

As enacted, requires that a person convicted of committing a dangerous felony involving a firearm who is subsequently convicted of the same serve a minimum of 15 years imprisonment at 100 percent. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17 and Title 40.

As introduced, prohibits certain health care facilities from requiring an uninsured or underinsured patient from paying more than 110 percent of the Medicare reimbursement for health care services. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, revises certain criminal provisions to include certain disruptive and illegal conduct involving unions and employee organizations. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 12; Title 39, Chapter 14; Title 39, Chapter 16 and Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, enacts the "Religious Viewpoints Antidiscrimination Act." - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, enhances simple possession of a controlled substance to a Class E felony where a person has two prior convictions for manufacturing, delivering or selling a controlled substance. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, includes bomb and arson special agents among those persons in the TCRS engaged in law enforcement activities on a day-to-day basis having a mandatory retirement age. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 36, Part 2.

As enacted, provides that the conveyance of personal property of a sexual offender used to violate a residential and work restriction of the sex offender registry is subject to forfeiture if the victim was a minor; specifies under the provisions regarding forfeiture of property used in the commission of a sexual offense that property is subject to "judicial forfeiture" instead of "administrative forfeiture". - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 5.

As introduced, requires a city or county to provide notice to citizens residing in an abutting city or county within a one-mile radius of a proposed facility that is to be built if the facility may be a danger to the health, safety or welfare of the citizens of such city or county. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 7.

As introduced, permits a county or municipal correctional officer to carry a firearm if the officer has completed POST firearms training and is authorized to carry by the sheriff. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 7; Title 8; Title 38 and Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, permits a grandparent with previously granted visitation rights to file a petition in opposition to relocation of a child and, under certain circumstances, to obtain custody over the child. - Amends TCA Title 16 and Title 36.

As introduced, reduces the amount of a surviving spouse's elective share by the value of any assets transferred, or deemed transferred, within the six months immediately preceding the decedent's death. - Amends TCA Title 30; Title 31; Title 32; Title 35 and Title 36.

As enacted, regulates student conduct on school buses; permits school personnel, including school bus drivers, to use reasonable force, subject to certain restrictions, in maintaining discipline. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39 and Title 49.
As introduced, names segment of U.S. 31W within corporate limits of Millersville in honor of John W. Reynolds, Sr.

As enacted, clarifies that a defendant cannot get records expunged if convicted of an offense other than the charged offense or convicted of one offense in a multi-count indictment, including lesser included offenses. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.
As introduced, requires department of finance and administration to create electronic tracking system for permits and licenses issued by the state. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As enacted, authorizes certain departments, boards and other governmental entities to allow holders of licenses, certifications or registrations to be notified by electronic mail of renewals, fee increases and changes in the law and of any meeting where changes in rules or fees are on the agenda. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 37; Title 45; Title 62; Title 63 and Title 71.

As introduced, removes prohibition on insurance companies making campaign contributions; removes PAC aggregate limitation on candidates; deletes report requirement on certain large contributions made within 10 days of election. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10 and Title 56, Chapter 3.
As introduced, enacts "Tennessee Non-Conforming Property Act." - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Doe Mountain Recreation Authority Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 11 and Title 67.

As introduced, clarifies development regulations in effect on date of submission of application for development govern review of that development; specifies that preliminary approval for planned development remains effective five years. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 3, Part 4; Title 13, Chapter 4, Part 3; Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 2 and Title 13, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As enacted, requires members of local and regional planning commissions to file disclosure statements of conflict of interests with Tennessee ethics commission. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5.
As introduced, allows on-site signs for structures that are rebuilt to nonconform to existing zoning regulations similar to off-site signs. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6 and Title 13.
As introduced, allows on-site signs for structures that are rebuilt to non-conform to existing zoning regulations similar to off-site signs. - Amends TCA Section 13-7-208.
As enacted, requires speakers to appoint all nine members of the judicial evaluation commission since the judicial council no longer exists. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 2.

As enacted, requires the commissioner to prepare semiannual permitting efficiency reports that include statistics on whether the department has timely acted on permit applications pursuant to the appropriate rule, beginning in 2013. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 5 and Title 68.

As enacted, allows members of the judicial nominating commission to serve successive terms; allows solicitor general and employees of the attorney general to serve on the commission; allows members to participate in meetings by telephone if three or fewer applicants; allows members continuance in court hearings if commission meeting scheduled. - Amends TCA Title 17, Chapter 4, Part 1.

As enacted, enacts the "Hunter Wright Hunting and Fishing Act," which authorizes the director of the TWRA to issue an annual sport combination hunting and fishing license upon payment of a $5.00 fee to Tennessee residents who are minors and who are disabled. - Amends TCA Title 70, Chapter 2.

As introduced, creates pilot project that will give allowances for Tennessee businesses in the evaluation of bids and proposals for state contracts during a two-year period. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 56; Title 12, Chapter 4 and Title 12, Chapter 3.
As enacted, allows employer to qualify as "seasonal employer" for purposes of unemployment insurance benefits. - Amends TCA Title 50, Chapter 7.
As enacted, enacts the "Unemployment Insurance Accountability Act of 2012." - Amends TCA Title 50.

As enacted, requires department of labor and workforce development to implement an Internet-based system that allows employers to receive notices electronically and to submit separation information electronically; requires more information be included on unemployment insurance tax statement at request of employer. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 50, Chapter 7.

As introduced, prohibits local board of education from avoiding or refusing to participate in collaborative conferencing; requires board to present a proposed MOU's content to professional employees and to provide opportunity for employees to express their concerns to the board before the board acts on the MOU. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 5, Part 6.

As introduced, authorizes counties to develop first responder teams to address emergency situations in their county; grants authority to such first responder teams to take certain measures to secure the affected area and minimize harm to persons and property. - Amends TCA Title 5, Chapter 1 and Title 7, Chapter 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Electricians Licensing Act"; requires persons performing electrical work under a contract for more than $5,000 of work to be licensed. - Amends TCA Title 62, Chapter 6.
As enacted, revises and enacts provisions governing the tattooing of minors. - Amends TCA Title 37; Title 39, Chapter 15, Part 4 and Title 62, Chapter 38.

As introduced, requires demolishers to contact the police before destroying a vehicle that does not present with a certificate of title, auction sales receipt, or certificate of authority to demolish. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 55, Chapter 16.

As introduced, requires the department of safety and homeland security to establish and maintain a hotline where unsafe driving practices of tractor trailer operators can be reported. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As introduced, directs the commissioner of revenue to reduce the state sales tax rate on food if there is a surplus of state revenue collected above budgeted estimates in a fiscal year; reserves one-half of such surplus for additional Tennessee student assistance awards. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, enacts "Influence Disclosure Act," which requires model bill filed by member to be accompanied by form created by chief clerk stating the bill is a model bill and naming the organization the bill came from; requires forms to be posted on general assembly's web site. - Amends TCA Title 3, Chapter 2.
As introduced, changes age for termination of health insurance coverage for dependents from 24 to 26. - Amends TCA Title 56, Chapter 7.
As introduced, revises statutes concerning preexisting condition exclusions to be consistent with federal law. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, deletes references to the joint education oversight committee that has been abolished. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, makes appropriations for the purpose of defraying the expenses of certain legislative enactments passed during the 2012 session of the 107th General Assembly.
As introduced, requires the THEC to publish its annual report prior to January 15 of each year, instead of February 15. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, requires the department to publish the energy division's annual report on the department web site. - Amends TCA Title 4 and Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 7.

As introduced, clarifies meaning of "arts and crafts" within items to be produced and sold by inmates to include woodworking projects, crafts produced by metalwork, pottery, carvings, sketches, paintings, ornaments, knick-knacks, drawings, sundries, and sculpture. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 6 and Title 41.

As introduced, prohibits an employee of a Tennessee education lottery corporation who leaves the employment of the corporation from representing any vendor or lottery retailer before the corporation for a period of three years, instead of the current two, following termination of employment with the corporation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 51 and Title 49.

As introduced, allows the department no more than 90, instead of 60, days to conduct a show cause hearing for the employer to demonstrate the employer's failure to secure payment of compensation. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 14 and Title 50, Chapter 6, Part 4.
As introduced, decreases the amount of time for the commissioner to report to the governor after the end of a calendar year from 60 to 45 days. - Amends TCA Title 45.

As introduced, establishes procedure by which taxpayers obtaining appraisals of their property dated after the assessment date of the current tax year may have the appraised value of their property adjusted for the next tax year by the assessor immediately upon presentation of the appraisal, if the assessor finds the appraisal to be sufficient evidence of value. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5.

As introduced, requires any person, firm, or corporation engaged in the business of buying and selling used or scrap jewelry and precious metals through the Internet to register with the chief of police and sheriff of each city and county in which the person selling or buying such used or scrap jewelry and precious metals is located. - Amends TCA Title 38, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires truck stops in Shelby County to conduct soil and water testing every three years on their property and areas contiguous to their property to check for contamination from petroleum products. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 215.
As introduced, prohibits truck stops within one mile where surface or ground water is located; applies only in Davidson and Shelby counties. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 24.

As introduced, authorizes general sessions courts, in counties with populations of 900,000 or more, to have the power to condemn or attach a lien to real or personal property with a value in excess of $25,000. - Amends TCA Title 16; Title 17; Title 20 and Title 29, Chapter 30.

As introduced, requires a transition planning commission planning the transfer of administration of a special school district's schools to the county board of education, where the transfer will increase student enrollment in the county system by 100 percent or more, to consider and plan for earthquakes and mitigation of earthquake damages, if the school systems are within 100 miles of the New Madrid fault. - Amends TCA Section 49-2-502.

As introduced, requires an attorney who has admitted or is found in a post conviction proceeding to have rendered ineffective assistance of counsel to repay funds received, if any from the state, into the state treasury. - Amends TCA Title 8; Title 16 and Title 40.

As introduced, broadens notification authority of the registry to permit the registry to notify each member of the general assembly of requirements for filing disclosure statements by sending the notice to a members legislative email address, if the member supplies the email address as a preferred means of receiving such notice. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, requires the department of education to track the graduation rates of students expelled from school for zero tolerance violations. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, allows recognized minor party to remain recognized for four years; lowers signature requirement to become recognized minor party. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, requires the department to design its structured information system in a manner that protects any confidential information about a service recipient, including any personally identifiable information. - Amends TCA Title 33.
As introduced, names bridge on S.R. 62 in Morgan County in honor of the late SFC Scott James Brown, U.S. Army.

As introduced, requires that an attorney provided to an indigent defendant, other than a public defender or post conviction defender, file a disclosure of financial interests with the ethics commission if the attorney is paid more than $500. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 40.

As enacted, deletes provision prohibiting district attorney from applying to judge for a wiretap order in marijuana cases in which the amount is less than 700 pounds. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.
As introduced, prohibits private ownership of primates, subject to certain exceptions. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 101 and Title 70, Chapter 4, Part 4.

As introduced, authorizes retailers and licensees selling liquor by the drink to offer discounts in such manner as the retailers and licensees deem appropriate as long as all taxes that are due and payable are paid on the full price of the product prior to the discount being offered and as long as the sale of the alcoholic beverage is not below the cost paid by the retailer or licensee to purchase the alcoholic beverages. - Amends TCA Title 57.
As introduced, prohibits a person who assaults another person at a sporting event from entering the premises of such sporting event for a period of time. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Uniform Limited Convention Act." - Amends TCA Title 3.

As introduced, extends specified deadlines for curing noncompliance under the Tennessee Small Business Investment Company Credit Act from 60 days to 65 days. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 8, Chapter 3; Title 8, Chapter 4; Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5 and Title 67, Chapter 1.

As introduced, provides that liability of defendant for noneconomic damages where liability is alleged vicarious, is determined separately from other employee's or agent's unless the defendant is a grandparent signing to allow a grandchild to receive driver permit. - Amends TCA Section 29-39-102 and Section 29-39-104.

As introduced, permits court to set a time period other than annual over which the damages will accrue when trier of fact is specifying the amount of future damages a claimant is due under the Tennessee Civil Justice Act of 2011. - Amends TCA Section 29-39-103.

As introduced, authorizes Tennessee film, entertainment and music commission to enter into partnership agreements with nonprofit organizations to promote and support goals and objectives of the commission. - Amends TCA Title 4, Chapter 3, Part 50.

As enacted, authorizes recognized minor party the option to nominate all offices by primary or by rules of the party; if they nominate by primary election, the petition for recognition must be filed by the qualifying deadline; if they nominate by any other means, the petition for recognition must be filed 90 days prior to the general election; revises other provisions relating to candidates. - Amends TCA Title 2.

As introduced, authorizes certain cities incorporated under the general law city manager charter to charge fire fees for the construction and maintenance of municipal fire departments. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 19.

As introduced, establishes a mechanism for areas in Shelby County that have been annexed or are about to be annexed to submit a petition for certain referenda related to annexation or deannexation to be held in such areas. - Amends TCA Title 6.

As introduced, moves a specified area of land located in Shelby County near the southeastern county line from the area reserved for annexation by Memphis to the planned growth area of the county. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 58.

As introduced, clarifies who is a parent for purposes of being on school premises; defines "parent" as parent, foster parent, legal guardian or person having physicial custody of a child. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, requires a health, housing and educational facility corporation to file with the state board of equalization a report listing leased properties and details of the lease and payment in lieu of tax (PILOT) agreements by October 20 instead of October 15. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 3.

As introduced, requires the governing body to certify the tax rate after 20 days instead of 15 days from the date the proposed certified tax rate and supporting calculations are received by the executive secretary of the state board of equalization. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 5 relative to levy of property taxes.

As introduced, adds to evidences of identification to vote, a valid photo identification card issued free of charge by the county election commission of the county in which a person is registered to vote, provided the person meets the current requirements to obtain a free photo ID to vote and signs an affidavit verifying such person's qualifications; equipment and training to be provided by the coordinator of elections. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, recognizes as evidence of identification to vote, a valid employee identification card issued by a Tennessee municipality or county, provided the identification card contains a photograph of the voter. - Amends TCA Section 2-7-112.

As introduced, urges that the course of instruction in public schools include instruction on the state symbols, their importance and meanings and appropriate display of the state flag. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, clarifies that THDA annual report of its activities for the preceding year to the governor, comptroller of the treasury, and the general assembly is mandatory. - Amends TCA Title 13, Chapter 23.

As introduced, permits a member to request and be paid an advance on the monthly expense allowance up to 90 days in advance of the date the allowance is due and payable in certain circumstances. - Amends TCA Section 3-1-106.
As introduced, revises outdated provision concerning eligiblity for teacher preparation programs and teaching. - Amends TCA Title 49.
As introduced, deletes obsolete references within state lottery proceeds statute. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 4, Part 9.

As introduced, requires justices of supreme court to be popularly elected by voters of designated supreme court districts to be created by the general assembly and requires intermediate appellate courts to be popularly elected by voters of designated intermediate appellate court districts. - Amends TCA Title 17.
As introduced, removes, effective September 1, 2012, requirement that the judge of any court be licensed to practice law. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 33; Title 16 and Title 17.

As introduced, permits person whose first offense is a Class B or C misdemeanor, is granted probation, successfully completes probation and has not been convicted of any other of offense for five years to have all public records of the conviction expunged. - Amends TCA Title 40, Chapter 32, Part 1.

As introduced, ensures that current provisions pertaining to qualifying petitions for municipal elections in Shelby County continue to apply only to municipal elections in Shelby County. - Amends TCA Title 2.
As introduced, requires commissioner of health to monitor compliance with indigent dental service requirements and to impose sanctions for noncompliance. - Amends TCA Section 68-1-304.

As introduced, provides that the chief administrative officer of the highway department in Decatur County must have a high school diploma or equivalent and four years of experience in the use of construction equipment used for highway construction or maintenance. - Amends TCA Title 54, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, enacts the "Collaborative Law Act." - Amends TCA Title 20 and Title 29.

As introduced, prohibits ownership or financial interest in, or employment by, a privatization enterprise by specified public officials and employees. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 10, Part 1; Title 3, Chapter 6; Title 8, Chapter 50, Part 5; Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As introduced, requires sellers of products or services pursuant to automatic renewal or continuous service agreements to disclose specific aspects of agreement and obtain consumer consent for automatic charges. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18.

As introduced, requires certain businesses to delete personal information provided by a consumer upon the consumer's written request unless the business is required to retain the information by law. - Amends TCA Title 10; Title 45; Title 47, Chapter 18; Title 62 and Title 63.
As introduced, creates the "Music Therapy Practice Act." - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 63 and Title 68, Chapter 1.

As introduced, requires LEAs placed in Corrective Action to extend the school term by 10 instructional days and if subsequently placed in Restructuring 2 to extend the school term by an additional 10 instructional days. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3; Title 49, Chapter 5 and Title 49, Chapter 6.

As introduced, requires chief administrative officer of custodial agency to sign records request response form if furnishing records will take more than 10 days and include statement as to why it will take more than 10 days. - Amends TCA Title 10, Chapter 7, Part 5.

As introduced, requires board for licensing health care facilities to promulgate rules requiring emergency room personnel to be trained in advanced cardiovascular life support by January 1, 2013. - Amends TCA Title 68.

As introduced, allows person voting in county where no driver license station is located and who does not possess photographic identification to execute affidavit of identity at county election commission office during early voting and have digital photograph taken there prior to being able to vote. - Amends TCA Title 2, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, requires every insurer offering homeowner property insurance to make available coverage for insurable landslide losses on any dwelling to the extent provided in the policy to which the landslide coverage attaches. - Amends TCA Title 56.
As introduced, creates the access to educational technology program, which provides laptop computers to all seventh and eighth grade students at participating LEAs. - Amends TCA Title 49.

As introduced, specifies that the unauthorized divulging or posting in electronic format, readily accessible on the Internet, of a patient's name, address or other identifying information is subject to certain civil action, criminal prosecution, and civil penalties. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 28; Title 29; Title 47; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, broadens preference for Tennessee products and services by allowing for 5 percent cost differential. - Amends TCA Title 12, Chapter 3, Part 8; Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 1 and Title 12, Chapter 4, Part 8.
As introduced, creates Class A misdemeanor for sale of beverages with alcohol content of greater than 60 percent by volume. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 57.

As introduced, requires postsecondary institutions authorized to operate in Tennessee under the Postsecondary Education Authorization Act to make certain financial disclosures to prospective students who will finance all or part of their education with military benefits. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7.

As introduced, requires motor vehicle dealers to comply with prohibition against making contradictory statements in initial offers for prizes or travel services; broadens scope of prohibition to apply at any time. - Amends TCA Title 47, Chapter 18 and Title 55, Chapter 17.
As introduced, requires the board of medical examiners and the board of osteopathic examination to issue rules for the training of physicians who prescribe certain opioids. - Amends TCA Title 63.

As introduced, creates certain requirements to protect cell phone users from the unauthorized intrusion of cell phone companies into the users' personal information stored on their phones. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 13, Part 6 and Title 40, Chapter 6.

As introduced, creates offense of manufacturing, selling or possessing a controlled substance analogue and punishes offense the same as the controlled substance for which it is an analogue. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17.

As introduced, prohibits vendors of services for electronic medical records from entering into or renewing contracts or agreements with health care facilities and health care providers that require indemnification of the vendor by the facility or provider or that prohibit lawsuits against the vendor. - Amends TCA Title 56; Title 63 and Title 68.

As introduced, requires a virtual public school to be closed, if the school, establisher, operator or manager fails to meet certain accountability and fiscal requirements. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 16.
As introduced, establishes K-12 Teacher Compensation Commission. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 1; Title 49, Chapter 2; Title 49, Chapter 3 and Title 49, Chapter 5.

As enacted, requires members of the highway patrol investigating motor vehicle accidents on interstates to note on the accident report whether physical barriers are present at the site of the accident. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 10.

As enacted, authorizes certain counties to levy a $1.00 litigation tax on each petition, warrant and citation to fund victim-offender mediation centers and initiatives. - Amends TCA Title 16, Chapter 20, Part 1.
As introduced, revises FY 2011-2012 appropriation for methamphetamine clean-up. - Amends Chapter 473 of the Public Acts of 2011.

As introduced, requires the department of health to develop and implement a program to provide colorectal cancer screenings for uninsured individuals between ages 50 and 64 and for any other uninsured individuals determined to be at high risk for developing colon cancer; requires health insurance companies to cover colorectal cancer screenings. - Amends TCA Title 56 and Title 68.
As introduced, permits any municipality in the state to adopt child curfew ordinances upon majority vote of the municipal governing body. - Amends TCA Title 39, Chapter 17, Part 17.
As introduced, defines "Tennessee resident" for purposes of tuition paid to public institutions of higher education. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7; Title 49, Chapter 8 and Title 49, Chapter 9.

As introduced, clarifies that teachers are not prohibited from participating in religious practice, including those with a student organization, if the participation is in connection with an event not held on campus. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 6, Part 80.

As enacted, exempts the UT board of trustees and board of regents from the requirement that a physical quorum be present at the location specified in the notice of a meeting as the location of the meeting in order to allow participation by electronic or other means of communication for the benefit of the public and the governing body in connection with any meeting authorized by law. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.
As introduced, prohibits a state or local governing body from installing or maintaining surveillance cameras to enforce speed limits after July 1, 2012. - Amends TCA Title 55, Chapter 8.

As enacted, requires that an application for a position of chief executive officer of a public institution of higher education, materials submitted with an application, letters of recommendation or references concerning an applicant, and any other records or information relating to or arising out of the process of searching for and selecting an individual for a position of chief executive officer of a public institution of higher education be treated as confidential and not open for public inspection, if the records could be used to identify a candidate for the position; enacts other provisions regarding information for such candidates. - Amends TCA Title 49, Chapter 7, Part 1.

As introduced, requires a public notice and a hearing before an establishment that may be detrimental to the neighborhood can begin operations. - Amends TCA Title 6, Chapter 54; Title 7, Chapter 3 and Title 13, Chapter 7.
As introduced, requires 25 percent of the proceeds collected by charitable organizations for veterans be donated to veterans. - Amends TCA Title 48, Chapter 101, Part 5.

As introduced, permits county with mental health facility, hospital or resource center in it to enter into annual agreement with another county to transport persons from the hospital to the original county for a flat rate or per person fee rather than billing for costs each trip. - Amends TCA Section 33-6-901.

As introduced, requires approval of courses of instruction in CPR and AED by the commissioner of health in addition to the emergency medical services board. - Amends TCA Title 68, Chapter 140, Part 4.

As introduced, requires the executive committee of the state veterans' homes board to file quarterly reports concerning the operations of each state veterans' nursing home with the chairs of the government operations committee of the senate and the house, in addition to the present law requirement that such reports be filed with the fiscal review committee. - Amends TCA Title 39 and Title 58.

As introduced, requires the commissioner of revenue to make a study of the fairness of the present distribution of local sales taxes in counties of population less than 300,000 that have more than one school district in meeting the needs of funding the school districts. - Amends TCA Title 5; Title 6; Title 49 and Title 67, Chapter 6.
As introduced, defines truck stops to include refueling stations and gas stations. - Amends TCA Title 1, Chapter 3, Part 1.

As enacted, revises various provisions regarding the Tennessee Local Development Authority and its authority to allocate on behalf of the state the portion of the "national qualified energy conservation bond limitation," as defined in federal law, that is allocated to the state. - Amends TCA Title 4.

As introduced, requires manufacturers of products added to public water systems to verify the safety of such products to the system operators. - Amends TCA Title 53, Chapter 1, Part 1 and Title 68, Chapter 221, Part 7.

As introduced, ensures that any member of a governing body who participates in a meeting by electronic or other means of communication timely receives copies of all documents distributed and discussed at the meeting. - Amends TCA Title 8, Chapter 44, Part 1.
As enacted, increases the maximum allowable exemption from the inheritance tax incrementally over next three years; eliminates the inheritance tax beginning in 2016. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 8.
As enacted, reduces the state sales tax on food and food ingredients from 5.5 percent to 5.25 percent. - Amends TCA Title 67, Chapter 6.

As introduced, subject to local approval, sets the number of members of the Maury County Board of Education at 11 to be elected from school districts coextensive with the county commission districts; sets staggered four-year terms for such school board members. - Repeals l Chapter 44 of the Private Acts of 1973.

As introduced, subject to local approval, requires that the boundaries of the road districts of the Highway Commission conform to those of the County Commission districts established by 2012 redistricting; increases, from four to six years, the next term of office for road commissioners elected from road districts two and seven. - Amends Chapter 55 of the Private Acts of 1951; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, adjusts election cycle for county road board districts to coincide with elections for school districts. - Amends Chapter 55 of the Private Acts of 1951, as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, reapportions, after the 2010 U. S. census, Rutherford County school districts. - Amends Chapter 454 of the Private Acts of 1968; as amended.
As enacted, makes appropriations for fiscal years beginning July 1, 2011, and July 1, 2012.

As enacted, authorizes the state to issue and sell its bonds and bond anticipation notes in amounts not to exceed $381,900,000. - AN ACT to authorize the State of Tennessee, acting by resolution of its funding board, to issue and sell its bonds and bond anticipation notes in amounts not to exceed three hundred eighty-one million nine hundred thousand dollars ($381,900,000) for the purpose of providing funds to the Department of Finance and Administration and the Department of Transportation; to provide for acquisition of equipment and sites, and erection, construction and equipment of sites and buildings, expressly including the acquisition of existing structures for expansion, improvements, betterments, and extraordinary repairs to existing structures, for construction of highways, and repair, replacement or rehabilitation of bridges, and for grants to any county, metropolitan government, incorporated town, city, special district of the state, or any governmental agency or instrumentality of any of them; to provide funds for the state office buildings and support facilities revolving fund; and to provide funds for the acquisition and implementation of an interoperable communication system upgrade, and to provide for the expenditure of said funds; to issue its debt in excess of the previously stated amount to fund discount and costs of issuance; and to provide for the expenditure of said funds. This act makes appropriations for an indefinite period of time for the purpose of allocating the proceeds of the bonds and notes authorized by this act.
As enacted, authorizes the index of appropriations from state tax revenues for the 2011-2012 fiscal year to exceed the index of estimated growth in the states economy by $250,000,000 or 2.01 percent.

As enacted, revises various provisions of law in order to reconcile present law with the annual appropriations act, including establishing a mechanism to provide supplemental funding to counties for improvement of juvenile court services and removing obsolete provisions concerning the appointment of dentists at certain institutions. - Amends TCA Title 4; Title 5; Title 6; Title 8; Title 9; Title 10; Title 11; Title 12; Title 13; Title 16; Title 17; Title 18; Title 29; Title 33; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39; Title 40; Title 41; Title 43; Title 45; Title 47; Title 48; Title 49; Title 50; Title 53; Title 54; Title 55; Title 56; Title 57; Title 58; Title 59; Title 60; Title 62; Title 63; Title 64; Title 65; Title 66; Title 67; Title 68; Title 69; Title 70 and Title 7.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter of Hamblen County to allow the clerk of the circuit and general sessions court to be the clerk of the juvenile court, while maintaining the business of the juvenile court separate from the circuit and general sessions court. - Amends Chapter 337 of the Private Acts of.
As introduced, expands power of the City of Franklin regarding the construction, maintenance, and repair of public sidewalks. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, prohibits candidates from running for more than one elective office in City of Franklin elections. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Private Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, clarifies charter provisions involving the office of Vice-Mayor in the City of Franklin. - Amends Chapter 79 of the Acts of 1903; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, dissolves the Woods Memorial Hospital District Board of Trustees in McMinn County. - Repeals l Chapter 13 of the Private Acts of 1965.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter of the City of Elkton relative to the requirements for becoming chief of police and to correct a typographical error. - Amends Chapter 431 of the Acts of 1907; as amended by Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 2007.

As introduced, subject to local approval, divides Sequatchie County into nine school districts, which are identical to the county legislative body districts, rather than eight districts. - Amends Chapter 83 of the Private Acts of 2002.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the charter to provide for a city administrator and for the appointment of a city judge. - Amends Chapter 563 of the Acts of 1903.

As introduced, subject to local approval, reduces size of Town of Oakdale board of aldermen from three to two beginning with the August 2014 election; requires the board to designate one board member as vice-mayor. - Amends Chapter 587 of the Private Acts of 1911; as amended and rewritten.
As introduced, subject to local approval, establishes a common-docket system in Bradley County. - Amends Chapter 17 of the Private Acts of 1955; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, decreases, from 12 to six, the number of county highway commissioners beginning in the August 2014 regular election; requires commissioners be elected from the same districts as county school board members. - Amends Chapter 53 of the Private Acts of 1985.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes remainder of proceeds from county wheel tax after all indebtedness for road paving projects has been paid, to be paid into the highway capital projects fund for highway and bridge capital projects. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 1995.

As introduced, subject to local approval, authorizes remainder of proceeds from county wheel tax after all indebtedness for road paving projects has been paid, to be paid into the highway capital projects fund for highway and bridge capital projects. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 1995.
As introduced, subject to local approval, abolishes the Weakley County highway commission.

As introduced, subject to local approval, removes requirement that persons be issued wheel tax decals for display on license plates as evidence of having paid such tax. - Amends Chapter 329 of the Private Acts of 1970; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the selection procedure for vacancies and expired terms of commissioners of the Board of Electric Light and Waterworks. - Amends Chapter 392 of the Acts of 1901; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, expands authority and supervision of the Board of Electric Light and Waterworks, with prior approval of city council, to include sewer in addition to telecommunications, natural gas, ISP and CATV services. - Amends Chapter 392 of the Acts of 1901; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, removes requirement that persons be issued wheel tax decals for display on license plates as evidence of having paid such tax. - Amends Chapter 329 of the Private Acts of 1970; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the August general election beginning in 2014; extends the two-year term of office of officials elected in the June 2011 election to the first day of September 2014 following the August election. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Acts of 1891; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, amends charter relative to the seeking of multiple positions in a single municipal election, vacancy and removal of council members, adoption of a redistricting ordinance, city judge and city court clerk salaries, and other charter revisions.
As introduced, subject to local approval, creates a special juvenile court in Williamson County pursuant to the Juvenile Court Restructure Act of 1982. - Amends Chapter.

As introduced, subject to local approval, increases the board of the Chattanooga-Hamilton County Hospital Authority from 11 to 13; the legislative delegation is to appoint the two additional members upon the recommendation by the Hamilton County Medical Society. - Amends Chapter 297 of the Private Acts of 1976.
As introduced, subject to local approval, enacts a hotel/motel tax.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the August general election beginning in 2014; extends the two-year term of office of officials elected in the June 2011 election to the first day of September 2014 following the August election. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Acts of 1891; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises various provisions of the charter related to residency of department heads; gives control and supervision of the electric plant to the board of mayor and aldermen instead of an electric utility board. - Amends Chapter 402 of the Acts of 1901; as amended and rewritten.

As introduced, subject to local approval, incorporates by reference for Cookeville officers and employees present general law language related to conflict of interest and contracting. - Amends Chapter 223 of the Private Acts of 1961.
As introduced, updates charter for the City of Portland. - Amends Chapter 288 of the Acts of 1905; as repealed.
As introduced, designates May as "Human Trafficking Awareness Month" in Tennessee. - Amends TCA Title 15; Title 37; Title 38; Title 39 and Title 40.
As introduced, subject to local approval, revises the town charter. - Amends Chapter 373 of the Private Acts of 1911; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, reapportions, after the 2010 U.S. census, Monroe County school districts. - Amends Chapter 117 of the Private Acts of 1963.

As introduced, subject to local approval, creates Tourism Board for Blount County, Alcoa and Maryville and allocates portion of the Blount County occupancy tax to such board. - Amends Chapter 102 of the Private Acts of 1979; as amended.
As introduced, subject to local approval, repeals the road commissioners.
As introduced, creates a new general sessions court and county attorney position for Washington County.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the city election to coincide with the November general election beginning in 2014; extends the four-year terms of office of officials elected in the May 2009 election to the first Tuesday in November 2014, and the terms of officials elected in the May 2011 election to the first Tuesday in November 2016. - Amends Chapter 179 of the Private Acts of 1923; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises authority of the board of trustees of the Cookeville Regional Medical Center to take certain actions subject to approval of the city council; removes limitation that defines the hospital campus as land owned by the City of Cookeville regardless of where that land is located. - Amends Chapter 49 of the Private Acts of 1999; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter; creates the position of "city manager" to be appointed by and serve at the pleasure of the board of mayor and aldermen. - Amends Chapter 238 of the Acts of 1903.

As introduced, subject to local approval, creates the "Financial Management Modernization System of the County of Sumner, Tennessee of 2012"; repeals Chapter 113 of the Private Acts of 2002, in certain circumstances.

As introduced, subject to local approval, creates the "Financial Management Modernization System of the County of Sumner, Tennessee of 2012"; repeals Chapter 113 of the Private Acts of 2002, in certain circumstances.

As introduced, subject to local approval, specifies that persons elected as mayor and aldermen be installed into office on the first day of December rather than the first day of January, beginning with November 2012 and 2014 elections. - Amends Chapter 306 of the Private Acts of 1951.

As introduced, subject to local approval, revises method for filling vacancies on board of mayor and aldermen; allows for recall elections of mayor and aldermen. - Amends Chapter 24 of the Private Acts of 1997; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, sets 30-day residency requirement to vote in the municipal election; authorizes property rights voting limited to one person per parcel. - Amends Chapter 105 of the Private Acts of 2004.

As introduced, subject to local approval, moves the date of the city election to coincide with the November general election; extends the four-year terms of office of the mayor and councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2009 and the councilmen elected at the regular city election held in June 2011 to expire on the first Thursday in November in 2013 and 2015 respectively. - Amends Chapter 247 of the Acts of 1905; as amended and rewritten.

As introduced, subject to local approval by both the City of Memphis and Shelby County, changes the name of the Memphis and Shelby County Convention Center to the "Memphis Convention Center," changes the name of the commission to the "Memphis Convention Center Commission" and provides for the appointment of the commissioners solely by the Mayor of the City of Memphis. - Amends Chapter 420 of the Private Acts of 1917.
As introduced, subject to local approval, rewrites the charter. - Amends Chapter 252 of the Private Acts of 1929; as amended.

As introduced, subject to local approval, reduces number of school districts from four to three; increases Lake County board of education from eight members to nine members. - Amends Chapter 119 of the Private Acts of 2002.

As introduced, subject to local approval, restructures Lake County highway commission by increasing the number of highway commission districts from two to three, to be coextensive with the county commission districts. - Amends Chapter 262 of the Private Acts of 1980, as amended.
